The proposal has clear objectives defined phase-wise and can be monitored for progress. The development steps have been provided with time limits.  The project's success can be measured based on the number of people adopting the solution and can be measured analytically.

I would suggest including a clear and explained breakdown of all costs in the requested budged. As this project requires a complex platform being built I would have liked to see a clearer description of the development work required and clearer task assignment, it's a larger project and it's unclear if the team would need to hire outside help. No mention of a launch date for the project is made, so it would be hard for the community to keep track of development. Metrics given are broad and they don't really apply to the V1 of the project, which is the scope of this proposal.

This proposal aims to bring the benefits of IWA membership to the cardano community, which means that the voice of the CNFT crowd can be heard withing a broad standard setting organization while also gaining the ability to use these standards. In order to drive broad adoption while also bringing reliable utility standards are absolutely necessary.

Although the goal of paying yearly dues for IWA membership is a laudable and one that should be supported so that the Cardano token community can participate in standards activities, the project doesn't directly contribute specific solutions according to the Metadata Challenge criteria. Rather it is a meta-solution.
The plan to pay IWA dues is clearly achievable according to the plan, and the NFTDAO team and community is clearly qualified to engage with and contribute to the IWA.

this proposal's task is really just that, a task. The more difficult side of it will be gaining broad acceptance within the CNFT community, however the team has a great head start on that through the community that NFT-DAO has already become.

Auditing the payment of the IWA will be straightforward. The proposal does not provide a clear metric for its intermediate goal of "active and fully engaged and contributing"; that goal could have been quantified.

creates new jobs? Sure. But not so many IMO, and it is a long way to materialize the impact.

Cardano is considered the best public block-chain operating in Africa - 2/5
Cardano projects in Africa are not isolated but networked and growing 5/5

While the proposal would potentially increase usage and network effect of ADA, the proposer does not provide enough technical details or a concrete plan to realize the vision. The nature of the Cardano integration is unclear.

Up to date localised imagery is essential in the development of local communities. From urban planning, to medical emergencies, the needs are many. This proposal addresses a critical necessity in the African continent. Combined with the motivation of ADA rewards, this proposal has a very good purpose behind it.

May not be a walk up obvious proposal to grow Africa but certainly can play a part in helping new users become familiar with cardano. Well received by community in the comments and this suggests an interesting topic that has prompted interaction.

It would be good to have more information on how they will manage the launch in Afrcia. Which countries, how are the stakeholders who will pay, how are they going to connect with pilots. Is there a drone pilot community in Africa? If not how will they start one, fund purchase or rental of drones etc.

The team has proven that they have experience since the image collection platform is already up and running, offering a valuable service of on-demand drone imagery. Combined with on the ground imagery provided by anyone who joins the platform and is willing to travel to a specific location and take the required photographs, the project could produce valuable resources. Not only is their project well-written, but the information included sustains their plan of execution.

The proposer seems to have the required knowledge to further the proposal. I note PC community are linked and feel this will be essential for moving the project forward. The plan would benefit from further detail as it a little generic at this stage.

More information should be provided on how they are actually going to engage both sides of the market in Africa (pilots and images users). What are the funds going to be used for. It should be noted this proposer has also applied for funds in the metadata challenge.

no metrics provided, but:

Number of purely African participants  can be measured 5/5
Number of Outside African participants with a significant partnership with African residents can be measured 5/5
Feedback on progress from successful proposals regardless of failure or success not stated, yet I can not imagine it  1/5
Novelty and appropriateness of solutions (hard to quantify, easy to see) 1/5
Number of African Fund5 proposals that do not need further funding to keep operating 1/5

The proposal contains a lot of useful information, though neither in the project description, nor in the attached documents is there a detailed budget, metrics or roadmap to be found. The sum they are asking for seems reasonable, however, it would have been better to include some details regarding their plan of spending.

Overall a well produced proposal that will be improved by further refinement. The proposal has a key ingredient (mass appeal) that if designed correctly will grow not only Africa but locations everywhere. Still need to work out many aspects to  be fully accepted.
It is not clear why the blockchain is needed for this project other than providing an NFT which seems to be non-core.

Anonimous and uncontrolled records of vaccination outcomes may not be useful for deriving any meaningful scientific conclusion. Recording of these in blockchain may have other implicit benefits which are unclear to assess.

I  don't believe people will be willing to pay a "transaction fee + NFT minting fee + small service fee" to take a survey where they will have to divulge information about themselves to get an NFT without monetary value.  I believe the data will be biased due to the monetary barrier of entry.  Stronger incentive or lower barrier of entry(free) is needed to change my opinion.

This proposal presents a very novel way of utilising Cardano's metadata functionality in a much-needed setting. I can understand and see why COVID vaccinations is the first cab off the rank so to speak but if implemented, this system can be used for quite a number of different patient-reported medical reports that would be helpful for some future projects in gaining perspectives. The proposal can benefit greatly in terms of sustainability if it adds a business model for researchers to pay for future data and/or provide incentives other than Fauci to encourage self-reporting. Some progressive governments collect nation-wide sets of private health data but as mentioned these are not widely shared and come with caveats. This solution paves the way for better  statistical and experiential analysis.

This is a great idea, but would benefit from greater alignment with medical information interchange standards (e.g. FHIR v4) and ensures that the metadata collected would meet research data standards and needs.  A bit more focus on the demand and usage of the information would help make a revised submission more compelling.

The proposal outlines a novel and impactful use of transaction metadata. Although it considers the PII and HIPAA issues, it neglects to note that analysis of the transaction history of Cardano addresses can be used to de-anonymize metadata submitters: the proposal would have benefited from a more detailed discussion about privacy assurance.

The funds requested seem larger than required for this effort.
Proposer seems to have the experience to complete this project. They have not discussed their ability to access patient to obtain this data
The proposal claims 9 years of experience as a data scientist. IT is likely that the proposal may be implemented successfully. However verifiable credentials would have been better for assessment.
Health professionals should be consulted with during the development of this project and I do not see any mention of health professional experience.

The proposer's background lends credibility to the project but would be further enhanced if the team could include a medical practitioner or a researcher to provide insights into the types of data pertinent to such a statistical and reporting tool. There's not enough details on the development pathway though to properly validate the levels of success of this project ever going into fruition. The proposal would benefit from a listing of each technical component required, the resources and time it will take to build and deploy and also of the costing. The Metadata Challenge only offers $50000 and the $40000 being asked for is 80% of the entire fund so greater scrutiny of the plan is required if this project ends up taking such a large chunk of the funds
Experience is impressive, but no clear research, development, testing, implementation plan is outlined.

The proposer has sufficient experience with the multiple skills required to successfully execute the proposed work. The proposal includes adequate detail and addresses most risk areas that would impact successful completion. It would have benefited from a roadmap that includes user engagement at all stages of the project, in order to ensure that it would meet its envisioned adoption target.

It is not clear why the blockchain is required for this. It is also not clear why the patients would continue to access the blockchain after they had initially provided the data and looked at the NFT . Perhaps if it was being used to provide an immutable record of vaccination for vaccine passport use it would have a stronger case

Detailed information regarding implementation and the product to be developed has been specified. However, uncontrolled collection of medical data may not be beneficial for serious research. This is casting dought on the effectiveness of the proposal post-implementation.

The proposal greatly focussed on the business process of the reporting tool and a bit lacking on the development needed, including timelines, milestones and budgeting. There's not enough information provided to properly audit this project and it would benefit greatly if this can be accommodated. As mentioned, it is requesting 80% of the entire funding allocated to the Metadata Challenge so this is very critical information, should it go ahead.
Without a resourcing model and high level implementation plan, there is not enough information to determine if the funding request is appropriate or if there is confidence in implementation success.

The proposal includes concrete metrics for ultimate success. Because it lacks a staged roadmap with intermediate milestones, it could be difficult to audit work in progress; that is somewhat alleviated by the specifics regarding the app's content, user flow, and reward system.

The proposal is for training people on how to use Metadata. In this training appreciation, tokens will be made to acknowledge donors to WADA. The proposal is good for community development and may result in better availability of developers in Metadata. Direct contribution to metadata innovation is quite limited.
This project focuses on building a traceability system for donations, something that addresses the need to increase trust for donors to see how the money was used.

The proposal is not specific about the details of the donor metadata and the approach to using metadata for authentication and tracing. It would have been helpful if the proposers described how metadata would be propagated beyond the initial minting and award of native assets, and how that augments the traceability that is already inherent in the UTxO model. For instance, enforcing (for purposes of authentication by the asset issuer) the inclusion of metadata in transactions would likely require smart contracts, but such is not mentioned in the proposal. However, a rigorous framework for authenticated tracing related to donations would be extremely valuable.
Tracing donations is a good real world use case to use the cardano blockchain. The proposal is also aligned with the general goal of Cardano to support the adoption of Cardano in african countries.

Donations traceability is a legitimate use case for metadata, and will enhance the use of Cardano as a platform for social good (for example mission driven pools. Being that WADA is behind the project, it overlaps with the Africa challenge as well.
the proposing team has experience working on catalyst projects and is no stranger to working collaboratively.

The proposing team has strong connections to the target audience and the diverse capabilities and experience to execute the project. The proposal includes a succinct roadmap of achievable activities, but its vagueness about the nature of the metadata schema and the authentication/tracing approach make it difficult to judge whether realizing the roadmap would result in a successful "framework to reward and trace donations on the blockchain using metadata" that would truly impact the community.

The references expertise is really convincing. It is also a good mix of different knowledge levels available in the team. Gimbalabs is is well established and WADA is also a long time member of the community.

Many resources are available including WADAs development team, Gimbalabs, and IOHK consultation.  The roadmap is described clearly. Even if the proposal does not meet all its goals, there should be considerable developer onboarding and training as a result.

Innovative use of metadata to improve its exploitation is not addressed in any substantial manner in the proposal. The conduct of metadata developer training may not contribute directly to the innovation in the use of metadata.

The proposal includes clear and measurable success indicators, but it does not quantify a "high WADA Foundation donor engagement". It has a sufficiently detailed timeline, and it is clear about its target audience. It is not sufficiently detailed about the capabilities of the fund-tracing framework and the use cases that such enables.
There are good success idicators to process the progress of the project. I would like to have different KPIs. Some that are directly related to the proposal. Therefore I deduct one star.

The 6k budget is for equipment and trainer/trainee incentives. The proposal outlines several metrics for success from deeper community involvement and dialog to independently released metadata projects. While the project may develop in unexpected ways, there should be many opportunities to judge the value delivered to the Cardano ecosystem.
The proposal adds a application of NFTs to the Cardano ecosystem that will benefit creators of literature, thus it is a great addition. It has a detailed concept and many well-reflected features
A very well thought out proposal. There is so much to build on here, one that would definitely resonate with a large audience.

The proposal puts long standing publishing models to the test, and offers a disruptive alternative. What isn't clear is how the media will be linked to the NFT, and if the media will be stored in perpetuity by burblr, hosted on some authenticated server, or even if the user would like to host their own copy on a local machine for offline use. If someone can't verify the checksum of the media themselves and can't store their own copies then that might be a significant speed bump in the plan. This is to protect the asset in case that burblr is no longer capable of distributing the Works themselves, in lets say 200 years.

Plan and resources look sensible. Only concern is budget, seems low. Can the non-tech work really be done gratis or should you look at coming back for further funding to help. I think the community would get behind this one if they see a POC after 3 months

Apart from a not-so detailed budget, which can be tolerated due to the business-related experience of the proposers, the proposal is very detailed and structured, making it possible to evaluate it with confidence.
the proposal includes key milestone dates and mentions metrics but doesn't include goals on how many signups, how many works are published and so on.

While I find this proposal very interesting, I struggle a bit to see exactly how the creation of a Cardano Encyclopaedia will bring new entrepreneurs to Ideascale. Otherwise, I find the whole endeavour well-thought and still consider it to be a a good addition to the entire Catalyst project.
The team has already started working on the website and they seem to be experienced, knowledgeable and passionate about the project.

The proposal is identifying the nonavailability of information in Spanish for attracting proposers and entrepreneurs to Catalyst. Wikipedia is the ideal platform with much better reach in the world. The proposal is not clear on what bases they have not considered Wikipedia.

The proposal has identified an opportunity to lower the barrier for capital investment in small businesses in underserved financial markets. However the scope of the project isn't clear, mentioning secondary markets for tokenized company shares, fiat to crypto on-ramps, liquidity provided by financial institutions and even a platform for sharing performance information.

It is possible to understand that the problem concerns the distribution and certification of small business shares, I recommend rewriting the problem statement to make it clearer and expand on the problem, so that it is possible to understand the dimension of the problem and the potential impact of the proposal. . There is no clear rationale for how the proposal may impact this challenge. No metrics or goals have been described to understand the impact of the proposal on the challenge.
This does not address the challenge (unless the funded businesses are DeFi opportunities - not stated as such).

"Small business expansion funding" is proposing to build a DeFi app for small business investment and dividend distribution. This effectively addresses the challenge of providing DeFi services on the Cardano Network. It's not clear given the focus on small business services in a specific geographic area how significant the scaling impact will be for Cardano DeFi.

The proposer shows relevant experience with the types of business that would benefit from the proposed work. It is unclear how the block chain technology would be utilized to provide the trustless exchange of information. The proposal's description of the team doesn't include a skill set in blockchain tech, or app development which introduces a large amount of risk in budget and scope delivery.

There are few details about the team, I recommend including more details and links to Linkedin so that the community has access to this information in a transparent way and can attest to the team's qualifications.

There is a rationale regarding the problem and the solution, but there is no clear plan for implementing the proposal. There is a budget brakdown. The costs section describes the development of an app and a website, but there is no detail in the proposal that explains the dapp and the website and their purposes clearly, which makes it difficult to assess the feasibility of the budget in relation to the plan.

There are no details about the technical aspects of the app. The idea describes tokenization of shares, this would involve NFTs, however these NFTS can be considered securities and this requires legal clarification on regulation. Several projects in the crypto space have suffered from regulatory uncertainty, even projects that do not have elements of securities end up having their tokenomics model defined as securities.

There is no plan on how this will be implemented. How will investors fund be secured? Why would the businesses pay a dividend? What are the governance procedures? Are you essentially trying to set up stock exchange for small businesses? Why equity? Perhaps convertible notes? Many questions to answer.

The proposal doesn't include sufficient information to determine how feasible it is for the small business shares market to develop. Additional information, such as what it costs to use the current financial systems to invest in a small business and the cost of trust in the current system would allow assessment of how large the opportunity might be, and support the case that it is feasible to replace the existing infrastructure.

There is no clarity on how the proposal will address the challenge.. There is no roadmap, no milestones, no metrics, no KPIs. I recommend including this information and more details about the team. There is a budget breakdown, but the lack of a technical plan makes it difficult to assess the budget and this compromises auditability.


In general, the proposal needs more detail and greater clarity.
A plan on technical, economic and governance structures with milestones and KPI's should be provided.
The proposal has clear concrete objective, clearly specifies how the proposed budget will be allocated, and describes the goals which can be assessed and audited.
The plan has a couple of workstreams, but no milestones, and no objectives or key results.

While the idea to use ADA staking rewards to subsidize housing is a good concept, this proposal does not adress that aim well: The rates for the people lending homes are much higher than typical US mortgage rates, making this offer only attractive to people that will not be able obtaining a mortgage, for example due to a poor financial situation. For those people however, such astronomically high anual rates are a very hard to cope with expense which have the potential do drive them even more into poverty, so qualifying this into doing something good as it is done in the proposal is difficult. As the rates in this business model are set, it is rather a model to earn ADA holders a higher APY than they would get by regular staking and additionally provide profit to the operators of the crowdlending platform at the cost of high rates for the people renting the homes. In order for the proposal to make a worthy addition to the DeFi-ecosystem of Cardano, the thoughts behind it's financial setup need to be made more transparent in order for it to be justified. On first thought, the proposal would be better if it introduced a system where the staking rewards would be used to discount the loan rates instead of making them more expensive.

This proposal meets the general requirements of the challenge. There appears to be significant desire for innovative financing mechanisms in the defi space and this proposal would be an interesting option. The proposal would benefit from a better discussion on what its success would look like. Is there a threshold that is being sought? (e.g. number of people using service, new Dapp users, particular level of value being locked in)?

The proposal seems to be very focussed on addressing providing DeFi options in the space. It would be interesting to understand if there had been intentions from the proposer to further develop the business model/tech if the proposal was successful and achieved it's MVP, launch etc.

The problem statement has an unsubstantiated and subjective claim. Some DeFi protocols currently have some of the largest APYs in the entire global financial market, this is easily verified on DeFi analytics websites such as https://defirate.com/lend/ or https://defiyield.info/

The proposal is to develop an MVP, so it will not meet the metrics established in the Challenge Brief and is not in line with the challenge.

I don't think this financial product of Leasing to Own as opposed to Renting to Own is novel enough to curb the first home ownership issues around the world. I was a home flipper myself and the profit mindset took me many years to shake. Let's build a better system outside ownership/profit/lease model.. Realestate sector is ripe for disruption

Given the small amount of money being requested to develop a MVP, it is  likely that this proposal would be implemented successfully. The proposer's experience is related but I'd appreciate more details on the technical side of it. What skills/workers are needed to develop the MVP? 

More details are also needed on the inner workings of the Stiff Money operations. The presentation deck that is linked to within the proposal could break down each step more clearly. For example, if a person stakes with the Stiff Money stake pool how does this affect their ability to liquidate? How long is the staking term for? Are there several options or is it a one size fits all scenario? These types of details will help the clarity of the overall proposal, as well as voters when trying to determine whether it could be successful.

The proposer seems to have some experience in real estate. The financial calculations behind the interest rates are intransparent and don't match up to US mortgage rates which will make the proposal likely to fail due to lack of interes on the side of people using it to get loans for housing. In addition to this, the introduction of another currency that will have a low market cap and thus be prone to volatility is another factor that makes the proposal less secure. There is no rationale giving for the budget demanded.

Whilst I was able to follow the slide deck, I feel each slide raised more questions for me. Who would ensure Stiff Money operated in good faith (given we currently do not have Smart Contracts)? How will $DEED work from a tokenomics perspective, who controls the supply? It feels slightly like the proposal jumps from a high level 'what could be' to 'we will build an MVP, thanks' which isn't totally connected with more detail.

There is no information about the qualification of the team in the development of smart contracts (the proposal requires smart contracts to allow a decentralized loan).

There is no detailed plan for how dapp will deliver a 10% APY yield. Dapp is promising a fixed yield of 10% APY, and does not describe in detail the economic model and the viability of the business of buying and selling real estate.

There is no budget breakdown.

The risks involved in the use of dapp were not described (unlike staking, in the case of this proposal, ADAs would leave the user's wallet and remain in a smart contract or be lent, this brings risks that can make the financial model unfeasible. With ADA staking, although the APY is around 5%, the risks are extremely low, in the case of loans the risk increases and mantaining the APY at 10% may not dynamically reflect the risks.

As before, I feel nervous about combining the primordial sense of home, belonging and security with 'crazy DeFi profits'. Its time to make RealFi Dapps. I feel nervous about associating landlordship in disguise with Cardano and adding to extractive mindset and agenda in the world. P2P lending could be a noble activity if our community were to somehow share profits collectively. Otherwise it looks like extractive legacy project to me which I don't believe will make the world a better place.

Given that this proposal represents only stage 1 of many likely stages, it is very feasible that this project will be achievable. Also, the low budget of this proposal presents minimal risk to the catalyst community with the potential for high returns. In order to increase the score I'd like to see the proposal go into more depth about what form the MVP will take and how this will be measured. 

The proposal could also do a better job at breaking down the funding request into smaller pieces so voters know exactly what the money will be spent on. 

The proposal could be strengthened by providing additional information on how it gets to it's yield numbers. For example, if the Stiff Money app is conducted through a stake pool, what will that mean for saturation limits and the diminishing returns when saturated? Can this be clarified? Could this affect the success of the overall project, why/why not?
In the attached deck there is also mention of using the profits to purchase housing but it is less clear how each of the components work together and what happens if people don't live up to their end of the smart contracts. Would there need to be an eviction/enforcement arm? 
Expanding on these details could increase the likelihood of successful implementation and sends the message that these things have been thought through to the voters.

As mentioned in the notes about, the financial model is intransparent and seems off without further explanation. There is no plan about the actual implementation of the platform (e.G. milestones) and no rationale for the budget. I recommend to publish this with a more detailed plan for implentation and calculations or at least explanations of the financial model behind it.
The proposal doesn't address features or milestones which could be used to ensure the proposer is on track with the project. It's more blind faith, insert coin, wait and see.

There is no detailed plan, no roadmap, no milestones, no metrics, no KPIs, no budget breakdown and there is no information about the team's experience in developing smart contracts.

I recommend detailing the proposal to allow auditability.
No plan on how this will be implemented, how the economics work, or how it will be marketed. No milestones or goals.

Well without dealing with evictions on defaulting the loans and all other such measures that deeply contradict my personal sense of community and human rights, I do not see this project having measurable outcomes that would agree with my Commonist standpoint. Even as a Libertarian I would not think that making large profits on DeFi housing is a new idea. It broke the gates of Babylon did it not?

this proposal is an innovative approach which uses DeFi to address the climate warming issues. Users of the tokens will have the ability to earn rewards from the carbon credits their NFT'd land produces. What is missing a sense of scale and scope, the proposal would be easier to follow if voters could get a sense of where carbon credits are being used in traditional markets, and how valuable they are to buyers. This would then lay out what the potential capitalization of the credits would be, and let participants gain a sense of how valuable this idea might be.

The author proposes a system where portions of a forest representing 1lb of CO2 emissions are represented as an NFT to protect it from being cut down over a timespan of a century. The NFTs would have possible price fluctuations and be, I suppose, tradable through means of a game. A very original take on forest conservation.

The proposal outlines an interesting DeFi economy.  If land tokens as small as 1 acre would open the system to many, but those most in need of DeFi services are probably not landholders. If land stewardship is to be verifiable in anyway, this hampers global participation because easement rules are highly variable or nonexistent  in different jurisdictions.

The problem statement is clear and the solution is within the scope of the challenge, however the only aspect of this proposal related to DeFi would be the DEX and there is not enough information on the DEX development or description of how the proposal will address the items and metrics described in the challenge brief. Due to the lack of details on the development of DEX there is no way to indicate that this proposal will have a relevant impact on the challenge.

This proposal was previously submitted to the Fund3 Dapps creation challenge. My recommendation is to submit the proposal to the Dapps challenge again, as there is a much more evident alignment with this challenge.

"Carbonland" is an innovative and important concept for how DeFi can be used to motivate positive environmental improvement. This is an excellent use of the Cardano DeFi capabilities and would showcase how the Cardano network can be utilized.

Without knowing what types of land or where the targeted land for this proposal is, it is difficult to asses whether local laws will support or degrade the proposal. It isn't clear where or who owns the targeted lands, which makes if very difficult to asses how local land law will behave with this proposal. Having a description of the target types of land would bring clarity to how big this system might be.

The author is known from ADA MakerSpace and has proven to be a valuable community member in the past. However forest conservation is popular in the short term, it is not guaranteed that this trend would last over an extended period of time. I have some modest doubts about what would happen if the game loses momentum in popularity. 
It could reduce people's investment to the sole aspect of nature conservation and no longer render it profitable.

The proposer has experience with blockchain and carbon credits, but there is no information about the team's skill in developing smart contracts, which compromises the feasibility assessment of the proposal.

The proposal seeks to develop an MVP, native assests and smart contracts, but there is no detailed information on the development of the DEX. In addition, it is important to note that DEXs are not used for NFTs, but marketplaces. For a token to be traded on a DEX it needs fungibility.

No budget breakdown has been presented.

No plan on how this will be monitored. What is the oracle to check the land is kept forested. constantly updated georeferenced Satellite imagery combined with computer vision algorithms could conceivably do this, but the proposer has not detailed this.

While this is a great idea, the proposal didn't provide a sense of scale for how much companies are paying for carbon credits today, which makes it difficult to assess what the total market capitalization might be for the CO2 and ACRE tokens.

The proposal also didn't identify how many acres will be targeted for the 100 year trusts.

I am missing a bit of a risk assessment and legal framework around it, which is important for a project like this. 
If a landowner decides to cut down a portion of the forest regardless, would that get him sued and the NFT holder compensated? 
Suppose a tree suffers from disease or is damaged by lightning so that it endangers the trees around it, would that enable the landwoner to cut down the tree? How would this be determined? I have noticed that the GPS coordinates do not match an exact grid. It's a stretch, but wouldn't that enable the landowner to cut down the trees inbetween the grid boxes? 
How about different legalities in different countries? 
It's a cool idea, but it still needs polishing on that aspect in my opinion.

There is no budget breakdown, no metrics, no KPIs, no roadmap. There is little information about the proposers and their roles in the development of the project.

The plan needs to be more detailed, and the information mentioned above needs to be included so that the proposal can be audited.

A detailed allocation of the budget and a timeline of objectives is not provided, which diminishes the ability to assess progress. Nevertheless, the written description of the goals is high quality the goal of establishing NFTs that represent Carbon Credits is clear.

This proposal clearly lands well within the scope of the challenge. There's no such thing as too many educational resources.  It's reasonable to believe there's a healthy number of people who would like to participate in developing the Cardano network, but are lacking the skills to do so. This is a sound proposal to close the gap.
This could be an interesting way to bring on new developers. However is this addressing the challenge?

It does address the challenges very well. A lot of people are enthused about Blockchain Technology and Cardano to be precise but they've got  only one problem and that is funding to carry out the practical version of what they've acquired through their journey of learning.
Providing incentives to learners who come on board I think is a smart way of raising their passion and productivity level as well sustaining them and recruiting more.
Thumbs up to this idea 👍
Definitely addresses the challenge, as more devs learn about developing on Cardano more are likely to actually build on it

Incentivizing to build developing skills through Cardano-based lessons can attract people that would like to get into developing and are not sure which platform/ network to start on. Promoting the learn-and-earn system directly at Universities is a great way to find new talent and interest students at the beginning of their career. 

The proposal connects to a couple of the key metrics of the fund (Incentivization structures, how to attract developers from outside, how to get developers motivated) and the impact would be directly tied to the objective of attracting new developers onto the Cardano Network. Implementing the learn-and-earn system in Latin America and Africa would be adding to the general interest of Cardano to include and invite people from poorer regions of the world to participate and open the doors to a career in blockchain. 

Game-based learning is highly motivating and adding incentives will further increase motivation. 

It might be important to look into factors that can limit the risks of abuse of the learn-and-earn system.

The proposers indicate they have over 7 years of experience in blockchain education. The provided link to the BEN website shows a functional educational website already in use, in connection with other technologies and networks. 4 stars rather than 5, because I am not seeing actual implementation of the "earn and learn" format of education. However, this is a very solvable issue.

The published "lessons" on xDAI is a basic overview of the blockchain and does not help developers https://github.com/BlockDevsUnited/learn-and-earn/blob/master/lessons/Lesson2:%20xDai%20Basics.md The proposer does not demonstrate any experience.

Goals and funds do not add up. 3000  developers have completed lessons at $3-10 per lesson would be more than 15000 in learner rewards unless each had only done on average <2 lessons each at $3/ lesson. In which case they probably haven't learnt very much.

7 years of experience and track record, that's enough to assure successful implementation of this project. 
Their laid down plan is convincing enough. Rationale being that with strategic breakdown of a year to carry out this project it's great timing.
Budget is also on point.

Currently I´m not sure if the proposal and the BEN team are connected or if Antoine would build the learn-and-earn program on the BEN platform. I´d advise to fill in more information about the team that would be responsible for this proposal. I was not able to find the proposers name on the BEN website, so I´m currently not able to assess the experience that the proposer and the team has. 

The github Ethereum learn-and-earn is not very intuitive right now to me as a user and I think it would be beneficial to include a specialist for educational material into the team to make sure, that learners can best benefit from the program. Add visuals, interactive tasks, peer-mediated feedback options……

The BEN website already provides some educational material so the learn-and-earn program can be integrated, but some of the pages just redirect to youtube videos and some are simply invalid: https://wiki.blockchainedu.org/en/ethereum 

It would be interesting, if the proposer provides more information about how a learn-and-earn lesson would look like. The educational material that will be provided is limited and mostly text based with some example tasks. It would be interesting for the team to cooperate with a specialist for course creation to look into the options for further material to enhance the learning experience.

Many things are made clear by this proposal, but one detail that isn't mentioned poses a question to the feasibility in the long term sustainability of this project. It's made clear that over half of the funding will be used to incentivize learners with rewards in ADA. But there is no mention indicating what will happen once the initial funding is depleted. I guess there is potential to operate a stake pool or multiple pools to generate more ADA to use as rewards, but that has limitations in scalability.  I have issued 2 stars for feasibility because theoretically free education (rather than incentive based education) is still a positive outcome, despite not being the exact goal of the proposal. Although even then, funding will be required to maintain the website and update the curriculum, so I would be interested in seeing the details of how these funds will be procured into the future.
Its not clear it directly meets the challenge or that the proposers have really thought through how they are going to fund it.
The plan is detailed and well presented. All the necessary milestones are described and it will be easy to follow the progress.

There's enough information to carry out audits. Regular assessments can be made at the end of their monthly breakdowns. At least at the end of each section, Community Team can assess to see if they're working according to plan. Close monitoring and guide will aid the project's success.
Budget and definition of success well deacribed, while most of the funds going to learning rewards is a huge plus

It would be important to break down the budget more clearly and look at the risks and barriers that might come up during the 6 month pilot phase. The rewards-budget doesn´t really add up with 1000+ participants going through 20+ lessons with 3-10 dollars each and a 15.000 USD budget for the rewards. It would be important to clearly state how the rewards are divided, if there will be a limited amount of people that can do each bounty hunt to be able to give out rewards as promised. If the budget is not sufficient, participants will lose trust in Cardano which would have a negative impact.

A six month roadmap is provided and after six months, the project would need further fundings. It would be good to have the team provide evidence, that the program would lead to  more new developers on the Cardano network. This could be done by referral codes, but it would be up to the team to further explain how success could be measured for Cardano.

The idea of creating a platform where citizens can invest in farmers, protected by smart smart contracts is great. I think that the idea of investing in farms/farmers needs to be facilitated - but there are also important risks that need to be addressed. Probably for all sides. 
Hence we come to the proposal. I think the proposal does focus on the technical side of using smart contracts and building a website platform - however, the success or failure of such an initiative will not be measured only by technical factors. 
The proposal in the current state seems like a rough draft, more a conceptual contribution - although it does identify a problem which needs to be solved. The impact of the proposed platform and the DApp will be measured by its ultimate success in resolving a longstanding problem - hence the devil will be in the details of the relationship between farmers and citizen investors, in their communication, expectations, deliverables, progress measurement, addressing issues of production volumes/quality, insurance, force majeure, market disruptions. 
There are many things that can go wrong in agriculture and a platform in which citizens can invest in farmers will have to take many things into account if it is to be effective. Building a platform by itself will not guarrantee success. The campaign brief states that "Quality Dapps and integrations will increase utility & adoption of Cardano". The idea does have quality, but what I would like to see more is the devilish detail that would indicate that the proposal will deliver solutions to difficult problems - that would put the "Quality" in the proposal and in the proposed DApp and platform and smart contracts.

The idea seems to be good and the intention as well. This could bring some users to the Cardano platform. Although, the idea should be better explained because it is not clear it this would be as investing platform, or a lending platform. If it's a lending platform, this functionality would be offered by other Cardano platforms already, since it is one of the main goals of Cardano in general. If the idea is to build a investing platform for farming only, it should be better explained because there is not enough information to understand the problem properly and to evaluate its impact

Great idea to incorporate resource production to the blockchain. Providing an opportunity to directly invest in local farming fits a trending narrative of 'grow local, buy local' and creating a more durable economy to everyone's benefit. Doing this on the Cardano blockchain might instigate an influx of new users as the project scales up.

The proposal has the potential to be a useful addition to the Cardano ecosystem, empowering farmers all around the worlds and making them more independent. However it lacks some details on the exact functionality and makeup of the app, how farmer-investor relations are going to be etc. Would have been nice to have some more insight on how well the project is reflected upown.

The idea is very good in terms of generating a positive impact for a society. In fact, to invest in projects, a lot of bureaucracy is usually involved by traditional means, banks, contracts and so on. If this financial support can be done in a more clear, direct and secure way, which are characteristics already present in cryptography. In addition, this proposal addresses a branch of the economy that is not commonly seen in the activities of the Catalyst community, which is agriculture. That is why I believe that this proposal can add value to the community, by exploring a field that is not common (at least there are no proposals that address this topic, generally), and bring it to the universe of blockshain.

Draft proposal. The problem and solution description are reasonable, but the absence of a detailed plan, details about the problem and metrics make it difficult to measure the impact that this proposal will bring to the challenge and to Cardano. I recommend that the proposer discuss more about the problem and the potential that this proposal can bring and also include solid metrics / goals that indicate the potential of the impact.

The idea of this proposal is great and could be useful to support local farmers, however, there is is not enough information to know to what extent this proposal could address the challenge. In order to increase the score more information must be added.

More details on plan required, Milestones, technolgy, platforms etc. Proposer calims domain experience (Linkedin profile to confirm would be great), however no technical expertise to produce the product. Is this to be hired?

Taking into account the size of this issue - according to the problem statement ("Every farmer in America is forced to go to big banks for funding. And the average citizen is not allowed to invest in their local farms") - the evidence for the proposer's ability to resolve this issue is not documented sufficiently well. 
The relevant experience of Agricultural Trade Executive / Technology Entrepreneur is welcome, but that statement alone is not backed up with evidence (references, links, etc.) of relevant skills and experience needed to implement a proposal of this magnitude. This proposal might be limited in scope, but it pretends to tackle an enormous problem that has not been resolved to date (according to the proposer) and as such there are evidently multiple possible points of failure.
An analysis of the reasons why such systems do not exist today would have been welcome. 
The proposal was submitted by a individual proposer and it is not clear who are the members of the team that will supply the proposed stages (Technology Development Research; Website and Social Development; Financial and Business Model Development; Tokenazation Development; Marketing Research) and their relevant experience and skills.
There is also a lack of detail in terms of technical aspects like architecture, language and technologies that will be utilized. "Smart contracts" are a general reference, but this is sufficiently good for an idea stage, not enough for a funding proposal, in my view. 
All in all, a lot is left open and there seems to be too much room for interpretation and the nitty gritty details of implementation do not seem to be hammered out. There is a general budget outline, but it does not seem sufficiently itemized and broken down into more components - apart from the five subheadings.

The proposer has experience with agricultural trade, but it is not clear it there is already someone engaged to de the development of the application or if someone would be hired afterwards. Also, the team seems not to be engaged yet. The budget is broken down, but it should be better explained. For example, what technology research means in this case? More information about the proposal in general should be included in order to better understand its feasibility.

The proposer has relevant experience on the marketing and sales aspect of the project. There is, however, no concrete plan on execution included in the proposal yet. 
This will need a team to develop. There are already other projects in the comments looking to collaborate. This might be a good move to increase the feasibility and realise this cause.

While the proposer seems to be enthusiastic about Cardano according to his social media footprint (specifically linked.in) his profile provides no proof of formal qualifications or projects that have already been successfully implemented in the space. The plan lacks detail, only a few low-detailed milestones and rough financial calculations are not enough.

It is interesting that the author of the proposal includes his direct contact by email, because he demonstrates availability and a close connection with the project. However, there is little information about it. Professionally, we can only know that he is an entrepreneur and in the technology area ... which is vague information. It would be more positive if the author included a portfolio, a profile on Linkedin, or simply explained more details about his professional career. I also thought it necessary for the author to show his intention to form a team, which would be necessary for the successful realization of the project. This team would need people to build the platform, people who already knew how to carry out transactions in cryptocurrencies, I think it would be interesting also people focused on educating future users on how these processes would happen, since it is a financial sector that is still little known by people generally.

Draft proposal. The only information about the team experience is: "Agricultural Trade Executive."

It is not possible to assess the suitability to implement a proposal with this information alone. I recommend that the proposer describe details.

There is no plan. The budget was detailed, but it is not possible to understand the feasibility of the budget without a plan being presented.

The proposal does not include enough information to tell voters whether the plan could be implemented successfully or whether the proposer has the necessary background to achieve it. Significantly more information needs to be added.

In addition to technical plan details, there is no information of how the proposer plans to reach the farmers. What country? What is the marketing strategy? Why are citizens investing? Do they get a return? If so what is it and how is it monitored? How does the information get into the smart contract?

The proposer has provided a roadmap with milestones and he has included a time horizon for achievement. This will facilitate audits although the milestones are somewhat general and the issue of quality of output is not addressed.
This proposal is so much more than building a platform as the platform itself will not mean antyhing if it is not used. Some metrics about its use and KPIs about how the proposal's success is measured (apart from having  10 farmers hosted in the marketplace) would have been welcome. 
I think that the true nature of the problem may have not been sufficiently deeply explored as it is a massive issue ("the average citizen is not allowed to invest in their local farms") - the reasons must be complex and the solution will probably have to be watertight on several fronts if it is to function successfully. All these aspects related to ensuring that  average citizens can invest in farmers, protected by smart contracts will need to be audited, not only delivering the code or creating tokens. 
There are legal issues/considerations, market considerations, price variability considerations, risks and threats inherent to farming systems - not sure if all of these are being and how are they being addressed with the proposed solution.

Some milestones are indicated there, creating a very simple roadmap. This could be the basis of the audit. Although, more information is needed, like some KPIs regarding the usage of the tool and not only registered farmers. There should also be included some discussion about possible risks regarding legislation in the US, since it's where the proposer lives.

There isn't much information to assess the proposal. It needs a drawn out plan as to how you plan to realise all this. To some degree a risk assessment would be in place as you would compete with large centralised organisations. 
The budget breakdown is set correctly and realistically.

The milestones are existent, could be a bit more detailed though. All in all the proposal could be more detailed about the exact execution of the idea. It is basically one sentence+ the milestones. It would be rated even worse, but at least that information which is there is auditable. It is appreciated that the budget is split into several tasks.

In relation to detailing the action plan, the author points out how the financial amount will be used, to which parts of the development how much money would be destined. Also, an estimate in months of the actions to be taken. However, the probable dates of progress of the project, necessary for monitoring progress, are not provided, nor is it explained how each part would work. For example, 8k would be used for marketing… but how would that be done? Through social networks? Does he intend to create a brand? Which audience do you want to reach, and in what way? There are many outstanding issues, which, if clarified, would greatly enrich the project in terms of reliability and safety.

There is a budget breakdown (which, due to the absence of a plan, becomes doubtful) and some success goals, however the only relevant and tangible metric is the 12-month success goal, where the participation of 10 farmers as a metric is established.

There is no roadmap, there are no milestones, there are no details about the proposer's experience and qualification, there are no KPIs.

I recommend including this information so that the proposal is better able to be audited.

Unfortunately there is not enough information in the proposal to assess this criteria or for voter's to make an informed decision. To increase the score the proposal should at least include performance indicators and milestones that can be measured as proof of success.
This proposal addresses a key Yoroi integration with exchanges/wallets that must be updated before Alonzo.
proposalTitle: Cardano Rust SDK update for Alonzo

assessmentNote: this seems that is wanted, but not necessarily as urgent as libraries for other programming languages that are more popular
proposalTitle: Cardano Rust SDK update for Alonzo

assessmentNote: This proposal is essential for nearly all developers in the cardano ecosystem. without updating the SDK there is a risk that many things stop working with Alonzo. who better to address this than the team that first wrote it?
proposalTitle: Cardano Rust SDK update for Alonzo

assessmentNote: The Rust SDK is already an essential piece of the Cardano Ecosystem, if it were not updated for Alonzo it would have a very bad impact and would cause many delays and problems. The team has a proven long time record within the community and as part of Emurgo.
proposalTitle: Cardano Rust SDK update for Alonzo

assessmentNote: Here we must say that the names and proven track records of the team is what give them this 5 stars review. If it weren't for their previous achievements they would only get 3 stars at best. We know we can trust them because we know them and we know they'll deliver but they could have made more efforts to give a cost breakdown with a detailed plan and time schedule, and all the things that we require for other proposals. They should not abuse the community's trust.
proposalTitle: Cardano Rust SDK update for Alonzo

assessmentNote: As said in previous notes, the notoriety of the team is what gives them credit to deliver and be accountable, but this proposal is really lacking the standard information required (cost breakdown, time schedule, deliverables, links to profiles etc...). I give them 4 stars because as a long time member of the community myself I know who they are but solely based on the information in their proposal they deserve a rating of 2 or less. They should have been exemplary. Now the definition of success is clear: The Rust SDK will be compatible with Alonzo or it won't be, there's no real gradation.
proposalTitle: Cardano Rust SDK update for Alonzo

assessmentNote: Enabling DApps to access a web wallet will allow for more types of applications to be build and may indirectly contribute to increased adoption.

This project will help make utilization of the wallet much simpler and easier through a web-browser-based system (a la Metamask).   To be fair if something like this existed it would simplify the purchasing and buying process through DApps but at this point it isn't critical yet as additional DApps would need to be developed to connect to it.
This is an essential piece of infrastructure that is being proposed by the dcSpark team. Reducing friction in the wallet experience is essential for broad adoption of crypto and cardano.

The team information is sparse and their ideascale profiles do not offer much insight into their track record and abilities. A big plus for the connector between Yoroi and Ergo - links would have been great.
The team has already completed this 'Metamask Connector' for the Yoroi to Ergo dApp integration.

This team is composed of Emurgo hands and more than capable of getting a project of this scope/scale completed.  Although the proposal is rather slim compared to others, as this will likely be running as an extension through Emurgo is will have strong project management and guidance to develop it.
This team has built/upgraded Yoroi wallet and has all of the dev resources needed to implement this solution.
The dcSpark's team is highly skilled, and has been working with Cardano/Ergo for years. There is little doubt that the team will run into trouble.

While external factors (e.g. approval of CIP) may delay a proposed timeline, expected difficulties and a breakdown of the requested funds are missing. However, the wallet functionality is self-explanatory and a perceived necessity.
The proposal does not go in detail about how the money are going to be spend. Also, there is no time line. I think this prosal is critical, but need a little bit more of work on it.
A more detailed roadmap and project timeline would be helpful to keep this project more auditable for development and implementation.

while the proposal doesn't set goals for delivery of a final product it is clear that with this smaller budget that the scope, timeline and budget each align. The team's experience adds confidence that the key project milestones are accurately scoped.

Having documents in your native language is very important, it can be a barrier for a lot of people who would like to join Project Catalyst, but are reluctant because English is not their first language.

Japan is reportedly holding substantial ADA and is quite open to cryptocurrency innovation. There is a large community however contribution to catalysts so has not been substantial. The specific tasks like Translation of Plutus documentation to the Japanese language and helping enterpernuers to navigate Cardano have the potential to contribute to the Cardano Ecosystem.

There is no clarity about the problem to be solved. I recommend including more details about the difficulties for devs and entrepreneurs in Japan.

The idea is to provide advice and educate entrepreneurs and developers about the Cardano Ecosystem, in addition to translating Plutus material for developers (but the last part is outside the scope of the challenge, as this challenge is focused on entrepreneurs and non-developers)

No metrics or goals have been described, which makes it difficult to assess the potential impact of the proposal on the challenge.

It is not clear how this proposal will result in entrepreneurs actively participating and submitting proposals on Catalyst.

The idea to develop a local community in Japan is good, but I'm just not sure about the need to have someone locally there since most of the work and relations is currently performed online, so I believe an office would not be essential for this proposal. But the fact that proposers have worked with EMURGO in the past is very good. Some more information about this should be included. And also some more information in general regarding the proposal itself to better understand the plans.

The team says that it already has an office in Japan and connections in the local Cardano community. Yet they provide no links to their previous experience or anything that might prove the veracity of their description. The plan has a good basis, but it would have been better to have some more details.

The proposer claim that they have worked with EMURGO and have developers in Japan. They also have established a legal entity in Japan. Given these accomplishments, it is likely the proposal is likely to be implemented successfully.

The team is extremely qualified to execute the proposal. The three team members are simply the former Emurgo CEO, Nico Arqueros; Ex-Co-VP of Engineering and Product Manager, Sebastien Guillemot and Emurgo Head of Research, Robert Kornacki.

My only recommendation regarding the team is that they communicate this information more clearly and add links so that the community has easy access.

There is no budget breakdown. The plan does not contain many details and there is no timeline. The absence of a detailed plan makes it difficult to assess feasibility.

  I recommend including more details and making it clearer how this proposal will result in more entrepreneurs from the Japanese community participating in Catalyst.

The fact that the team has had work experience with EMURGO is really good, but this information should be better explained in the proposal itself. Also, it's good that there is a Cardano developer involved in the project. Although, there is not much concrete information and a concrete plan of how this would be implemented, for how long, and how the money would be used. The budget should be better explained, and some concrete and measurable goals should also be defined.

Sebastien is fluent Japanese, lives there, and has been working in tech in Japan for years which means that there is little chance that this proposal fails. the only concern is that a # of people introduced to cardano isn't presented.

While the team does have a plan and already a good start, they do not provide any information regarding the budget, the metrics or any other details that might have suggested that they have planned rigorously.
It would be good to have some expected numbers of developers who would be reached/supported through this.

The proposal is detailed to an extent. Specifics such as number of meetings, number of potential contributors to be addresses, and a planned location and methodology for outreach tour of Japan are not mentioned in the proposal. Moreover, the breakdown of cost associated with the proposal is also not enclosed.

There is no information to allow auditability in this proposal (metrics, KPIs, roadmap, budget breakdown). I recommend that the team describe items that allow auditability as per the Catalyst documentation and ask for the help of a mentor to search for the documentation, if necessary.

The proposal lacks a roadmap, milestones and KPIs. It currently has some goals but they are not measurable and it might be difficult to audit this proposal if actually it gets funded. The proposal in general need more details, but specifically there is almost none information to support it's auditability. Also, this should be focused on new proposers getting into Catalyst, so some KPIs regarding this should be added.
the only concern is that a # of people introduced to cardano isn't presented.

The proposal offers some interesting ideas and concepts that would address the challenge, such as the referral scheme (buddy tag system) and mentoring of new users. It still reads only as a top level concept though and would benefit from further refinement and more details to become a executable proposal.

Three out of the four elements of the proposal focus on outreach and attracting new community members, so the proposal would have probably been better place in the Proposer Outreach or Value Onboarding challenges. The underlying assumption on which this proposal is built is that we should give up anonymity, but my sense is that a lot of the members in our community value their anonymity.

The proposal helps to push distributed decision making and helps to increase participation. The idea about a TAG-System sounds very interesting and could help the communtiy-network effect grow. On the other hand we're in the field of blockchain and crypto and loads of people like to keep their privacy.

A Buddy system to train 6 new incoming persons and rewards for doing so is a unique idea. The social media campaign and AI bots do not have a clear utility. The Cardano community has an immense presence, therefore the Ad campaign does not seems to be an ideal solution.

The proposal effectively contributes to addressing the challenge but it could have been a little more descriptive on how they see the communications and engagement strategy ultimately affecting community (distributed) decision making. We may be able to imagine how the communications and engagement strategy may contribute to that but it should have been the responsibility of the proponent to help us visualize it. In my opinion, the proposal is promising.

It's not clear what experience the proposer has that would help him achieve this, specially for the 3rd section of data analyses and AI automation section. It also doesn't seem feasible for the proposer to set-up a referral scheme, mentoring, data analyses and creation of a video message board on his own. The plan lacks many details e.g. which social media will be used to advertise, what type of adverts, how the buddy tag system will be implemented, who will sponsor and mentor new recruits, what type of data analyses techniques you will use, etc.
The budget allocation is also very briefly described, for example you say "Social Media targeted Ad Campaigns- 5000" you should detail how many adds you intend to lunch and in which platforms.
The plan lacks concrete details and the proposer doesn't have any stated technical background to produce a solution.

The proposer states that he has a background in healthcare and education, but no information is presented to verify this. More so this proposal is marketing and functionality oriented, yet no credentials or information is given regarding that. Furthermore the proposal includes the development of an AI to parse community information, yet no concrete plan is presented about how would this be achieved. Who would actually implemented it, the budget for that part seems extremely low.

The experience of the proposer doesn't fit a 100% the qualifications that are needed for such a proposal. The goal is appartently to outsource a lot of tasks but wouldn't it be better to focus on one thing and do it right instead of trying to achieve several different goals?  It would be good to actually first gather a team or at least one or two persons so voter see that you are committed. There is a sensible butget and a fair allocation of funds.

The proposer claims limited experience in software development and has not identified developers capable of developing an AI bot. It is a difficult proposition to implement such a complex system on such a small budget.

The proposal does not require that the proponent demonstrate the skills to achieve implementation on their own. Instead, the proposal suggests relying on in-house experience and outsourcing. Given that the realm of the proposal is established on social media, the existing technical experience related to Cardano should be more than enough to pursue the project satisfactorily. The project would benefit from clearly identifying (or hiring) someone with the demonstrated experience, inside of the Cardano community or in the professional market. If I could I would have given the proposal a 3.5 (or a little bit more).

There are no milestones presented on how the concepts would be developed. There is no criteria of success presented e.g. minimum amount of participants referred via buddy tag system and number of users brought in via adds.

Setting aside the elements of the proposal, there's no clear plan as to how those elements will be actually implemented. No clear roadmap dates are given. No KPIs. No metrics by which to asses progress.There's no description of the team/person who would actually implement the proposal. Having video content attached to proposals would help with decision making for sure, but isn't attaching videos already an option for proposals who want to do it, why would we need a separate platform.

There is a lot of informations on what the proposer likes to achieve but not that much about how to achieve it. A more detailed roadmap would benefit. If you compare the proposal to others you can see what I mean.

The proposal has sufficient information; however, it will be difficult to audit the progress of AI bot performance and the social media campaign. There is also a lack of info concerning the development of the solution.

Given that the reality of the proposal is, for the most part, established social media and other collaborative platforms, it should be easy to create a detailed audit for its implementation. Thanks to the proponent for their contribution.

The problem statement is confusing and doesn't address the challenge. "WADA's capacity is currently limited by their web app capacity." what does this mean ? WADA's website has reached is capacity, WADA cannot cope with more community members ?. This needs to be better described.
The proposal purpose seems to be  focused on helping developers, which doesn't address this challenge, would sit better in Developer ecosystem or Grow Africa, Grow Cardano

It is not clear how this aids in decentralized decision main for the Cardano community. If this is purely about WADA internal systems, it should probably be proposed under the "grow Africa, grow Cardano" fund.

This proposal is the second stage of the proposal: "+ WADA Outreach = Smart Catalyst Users" (Fund4).

The problem and solution statement does not indicate a relationship with the challenge. There is no indication of how this proposal or the proposal "+ WADA Outreach = Smart Catalyst Users" addresses the challenge, there is only one mention of decision making distributed in the previous proposal ("+ WADA Outreach = Smart Catalyst Users" from Fund 4) and this mention is inconclusive.

I recommend that the proposal describe in an objective way how it will address the challenge, since the only mention is about proposal outreach in a way and this is very subjective. What would proposal outreach be?

The metrics described in Fund4's proposal indicate that the proposal was more aligned with the challenges of Proposer Outreach or Developer Ecosystem.

While thorough and well-written, the proposals objectives are not aligned with the topic of Distributed Decision Making. Instead, this proposal is focused on a software development utility. The Developer's Ecosystem would have been a better topic for this proposal.

I am not able to identify the specific system that the proposer is trying to build. A question in the comments section was not answered. A distributed integrated management system sounds like a to fit to the challenge but there are more details needed to understand, what will be created. A list of features that this system will have, would help.

It's not clear what experience that team has. The github page mentioned is for a lost and found application (!!), with the last commit happening in 2019. The plan mentions that this proposal addresses phase 2 of the Fund4 proposal,  but i can't find evidence of completion of phase 1. The plan is a to brief e.g. at 3 months: "WADA Integrated management system is fully operational", how will this step be achieved ? what architecture/language will this be built in ?

The WADA team already has great involvement with the Cardano community and already has projects under development. There is information on the experience and skills of WADA and DITC that indicate capacity to execute the proposal, however I recommend that links to the members' profile be made available, as as the proposal describes the need for several members with different skills it is important that we can evaluate this in an appropriate and transparent way.

The proposal describes the need for 16 members, but the budget describes allocation of resources for only 5, this is confusing. Will only part of the team be paid?

There is little information about the proposal plan. Fund 4's proposal is described as a management system for streamline / optimize its proposal outreach mission, but it doesn't make it clear how important or relevant this is or even what "proposal outreach" means.

There is also mention of the development of a distributed ledger of the DAG type, but what is the relationship between the web app for management for streamline / optimize its proposal outreach and the development of a DAG and how does this relate to the Distributed Decision Making challenge?

This proposal has a dependence on the funding requested in the first stage, this was not described in the proposal, but I think it is an important aspect to be mentioned.  

The lack of clarity in the purpose of the proposal and in the plan makes appropriate feedback difficult, I think it is important that this can be communicated with greater clarity.

Important to note this proposal cover Phase 2 of a Fund 4 proposal, and need 3 months for completion. WADA not only carry on without funding in the interim . After completion in 3 months it will be a gateway for proposers to Project Catalyst, include crowdfunding platform for WADA membership schemes, which can be easily replicated to Project Catalyst later.

The listed teams is quite large and would allow to build several things. As I have problems to undersand the product(s) that should be built and there was no feedback to the comment, I stay neutral in this question.

Brief milestones are described within the "Success looks like" section which is confusing. Given that the requested funding will go towards only the first 3 months, the milestone presented "WADA Integrated management system is fully operational. Website becomes a gateway for proposers in Project Catalyst." is very brief, i.e. you present only your final desired solution but not the steps required to reach it.
No success criteria is presented e.g. how many members added to the community, how many people trained, etc

The first stage of the proposal (Fund 4) describes a reasonable timeline with some defined milestones, this timeline was used as a reference for the definition of the proposal's success in Fund5, however I think it is important to describe a raodmap, with goals, milestones and KPI in the current proposal.

There is no clarity in the problem, in the solution and how the proposal will address the challenge, in fact everything described in this proposal and in Fund4's proposal indicates that the proposal is more aligned with the challenges of Proposer Outreach or Developer Ecosystem.
More details are needed regarding "what does success look like". Currently, the 3, 6, and 12-month goals are vague with regard to the development of WADA.

Assessment checklist completed, budget of 12000 USD requested with detail of brake-up. Detail lay-out of plans, resources, time and success parameters. It is easy to see WADA and partners plan a great future together with Project Catalyst and Cardano Community in immediate future.

The information about "what success looks like" is available and also a basic budget breakdown. No work-packages or milestones are available, that shows a direct connection to the things that will be built. The proposal make the impression, that it is not known, what will be implemented. It would be much better, if there was a list of features that the applications need to have and then milestones, when the applications with those features will be available. The current information is to vague to allow a proper audit.

I think the team is certainly on the right track towards engaging further proposals to PC. They could perhaps identify how they will access new blood to the process. How to encourage folk to attend podcasts for example.

The idea dialogues well with the objectives of the challenge, because it seeks to attract new members (from what I understand, focusing on Africans, which also relates to the objectives of the Africa challenge, in that same round) and projects for the community. This would be done through the creation of an online material, focused on visual representation, that would show the entire path of a project, from its conception to financing, completion and practice. The team says that there are already workshops focused on guiding new projects, but their differential would be to do it in a more personal way and also using projects that were previously completed as examples.

Video material regarding on ground positive impact of Projet catalyst can galvanize people with doubts to get involved. There is a requirement to document the role being played by Cardano in Africa and its impact. There is also a substantial chance that new proposers will join this social initiative.

The team appears to be making good connections to forward this project and I realise negotiations are pending with a number of PC community. I query training need somewhat at this stage, I wonder if the team have exhausted community resources?

The team that proposes to carry out this idea is, according to what has been said, composed of professionals from different areas, such as educators, marketing specialists, developers and so on. They also show their intention to close partnerships, such as with the New Mindflow group, focused on audiovisual content, which would be essential for the realization of the project.
