Developing tools to facilitate that bridge addresses the brief of this challenge head-on by creating an easier working environment to engage with and giving them reason to become an active developer on the Cardano platform.
proposalTitle: Native Token API for Game Devs

assessmentNote: It is an interesting proposal however purely using total historical pay as signal of quality has issues. At a minimum more information such as number of jobs, whether fired before contract completion should be taken into account. Metadata about the type of job should also be recorded and taken into account. Also it suffers from a chicken and egg problem. Until many people have used it for a long time, it shows a very incomplete history of a worker. If it took off it would obviously drive usage of ADA in Africa.

The suggested proposal would create a secondary option to receive initial funding for developers in a shorter period of time. At the moment, presenting on Catalyst is challenging for proposers since they are competing with more seasoned teams, and challenging for CAs since they have to review ideas and not products. This proposal would address both issues and help streamline the process of launching a project on Cardano.

The proposal explains the process very clearly and has listed steps that will be undertaken in chronological order. The proposal has verifiable settings and can present measurable outcomes in terms of a number of proposers attracted and funded in Catalyst through these events.

The proposer provided a detailed breakdown of their project with sufficient information on budgetary needs and expenditures, roadmap timelines, and team description. They have also set forth a number of goals and milestones which will be easy to track in order to gauge the success of their endeavor.

I can see the importance of a payment system within an NFT framework.  It will certainly streamline the development process. Any NFT framework will want a streamlined payment option available to accept widely used payment methods for auctions and sales. The proposers do a good job of explaining this need. It is a challenging gap to fill and it would be wasteful if every project had to develop a payment framework independently.

I wish a more detailed breakdown of the use of funds was provided, but I realize the exact trajectory of the project is not easy to predict. Still, the proposal would benefit from a detailed rationale as to how they came to the 70K number, and how funds will be allocated in each stage.  As it is, we can follow github and expect an MVP in 3 months and a functioning product in 6 months.  Due to a lack of additional details or reporting, It will be difficult to audit how efficiently the funds are used. I suggest, if funded, they improve their transparency in this respect.

It is not clear how building a local stake pool significantly expands Cardano in Africa. A local marketplace to trade mpesa for ADA would be useful, though why Catalyst should be funding a 20,000 float of ADA is not clear. Transfers take seconds, this could be bootstrapped and built up using liquidity on other exchanges.

This proposal clearly addresses the challenge of creating a positive developer ecosystem by promoting research into interoperable NFTs across chains(Space Travel). There is an overwhelming amount of NFT proposals for Fund 5 in Catalyst. I believe the proposer does a good job of distinguishing from the pack by making this a research project. Promoting collaboration among this experienced group of developers and NFT enthusiast will result in some epic brainstorming sessions and ideally a framework to deploy a scalable and elegant solution.

The NFT DAO team has several members with experience in the field of NFTs and are already participating members of the Catalyst community. In addition, they were one of the winners in Fund3 and are delivering promising results in their projects.

In general the proposal is well structured, there is an objective rationale about the objective of the proposal.

The budget will be destined to do research for one month, but an estimate of hours or workload for the research has not been defined, which makes it difficult to assess the feasibility of the budget.

Excellent information provided with extensive bio of team presented. Plan satisfactory but possibly an opportunity missed re: detailing examples of what the project might become. As it stands the team are asking for funds to do research which is fine but would have been improved with greater links to examples even if these were simply a mock up or others work  re: bondly reference.

This is an excellent and necessary idea, but since it is just the research phase it is difficult to gauge what success looks like. I understand, as you stated, that in 6 months you would like additional proposals submitted, and in 12 months to have proposals approved and development started. I would have liked more details though on each of these steps including the first month of research. The NFT space is evolving so rapidly it is challenging to map out an interoperable framework between two chains today. It is an order of magnitude more difficult to predict the landscape a year from now. That is why starting research and utilizing this experienced team will be crucial to make "Space Travel" possible on the Cardano blockchain.

This proposal is well structured, identified some existing problems in the ticket market and proposes a viable solution. By explaining the several components that the team wants to build they clearly articulate how they will add value to the Cardano ecosystem. The proposal fits well into the narrative of this challenge.

The problem and solution descriptions are clear and objective. The proposal indicates a direct relationship with this challenge and has the potential to bring many users and transactions to Cardano's blockchain through a relevant market. The goals described in the plan indicate the potential for significant impact.

The plan is very well structured and detailed. There are relevant details about the experience and qualifications of the main members of the NFT DAO, indicating their ability to implement this proposal successfully.

The NFT DAO is one of Fund3's winning proposals and has demonstrated excellent performance and achievements for the NFTs space on Cardano.

There are details on budget allocation.

There is a reasonable and well-defined timeline

In general, the proposal describes many details that assist in auditability. There are details about the team, budget breakdown, relevant goals, a clear timeline with defined milestones.

I recommend only the inclusion of KPIs that allow a more objective audit.

There is clarity on how the problem will be addressed and on the alignment of the proposal with this challenge. There are details about the team, a solid and detailed plan, including a clear timeline, relevant delivables and goals. I recommend including KPIs and details on budget allocation.

This proposal addresses an interesting use case for dApps but it is giving the impression of being an idea more then a well thought out proposal. I believe this proposal could be a good addition to the Cardano ecosystem but the proposal needs to be refined before it is ready to be considered for funding. You should identify and present key metrics and goals in your proposal. Examples of key metrics could be monthly participants in raffles, volume etc. Will there be any tokens related to raffly? If so, what are their role?
The proposed idea is very interesting, but the actual proposal needs to be refined and completed, in its current form, I rate this proposal a (2) in terms of impact.
proposalTitle: Raffly.io the simple way to raffle

assessmentNote: As mentioned, the legalities of getting this going is an issue. There isn't mention on how that will be addressed. The developer does not seem to be a lawyer or have mention of people involved to figure out the legal part. I think it would be a good idea to have a detailed plan for this and what costs may be associated.
proposalTitle: Raffly.io the simple way to raffle

assessmentNote: Draft proposal. There is no reasonable plan, just a basic ratinale of a raffle model. There is potential in the concept, as there is a successful dapp on Ethereum called Pool Together that works as a lottery and has a very similar structure. The proposer did not declare relevant experience for the development of a dapp.
proposalTitle: Raffly.io the simple way to raffle

assessmentNote: The proposers certainly seems to have previous experience with running successful raffles, but running a mail-in application raffle and a blockchain based platform are two very different things. Providing a detailed plan to building the online platform and how it would interact with the Cardano blockchain would be crucial in assessing the feasibility of this proposal and I would highly recommend including them in the next iteration.
proposalTitle: Raffly.io the simple way to raffle

assessmentNote: More details are needed for this one. I would recommend cutting back the scope of the project. If, say, you were to only focus on digital assets such as NFT being raffled then I think that would make a good starting point and not get you into trouble with the legality. I think other assets are a good idea but it would be best to have a standing dapp that works first and then enhance the project further in the future to incorporate more types of asset. Additional metrics and roadmap would be helpful. How many hours will this take? how was the amount decided on? Is there a team? etc.
proposalTitle: Raffly.io the simple way to raffle

assessmentNote: The proposal lacks all the elements required in the self assessment checklist, and I strongly recommend including them in the next iteration (can be checked when submitting the proposal). The website link points to a parked domain and the additional details that were promised haven't materialised. I suggest refining the proposal and resubmitting in a future fund, as it would be impossible for the community to audit the results in its current form.
proposalTitle: Raffly.io the simple way to raffle

assessmentNote: Slush has attracted many startups and venture capitalists in the last 10 years of its existence. Carano has a host of possibilities for exploitation by both. Therefore the proposal to include Cardano in Slush 2021 is perfectly matching with the criteria of this fund.

I agree that one of the biggest ways to outreach is to get bright people to contribute with the environment and no place is better to find this kind of people than start-up/entrepreneur meetings. 

I've just missed some more detailed information about the partnership, how it will actually work. In the "potential value-adding services" topic is mentioned very briefly the improvements, however I wonder how much space will Project Catalyst really have to pass information, newsletter and co-participate in lectures or presentations.

The problem and solution statement are reasonable, the proposal intends to organize and document information between different DAOS related to Catalyst, which I see as something essential for our community. Each DAO ends up having to develop different models to define how decision making will be carried out in a distributed manner, this is an inherent aspect of DAOs and bringing together the experience and knowledge of each DAO can help improve Catalyst decision making. Although I see potential in the proposal, it is not clear how it will impact decision making in the next 2 of the Funds. I understand that much of what has been described has an experimental character, but I think it could be better addressed.

The proposers seem to have the experience and motivations to implement this proposal. The roadmap presented for phase 1 is not very ambitious and not very detailed i.e. they plan to facilitate "an initial meeting between representatives from member DAOs" and draw a publication from these meetings/collaborations. In my opinion these steps should be taken before, and the publication/research documents that come out of these meetings  would form the basis of a more impactfull proposal. As it stands we don't know what we are funding, no concrete ideas to improve DAO's.

The team is requesting a modest amount of money for a well-thought-out and relatively simple plan to execute. While the three-month plan proposed may not be adequate to fully realize the ambition of hosting a Council of Catalyst DAOs, the team has outlined what they will propose in future funding rounds to continue the development.

Proposal appears to be a suitable for the challenge. Any additions to Yoroi wallet application is a welcome. I wonder if the question was asked "what else would you like to see in Yoroi?" if users would submit further use cases.

The proposal addresses a very particular aspect of the challenge - creating tools to improve the developers experience on Cardano. The scope of the challenge is very focused, however the thing it has pinpointed will definitely simplify the works of devs on the ecosystem.

Considering the background of the proposing team, the fact that it's a relatively small task, the small amount of man hours required to implement it and the small budget required I foresee a very high chance of successfully implementing the deliverable of this proposal and improving the experience of devs working with Yoroi.

The proposal involves adding a feature to your backend. This is likely to a simple step and can be easily monitored. The success can also be measured based on the number of developers using the feature.

This proposal has a very limited and targeted scope and identifies a problem that needs to be solved that will ultimately benefit developers of the Yoroi wallet specifically, but crucially also the entire community - including Cardano developers in general. 
The proposers do state that they are aware that the proposal "doesn't completely fit within the developer ecosystem challenge". 
I do agree that while strict standards - if we look only narrowly - in this case may not apply - in a wider sense they do apply as the continued success of the Yoroi wallet as a light client has enabled the Cardano ecosystem to thrive and to bring new developers. 

I do agree with the proposers that improving the stake pool operators communication with delegates is critical and that in the end - with Yoroi being one of the two main wallets (at the moment!) in the Cardano ecosystem, in effect it is also being used by developers, stakepool operators and the entire community. 

Essentially, I think that a more robust Yoroi wallet - a critical piece of the Cardano infrastructure at the moment benefits the entire developer ecosystem as there is no single point of failure (Daedalus) or weakness. This limited addition to the Developer Ecosystem challenge in my personal view does open up the way - in a wider sense - for attracting developers to the ecosystem and educating them on how to build applications, especially as it is linked to a specific and existing Cardano Improvement Proposal (CIP 12) that the proposing team co-authored.

The proposers themselves admit that this project doesn't fit the challenge perfectly, however value will be gained from its implementation by the technical Cardano community, indirectly improving the experience of developers building on Cardano.

The plan is straightforward and the proposal is small scale giving me confidence that it will be successfully implemented. The team would appear to have all necessary experience to achieve required result.

The experience listed by the proposers (co-authors of Cardano Improvement Proposal CIP12 with Emurgo) and their work with Emurgo serves as confirmation of the existence of relevant skills and experience needed to implement the proposal. 

The plan is very focused and limited and requires 8 engineering-hours to complete the deliverables. The timetable is realistic and a further breakdown of the budget is not required due to the size of the proposed project.

The proven background of the proposers within the Cardano community, coupled with the low budget the proposal is asking for, make this a very low risk investment. The scope of the proposal is very limited, but everything that it plans to achieve is very clearly described.

The information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and success of the proposal as the authors specify that they will deliver these proposed features within one month from receiving the budget.

The features to be implemented in Yoroi are clearly identified and as such should be easily measurable by auditors who follow up on the implementation. 

The proposing team evidently has a clear awareness of the problem - they even co-authored CIP 12 - and they have and propose a solution that will resolve the problem.

The proposal is lacking in details in terms of verifiable credentials or past experiences to provide any level of confidence that this plan can be executed. It needs to elaborate on what is a 'Launchpad' and how can it be filled with participants and what activities will they perform to improve job prospects and specifically what they can do within the Cardano ecosystem. This is a proposal which is in a very early stage. It will benefit from a more carefully presented document which lists each step to be undertaken, how much it will cost and the resources that is required to achieve its goals. The timelines and milestones will also need to be listed carefully to ensure audibility of each stage of the process.

The proposal addresses the Fund 5 Africa challenge well. It addresses How Cardano can reach more people in Africa by breaking down the language barrier by creating content resources in native African languages. This project, if implemented well, will bring more users to the Cardano ecosystem.

I found this idea very interesting, because it allows music fans to directly support their favorite artists and bands, without the need for a major label to manage them, so that they can have a financial condition to launch future works. In this way, the 3 groups would benefit, the fans, who in addition to directly helping the artists, can, as it says in the proposal, participate in decisions about the works. About this, I thought it was positive, but it is also a little problematic in the question of: would the artist be shaped by the public then? Artistic freedom would be a little compromised if these decisions are considered inflexible, but I believe that these details can be improved). The artists would benefit, and the Cardano community as well, since the app would use tokens and smart contracts to work. In other words, it would be an app that would add value to our community and have a good cultural return.

IT infrastructure costs appear excessive - especially in relation to web/blockchain development. UI/UX design for (what reads like an) mvp appears to be too high, too. $50,000 should be enough to get a mvp off the ground if you know what you're doing - however the unknown developer is a red flag.

The idea is interesting and has the potential to increase adoption. The attached pdf is certainly helpful to communicate key points. However, since the usage of ADA is merely a side-note and the case for fiat is made (plus prices are denoted in $), it is unclear how this would actually help Cardano.

Plan is relatively detailed. It would be good if there was evidence to back up the experience of the proposers (ie linkedin profiles). Do they have connections in the publishing world? Is there a market for this product? What platform are the books to be read on?

Sounds like a good project, but it needs much more details. No one likes big banks, but what problem does this create for farmers? What benefits does your project have to farmers and investors? What are the token mechanics?
Have you made a start building anything yet? You might need to be able to show some progress to get funding.

While I have no doubt that the team has the capability to deliver, the proposal in and of itself is sparse, slightly vague, has no specific roadmap/timeline for delivery or checkpointing, and provides no rationale for the specific funding amount requested.

I do have some misgivings about the potential abuse of users that might use such an Dapp. I cannot fault the potential for such a Dapp if the end product gains acceptance. The concept of P2P betting will eventually gain popularity and so the concept must be given due consideration.

The proposer talks about betting platforms as setting the odds but doesn't mention the biggest centralised competitor this would have BetFair. What about Augur? How will it compete? What is the marketing strategy? How will it deal with regulations on betting?

The proposal falls short in articulating the challenge, its relevance to ADA and the stated DApp solution. It seems this idea is at a very nascent stage and requires further thought and improvement. Potentially it could be redeveloped for submission at a later funding stage, when the 'team' (I assume devs) it seeks is put together to better translate the product and its mechanics.

The problem statement doesn't present a problem, which compromises the understanding of the value proposition, I recommend modifying this.

There are no metrics or goals to assess the impact of the proposal on the challenge.

There is no clarity on the need to use blockchain in this application. What is the financial model for ADA in the app? This is crucial for us to understand the proposal's alignment and impact on the challenge.

Though the proposer has valid experience in the sports and training industry, there are no plans or pathways ahead to assess in order to validate the proposal itself and the solution. There I no likelihood this could be implemented if there are no clear explanations of what is being built, much less provide confidence it can be built successfully.

The proposer has experience in sports and training, which is aligned to the proposal idea, but there is still missing a person to develop the app, which is stated there and that's ok. Although, the proposal lacks a roadmap and information about the plan, how to execute it and a time frame for it. The budget is not detailed. A sensible plan should be included in the text.

This is not a proposal, but a request for developers to join a domain expert to do something in the healthspace. The proposer should reach out in the community to develop a specific proposal and organise with people with the capability to deliver.

The proposal is missing information about roadmap and milestones, KPIs, and other metrics of success. There is no further discussion about the risks and challenges that such an implementation might face. If the proposal is submitted again in a next Fund, it should include all the stated above. In this case, it would be good to include, for example: active members (trainers and 'students'), frequent users (track their progress), number of challenges completes, and others.

This proposal identifies a need for the developer community but doesn't directly address the challenge of generation of DeFi Dapps. This proposal would not only make DeFi development work easier but all Dapp development would be easier which means it could be a better fit elsewhere.

This project is 100% in line with the goals of the challenge: it offers to develop specific Cardano training resources and tools for developers, including a specific playground, to contribute to growth the number of Cardano blockchain developers. I tried following Plutus Program courses: not easy, I'm certainly too low skilled in functional programming. Such a platform, containing tools, Dapp examples and documentation, would help me diving into blockchain programming and would help many new developers coming to Cardano's environment.

Metrics that define success are not very precisely defined. I expect more details on what topics will be addressed, description of the tools that are to be developed, how many types of Dapps example and use-case should be developed. I recommend adding details on the ressources that will be produced to help the community assess the auditability of the project.

This proposal yields an impact score of 3 because it highlights a critical area of need but it is not clear how the value will be provided to end users by the end of this calendar year. The value to end users appears to come not until 2022. The application, according to the proposal's calendar, will launch in Q4 in 2021 which means that the liquidity pool will begin to be created and some people may apply for insurance products through ensuro at that time.

This is a well-founded concept and offers both an investment and customer service dimension that would bring value to different users of the solution.      

Two components of the solution are outlined, but a third component will likely be needed to address insurance customer claims.   

Parametric insurance will depend heavily on external, real-world data.  This should be highlighted more deeply in solution and implementation / roadmap planning.

The concept of modularized risk modeling is a great foundation to build and differentiate your services.  Would respectfully suggest a more reasonable initial product / prototype would be organized around a single risk model to improve focus and to position for iterative learning.

Based on the information given in this project proposal, it is highly likely for this proposal to be implemented because the team has done extensive research intending to solve this real estate problem in Africa. The team member seems to have extensive experience in technology and the real estate industry. This understanding of technology is an edge for the project to be built quickly on top of the Cardano blockchain. The budget per unit is feasible, and I would recommend the team present architectural designs this way, the community will know what type of home can be built. The Tokenizations of Empowa is relevant in helping the project raise more money once the platform is developed.

The current plan to build one house is feasible. Future plans which actually integrate with Cardano Smart Contracts are not detailed. Thus they are hard know if they are feasible. They may require future funding. The question that must be answered is should Catalyst be funding the building of a prototype house. It seems the next phase it what should interest catalyst, and it should not be hard to find a builder who has already built houses that could be used.

The proposer does not provide a description, a development plan or any other element enabling to evaluate the feasibility of the idea. 
The requested budget is not detailed and seems high to me compared to the project, but maybedue to this lack of details of the steps of development. 
The principle of tokenization of an asset is a known principle that does not seem to me to present any particular risk.

The project is very insufficiently described, it is not possible to assess the stages of development and the criteria for success.
The possible obstacles and risks that the project should be investigated and exposed in future proposals at later stages.

The team described extensive experience with software development, web development and software engineering. There are links to your Linkedins and Githubs where you can check the qualifications and expertise. The team is participating in the Plutus Pioneer Program, but there are no details on the team's experience in developing smart contracts.

The integration with SPOs to implement the concept of Babel Fees needs further clarification as the implementation of Babels Fees should not occur in the near future and this makes implementation in the short term unfeasible (within the 6 months that are the reference of this challenge). Nevertheless, it is a promising path for Cardano's DeFi ecosystem.

There is a detailed and reasonable budget.

This is a well presented plan of creatively named releases but very little energy was spent in explaining actual works that rather generalist and academic team members are planning to undertake on day-to-day basis.

The team's credentials are highly experienced with ties to the governments in the countries where they want to deploy this first. Given the structure of the roadmap, everything is already planned. 
If they manage to recruit the right developers, it would be likely to succeed.

While further information may have assisted the overall quality of the proposal I cannot fault the efforts of the team to provide as much as possible. The enthusiasm is evident as is the daunting nature of the project. I like that the team are going to focus on a single location to begin with as I'm quite sure various iterations of the final design will be required to abide by localisation rules and regulations. If the team can get the first region governance resolved I'm confident they can grow further.

Additional information detailing the connection between the raffle, the centres and the increase in Project Catalyst proposers is needed in order to better assess it. The problem solution does not address the problem statement and neither of them seem to tackle the challenge.

The proposal does address the challenge although I'm not sure how effective it will be. The concept certainly has merit and the mock up certainly looks good but I would like to see more about the global outreach campaign. Driven well this project may well increase proposer engagement.

The links to the team's experience should not be hidden in the attached document. There is no character limit for the proposal description and this is one of the most important pieces of information that should be easily accessed when reading the proposal in order to better assess it, both as a community member and as a voter. The attached document does provide a bit of extra information, but still not enough to be able have a clear picture of how it will be implemented.

The proposals are experienced, provided LinkedIn profiles and other information that make it possible to properly evaluate their capacity to implement this project. Also, they already have a platform and partnerships that bring more confidence in this proposal. The budget breakdown is clear, although some point could be better explained, for example, what are expert services, and why a physical space is needed. The return on intention calculation is not clear, how the profits were estimated? If it used the $500,000 number, what source can back this information?
More info on how many people this centre in Panama will actually reach would be useful to enable estimation of the size of thee impact this will have.

Certainly the idea has appeal although the information provided does not give sufficient insight to fully appreciate the author(s) vision. The proposal needs further refinement with additional content. There does not appear to be any rationale attached to the budget which will need better definition to help make this proposal more competitive.

There is no information on how many people will be needed to develop the proposal, the proposer has experience as a full stack software engineer and is participating in the Plutus pioneer program, but there is no information about the proposer's experience with the development of smart contracts and blockchain tech of the blockchain, there is also no information about his level of experience in Haskell / Plutus. Considering that this proposal has a high degree of technical complexity, it is important that we can understand the team's expertise required to develop smart contracts, as the development of smart contracts for loans requires a high degree of reliability. It will be necessary to hire more people to develop the proposal and this raises doubts about the feasibility of the project and the budget.

Requiring KYC in a DeFi dapp is counter intuitive, as one of the great pros of DeFi for unbanked people is that these people do not have documents to access credit lines, so getting KYC excludes these people from the protocol, in addition KYC brings problems for privacy and compromise censorshipo resistance, ultimately for a DeFi dapp to be able to deploy a credit score system and enable undercolateralized loan in a decentralized way it is necessary to implement DIDs and there is no mention of this in the proposal.

The idea of ​​using KYC without DIDs makes the application centralized because it has a dependence on trust, this removes several benefits for using blockchain, which goes against the goal of DeFi. Creating a centralized protocol and sekk decentralize over time has proved to be a failure in the DeFi environment, as DeFi is naturally less user friendly and incentives end up causing the vast majority of DeFi projects to abandon the search for decentralization or to prolong decentralization. . My recommendation is that the proposer look for an option to implement DIDs in the dapp.


There are no details to explain the technical difficulties for the development of dapp, considering that this proposal requires the development of smart contracts for mission critical applications (finance) it is important to clarify whether dapp will be developed in Haskell, margin call mechanisms, what will be the dapp financial model , the need for a token or not, etc ...

There is a budget breakdown, but considering that the development of smart contracts is defined in the budget, it is important to specify the technical capacity of the proposer to develop smart contracts.

The author of the proposal does not appear to be someone involved in the world of technology, because, according to what he declares, he works in the health area. It would take a team already used to this area of activity, programmers and game designers, artists to create the visual elements, etc. We know that he intends to hire them, what is a good point, but it would be better if he detailed as well who would be the professionals who would form this team, more specifically.. I see the author as the creator of the idea, but not as someone who has the techniques to execute it.

Game development is expensive and cost and time delivery overruns are likely - marketing and building and maintaining a player base is also difficult. The proposer has no specific game development experience and has not got a specific team in mind - this in and of itself is not enough to provide a low assessment but adding the need for extensive and detailed execution plan does. The concept is an interesting one however details execution are missing. A budget of $100000 is a lot considering the challenge is $600000. If the proposer is not successful in this funding round I believe that a smaller proof of concept developed to help create credibility might prove like a good way forward.

There is no information about the team that would be involved. 

It is unclear what Flycode current capabilities, or what "Flycode connectors" are.

very low information about the person, a sample of a video would be nice, to see his skill in this area.  I think that most of the time will take just to hire people to help out to make this project happen than is estimated.
The proposer seems to have video editing skills. But no word on experience growing an audience or managing social networks.
The proposal has detailed information regarding execution of their plan. There are minor concerns about long-term sustainability of the funding model.

Cardano's main mission being "bank the unbanked", it is difficult to classify this proposed challenge setting as a priority. It is not clear why it is imperative to have stake pools in 100 countries for growth of Cardano. Currently, SPOs have a choice to either host nodes on bare metal, which will be locked geographically, or on cloud infrastructure, which gives them the freedom of mobility. Therefore, thriving to achieve 100 geographical locations will not provide a clear benefit to Cardano's ecosystem. A more viable option for a challenge setting would be to task SPOs to reach for Carbon neutrality or participation in Charity. Furthermore, current ADA distribution amongst supernodes needs careful consideration and review since it does not support small pool operators. Adding more small pools will not help this problem and will set them up for failure.

I believe that the idea is good, but it would be better to divide it into smaller challenges. 100 is a great number but it would be difficult to reach that amount of people at once. It should also have some criteria to avoid having two different proposals for the same country, since this is very likely to happen. Also, some marketing would be needed in order to achieve the desired goal of 100 countries.

Considering that there are about 195 countries around the world and dozens of those countries already have SPO operations, I think that the established objective may not be realistic, as we do not know exactly how many countries already have some type of operation, this makes it difficult to measure the established goal. Perhaps we should start by defining the number of countries that have some SPO participation (according to the criteria set out in the challenge description)

This does not make the challenge any less important, I just believe that an easier goal to be verified should be set.

The other metrics presented are good indicators for assessing success.

The metrics by which to measure success by in this challenge are certainly on the right path, but they could be more clearly expressed and with a clearer scope of what the actual aim of the projects/proposal would be besides collaboration between the two communities which seems to be the main objective now.

Other criteria like proponents' capability, track record and setup need to be stipulated, and other metrics that get to the heart of whether particular proposals should be differentiated from others as to their likelihood of success are the key to helping the community decide whether particular proposals should be funded. Those are the assessments we should be trying to make a this stage I think, and getting a good set of these for each proposal would be a measure of how well the challenge had gone, in addition to the end result measurements that have been appended so far. The number of use case ideas generated from particular hub proposals, and ways to encourage generation of these, would also be useful to get proponents thinking about and measuring.

Great idea. This will create favorable atmosphere for users, developers to be engaged and involved in building a cardano ecosystem.

In my opinion, your challenges should be directed to a particular interest, purpose or gap in the ecosystem.

This is an area that would soon be a tremendous challenge, even without the resources attached to this Fund 7 Challenge setting proposal. Each of us can simply look at our storage needs and we can all admit that what we have now is never enough. Cardano itself may begin seeing data-storage issues after Alonzo is released. As it currently stands, and with CNFTs being minted without smart contracts, a blockfrost.io proposal claims huge amounts of data already going through their APIs that they have had to present proposals themselves to deal with traffic. That their proposal has nothing to do with storage, but the traffic they observe reveals a lot about the data storage needs of our community. I initially wondered if this should simply be a DApp proposal that could be submitted under normal challenges but given current crypto-projects dealing with this issue are themselves multi-billion dollar projects, I recognise that even the $350000 price tag may not even be enough. This is a project that truly needs a white paper.

The metrics listed is what you expect for the current storage facilities available to us. There well may be other metrics proposals can present which have not yet been considered simply because the novel ways of data storage solutions have not yet presented them. Within this round I have assessed proposals under the Metadata Challenge and most point to a 3rd party centralised storage facility to run in parallel with the immutability of Cardano's metadata. It would be nice to see Cardano involved in not just recording the metadata but having its facilities leveraged to ensure immutability of the data file/s themselves. Good luck to us all.
The goal, as I understand it, is to somehow extend Marlowe so an NFT can be assigned to each contract. Insofar it is in scope, but questions remain.
proposalTitle: NFT for each CARDANO Smart Contract

assessmentNote: Die angeführten Kenntnisse sind überzeugend und die Beschreibung im Video lässt ebenfalls auf hohes Fachwissen schliessen. Die Umsetzung als Open-Source Projekt ist ebenfalls ein positiver Aspekt. Die Kooperation und Weiternutzung des Projekt-Ergenisses wird dadurch vereinfacht.
There is no design doc, and the option proposed is quite opposite to the decentralisation goal of blockchain.
Not clear the proposer has the capability to do this, though has provided 1 demo (I don't speak Russian so can't comment on accuracy). Is 260 per hour of Russian video translation a fair price?

The information provided is realistic and and easy to follow. He knows how to proceed with the translation, he knows the costs and how long it would take. The information is easy to evaluate over the period of three months that he has committed for completion.
People will go to shops and see the terminal. It will give an option in the physical world and might help the adoption speed up.
proposalTitle: Paper wallet terminal for in a shop

assessmentNote: The author of the proposal claims to be an industrial designer, with a master's degree, and to have 8 years of experience building machines, knowing something about programming and systems. But, apparently, he does not have previous experience with the continent or with the training of people (the shopkeeper would need to be well educated), which are important points to be considered as well. It is necessary to increase the range of skills, not discarding the technical part, but adding it with other factors.
proposalTitle: Paper wallet terminal for in a shop

assessmentNote: Nice pictures, embedded in the story of Cardano and showing that there is already put effort in the project. Known track record on engineering.
proposalTitle: Paper wallet terminal for in a shop

assessmentNote:
It is unclear to me what the proposal actually proposes. So I have to guess that it's a project think tank incubator. If so the community might benefit from this. 
It is also not clear what the proposal concludes. Is it a plan to create a communications platform? 
I don't see much value in how this could onboard people to the Catalyst community.

The proposal doesn't make it clear which problem it is seeking to solve. There is no indication of how the proposal is related to the challenge. I recommend that the proposal be included in an appropriate challenge, changed to suit a challenge, or if the proposer believes that there is no challenge related, there is the possibility of creating a new Challenge setting.
Possible a germ of a good idea here. Bring together diverse people to make better proposals. No real plan on how deliver on this.

The proposor works for a Japanese government subcontractor regarding innovation projects. There is no mention of how this project would attract people from outside of the community. Nor is there a mention of any way to market this and get it known to the public.

There is no real plan against which progress can be measured. Proposer wants to incentivise interaction for interactions sake. How does that work. If people interact for interactions sake, what role does incentivisation have?
Great idea to reach out to college graduates as this is a very crypto enthusiastic group. I would like to see more specifics on which Universities you are planning to target.

The experience would affect this rating more positively if interacting with this program (e.g. daily zoom meetings) would be mandatory. Submitting learning plans to staff (and force them to adhere to these) is one thing, creating interest and incentivizing people is a very different story.

It is not clear the proposer has the experience to deliver a successful social media marketing campaign. The proposal states it wants funding for a few months until it come become self funding. However it also states this proposal went into fund4 and if funded there this would be a continuance of funding. These two statements contradict. This raises questions on how well the proposer has though through the funding requirements and thus their ability to to deliver.

The metrics involving the number of people attending each approach method is a good way to measure success of this proposal.
However, I miss a good roadmap.
The proposal hits on a trust problem that may be addressed by blockchain technology, and the paper included an analysis on how big the problem is.
While the project doesn't provide concrete goals, there are references to the potential size of market through out the proposal. the Key metric is clear and it is degrees on chain.
It is likely for this proposal to be implemented because the project plan is good. The most important is will your requested budget be enough? Please give a breakdown.
It is not clear this project meets the challenge. It seems more focused on proposers and entrprenuers.

Your proposal certainly outlines what you aim to do i.e. to provide a website that functions to channel potential developers and proposers into "spaces" with likeminded individuals. This no doubt addresses the challenge. I feel that your proposal could present more detail of the structure of the website and perhaps detail how this funnelling is implemented.

The catalyst common idea funnel sounds interesting to allow an easier access to catalyst but the challenge is called developer ecosystem. It could help proposals that then provide tools that create a positive developer experience. This is that is far fetched.

The developer ecosystem in Cardano is not likely to be improved by funneling or grouping developers into catalysts. The proposal overall explains the Catalyst workflow and has not connected how it is going to improve the developer ecosystem.

How is this classification to be done. Manually? If automatically how are you setting it up? The plan needs more details on how this can automatically be done as a manual process will quickly become unmanageable.

There are not many details about the qualifications of the proposer and there is not a single answer to the questions in the comments. The stages are described well, but that alone creates only little confidence towards a successful implementation.
The proposer claims experience in motivating people in sales and marketing. There is no reference to the type of tool that is proposed or experience in developer management.
The plan needs more concrete detail to asses feasibility. The proposer should provide more information on how this proposal directly addresses the fund challenge as it is unclear.

I could not find any information in your proposal that provides sufficient information to assess how feasible it is and how effectively it addresses the challenge. If a plan of how you would measure success was present in your proposal I feel that voters would be more willing to commit to your project.

A very basic breakdown of the requested funds is provided. There are problem solving contents mentioned and also the salary for a developer. It seems that the proposer does not yet know, what exactly he will do with the funds. He has just a general idea. auditing such thing is extremely hard.
The proposal is abstract and the process to be followed for implementation is not clarified. It is difficult to audit the progress with the present state of clarity.
This proposal has potential to bring holders of all types of crypto assets into the cardano ecosystem, with a simple way to bring them on board.
Not a very detailed plan given the project is asking for  3/5 of the fund. Even this will only in their own admission give them 4 months runway. Then what?

The team appears to be highly experienced and highly motivated and this certainly bodes well for the likelihood of success implementation. It does seem that further thought into the presentation of the plan with staged progression that is budgeted accordingly would improve the chances of successful implementation.

Good proposal build up which is not too long and contains all necessary elements. 
In the funding breakdown, software engineer salaries are pegged to USA standards, which explains the high cost. Is this necessary for a decentralised blockchain that is international in nature?
The proposal has a clear set of milestones on the roadmap, and even identifies that they will need more funding in the future, which shows maturity and necessary risk management skills.

Everything is clear, concise and to the point, the need is clear, the implementation already promising. I really would have liked to see the proposers ask for a higher budget/compensation for their work. They honestly deserve more. But I guess most of those who actually do the work are modest people

The proposal doesn't seem to be aligned with this specific challenge. I can't see a direct connection between a online store for SPOs and the increase in participation in Catalyst. Also, the acronym SPO is not explained for those who are not aware of what it is. I believe this proposal would fit best in another challenge.
There is not enough information regarding the proposer's prior experience, only a self-description and no clear information regarding the implementation, a detailed budget.
No plan on how this addresses the challenge. Why do you need 15,000 to set this up? What is the budget for. This could be done on ebay.

The proposal is insufficient in detail or explanation on how it would be implemented. Without additional details voters cannot make an educated decision and therefore should not support this proposal at this time.
The proposal barely contains ans information, not a concrete plan, no milestones etc. and niw connection to the challenge set.

Draft proposal, there are no details about the plan or any metric that allows audit the proposal. I recommend to submit the proposal in an appropriate challenge, if there is not an appropriate challenge, there is the option to create a new challenge in the Challenge Setting.
People who are interested in staking on Cardano are already in the ecosystem to some degree. This proposal does not address the goal of reaching new people.
How does this bring prospers from outside the Cardano community in to make proposals. SPO's are already in the comunity.

There are already youtubers that do interviews with small SPO owners. And there is a support programm directly from IOHK. There aren't enough details in this proposal to see how exactly this would benefit cardano.

Draft Proposal. The problem and solution described are not related to the challenge, but to the disclosure of SPOs. The absence of a plan, metrics and goals makes it impossible to indicate the impact of the proposal.

Bringing small stake pool operators in front of as many people is a good idea in attracting new people to the Cardano community and also a way to diversify staking even more. But the concept should have contained details regarding the video structure, its marketing and launch date.
As the proposer admits, "Ive never done a YT vid, never wanted to. But for the love of ADA...I'm willing to sacrifice my time to learn, and grow the network/comunity"

The proposer self-identifies as a stakepool operator and marketing professional (among other things), but does not indicate their qualifications in the proposal to turn this into a reality. On the contrary, the proposer acknowledges the lack of expertise.
The proposer does not have the experience to make the videos (stated). More importantly no plan is actually detailed.

There is no plan associated with the proposal and the proposer admits not to have experience with videos and/or youtube, so this looks like a bit risky to me. However, they states to be marketing professional, so this should help a bit. Anyway, I would like to see more effort on the presentation of the plan given the lack of experience.
Draft proposal. There is no plan and the proposer has no experience with video production. I recommend including a detailed plan and submitting the proposal to an appropriate challenge.

No metrics stated, also, given the YT channel, it would be very tricky too. 

I addressed the proposer how would he measure it, he just replied that "as more people would know about it, more people would join", but no tools how to measure it.
It is unclear how $10,000 would be allocated to interview "as many small stakepool operators" as the proposer can.

There are no milestones, deliverables or timelines. The budget is not partitioned and it is unclear what it will be used for. The amount of work is also not scoped, so it's hard to asses what a failure / success is judging only from the short outline
The proposal is really short. Unfortunately there is no information on how exactly the funds are being used or how the proposer plans to measure the success of his youtube channel.
Draft proposal. There is no information to assess the auditability. I recommend following the Catalyst documentation to elaborate the proposal.
There is no detailed description, no plan, no metrics, no prior experience given. As stated above, I recommend re-submission to a future fund.

This is a duplicate proposal and should be withdrawn.
Original proposal - https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/Insurance-Claims-Processing/350998-48088
More details on technical and economic  model. What is the sales channel to get the product accepted even if it is developed? Where is the budget justifying $150,000 funding request?
Little information is presented. The high demand in requested funding in combination with no plan to provide the community with auditability is concerning.
The progress can be audited to an extent. There is a need for the detailed roadmap and project report for enabling detailed assessment.

Not wishing to repeat myself, but the proposer who submitted this proposal has not withdrawn it - but indicated that it is an error. 

He has stated in the only comment that is available to this proposal that it is an erroneous submission as his original proposal can be found here:

https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/Insurance-Claims-Processing/350998-48088

So this proposal is a duplicate and if allowed to proceed with a normal assessment, it could result in voters granting funding for both versions of the same proposal - which would be an error. Hence, I am downvoting it as both cannot be auditable - because the budget would be duplicated - if both win.

However, I would also briefly touch upon the fact that the proposal itself is difficult to audit without milestones, a detailed roadmap, budget breakdown and deliverables. No consideration has been given to risks, problems and challenges.

Requesting USD150000 and not describe anything about your project, is not enough in order to have it assessed. If the team behind it are actually looking to get funding through Catalyst, I suggest re-submitting for a next round of funding.
The funds requested are very high no metrics for success are given. No roadmap or budget breakdown are given. Auditing the use of the funds does not appear possible with the given information.

The provided information is unfortunately lacking. The main idea would be interesting and could add a lot of value to the Cardano ecosystem. But in this proposal, we are lacking crucial information on how the project can be realized.
It is not clear how this proposal solves an existing problem and it is not clear how this project is going to work.
Which maps? are you providingh your own mapping solution. Or using google, apple or open maps?
No detail on how this idea would be applied in the platforms where people view maps.

Draft proposal. There is no plan or objective details on the qualifications of the proposer to develop a project related to NFTs.

What exactly will be tied to the NFT? A satellite image? it is important to remember that today Google dominates this market and monetizing this type of information would involve conflict of interest.
the whole proposal contains only four sentences. I would recommend to have a look at other proposals and resubmit it.
Please provide a detailed plan on how this would be implemented and how you would get it into the platforms where people view maps.
As stated above, the proposal should include more information regarding the detailed project, budget, roadmap and metrics. The proposer hasn't even validated the Self-Assessment checklist.

While it is a useful applicattion that will bring many new people onto the blockchain if correctly implemented, the costs are too high for such an application as compared to what other proposals do with a similar budget. It is failed to describe how this would be connected to blockchain.

The problem description and solution make sense, are reasonable and are within the scope of the challenge.

The proposal describes the potential of the gig economy market and shows potential for positive impact for the challenge and for Cardano, however the lack of roadmap, metrics and goals makes it impossible to measure the potential impact of the proposal.
If the end user experience is outstanding, this proposal can drive adoption for Crypto and Cardano and benefit a lot of people at the same time.

The technological side of things is ignored in this proposal. An idea (even if it's good) means nothing if it cannot be implemented by the team. $50,000 is a big chunk of money but probably not enough over a six year effort that does not have developers or marketing experts.

There is not enough detail on the technical side of what would actually be built or evidence the proposer has the ability to deliver this. More detail should be provided on the marketing strategy as this is key to it being successful.
The proposer provided no verifiable credentials and has no team with the core competentcies to develop such a DApp assembled yet. There is no schedule/no milestones set, and no detailed budget given.

The author cites having many years of experience in relevant companies, in addition to having already worked with online marketing. However, he does not specify what these companies would be, he does not give examples of some of the work he has already done. The information about his professional trajectory is a little vague. In addition, he also does not say whether he intends to form a team to build the application, which professionals he would hire, with what functions and so on. Therefore, I think that in relation to the project's execution capacity, the information is insufficient.
Not feasible in current format. More detailed technical, marketing and economic plan should be provided.

While the creation of a MVP and the assembly of a team are milestones that could be measured, nothing else is contained in the proposal that could be considered an auditable milestone. The proposal overall fails to set a concrete plan of action. no diversified success criteria are defined.
This proposal presents a unique viewpoint on the world, but it only vaguely identifies a problem related to growing the Cardano ecosystem in Africa.  This might work better in a different challenge.
This is an interesting idea. If it worked this would be an interesting way to get a large number of users of Cardano in Africa

The idea is interesting, however, I thought the justification as to why it would be specifically beneficial for a little superficial Africa. I think the environmental issue is of interest to the whole world, so creating an application that seeks to guide people in the development of more ecological habits is valid. And in fact, using ADA in app payments would be beneficial for the Cardano project, now as Africa would be the protagonist in this, it all seemed a little vague. Note: 3.

The proposer has a noble goal to help the Earth by making polluters pay others to garden through a DApp, but doesn't really describe how this would work; The proposal would benefit greatly if more details about the Dapp were provided. Without this information, the proposal does not effectively address the challenge.

This proposal is very holistic in nature and it seems like it may be difficult to gauge how effective it is in meeting the objectives.  I would like to see more detail on what success would look like and how the effect of the proposal could be measured.  I think that could be tricky with such a holistic proposal.
This idea needs more details and linked with people with experience before it can be deemed feasible.

The milestones and the aim are set very open-to-interpretation and a bit vague. Together with what the proposer added in the comments it gives a slight picture of what it could become, however I wish more effort was put into the proposal for something that has so much potential.

The proposer lists serveral milestones over a years time, with only 3 months of that time dedicated to the development of the DApp. It would be helpful if the deliverables for each milestone were more detailed.
proposer is asking for the entire amount of this fund. This requires very strong evidence that the proposal "will provide the most value for end users in 2021". This has not been given.

Honestly, It is a very cool idea for a social platform, although it requires massive adoption to be successful, and the proposer gives no outline as to how this will be achieved. Because the proposer only offers a neat concept, but no technical plan or roadmap, it is unlikely that it will add a significant number of users to the Cardano ecosystem.

The proposal is a cryptocurrency-backed Patron or Reddit type of site. However, the plan is nascent and needs extensive work before it evolves into a practical site that will have the desired network effect.

Interesting idea. The proposal intends to onboard people to the community by gamifying the blockchain. It's not entirely clear if the author intends to do that by building an actual game with an own GUI or do this by means of text through a browser. Be careful with potentially offering sexual content on a platform where 'anyone can join', though.
No detailed plan. Seems like the proposer want to make a game, but has not detailed any real game mechanics and doesn't have any game making experience.
The proposer only gives a vague unverified experience and the proposal demonstrates their lack of technical understanding regarding Cardano. This in no way justifies the funds requested.

The proposer has claimed 5 years of experience in app development however has not presented any verifiable references. Moreover, the proposal has a huge scope, and a relatively large team will be required to implement it on any scale successfully.
Not clear how it meets the challenge. No detailed plan, thus unlikely to be successful. Requested entire fund of 250,000.
The proposal lacks any auditable points. No goals or breakdown of costs are given. I have zero confidence that the 250k in funds requested will be used efficiently.
The proposal has no cost breakdown or phase-wise tasks that will be carried out. It won't be easy to audit the progress without such a detailed analysis.

This proposals primary goal aims to spreading cardano among brazilian people. While this is a good thing, only a minority well be drawn to Project Catalyst and it even less aids in improving quality of proposals.

The problem and solution description are clear and make sense, but the proposal doesn1t describe how it will address the challenge.

The creation of general content about Cardano can increase the onboarding of people for Cardano, but the goal of the challenge is on value onboarding specifically for Catalyst. 

The proposal describes the creation of materials in areas unrelated to Catalyst, such as how to buy ADA, how to do staking, news about Cardano and general tutorials, but there is nothing to indicate the impact this will have for Catalyst.

In addition, there are several content creators creating materials about Cardano, including in Portuguese and the material that was created covers all the topics suggested in this proposal, which reduces the potential for impact.

While it can be argued that onboarding can be aimed at new clients I'm not sure that is how the challenge is intended. Certainly your channel and this proposal would equate to marketing of the Cardano product(s) but I feel this challenge is more about engaging with people whom are already interested in PC and are requiring ways to learn how the community operates.
THis does nothing to address the challenge. Are his subscribers community members? Even if they are what is he doing to encourage meaningful participation from them.

It is good to bring more Brazilian to the Cardano ecosystem in general, but the proposal does not aim to bring people to Catalyst. It explained very basic information about Cardano and crypto in general. I agree that this is the first step to better explain Catalyst in the future, but it should be at least in the roadmap. It also wants to promote a stake pool, which doesn't make much sense to the challenge. I believe this could be aimed to Catalyst, and use it to explain basic concepts about Cardano in the go.

While it is likely that the proposer will be able to produce useful videos as a youtuber, no detailed plan is given and no rationale for the budget is provided, as in what kind of people will be hired for what and hiw many of them.
Proposer is a youtuber, but doesn't actually claim any crypto or Cardano experience. As the plan is just to make more videos and a few tutorial he can probably deliver

The proposer has valuable experience in the Cardano ecosystem running a stake pool and is a native Brazilian who is fluent in both English and Portuguese.  This proposal is working alone and already has some content available through their stake pool and would like to expand beyond that scope.
The content planned is not explained in detail, especially not the content that is supposed to affect the challenge for which this project is proposed.

Good information provided and I feel that assessing the feasibility for a youtube marketing and education campaign is valid. Perhaps this proposal would benefit from further discussion with the community and revision for a future Fund.

Desired deliverables to be created are listed but there is no real roadmap to how this will be accomplished and a timeframe for delivery.   This proposal is a little off the mark of the overall description of the problem and the solution it intended to create.
Any payment integration could be beneficial to Cardano, but the proposal does not go into detail as to how this would be accomplished.
For someone with experience in the field, a plugin for Magento should be a manageable task. What I'm still missing is the connection and interface to the wallets.

If i research the only information available about the proposer (mike chandler and the tag @webnettricks), all I am finding is some posts on stock trading (one of them is pushing AMZN stocks, just saying) and something that indicates the proposer working as a copyright agent (found on a webpage of some cell phone shop called phonebank). Nowhere about the competencies the proposer claims to have. Given that and the fact that no timeline or detailed plan for the proposal exists, it can be assessed that it's highly unlikely that it will be implemented.

Draft proposal. The details about the team are vague, there is mention of experience in the development of applications, but it would be important to provide more details, links to the team's Linkedin and the number of people involved in the development of the proposal.

There is no plan outlined in the proposal.

The lack of information makes it impossible to assess the feasibility of the proposal.
The proposer has claimed 10 years of experience in developing applications. However, no verifiable data has been provided to evaluate the capability of the team.

No experience details, the proposer only describes himself as having "built many applications for fortune 500 companies", yet no link is given and when asked about it in the comments, no answer was given. The plan is very basic, offering no details beyond the initial draft of the idea.

The proposers apparently have some development experience, but no technical outline or project roadmaps is given. The proposal lacks any substantive content.  This lack of effort in the proposal makes me doubt that the project will be successful.

The proposal is practically non-existent, it contains eight sentences. This goes nowhere near the quality criteria other proposals fulfill and contains no information about how the idea is going to be implemented or how the funds are going to be used. It was not possible to find any credible credentials for the proposer.

There are a quite a lot of DEX proposals circulating at the moment. Which is normal as DEXs  will be needed soon. So it is a good idea, but I was unable to find anything that would distinguish this proposal from others.
proposalTitle: A DEX aggregator built on Cardano

assessmentNote: Aggregating decentralized exchange can improve liquidity. With integration to the existing platform of Instamo, the integration is likely to result in the adoption of ADA for fund transfer.
proposalTitle: A DEX aggregator built on Cardano

assessmentNote: Based on the information presented it is not clear how this proposal will bring new users to cardano blockchain. How the funds will be used isn't disclosed either. the pitch deck has a very large scope that is off chain and doesn't directly apply to Cardano. The pitch deck doesn't mention cardano or EUTXO once.
proposalTitle: A DEX aggregator built on Cardano

assessmentNote: While the company behind the proposal seems credible and competent, it is clear no effort was put in the plan for the concrete proposal and instead only a marketing presentation for a similar project by the company was provided. Since this idea has a lot of potential and it is an important, expensive project, I request the proposer to re-propose it in another funding round with a proper plan and diversified budget.
proposalTitle: A DEX aggregator built on Cardano

assessmentNote:
There are projects right here on Catalyst that offer very similar services and claim they can do it with less than half of the funding. After digging around in the slides, the cause of this amount is the projected cost of hiring new personnel (totalling 439,200 USD for this year alone). Which raises the question if this really needs that many people to operate? 
To make it more feasible of success, I'd suggest to merge with other projects.
proposalTitle: A DEX aggregator built on Cardano

assessmentNote: There is no clarity in the purpose of the proposal. Without understanding the mission, it is not possible to understand the feasibility of the proposal and the relevance with the attached business plan.
proposalTitle: A DEX aggregator built on Cardano

assessmentNote: The proposer has a strong well-established team and has a presence in Vietnam. It is likely that the proposal will be implemented successfully.
proposalTitle: A DEX aggregator built on Cardano

assessmentNote: Very elaborate roadmap in the slides. However, when it comes to sending vast amounts of money overseas, a risk assessment is advised. For example: The platform in mind operates by leveraging the licenses of other entities, but it is unclear how it would adapt if these licenses would expire.
proposalTitle: A DEX aggregator built on Cardano

assessmentNote: The proposal has a detailed document of Hawking Istamo but has limited information on how cross-chain liquidity and Cross-chain DEX will be implemented over Cardano. There is a need for specific technical analysis to identify how these technical challenges are planned to be overcome. The proposal is overall auditable ane the progress can be measured based on the number of users utilising the system.
proposalTitle: A DEX aggregator built on Cardano

assessmentNote: the proposal is a small piece of a much larger scope, which makes it impossible to audit for completion. Especially when a detailed timeline, budget and scope are not disclosed.
proposalTitle: A DEX aggregator built on Cardano

assessmentNote: There are already proposals for a DEX which a committed team behind it. It would help if you include your position why we should found your dex. The statment that there's a shortage of DEX in our ecosystem ist not true.

The proposal is for a whole suite of off chain software packages which will work with centralized institutions, it is unclear how this relates to a decentralized finance and appears to be the opposite of DeFi. The propsal's slide deck doesn't mention where the decentralized exchange would fit within the permissioned ecosystem that Instamo is developing with KYC at every step. In addition, cross border payments are available right now using ADA, the problem this solves isn't clear.
Proposer has asked for the entire fund, with no detailed plan. Please explain how this addresses the goal with a detailed plan and explanation.

The declaration of the problem and solution make sense and are aligned with the challenge, but there is no information in the business plan (attached file) related to a DEX, I recommend that the proposer clarify this aspect.

In the plan presented in the attached file there is no mention of the terms "Dex", "Catalyst" or "Cardano".

No specific proposal is provided by "A DEX aggregator". While Instamo may or may not be an effective DEX aggregator neither the Catalyst proposal nor the linked slide deck provide any information regarding how Istamo will be integrated with and provide services for the Cardano ecosystem.

The proposal does not adresses this challenge, at least, in the way it is presented at the moment.
It looks like the website is about an app building bridges between businesses and payments / investments gateway.
I feel like this proposal should be in the DApps challenge.

[UPDATE]: The exact same proposal is also in the Dapps challenge.

The team has relevant experience in this financial services world, however it isn't clear how the funding from catalyst will be used while they seek to raise over $800k. There is a risk that even if funded with catalyst that the remaining funds won't be raised and the project would fail.
No plan. No evidence of experience. Asking for 250,000, the entire fund budget. Unlikely to be successfully delivered.
No plan is provided. While the Instamo slide deck is informative, this is an overview of Instamo rather than a proposal for how the Catalyst funds will be utilized.
I would recommend to re-do this proposal and add way more information. Again, no roadmap, risk assessment or anything.

The proposal doesn't show how the Cardano's DeFi ecosystem would grow as a result of this proposed project. Cardano isn't mentioned at all in the proposal's slide deck, and it isn't clear how cardano would be used to power instamo.

The described business plan presented in the attachment file has no relation to a DEX.

There is no information in the business plan related to Catalyst or informations that justify the requested budget.
No information is provided regarding the objectives or tasks to be assessed. There is no way to audit the success, since there is no proposal.

There are many informations to audit the progress of this proposal, but it looks like a real business plan with many partners, and, as it is written in page 46 of the google doc: "We are looking to raise  $840,000".

That being said, how catalyst community's money will be implemented in your budget?
Why the Cardano ecosystem would need a centralized company to offer theses kinds of services?
I can't see many benefits for the community at this moment.

Having such a camp, teaching young people about the future what waits is highly beneficial. For future plans it opens up awareness and another occasions, wider scale adaptation. The timetable breakdown contains useful content.

The proposal dialogues very well with the objectives of the challenge, because it works directly to bring knowledge about Blockchain to young Africans, benefiting the community and cultivating fertile soil for future Cardano projects. The camp would be composed almost entirely by Africans, and the project would probably continue to bear fruit after the end of the event itself, since these young people would continue to study, and in the future work in the area, if they have a good direction. Note: 5.

The age group this proposal is aimed for might be too young. Maybe it can be raised a bit, even though I understand the possibilities that can be achieved if talented children start learning about blockchain at a young age.
The initiative is based on a good premise, that with their knowledge and plan can be successfully implemented.

The institute behind this initiative seems to very competent and engaged with the development and traction of blockchain in Africa. The roadmap is clear, budget is well explained, and the project itself it not so difficult to execute, so I believe that this proposal is completely feasible.

All the information to make the proposal auditable is there: roadmap, milestones, KPIs. Also, the foreseen dates are clear and reasonable. It seems that there are no major risks related to this project, but I believe it would be good to have some information regarding that in the text. But I believe that this proposal is completely auditable.

This proposal focuses on the business standard, which is one of the components needed in order to really realize the idea and bring it into the hands of soccer fans, which would be what drives adoption.
Interesting idea but does not meet the challenge of "What applications will provide the most value for end users in 2021?"
The proposer does not have the technical skills to do this. Without a detailed plan it is hard to say that the funds requested will be enough for the 4 technical staff he wishes to hire.

The author claims to work with artificial intelligence (with 8 years of experience) and computer science, which are two areas directly linked to the project. In addition, he also made his LinkedIn profile available, where we can learn more about his professional career and some examples of companies and projects in which he participated. It is also clear how there is an intention to form a team, because a project as comprehensive as this needs more people involved, different types of professionals and so on. In this way, I believe that the author and his future team will be able to work on the project in a positive way.
The proposer has about 10 years experience in project management, and the proposal is simple and focused. Therefore it is safe to say that the proposal will be successfully implemented.
The proposal has not identified measurable metrics, even though the challenge has a number of specific metrics to go by.

Detailed technical plan required to ascertain whether the funds will be enough to fulfill the idea. Hard to agree a POC of physical tokenisation on a low level UK football club will meet the challenge.
