The details are in the open domain, and the project is proposed to be taking the inputs from the community to finalize the standard for a specific use case. The project is auditable, and the success is fairly simple to measure.

The proposal appears to meet the challenge criteria in that will over time produce a Dapp. I am inclined to query the plan and budget aspects. It would benefit greatly from more detail about initial steps and team building aspects.
This project address the need for having a crowdsource funding run on smart contract to increase the trust between project backers and the project owners.
As the proposer is a plutus pioneer with relevant development experience and accounts for outside help, a moderate success prediction is justified.

I believe the proposer has good skills yet am concerned that he is working alone and does not describe hiring further developers. This appears to be a large project and would benefit from a collaborative approach.

Slightly ironic for a proposal which is based on releasing funds vs milestones to not have detailed milestones themselves. This raises the issue on whether they fully understand the problem. How will you gather and validate the information for the smart contracts to release funds?
Yes the information about feasible work package components seems very feasible although insufficiently decentralised or peer collaboration empowering in my view.
Proposal needs a more detailed plan to be able to asses feasibility. Milestones, budget etc. Same as they would be imposing within their project.

There's a brief overview of what the proposal milestones for each phases all the way through the end of the year. It's not obvious however how would the proposer plan to accomplish getting 50 campaigns active in 6 months after completion. Will there be a partnership with existing crowdfunding platform?
This proposal does not increase utility nor adaption for Cardano. This is an opinionated workflow that further goes against pure, functional programming as it pollutes your dependencies.
Is this something Developers need (or want)? Do they not have their own JS tools?
Developers prefer workspaces as per their choice and use of pnpm for the development of libraries is restrictive and may not be solving the problem being addressed.

Seems a valid proposal that is addressing the challenge although not clear how much interest it is generating from the community. This causes me to wonder if it needs further refinement to increase that engagement. I note that there is some discussion on the budget and team aspects of the proposal that may impact the voting community.

Success is not defined in this proposal at all. The proposer does not indicate how developers will be informed. It can be assumed that the proposer will try and tell other developers about this approach, but effectiveness can not be assessed.
It is not clear the proposer has the experience to build a universally useful workspace of Cardano JS developers.
The proposer has contributed to the open repository and has the capability to train others to use that for adding the code base.

The proposer is already running the github repo and wants a salary for marketing, teaching, and contributing to the repo for two months.  It would be good if the developer had a lot of connections to to potential participants or a clear plan for attracting them.
The proposer should detail why there is a gap that this project is filling? What is currently out there and why is this better?

The proposal is based on an adaptation of a specific workspace and depends on developers contributing to the library with no incentive for them. It will be difficult to identify how the efforts of the proposer are contributing to the development of other libraries.

Sufficient information has been provided although very little data presented on metrics and that makes success difficult to gauge. I am left not really able to understand the need for this project even though it may be of great merit. The author need to engage further with the community to progress the idea and present that to the voters as a proposal that needs attention.
This proposal appears to adequately address the challenge although there are potentially a number of barriers that may require further attention.
This proposal, if implemented, can serve underserved freelancing markets while providing lower fees and thus has the potential to drive adoption.

The author has IT experience but I would like to have seen further evidence of team building as this appears to be a complex build including many facets that will require expert professionals. I do note that preliminary collaborations are underway and await the outcome of same.
Because the proposal is missing a detailed budget, verifiable proposer info, and the team is not yet formed, a high score for likely success is unwarranted at this point.

This proposal does provide a reasonably solid depiction of what the proposer would like to achieve. I would like further information or a breakdown of the many moving parts to be provided. I do feel that with further team building and refinement that this proposal could be effective.
Even if all technical hurdles are addressed, what is the marketing plan? How will you build a user base of businesses and contractors?
If implemented, this would of course drive user adoption - probably, and unfortunately, with a lot of very reluctant users. However, this proposal addresses the challenge.

Issue of Vaccination passport is a complex process involving the identity of the person and the medical records. Moreover adaption of the proposed blockchain solution by the countries involved is the major problem. The proposal is not comprehensive in its plan to solve these major challenges.

The problem and the solution are within the scope of the challenge, but the absence of metrics and goals makes it difficult to assess the impact of the proposal. In addition, this proposal is a proof of concept, which brings additional risks.

Although the proposal's goal is laudable and would involve recording tamper-proof documentation as transaction metadata, it does not address the critical requirement for a verifiable chain of trust for credentials like a vaccine passport. Without a globally accepted trust framework that verified the metadata before it was placed on the blockchain, the non-tampering verificaiton on on-chain data is moot.
The proposer has stated they are not a Cardano expert. At a minimum they should detail what technical experience they do have which would make the development a prototype likely to be achieved

While Business Development may help in communicating with and between people, the proposer does not indicate technical skills.

A "Charles, please help" is not really a plan.

The proposer described experiences in Business Development and Business Strategy, which is subjective. I recommend detailing the qualification further so that we can understand the aptitude to develop the proposal.

As described in the proposal:

"As a technical specification needs to be defined yet, It is tough for me to estimate the fund required but we need to start with a Proof of Concept."

This indicates that there is no defined technical plan and that the defined budget is not feasible.

Verifying a certificate issued on blockchain does not guarantee that there was no fraud, the fraud can occur before the data is included in blockchains and the purpose would be lost, so people could continue to be required to receive vaccines to enter different countries. In addition, there are many different vaccines and countries have different vaccine acceptance standards.

The creation of a covid-19 passport by governments can be a step towards a social credit score system, which is something that really threatens individual freedoms and goes against the ideal of public blockchains. Some jurisdictions, such as Florida, have banned the use of passports, as they are against individual freedoms and could actually be used in a harmful way in authoritarian countries.

There is not enough information on how this would be deployed. Does this require smart phone apps which communicate with the Cardano blockchain? Are these being built as part of the PoC. If so one which smartphone operating system?
While the technological aspect may be feasible enough, this proposal heavily relies on finding agreement with external parties that the proposer has zero access to.

The proposal presents a novel use case for Metadata, however, the technical process for achieving the desired result is not explained. The challenges in the adaptation of this system also need more thorough analysis.

There is no budget breakdown, no metrics, no goals, no KPIs, no roadmap.

I recommend the inclusion of these items and that the proposer follow the documentation to prepare the proposal.
There is no clarity on how this proposal will address the challenge or how it will bring improvements to developers. The absence of reasonable metrics and KPIs compromises the impact assessment.

The COVID environment has opened up a large number of remote positions, even in core business models. This phenomenon has also increased the freelancing model for getting the job done. Therefore this Cardano market is addressing a core requirement.
Proposers are asking for funds for something they have already built. Thus it will be done. Though given its already done, why would Project Catalyst give it more money?

The proposer offers goals at 3,6, and 12 months on which to gauge success. They are defined by a number of listings and completed orders. No specific technical goals are given.  The proposal looks like an ambitious startup and lists so many costs to make auditing difficult. The startup nature also suggests that funds will be allocated inefficiently.

The proposal is clear on the aim and the process to be followed to complete the project. However, task analysis and who and how many are planned for forming the team or the size of the existing team is not clear in the proposal.

No, unfortunately this lovely project is not showing (as one of the comments says) how or why booking and investment monitoring Dapp needs to be decentralised for the success of the project. The proposer is running a centralized B2C enterprise and P2P transactions are in the current business model sadly superfluous.

I don't think they have explained very well how this would positively impact the Cardano community. I think we need to build the dapps that will bring the most users to Cardano first. I don't think this will do it, and I don't understand what problem the dapp will solve.
NFTs core principal is that they can't be faked and are forever on the blockchain. It could be hard to tell for an average user. So maybe an authenication programm is a good idea.
Draft proposal. There is no plan. There is no way to assess the impact on the challenge. I recommend including more details for appropriate feedback.
Due to the missing info, it's hard to assess how scanning audio and image files for authenticity could lead to a wider adoption of Cardano.

No evidence of technical capacity of the proposer or any details on what would be done. How will you use AI and ML to scan for authenticity? What is the oracle to be compared to. How does this integrate with NFTs?
Could well be! Although we have insufficient feedback to engage the proposal at this stage I would like to hear more from this proposer..
The proposer claims to have already built 3 apps and 1 Ethereum based app, yet doesn't provide any link to verify. There is no plan provided, only one short sentence describing his idea.
The proposal contains only 3 sentences, which unfortunately makes an audit impossible. I would recommend to re-do this proposal for the next fund.
Not at all unfortunately and I sort of feel its the CA fault as no comments have helped this proposer to integrate and engage..
While the problem solution is intriguing, there is no detailed plan to back it up and to give it more context. Suggest re-submission with the missing info added.
As proposers have noted, they need to hire the developer to implement this. Obviously success resides on their ability to hire a quality developer for the funds they are raising

The way the political system is being described as functioning in the Netherlands, this proposal has the potential to produce a dApp that many people will be enticed to use, thus attracting more people to the Cardano ecosystem.

The proposer has wide experience in handling large projects and is associated with a political party. The proposer is also planning to hire independent firms for implementation. There is a very goof chance that the proposal will be implemented.

Draft proposal. The problem and solution statement makes sense, but IOG and RunTime Verification are already developing solutions to this problem, through KEVM and IELE.

There is no plan, goals and metrics, which makes it impossible to assess the impact of the proposal on this challenge.

This idea is already integrated in the Cardano roadmap and currently in development for the Goguen era. So the proposal is not suggesting something new. The K-framework will create these libraries and using IELE, will enable to run all previous languages on the LLVM devnet.
There are projects underway in IOG for achieving the same aim of the project. The proposer has to start afresh it will be better if gets to work in the projects currently underway.

No references to verify the proposer's experience are provided. No detailed plan, timeline, or goals are provided for what is a highly complex and demanding problem.  With such a proposal it is impossible to believe that 140k will be used efficiently, or that a genuine product will be produced.

Draft proposal. There is no plan, how to understand the proposer's ability to implement this proposal when there is no clarity on what will be carried out and there is no plan?

I recommend that the proposal be detailed so that we can give appropriate feedback. Some people commented on the proposal about the fact that IOG is working on the development of IELE and KEVM, but the proposer did not answered.

The proposer had a background in coding. However, the proposal is aiming to create a very similar solution to what is already being developed by IOHK. The set budget is not outlined and there is no reason as to why it would be 140k USD. There are a few comments on the proposal that are justified as to why it is obsolete.

Developing a bind with the required security assurance supporting formal verification aimed by Cardano is a major challenge. There will be a requirement of the team of the size employed by IOG to achieve success. The proposal does not have enough detail to clarify the issue.

No breakdown of fund allocation, specific timeline or prioritization of languages, or goals for successs are provided.  The quality of the proposal is very low and demonstrates little professionalism.  As the proposal stands it will be impossible to verify how the funds are allocated, and impossible to judge the success of the project.

There is no detailed information available in this proposal. No roadmap or metrics that would provide an explanation for the cost. Nor does it provide a solution for something that isn't in the works already.
There is a requirement for task analysis and the justification for the amount quoted. The progress is measurable however the success in terms of getting verifiable code will be a challenge.
The initial idea is good, but it is unclear from the limited information provided how this project would scale and if the plan, if there is any, can be realisable in a timeframe of 6 months.

Draft proposal. The problem and solution description makes sense and has the potential to address the challenge, but there is no detail or plan to assess the impact and alignment of the proposal with the challenge. I recommend including details according to the Catalyst documentation.

There might be something to it, but the proposer has acknowledged in the comments section that he doesn't have the necessary expertise to finish writing the proposal: "I need to say this. I would not be able to complete this project. I just wanted the idea on here. I know it's possible! I am working on a more detailed plan. But I couldn't except money for it. I am just not capable of creating the Dapp. I just hope the right person sees it."

The proposer's experience does not apply to the proposed idea. There is no plan on how the idea could be implemented, how and who could develop it. 
Without a context of plan, it is not likely to succeed.
Draft proposal. There is not enough plan or information about the proposer / team to assess the feasibility of the proposal. I recommend including more details so we can give appropriate feedback.

I appreciate the proposer's honesty about not being able to complete the project, yet I feel that in this case he should have withdrawn the proposal and maybe submit it in the InSight session of Fund6.
No plan. Not feasible. Please produce a plan on what you would do, a breakdown of how you would fund it, market it etc.

The author is asking for a 250k USD fund without providing more context to an idea longer than 2 sentences. It needs a written out plan, a roadmap , a funding breakdown, a risk assessment as your competition would be large multinationals, a team to build it, etc.
Draft proposal. There is no information that makes it possible to assess auditability. Include more information according to the Catalyst documentation.
The proposal should be resubmitted with a complete description, detailed budget, metrics for a future fund.
The budgetary estimates are conservative with a clear task list. The project is proposing a simple auditable process. It will be simple to audit the progress and measure the success of the proposal.
proposalTitle: Cashout and Buy ADA in Ethiopia

assessmentNote: while this proposal will bring an element of competition for DeFi projects through third party audits, it does not in itself provide more DeFi use in Cardano.
proposalTitle: Smart Contract Audit Token SCAT DAO

assessmentNote:
The proposal consists of an independent, self funding auditing DApp. 
The notion of creating audits without being dependent on customer funding would contribute to audit quality and stimulate community investments in DeFi on Cardano. 
A clear definition of success seems to be missing. (How many audits a week are you aiming to perform?)
proposalTitle: Smart Contract Audit Token SCAT DAO

assessmentNote: Great idea. Doesn't really meet the goal of the project to encourage the building of new DeFi solutions. This could significantly help build user confidence in the DeFi ecosystem.
proposalTitle: Smart Contract Audit Token SCAT DAO

assessmentNote: The problem and solution described are within the scope of the challenge. No metrics have been described to measure the impact of the proposal on the challenge, which makes the success and impact assessment subjective. The goals set are in line with the challenge, as they would allow the audit of dapps and this would bring more security to the DeFi ecosystem.
proposalTitle: Smart Contract Audit Token SCAT DAO

assessmentNote: Yes, security audit are important for DeFi. However, nothing demonstrates that audits cannot be trusted today.
proposalTitle: Smart Contract Audit Token SCAT DAO

assessmentNote: The proposer has relevant experience in the auditing business in current US business practices, however it isn't clear how the blockchain specific functions of the audit will be addressed. In addition, the project claims that funding will come from a treasury of it's token but doesn't include a decription on how the initial funding of the treasury will take place. This has significant implications dependent on the methodology used, and it isn't addressed.
proposalTitle: Smart Contract Audit Token SCAT DAO

assessmentNote: The author is experienced in Fortune 500 company audits, yet has no relevant experience to write the DApp. It is critical to onboard developers to write this DApp. As of now, there is no clarity in who would perform this task. I suggest using the seek-tags to reach the right people for this.
proposalTitle: Smart Contract Audit Token SCAT DAO

assessmentNote: The author has certainly spent some time developing the proposal and the current team meet certain criteria experience wise. They also acknowledge the critical need for devs that can handle the significant coding aspect of the project.  At the time of this assessment I could not find if this has progressed. In light of such it may have been wise to further frame the audit governance and submit a smaller first stage proposal.
proposalTitle: Smart Contract Audit Token SCAT DAO

assessmentNote: Proposer has the skillset to develop (LinkedIn profile to confirm would be good). It would be good to have an operating and financing plan going forward. How much will it cost per project to audit.
proposalTitle: Smart Contract Audit Token SCAT DAO

assessmentNote: Security audits are expensive, and it's unclear how the passive income would be sufficient to fund the requested code reviews.
proposalTitle: Smart Contract Audit Token SCAT DAO

assessmentNote: The proposal doesn't include an estimate on how large the problem of bad-actors are in this space, doesn't include an estimate on how many projects could use auditing, and doesn't include an estimate on how market capitalization on the SCAT token.  Would individuals want to hold the token? what would prompt individuals to fund SCAT over the current practice of 'wait and see' if someone else falls into a trap mentality.
proposalTitle: Smart Contract Audit Token SCAT DAO

assessmentNote: There is a lot of information already present in the text, however, there are still some aspects that need some work. There is important information lacking involving visibility and how the project would make sure that the audits would get read and where they would be published. It needs some kind of marketing to get known by the community. There is no concrete risk assessment included.
proposalTitle: Smart Contract Audit Token SCAT DAO

assessmentNote: The proposal is well written, received interest from the community and seems a valid concept. The information was satisfactory and inclusive. This included the not inconsiderable risk/task of finding suitable developers for the coding aspects of the project.
proposalTitle: Smart Contract Audit Token SCAT DAO

assessmentNote: Initial plan easy to audit. Measurable KPI's going forward would be good. Is each project to be audited initially on launch, or repeatedly? What will be the funding requirement going forward?
proposalTitle: Smart Contract Audit Token SCAT DAO

assessmentNote:
There is clarity in the description of the problem, but the solution still needs to be more detailed, especially in relation to the tokenomics model.

There is no information on the team's experience with Plutus and with smart contract audits (audit in finance and IT was mentioned). There are details on budget allocation and the roadmap. There are no metrics or KPIs.
proposalTitle: Smart Contract Audit Token SCAT DAO

assessmentNote: Whilst this would add users, it seems the use of Cardano is a side issue here. How many pontoon do they expect to deploy. Is this significant in terms of number of users for Cardano?

While high transportation cost are no doubt a valid problem,  the proposal does not offer a clear solution. The proposed concept is geographically limited and does not reflect an understanding of the technological and economic limitations of such a transformation. A tremendous investment would be required before the project would significantly impact Cardano usage in Africa.

The idea of a different solution other than fossile energy sounds great. But the proposal doesn't make it as clear why there is funding necessairy except from using Cardano as a payment channel. It would be nice to have more detail how this proposal tracks the number of users, how it rewards the entrepreneurs and end users and give the first step for blockchain into inland transportations. The proposal has the ability to scale but it doesn't have to.

The idea is very good in terms of impacting the inhabitants of Africa, since it promises to develop a way to generate cheaper energy and cleaner too, which would be ecologically interesting. As water transport is already a common practice in the region, the author can see a way to enhance a present practice and add it with a new benefit. In this way, the project would rather benefit the inhabitants (many would be involved, a mobilization would not be necessary to attract people) and the locality, in addition to representing a solution that mainly meets the adequacy requirement. It also involves the activities of the Cardano project during the monetary transactions of boat trips, as he explains in his detailed plan.
The idea is original and could provide a more fuel independent solution for african waterways traffic. It was not entirely clear in the proposal wether Cardano would be used to buy or rent a boat.

I can see some potential here in relation to challenge being targeted but am not fully convinced by the submission at this stage. The proposer perhaps needs to revisit the community and collaborate further to adapt this project to specific use case.

Inland waterways are used in a substantial manner in South Sudan to overcome the limitations of poor road infrastructure. The initiate to use solar-powered boats with payment in Cardano is revolutionary and will help the overall
The proposers have not yet looking into the key issue of connecting the smart pontoons to the Cardano network. Do they have internet access?

The author of the proposal has attached a website that contains a lot of information about the activity, as well as a page that shows who the people involved are and what they do. Thus, a lot of security is passed on to the team, which apparently already has experience in what it does, and manages to demonstrate this in a precise and objective way.

The project aims to start with small piloting projects before scaling up. This enables a more solid aproach. The website states that E-ROW already has a running project in Togo and including information on this as reference as to how operations are faring there would create an extra perspective on feasibility. The requested budget is very small for such an undertaking and there are doubts that it would cover the costs.

The proposer seems to have excellent experience in terms of electric boat transport but needs to make the alignment between this and a specific example (especially in the promote Africa challenge). I feel with further refinement and collaboration the plan will improve to make a good case for funding.

The proposal is ambitious and has a large number of risks. Solar Impulse Foundation is a large organization with an aim to get government funding. With this backdrop, it can be assumed that the proposal will be implemented in earnest.
Mor einofrmation should be provided on how many smart pontoons are expected to be provided and thus how many people this project will drive to the Cardano platform.

A more feasible and auditable proposal would include details of the proposed government grant, Choice of a specific pilot location where average trip lengths fit within the limitation of battery power. Detailed discussion of the potential output of the turbine unit in the chosen location. Detailed discussion of the cost of conversion of battery powered boats. Detailed timeline of how 50k users will be achieved in the proposed 6 month period.

The proposal includes all the necessary informations but keeps it at a minimum. The whole proposal could be more detailed and after reading it as a CA you do not really have a clear picture. It is an ambitious proposal which comes with a lot of risks. A risk assessment but have been beneficial.

The proposal contains much information, but is not formatted in seperate sections which makes it hard to find targetted information. It could be made much clearer if it were to contain titles and sections. I'm missing some information on how the project would be imposed (how to get the equipment there etc.. ) to determine if the rtequested funding would be adequate.

The information provided is sufficient however, it appears this proposal is still in the early development stage. Due to this I cannot yet see the suitability of the proposal for funding. I underline at this stage because with further attention this may become a very suitable project.
The proposal is a simple to use of Cardano as a token for payment in a solar-powered boat. it will be possible to audit the progress and measure the success.
Project may be a good DeFi project in its own right,, but does not meet the challenge of Scaling up the DeFi ecosystem in Cardano.

"DeFi Billing" is strongly aligned both with the "Scale-up Cardano's DeFi Ecosystem" and the overall focus of the Cardano community on providing services that individuals, corporations, and governments can benefit from.
The proposal doesn't identify a measureable to assess progress against but it does set the goal to have 1 working partnership.

This is not a DeFi solution at all, its CeFi using Cardano smart contracts, the implementation risk is also massive: there is a reason governments use "expensive inflexible insecure solutions", it's because they know they work and have been hardened for years. The proposal plan and roadmap also leaves a lot of open questions: who are the developer resources? why does it take 12 months to fully develop this dApp? Please include technical docs or a White Paper to describe this solution in detail.
No metrics or KPI's provided, especially on how the project meets the goal of scaling up the DeFi ecosystem within the next 6 months.
The proposal effectively addresses the challenge. The idea seems valid and would allow Ecommerce merchants on the Woocommerce platform to receive payments in ADA.
Integrations like this will assist in adoption. I would consider this to be rather small increase to users in the ecosystem however

Proposer claims to be an open-source embracing software company, but this is not backed up by the proposal itself. No links to code repositories on the website are found. The ask to back up the claim in the comment section has not been answered. Thus, the information provided is insufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal.

it is definitely a good idea, the language barrier can be broken, and having it more user friendly could increase the number of holders, the spread of Cardano etc. 

Yet, is not the majority from now on learning English or other world top languages? I think this application might be "the top" for a few years, but then, it will not be required. That is why I put 3/5
This is a proposal with real usability, that could help grow the Cardano community across the African continent, while building a wallet app that adapts to the real situation on the ground.

Although the problem statement doesn't clearly state the problem, after reading through the proposal it is clear to me as a westerner. The proposer is in tune with the needs of the african continent has has considered them in the proposal.
A wallet with optimized user interfaces for the African market sounds like a very good approach to promote further distribution.

Wallet in local language with reduced data use and non-textual UI can potentially improve the adoption of Cardano in many places of the world. In countries with low literacy rates, this can become a force multiplier.
The proposer seems to be legit, and description of his skills and experience matches the proposals outcome.

The proposer is an experienced developer, who has put together a plan that describes in detail many of the real issues of the African users. The knowledge and the extensive project that he articulated, provide enough indications that the plan will be successfully implemented.

It is likely for this proposed project to be implemented. There is a big potential to expand Cardano's reach through Apps. This proposal needs details on the core team, who will implement this proposal, and their relevant experience. How do you plan to overcome the challenges of running adding or translating the apps to multiple African languages? How many languages will be available by the launch date? Will you be working by yourself, or do you have a team?

The proposers claim to the developers of Q Modeler and have a good number of apps in the play store. Considering this, it is very likely that they shall have the capability to implement the project. The requirement of local dialect translation and other UI designs using experimentation with the local population is not considered in the proposal.
The plan is reasonable and it is obvious how it would benefit the challenge assuming security challenges can be sufficiently addressed.

3 month we will have designed the application and be in testing
6 month, wallet will be in the App Store
12 month most popular wallet in Africa

let's assume that these metrics are valid. I did not come with another better one but expanding these. 

Also, I am sceptical about 2000+languages under 3 months.

The author of the proposal claims to have a lot of experience in application development, as well as in blockchain and familiarity with the Cardano project. That is, it is apparently someone prepared. However, it would be interesting if a link was attached where it was possible to learn more about his work, for example, which applications he developed. It is also a little vague what exactly your background is: developer, designer? In addition, it would be beneficial for him to be more interested in forming a team to work on the project.
They presented a lot of experience during 10 years. For me is enough to trust them and capable to success the project.

I feel that the team has the necessary experience and plan to implement this proposal successfully. They seem well advanced in their own endeavours and have already produced quality. The problem being opened up to the community requires further research which is what this proposal is targeting.
Reducing the knowledge threshold to build apps onto Cardano would increase the probability of take up across Africa.
The developers of Q Modeler will train the required number of people expectedly. The process is simple to execute and is like to be sucessfull.
The proposal is very detailed and provides a lot of background information on the software and technology used. Milestones and success metrics are set, attainable and auditable.

the proposal is very well prepared. The referenced linkedin-profiles give good information on the expertise of the involved people. The fact that the unpaid leave is mentioned to provide enought time ressources tell me, that it was already checked that this possiblity can be utilized.

The lead proposer has founded Project Hours and all co proposers have substantial experience in the related field and in software development. The aim is modest and the proposal has considered all the asociciated risks in implementation.

Project is complex but should be feasible for the team. They are obviously still working through all the details and a more complete plan with cost breakdown would help in estimating feasibility. Where location are they intending to launch in?

The notes on roadmap are great and appreciated. Seems like a decent enough idea but at the moment I'm of the belief that its too early for its time. Since a component of this is identity and cardano has the atala prism to accommodate that I think it would be best to wait until that is available until this application is pursued.

I think providing this information or even creating such a proposal can be useful after a solution to the "how we make Africa people buy Cardano" solved. From what I have understood, there are still large barriers between Africans and their possibilities to buy Cardano, and from this perspective, this seems like another step.

The proposal is not very clearly written. While there are some parts of it that I like, the problem statement for example, others are not clearly explained, making it hard to visualise the entire plan.
The idea of supporting African pools is a great one, and societal integration would be beneficial for Cardano and clearly meets the goals of the challenge.

The project aims to "measure and report on the diversity of the SPO network" however it is planning to set up a charity in 3000$ and collect his information in 6000$. The information is already available in open domain and a 3000$ charity may not be the  correct manner to improve the Cardano SPOs diversity.
The project identified a real world problem but the offered solution doesn't solve the problem. I would recommend coming up with a different solution.
Proposers appear to have the requisite experience. However the plan could have more details. What is the charity doing?

The proposal seems relatively simple. Gather and publish data on African stake pool operators to enable informed decision making regarding diversity. Should this information be integrated into options on the Daedelus stakepool ranking system?
Some of the criteria are difficult to quantify and no proper milestones are set. This proposal all in all is difficult to define and determine. Try making it more concrete next time.
This proposal doesn't include any roadmap which makes it hard to audit. Please review the proposal and include a step by step roadmap.
As NFTs are in extreme high demand, improving on the existing nft-maker.io by developing a marketplace will drive adoption tremendously if properly executed.
Short proposal, but brings it straight to the point.
Proposers already have beta up and running. Nice to see LinkedIn profiles backup up claimed experience.

3 of the founder are the expert on their field. 

Proposer is using general timeline based on after 3 months, after 6 months and so on. Proposer did not specific on the timeline.

Manpower, currently 3 founders are doing the project themselves. Fund requested to add more manpower to ensure the timeline is been met. 

On the additional developers, no mention on how many developers will be paid using the requested fund.

Marketing budget is too small, 5,000 to attract crowd and artists.
The technical challenges could be described a little bit more in detail, but besides that a clear explanation.

Granted the milestones for the next 12 months are listed, it's not clear what would be considered a success as far as how many users signed up including the artists it plans to recruits, as well as how it plans to advertise/promote the site to increase the traffic.
The plan and most notably the experience of the team will allow a successful implementation of this project.

Unfortunately I struggle to understand what exactly the proposal helps to accomplish.  In my opinion the language and approach of the proposal makes it unlikely to gain acceptance in the community and have its intended impact.
Definition of success and expected output is provided. the request fund is 5 USD. This enough information to track progress.

Problem statement not coherent. The competitors can't be both heavily curated and saturated with art of varying quality. What is the governance process. How are you combining a council or curators yet also democratising?
No doubt the mechanism could be built. But having no studio artists on the team, (vs graphic designers), it does not seem it will serve artists in a new way.

While an incremental approach may make sense, assume that the last round of funding is the last round of funding you will ever receive. As there is no monetization plan, how will you survive long enough for this project to come to fruition?

Seems like a valid use case for this challenge and therefore addresses the challenge. I note that the proposal still seems to be in the development stage and that a team will be required to build the Dapp. Would be great to get an update on how teambuilding is progressing.
proposalTitle: Farm to Fork Supply Chain - Insects

assessmentNote:
As it is quoted
 in the proposal: "connect consumers, brands, and farmers in real time, removing the need for trust in institutions by transparent verification of the entire process". The author seeks to encourage and practice trade around insects, which can have different uses, such as food, by building a platform that makes the connections mentioned above. With this, the App would have a great impact both for the ecological sector (it is a more sustainable economy than the production of traditional proteins) and for the economy. However, the author does not emphasize where ADA would be used in this project. Naturally, I think it would be through financial transactions, but it would be interesting to clarify this issue better, after all, the financing would be made by the Catalyst community.
proposalTitle: Farm to Fork Supply Chain - Insects

assessmentNote: The concept of insect farming and distribution as a source for nutrition for humans and animals, coupled with a dApp that would guarantee the supply chain is a very interesting concept, highly sustainable, with the potential to bring along a new community to the Cardano ecosystem. However, on the dApp description side, there is not much information given.
proposalTitle: Farm to Fork Supply Chain - Insects

assessmentNote: Although the proposer lists relevant experience briefly, it is not directly supported by links to a relevant LinkedIn profile and other organizations. However, a cursory search via Google confirms some of the experience listed, although the proposer could have made it easier for voters to access this information via his proposal.  What is missing, however, is the experience of the team members, the DApp developers, even the traceability system experts as this is a traceability DApp. The budget is not outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items, which is a problem for a project of this ambition. The proposer includes a general timetable for the DApp development and a pilot project stage, which is good. However, there are no technical details about the proposed DApp, its potential use of smart contracts and challenges and risks to implementation are not addressed.
proposalTitle: Farm to Fork Supply Chain - Insects

assessmentNote: The author says he has experience with the issue of insects, as well as in startup-type industries and being a skilled communicator. However, it does not mention if it has already had previous contact with the Catalyst universe, with blockchain and etc., which would be essential to develop the project within our community. He shows up with the intention of hiring a team, developers, but it would be beneficial if he made it clear who are the people he intends to call to compose the team. I also missed a profile on linkedin, or even a more detailed description of his activities in the insect business, which arouses our curiosity and could bring more credibility to the author. If such information were added, as well as further clarification about the future team, it would be better.
proposalTitle: Farm to Fork Supply Chain - Insects

assessmentNote: Even though the proposer has not provided any links to his past experience, from the details regarding many aspects of insect farming and distribution one can tell that he's been in this business for some time. But while the project describes in detail everything insect related, it lacks entirely on the app side. I understand the proposer is not a developer and is looking to collaborate with one, but since this is a challenge for dApps it would be hard to overlook this aspect.
proposalTitle: Farm to Fork Supply Chain - Insects

assessmentNote: Good information provided but there remains the issue of team building that will be essential to the project getting built. The idea itself seems widely received by the community and this tells me once team building underway the community is likely to have a positive response. The use cases for such a Dapp could well turn this project into something significant.
proposalTitle: Farm to Fork Supply Chain - Insects

assessmentNote: Cardano is praised in proposal but the prototype does not contain any Cardano related items. Doing some Cardano-specific tasks are mentioned but not in much detail. Connecting Mobile-Money to the Defi-World has huge potential and it would make Crypto Currencies easier accessible to a lot of people in africa. With the current information, I don't see how the ADD.xyz's DeFi Mobile Money Bridge would help to establish Cardano as the best public block-chain operating in Africa but just beeing a part in the proposal is already a great thing.

It is unclear if the proposers have the capability to deliver on this project. ADD.xyz is still in beta. The majority of the text in the proposal doesn't really cover their capability or development plan.

The description of the desired solution and the concepts that are used is very detailed. A big team is mentioned in the experience section, but no references are provided. But the linked website and already available prototype is very convincing.
One star reduction because the website states, that in July 2019 a $500k seed round was closed and in Jul 2020 a $1m token sale was completed. This is a lot of money and the provided results seems rather low.
More detail should be proved on what they currently have and the road map for what is being developed to enable feasibility to be assesed.

Strongly disagree, after all stated above, this proposal needs more development and polish. Parts of the writing are dificult to understand, please try to go through your proposal with another person, there are few spelling errors, like "...Africa is a content...". No concrete solution is provided.
From one point of view, I would say yes, it can have a positive impact, but given their goal - 20 proposals after 3 months, I would say that is VERY INEFFECTIVE. so 1-3 stars.

This is a really valuable project for the community since it reaches a variety of people that might be very hard to reach. I really enjoyed how everything is designed and the idea of giving solutions to small business (SB) using the Cardano ecosystem. That is a totally different point of view and to implement which could open the minds of this public and they gonna 'spread the word' as well.

The proposal potentially addresses the challenge of proposer outreach although it is difficult to assess how efficient it might be given the target audience is small business operators. Yes they potentially could benefit from blockchain technology but is the community likely to see a host of proposals in upcoming fund submissions?

to have atleat 20 new proposals after 3 months - 

but we do not know how to find it? Also, the impact of budget/new proposals is very low.
The success metric or 20 new proposals for the entire amount available in this fund seems like it would fail to make much meaningful impact in meeting the challenge.

The proposal itself will not jet use a blockchain, but only it is the first step toward the final product iGIVit. This product should/will provide improved transparency for donations  with the help of the Cardano Blockchain. What a wonderful combination.

Team experience is given, but there aren't any work references, based on what it could be decided whether the given information is true. Requested budget spending isn't listed neither and the long term plans would also welcome some thought.

Due to missing time plan and risk overview it is hard to judge on audibility. I would welcome some more efforts on reworking the complete project time plan and spending in order that it gets rewarded.
It is not clear how creating infographics to explain the insight sharing stage meets the challenge of improving distributed decision making.

Yes, the issue is clearly identified but more could be written about the issue in problem statement. Granted, someone familiar with the catalyst process would know what the proposer is talking about, from their own experience of being a CA.
It is true that during this assess the fund4 was not voted yet. Thus, I think that this art peace may be affected, since you gave no identification of the "themes" that would be shown.

The proposer has contributed to the development of a community website at a cost basis and his personal website claims experience in visual design. It is safe to assume that the proposer will be able to produce infographics of high quality.
Yes, the proposer had made his/her expertise clear in the relevant experience and 'about me' sections and provided links to portfolio of work so a reader can check.

Philip is a very active member of the CATALYST Community and has impressively demonstrated his capabilities and 'full-hearted engagement.' He has succeeded to become part of a wider team of activists, so that the continuous discussions will help to further optimize his proposal 'on the job'. The outlined costs for this proposal are VERY reasonable, I have no doubt that this produces great ROI.
The proposal is simple, straight forward for audit and track progress. Each infographic provided can be used as a simple measure of progress.

There is a defined roadmap with a scheduled delivery cadence in the plan to generate the infographics.  The problem is clearly understood to help support Community documentation with east-to-read infographics and an additional buffer for delivery is included in the plan.
The information on success criteria and measuring milestones is a bit unclear to me and could do with expanding somewhat

Good information added for providing basic audibility. Nevertheless, I give more weight to the fact that Philip is quite active and entangled with the CATALYST Community, so that this proposal will not only be audited based on formal milestones, but also in ongoing interactions with a lot of other knowledgeable activists.
Its not clear how this solution solves the problem it is stating. If all the DApps go there then is it no the same problem? If hardly any go there, then will anyone look at it?

A central listing for Dapps seems like an important project, although I assume there will be a lot of competition in this field. I'm not sure the team will have the resources to become a dominant hub for Dapp information.  From that perspective, the real impact may be limited.
Yes, however it would help I'd the writer explained more clearly what 'They can manage profiles more easily' means in the solution statement.
The plan could have more detail on how it will actually deal with the problem of lots of DApps. How are they filtered? How does it solve the problem of too many DApps?

The team appears to have the necessary skillset to implement this limited proposal. It would be good to read further about each member and provide examples of product/design in addition to the website.
The team of three has a developer and a general organizer. The proposers are also hosting Cardano Stake Pool. The proposal is simple, and the team will implement the proposal in the right earnest.
A well-written Project Catalyst targeted newsletter could indeed lead to an increase in awareness and would most likely be welcomed by the Cardano community.
Given the linkedin profile, I have trust that he can deliver what is he is proposing.
the proposal has clear goals which are aligned with the challenge's goals. Bringing awareness and deep-dive forums to university hits right where adoption is needed.

The proposal has covered a lot of details. Yet there must be more attached to it, then just venues where students can go, listen to someone talk, have a snack, get a T-Shirt and then go back home, and soon forget about it all.
The proposal provides dozens of KPIs so auditing for success should be straightforward. The problem and solution they propose is clear. Their roadmap is detailed.
This project makes a good case for a better system of  analysing the data around project proposals, assessment and voting
proposalTitle: Open Ideas and Data For Cooperation

assessmentNote: This is a really good idea, create an alternative for Ideascale which is centralized and bring it to the community and more, create a better environment which allows an easier navigation. This is totally coherent with the whole crypto idea.
proposalTitle: Open Ideas and Data For Cooperation

assessmentNote: Useful proposal in the heart of the target zone. Makes sense to promote Cardano in this community and therefore this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.

The awareness events can educate power centers regarding the possibilities of Cardano Blockchain on offer. The presence of people on the ground can have a much lasting influence than any information video on that basis this proposal can have significant impact.
description of the proposer seems to be enough, yet more information would be nice to have, even linkedin profile.

The experience appears suitable for the project being proposed. I would mirror other comments about the high cost of budget and feel with not too much effort a more streamlined budget could be found. This in my view is the only real concern.

The author of the proposal says he has experience with events in the industry, held in hotels, and also as digital marketing, two areas totally related to the project. Therefore, an initial trust is soon established. However, it would also be interesting to expose some examples of events and advertising campaigns carried out previously. I believe that a person already involved in the business is the first step towards a conscious conduct of events.

The proposal will be sucessfull if it gets people from decision-making echelons of Government and corporates to attend the event. The experience of the proposing team members in this aspect is not clearly coming out in the proposal.

The alleged experience is very well aligned with the proposal. Also, the roadmap is well explained, quantity of events is clear. Budget breakdown related to each part if the events is also good, but I believe it could be a bit lower, although this observation doesn't impact the proposal's feasibility.

Seems like a valid proposal that shares sufficient information. It would be good to see whom the team would be targeting for keynote speakers. I note talk of internships for students but could not see that in the budget?

The author of the proposal says he has experience with events in the industry, held in hotels, and also as digital marketing, two areas totally related to the project. Therefore, an initial trust is soon established. However, it would also be interesting to expose some examples of events and advertising campaigns carried out previously. I believe that a person already involved in the business is the first step towards a conscious conduct of events.

The proposal is about organizing events and hosting them on streaming platforms to improve awareness of Cardano. Therefore will be very straightforward to audit the progress. Details of exact people who will be attending will enable a better audit of the process.
This seems targetted at a small number of large financial institutions, not Cardano end users. Not clear it meets the challenge goal of providing the most value for end users in 2021.

The proposal represents a big use case for blockchain and stablecoins. We would love this kind of institutional use of Cardano. However the idea feels premature considering the current state of Cardano.
This is targeted at large financial institutions. These are all developing there own solutions. None of these are mentioned in the plan. How will this get taken up?

It is likely for this proposal to be implemented but needs more details on the team members. 
Do you plan to hire a team? How many by when?
The proposal is for media & social media advertisement. The returns on this advertisement complaint is difficult to audit since it depends hugely on quality, timing and various other factors.

The challenge seemed focused on Dapps an integrations that promote Cardano adoption. The proposal specifically wants to increase participation in the delegation process by simplifying the decision making and tracking involved in delegation. The tools outlined could be attractive to new delegators and increase participation in the proof of stake mechanism.  But to really meet the challenge the proposal should focus on how  to attract first-time delegators.

The proposer identifies several good ideas to provide utility for Cardano users and fits the challenge parameters. The solution statement given is very generic, but the services provided by the proposed platform are better explained further along in the proposal. However, since so many services are being proposed, there isin't very much information given about any one of them in particular and which problems they solve. It's my opinion that the proposal might be better served by focusing on a single service instead of an entire platform.

The proposal has a good impact to make it easier for newcomers to stake their ADA as the system is currently designed. Although, I believe that other solutions, like intermediary solutions (without compromising security and ownership) or even improvements in the staking system itself, might solve the problems described in the problem statement in this proposal in the medium/long term. Although, this might be a good temporary solution until something directly related to the staking system changes. Also, I believe that the requested budget is a bit too high for the kind of development proposed.

The simplicity and fluidity in Cardano staking are perfect, leading to wide options.  There is substantial discussion of staking, the performance of pools, and accountability of few mission-driven pools. Therefore the proposed platform is required and is likely to have an impact on the community.

The proposer appears to have relevant development experience (particularly in the data back end) although no specific links or examples were given. No information is given on how onboarding participants would be achieved or how much participation would be required to make the project a success.  This makes it difficult to assess the feasibility of attracting new delegation participants.  The  help bot is an interesting idea but may require specialized developers to create a product with good utility.

Based on the proposer's experience, the proposal seems to be feasible, especially because all of this developments could be done off-chain and has experience with software engineering. The NLP development might need special AI background, and this was not mentioned explicitly in the proposal, but I believe it would be covered by the proposer's background.

The proposer is operating WISE pool and has referenced his capability in the backend services required to complete the project. WIth these credentials, it can be safely said that the proposal will be implemented in right earnest.

The Notification Service description provided some good details; More details on the other services would be helpful to illustrate the scope of the work that needs to be done and what each service would look like when completed.

The phases of the proposal is well laid out and clearly explained. It is a open-source project and is auditable. However, the proposed cost is for hosting it for six months. The sustenance and plan for continued service and exploitation of the developed software are not given clearly.

This proposal is not effectively addressing the challenge of building a DeFi protocol on Cardano's Plutus layer. You don't need an accounts model on Plutus there are teams that have built entire concurrent state management proof of concepts that make this proposal's problem statement entirely moot, if anything this is a distraction from the f5 challenge.
proposalTitle: AVOUM: Account View on UTXO Model

assessmentNote: It's false to assert Cardano requires an accounts model to avoid DOS attacks, the proposer either does not fully understand UTxO's or is being somewhat intellectually dishonest in the problem statement/solution.
proposalTitle: AVOUM: Account View on UTXO Model

assessmentNote: The information presented in this proposal is super misleading in the context of UTxO and DOS attacks. There are several solutions to the problem presented and the proposer does not mention any of them. This is not effectively addressing the challenge.
proposalTitle: AVOUM: Account View on UTXO Model

assessmentNote: A proposal to not build a DeFi protocol on Cardano but instead rebuild Ethereum's broken accounts model is not at all addressing the f5 Defi focused challenge. The proposer does not articulate any of the ways Plutus teams are building solutions to address this known UTxO tradeoff today, there are several already in the works.
proposalTitle: AVOUM: Account View on UTXO Model

assessmentNote: The skills and experience of the team is fantastic, but the risk is in whether or not the cardano language would support these types of contracts. given that the team recognizes the risk and proposes an alternative solution in the proposal the team shows that they have experience and know what they're up against.
proposalTitle: AVOUM: Account View on UTXO Model

assessmentNote: The team behind this proposal is working on Glow but their experience working on UTXO vs. Accounts model is not made evident, they also make false claims in the problem statement and proposal plan that make validating their experience on this proposal even less compelling.
proposalTitle: AVOUM: Account View on UTXO Model

assessmentNote: Proposers have a good idea of what they are trying to do. There is a risk of failure in development as they still seem to have parts to work out.
proposalTitle: AVOUM: Account View on UTXO Model

assessmentNote: The proposal team does not have seem to have an expert view on Cardano's eUTXO model. They don't mention any of the solutions currently being developed to handle multiple contract instances that render their entire prob statement/solution to problem moot.
proposalTitle: AVOUM: Account View on UTXO Model

assessmentNote: The team behind this proposal does not fully understand how the Plutus eUTxO model works in Cardano or the solutions built to manage smart contract instances at scale.
proposalTitle: AVOUM: Account View on UTXO Model

assessmentNote: The entire plan presented is centered around the thesis UTxO based dApps are susceptible to DOS attacks, this is not true and the several teams building Plutus protocols are all working on various scaling solutions to enable their sc architecture to function at scale. The proposer mentioned none of these.
proposalTitle: AVOUM: Account View on UTXO Model

assessmentNote: As noted above, their are false statements in the problem statement and in the proposal plan that make the proposers experience *and the need for an accounts view model* highly questionable. Does this proposer really think IOHK Plutus devs are naïve enough to spend the last 5 years on a contract model and not build in a plan to mitigate DOS attacks because that's essentially how this proposal reads. It's simply not true and it shows they have either 1. spent little time understanding how the Plutus eUTXO model actually works or 2. Is conflating Ethereum accounts model/contract design pattern with Cardano. both of these blatant issues makes this proposal a non-starter.
proposalTitle: AVOUM: Account View on UTXO Model

assessmentNote: The proposal fails to make it clear *why* the Plutus concurrent state management solutions are not sufficient for teams building DeFi dApps on Cardano. They dont even mention this, leading CA's to believe this proposer team has a very limited understanding of how the Plutus eUTxO model actually works.
proposalTitle: AVOUM: Account View on UTXO Model

assessmentNote: This proposal is essentially an attempt to rebuild the Ethereum accounts model on Cardano's eUTxO but they completely ignore the fact IOHK purpose built Cardano's UTxO to *not be* the same accounting model as Ethereum and there are several known ways to handle several sc instances that enable DeFi dApps to operate at scale.
proposalTitle: AVOUM: Account View on UTXO Model

assessmentNote: The experience to produce a Dapp seems sound and the plan is developing so I feel given time this proposal would likely find a successful implementation even if somewhat revised from the current plan.

The roadmap shows a fast paced development. Up until now, the team has managed to be on track with the roadmap. The team is composed out of experience stake pool operators. The only obstacle could be small staking pools to prefer working independently.
The proposal will enable access at different permission levels to data and API's running on the Cardano blockchain. This will grow the pie of use cases.
The proposer has significant experience (a LinkedIn profile to confirm would be useful).  The plan is reasonably detailed and thus we can have reasonable confidence it will be delivered.

The proposer is actively involved in the Cardano ecosystem as SPO and is undergoing Plutus Pioneer Program. The proposal includes a detailed technical presentation that clearly gives out the aim and implementation details.
A number of steps outlining how the proposal will be delivered are described and it is clear how it will address the proposal and benefit the Cardano ecosystem.

I do not see how this proposal will effectively increase the number of proposals, but the owner of the page will own 500 000 ADA. 

I can not be UNBIASED in this case. This is a very bad proposal. 

Also, having this webpage is one thing, and what about 

"how to buy pixels?" 
"does it increase more NFT market or number of proposals?"

Beg your pardon if I've not understood. However, what is the value of buying a pixel in order to help someone with just a half of the value of what they've bought? Would not be easier and more helpful if I just choose a charity and give my money to them? 
Other than that, I was wondering if it would get viral or would generate interest because some data shows that only individuals in US gave, in 2019, more than $300bi to charity, thus 500K ADA (assuming ADA $2) ~ $1M. 
And, it seems to be just a one shoot thing.
low info provided, but I assume he would die for it, since he would receive 500 000 ada by time :)
It is not clear how the project will be markets and how the proposer expects to manage this process or if they have the experience.

It's not specified in the proposal how it is going to work, exactly. I've seen a brief explanation in the commentaries about the 'color change', however, I would like that this was more explicit in the proposal itself. 
Besides, the roadmap could be more explicit, giving dates and milestones, allowing us to follow the results.
Moreover, it's not explained if we're going to wait to sell all the 1Mi ADA or whether will be a deadline to donation, or how everything is actually going to work. If you do not sell all pixels, what will happen?

I did not find any key metrics. Giving to charity would increase only the brand of Cardano, and that is not the point. 

EDIT he provided an explanation and ways how to count website visitors, and argued that there is no (or it is hard) to find a tool to measure how a marketing campaign affects the number of proposers. Well, I gave him a suggestion, let's see.

It's missing a more detailed roadmap, metrics and KPI.
It's not clear how we gonna measure the amount of people outside from the project that came because of your platform, for example.

It's very unclear what problem this is trying to solve. For the masses, a light node is enough. For enthousiasts, running a node on their computer, optionnaly with a Ledger is a good solution. What is the point of having a dedicated hardware for a node? How does it scale up DeFi?

As with the above comments I do not think that this proposal should be within this challenge as I fail to see how this will bring more Defi  teams to build/deploy open finance solutions on Cardano in the next 6 months.

The proposed project would undoubtedly build a useful tool for the developers that would be in a position to use it. However I believe that the subset of developers that would make use of it would be quite a small percentage, from the overall pool of Cardano developers, and as such the impact of the proposal on the developers experience in the Cardano ecosystem as a whole would be limited.
The stated experience was a good basis to implement the proposal but what me totally convinced was the technically sould reply to the comments.

Given the clear roadmap and set launch date I see no problems in the community being able to keep tabs on the project if funded. The proposers mention that they will begin work prior to voting, allowing for their dedications and  intentions to be verified by the community without risking more than possibly the initial allocation of funds.

The proposal is notsufficients. It does not present an exact account of the solution that is going to be implemented, no milestones and success criteria and norationale for the very high funds that are demanded.
Bringing insurance policies and automated claim processing would indeed drive adoption.
This idea is in twice. No detail on what is being developed and how honesty would be assessed.
Impossible to asses given the information in the proposal.
Very little information on the team behind this and what the actual task is.

The proposal appears to align with the challenge. The reason why it is getting a low mark is because there is not enough information about how it will measure success or how it's dApp will drive adoption of Cardano. The proposal would be strengthened by better articulating it's value added to the ecosystem. What I am missing is the justification why the solution proposed is best suited to address existing problems. Other than insurance being publicly subsidized, which causes inequalities, it is unclear which other problems this aims to address.

There is simply not enough information to make this determination. The proposers provide little to no details on why they are suited to conduct this work. There is no overview of the existing team, and there is no action plan provided with measurable milestones to indicate success. This will leave significant gaps in understanding for voters as to whether the team can actually deliver.

The proposer claims to have decades of system dev. experience. But there is no way to verify this. If a team asks for 150k I think its ok to expect and introduction of the team.  In this proposal there is only a website linked which hasn't that much information about details as well. There is no explanation on how exactly the 150k are allocated.
The proposal does not include a detailed road map.  The brief proposal makes me doubt the author's commitment to what appears and ambitious project.

**The team submitted 2 identical proposals, so I am submitting the same rationale.

The plan is still a draft. There are no details on how the proposal will prevent fraud. There is little information about the team, I recommend providing details about how many people will be part of the proposal and details about the experience and qualifications of each one, also indicating what will be their role in the proposal. It is important to detail the budget allocation better. If the budget is used in its entirety to pay developers, I recommend detailing the work to be performed by the devs and an estimate of hours for the work to be performed.

I also recommend that the team follow the Catalyst documentation as a reference to prepare a proposal.

There is insufficient information to determine how feasible the proposal is and how effectively it would meet the challenge criteria. 

To increase the score of the proposal there should be a discussion about foreseen challenges and any potential work arounds that have been identified. 
In addition, the proposal is requesting a budget of $150,000 yet there is no breakdown of the request. It is unclear how many people will be needed to develop this project, what tools are already available and what is still needed. 
Given that there are no timelines presented within the proposal it is unclear how long this project would take. What is the work flow and process? What steps will the proposers take to share successes and failures to the voters?

Some information about the team has been described, but other than that, there is no information to audit the proposal. I recommend that the team read the Catalyst documentation and adapt the proposal, including metrics, roadmap, KPIs and the other items present in the documentation.

**The team submitted 2 identical proposals, so I am submitting the same rationale.

The milestones and budget presented are only for the implementation on the Cardano blockchain, since the app is already being developed by a different team of developers as specified by the proposer in a comment "We are already funded for our insurance and app business so are not reliant on funding via catalyst […] The funding would be used to employ 2 full-time developers dedicated to this work. There are other developers in the team to support and infrastructure already in place."
In this case, it would have been useful to have more details regarding this specific part that they are asking the funds for, in order to have a better understanding of the progress.
Bringing insurance to Cardano is a great idea. It is true that insurance fraud is a huge problem which has to be solved. Having insurance on Cardano would definetly benefit our ecosystem.
The tokenization of insurance is no doubt a great use case for blockchain.  The proposal in its current state does not convince me that the team can accomplish this.

it is important that more details are described about the problem, because in order for us to measure the impact of a proposal it is necessary to understand the size of the problem. Why would blockchains help reduce insurance costs? What is the potential for cost savings? The plan is still a draft and has few details.

**The team submitted 2 identical proposals, so I am submitting the same rationale.
Liqwid/MLabs team are working with an experienced group of Haskell dev shops to review their codebase/smart contracts before the v1 go-live.
The Liqwid team is building a complex DeFi dApp that requires a security audit before going live, the dev team has also begun engaging with Well-Typed engineers for continuous code review sessions.

Every DeFi dApp requires a  protocol security audit before launching, to secure the system's attack vectors, build trust with end users, and validate the design patterns used in the dApp. This protocol effectively addresses the challenge.
Deciding to work with the top Haskell development firms to audit the 1st DeFi lending protocol to launch on Cardano is effectively addressing the challenge.

As one of the early DeFi protocols to launch on Cardano the amount of fidelity the community is placing in this protocol is high and a security audit is the only way to cement the security of a system for end users/developers who will build atop Liqwid.
Liqwid/MLabs Team has solid foresight to complete this critical step in their development process of completing a security audit by Tweag/Well-Typed before deploying contracts to Plutus MN.

DeFi protocols with smart contract that custody user funds via interest rates curves must be audited before real funds are deposited. the Well-Typed/Tweag teams Liqwid has chosen to complete this work are class Haskell dev firms.
The team has already begun work on the 1st of the 2 deliverables with the Well-Typed team and are working closely with the Plutus delivery team.
The dev team behind this proposal has a track record of building and the MLabs team previous experience in fintech platforms lends a lot of credibility to this proposal.

Tweag/Well-Typed developers working on this proposals deliverables: 1. the code review and 2. the security audit are well known industry veterans in the Haskell space. This combined with the experience of the MLabs team means success in implementation is high for this proposal.
The presented plan is complete and outlines the Liqwid/MLabs plan to complete code review sessions followed by a full security audit of the Liqwid protocol smart contracts.
The team experience is made clear from their open source Haskell project work, the presented plan is complete and it's likely the proposal will be successfully implemented.
The proposal provides sufficient info and outlines the Liqwid team's plan for continuous code review and a security audit leading up to mainnet launch.

This proposal provides sufficient info and explains why the hard requirement for protocol security audit pre-launch exists. The software dev firms selected to work with the Liqwid/MLabs team have expert Haskellers who can fully test the protocol architecture/implementation.
The information presented in this proposal is sufficient to track the Liqwid code review/audit progress.
Tweag/Well-Typed Haskell dev firms working with the Liqwid/MLabs team on this proposal have the senior talent on deck required to deliver on the proposal's goals.
The team behind the proposal has a complete project plan to fully test/audit their Plutus smart contracts before mainnet. the info provided is also sufficient to audit the project's progress.
Information provided in this proposal is sufficient and the Liqwid/MLabs team has already begun working on one of the deliverables they highlight in their presented plan. This proposal is auditable.

The proposer includes a lot of extraneous information, such as travel itineraries and personal information like what they are packing for their trip that is not very relevant to the proposal. They briefly mention Blockly, a visual programming editor but it is not very clear as to how it fits in. I'd recommend focusing more on this aspect, i.e. "using Blockly to implement a Plutus Contract in a web interface on a mobile device" as a more tangible goal. The proposer doesn't mention if there are any risks relating to current toolchains such as compiling a contract on a mobile device. Would the solution require some kind of back-end server solution?
proposalTitle: Mobile Plutus and Marlowe Dev Tools

assessmentNote: The proposal is fairly complete, gret that the funding requests are explained, and that there are a clear timeplan with deliverables. The only thing missing is some more information on the team.
proposalTitle: Mobile Plutus and Marlowe Dev Tools

assessmentNote: It addresses the challenge by creating a new dev tool kit. Feasibility is a harder question as it is not clear the proposer is certain it is tractable.
proposalTitle: Mobile Plutus and Marlowe Dev Tools

assessmentNote: The proposer presents an interesting problem i.e., "how to make it easier for developers to use mobile devices for development in countries where laptops or desktops might be cost prohibitive"), and presents a solution. However, how that solution is to be implemented is not very clear. Recommend to include some diagrams and limit the information in the proposal to relevant information to increase the effectiveness of the proposal.
proposalTitle: Mobile Plutus and Marlowe Dev Tools
