assessmentNote: The Credmark team works on data models to allow users to input TX info in their risk-adjusted models, this proposal is for the r&d of a similar set of risk-adjusted models for Liqwid's borrow smart contract.
proposalTitle: Liqwid x Credmark R&D on Loan Risks

assessmentNote: The proposal from the Liqwid Labs team is to grow the body of research into liquidity, insolvency/default risks inherent to any DeFi lending app.
proposalTitle: Liqwid x Credmark R&D on Loan Risks

assessmentNote: This proposal address the challenge of Scale-Up DeFi by providing research by experts in the DeFi to the benefit of not only Liqwid, but all DeFi lending protocols since it will be released under the Apache 2.0 license.
proposalTitle: Liqwid x Credmark R&D on Loan Risks

assessmentNote: Liqwid protocol plus all Plutus DeFi dApps have a lot to gain from the outcomes of this research. The proposal is effectively addressing the DeFi challenge and the proposal goals are stated clearly.
proposalTitle: Liqwid x Credmark R&D on Loan Risks

assessmentNote: One of the main risks in a DeFi lending protocol such as Liqwid is market risks that lead to default risks and liquidations, building a system that can deleverage users gracefully when required is critical to avoid scenarios such as the Black Thursday events of March 2020. This protocol addresses the DeFi challenge by completing the R&D required to mitigate these risks in Liqwid's lending protocol.
proposalTitle: Liqwid x Credmark R&D on Loan Risks

assessmentNote: The r&d into loan/default risks for Plutus lending protocols needs to be scaled up for Cardano DeFi to have a safe rollout.
proposalTitle: Liqwid x Credmark R&D on Loan Risks

assessmentNote: Liqwid/MLabs team are collaborating with Credmark's DeFi data analysts to complete r&d into the Liqwid loan risks and simulate the liquidation process. Every yield curve DeFi solution on Cardano can benefit from this work when it is made open source.
proposalTitle: Liqwid x Credmark R&D on Loan Risks

assessmentNote: The proposal is within the DeFi realm as both teams work on lending/risk-adjusted models. The ability to join forces to develop stronger understanding of Liqwid's loan risk is effectively addressing the DeFi challenge.
proposalTitle: Liqwid x Credmark R&D on Loan Risks

assessmentNote: The proposal effectively addresses the challenge with research and development into loan risks and liquidation/liquidity crunch scenarios in the Liqwid's protocol.
proposalTitle: Liqwid x Credmark R&D on Loan Risks

assessmentNote: Scaling up r&d into loan risks is effectively addressing the DeFi challenge. Liqwid has large implementation risk in rolling out the first lending solution on Plutus and this proposal helps de-risk the production implementation of the protocol
proposalTitle: Liqwid x Credmark R&D on Loan Risks

assessmentNote: The proposer includes detailed information on both team's previous project work and ability to successfully implement the outlined deliverables.
proposalTitle: Liqwid x Credmark R&D on Loan Risks

assessmentNote: The dev teams behind this proposal each have advanced experienced building on the current DeFi design space. Credmark builds similar risk-adjusted products for borrowers in the current Ethereum DeFi protocols.

assessmentNote: The teams involved are top rate, and have been working on these issues on Ethereum's ecosystem. They will be able to assess similar risks and provide analysis on the cardano ecosystem.

assessmentNote: The proposal includes sufficient information on the team's background in DeFi risk-models/DeFi lending protocols. Given the team experience its highly likely they have the ability to successfully implement this proposal's deliverables.

assessmentNote: Project has 2 milestones, and KPI, but doesn't propose key results.

assessmentNote: The proposer seems to be proficient on the development side, and attending the plutus pioneers speaks for this as well. What is more uncertain is the marketing and advertising part.

I neither agree nor disagree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals.

proposalTitle: Native Token API for Game Devs

assessmentNote: The proposal aims to provide an unique (Cardano) payment address to an employee which can act as a resume. This idea has a basic adaptability problem in that every person who seeks a job wants to move to a higher-paying position. This proposal has substantial adaptation risks.

It is an interesting idea, however to be taken up by employers I believe it would need a more complex measure than just average and total pay. More complex quality metrics should be developed. It is also not clear that workers would accept payment in ADA given its recent volatility.
The proposal has claimed limited development experience and has accepted that he needs to identify developers interested in the project.
The proposal has not presented the full plan. There is a need for clarity on methodology and outline specifications.

It is not easy to address people that are suited to make proposals  on catalyst but establishing contact with Entrepreneurial Community Builders and organize events that target entrepreneurs is a convincing approach to successfully implement it.

Project catalyst tasks of this Fund's head are ideally summarised by "We will get the most trusted source an entrepreneur has to tell them about Catalyst's FREE MONEY to build their startup". The approach to have events to make potential startups take part in catalyst sounds logical and addresses Catalyst's challenge in attracting passionate startups.
The described success story of the concept is very convincing. Having participated in similar events myself, I can confirm the desired effect on the participants.
The proposer has established credentials in organizing startup events. It is likely to attract startups with restrictions in funds to take part in Catalyst.

The proposer appears to be a highly experienced entrepreneur with knowledge in organizing and leading Hackathons. They claim to have collaborated with Fund2 winners prior to them joining project Catalyst and have a team of individuals capable of handling the task.
The use of the requested capital is well explained. The number of events held is an obvious KPI. The estimated costs seem reasonable.
This is not an easy challenge, but the team and the support of the greater NFT-DAO community make it feasible in my eyes. In other words, if anyone is likely to succeed, it is this team.
Adding interoperability for NFTs and/or harmonizing them in between chains will greatly facilitate their use and implementability and make developing in that area more attractive.

The proposal effectively addresses the challenge and appears to be an extremely daunting final project. What I particularly like about this proposal is that the team is taking small steps towards the big picture. Without really understanding the complexity of the overall task I do feel that the proposal allows me to grasp enough to encourage further work.
The team has experience, but it is a research project, they do not know it they will deliver anything.

The team is very experienced and has credible background by partially already having worked together with IOHK. While the plan and the budget are a bit open and not that defined, since the challenge is open itself this is okay, considering the fact that the team knows what it is doing and it can be assumed that they deliver something worthwhile with the experience they have.
The team has agreements directly with IOHK and are highly qualified to do this research and propose standards. This gives me confidence that the  funds will not be wasted.

The team appears to have the experience and to set off on this proposal and the budget is weighted accordingly. It seems that this preliminary phase will be mostly research based which may be a sticking point for some of the community. However, I do feel that the end product may indeed be very beneficial to the community.

The proposal is well written and explains the importance of the challenge, shows the background of the proposers and the github repository indicates they already did some research regarding the topic making it credible that they will do good work on providing a solution.
The funds are for research. Fruitful results will be the only audit. We will learn in future funding rounds what the team has learned and how they plan to move forward.
answered above, delivery is measurable. The next proposal is dependant on results of this initial research.

NFT storefront facilitating smart ticketing has a worldwide appeal. With Cardano's state of art NFTs and low transaction fees, this system has the potential to attract wide adoptions. The NFT based tickets to cultural and sports events can open up the market for trading these tickets which are quite cumbersome today. The proposal is addressing a very important step in Cardano adoption.

This is a powerful use case for blockchain and the proposal does a good job of explaining the benefits to the industry, which should encourage adoption. Cardano is a perfect low cost platform to make the economics work.

NFT-DAO claims the support of about 12 developers and it is very likely that technical expertise for developing the dapp will be present in-house. The proposal is not a very complex implementation of NFT with a smart contract. Therefore it will be possible to implement the proposal successfully.
The NFT DAO team is highly qualified and has a lot of momentum in the Catalyst community. The project is organized into 6 phases and has a clear timeline. I see the project as highly feasible.
The project has a well-laid road map with clear markers for measuring progress. It will be possible to measure the progress of the project quantitatively.

fund allocation is not broken down specifically, but the 6 phases allow for monitoring of progress. Software development can be monitored via github. Success reporting is defined at 3, 6 and 12 months. Given these resources it shouldn't be difficult to judge the success of the project.

There is a clear description of the proplem this proposal wants to tackle. They also describe how they want to achieve it. By breaking down their plan to Phase 1-6 they provide information of how their progress is supposed to look like. They provided 3 stages with metrics that define the succes of the proposal.

There is a need for human-friendly Cardano addresses. There are multiple ways to address compromise in one or more characteristics. However, the feature will be useful in some settings which can accept these compromises.

All the NFT-DAO related projects are high class. The team behind this one appear highly qualified, and they have all the resources of NFT-DAO behind them. Similar Catalyst proposals have merged with this one, bringing even more talent ant momentum. The project intends to move forward with or without Catalyst funding.
The proposal is by a team with which is developing Glow programming language. The team has substantial experience and expertise to cater complete the proposal sucessfully.

The project has a clear and simple aim with a high technical challenge. The scope, outline, and task list are fairly clear; therefore, it is fairly straightforward to monitor and audit the project's progress.
Building a decentralized marketplace of any kind requires much more description and technical detail unpacking than what's presented here.
proposalTitle: Raffly.io the simple way to raffle

assessmentNote: General idea of a dapp that can raffle assets is great and has many use cases but does follow under gambling and could have substantial issues in people selling their non-digital goods.
proposalTitle: Raffly.io the simple way to raffle

assessmentNote: Draft proposal. There is no description of a problem in the problem statement. There is no reasonable and detailed plan, which makes it difficult to assess the alignment and impact of the proposal on this challenge. I recommend including details according to the Catalyst documentation so that we can give you appropriate feedback.
proposalTitle: Raffly.io the simple way to raffle

assessmentNote: The idea behind the proposal, a raffle system, could definitely prove popular, but it's unclear if participants would directly be exposed to the Cardano blockchain, thus increasing its visibility and drive adoption.
proposalTitle: Raffly.io the simple way to raffle

assessmentNote: There is not sufficient information to asses feasibility. Please provide a detailed plan on what would be built and how it would be marketed.
proposalTitle: Raffly.io the simple way to raffle

assessmentNote: Draft proposal. There is no information that allows auditability of the proposal. it is important to include more information, according to the Catalyst documentation.
proposalTitle: Raffly.io the simple way to raffle

assessmentNote: I think this is a really good idea, and something which will help development on Cardano skyrocket. The benefit would be fantastic.

Yes, documentation is important. It is certainly a task that even came up during the Plutus Pioneer Program where in-code documentation was mentioned to be inaccurate. Making it easier for developers to build on Cardano is effectively addressing the challenge.
Documentation will help everyone get to know the ecosystem better and start developing on Cardano. If this is done right, it could really boost the quality of documentation available.
As written, documentation is important for developer adoption. Incetivizing documentation sounds like a difficult task though. I would guess the game theory around it would require a lot of research.

They haven't provided enough information on their background with smart contracts, or how they plan to design the smart contracts to judge whether it is feasible. So I am inclined to say it is not feasible that they will be able to do it unless they provide some details on how it will work and how they will use the money.
The team provides little information about themselves. A detailed budget (only that the bounties will be the main expense) is missing.

It would be good to have more detail on how the bounties will be funded. How much of the 40,000 funding request is for this. How will the peer review process work and how will this interact with the smart contract to pay out? How do we stop collusion and gaming of this system.

There seems to be a plan for an open source github and how the general process will go. I would appreciate more details on how the datum from github would get to the cardano smart contract and be used there.

Topics and/or examples for approved vs. not-approved documentation would give the reader a better idea of what level of writing is acceptable. What about rewrites, a Hello World type of document for the hundredth time?

In coming up with examples, potential impact of this proposal would become more clear.

The information provided is sufficient to audit the success and progress of the proposal; if examples of acceptable documentation was provided, the score for auditability would be higher.

More information on bounty funding and how the payment function will work would be useful to understand how feasible this is. If you put monetary payments into a smart contract, someone will try to game the system. this needs to be well planned.

The general idea is doable and makes a lot of sense to move forward with. I think in my mind what is mostly missing is the detail on how the commits will be reviewed, will there be also an incentive to review content? how will people which are trying to game the system for money be stopped?
The proposal could contain more information on the team behind it, deliverables, timeplan and how the funds will be allocated.

I think it is a good idea to have a "Cardano stall" on an event like this.  But till December, it might be that cardano will already make a large reputation, thus this is a long run project, and I am not sure if is on schedule.
The proposal in really on point with the challenge and the target audience is indeed the one Project Catalyst is looking for. Probably one of the best proposals in this matter.
The proposer provided a valid reason why he should be able to pull it off.
The proposal credentials are in the open domain and have sufficient experience for the task involved in ensuring the success of the proposal.
The experience is on point with the proposal and the plan is detailed. The proposer has previous experience with such events and the proposal looks solid.

The proposal is clear and straightht forward. The proposal has a clear time and budget plan. The proposal is highly feasible and has the potential to attract a large number of fresh entrepreneurs into the Cardano ecosystem.

The plan is detailed and the budget is partitioned. Milestones and deliverables are defined as well as success metrics. There are also sufficient info to judge what is the impact / purpose of Slush to those that are unfamiliar with it
Whilst only addressing one part of the community, this could be an important project to move forward and the size of the funds request is relatively small.

At this stage the proposal only seeks to form a collaboration to perform research and answer questions, so it's difficult to assess how effectively it would address the challenge. There is also no clear milestones for phase 1 for which the funds are being requested or success criteria.
The proposed solution improves the development of new applications on Cardano. It is a specialiced case, but still an important pain point that is adressed. The requested funds are also quite low.
There is a need for wallets to access data from oracle endpoints. Yorai backend is a commonly used software adding this feature will create lot of value to the eco system.
The team seem to have the necessary skillset and motivation to implement the project successfully. The budget is reasonable and would add to the Yoroi wallet functionality.
Five Binaries are pioneer in the Cardano-space. They have a proved track record and their product bockfrost is already used by many products in the cardano ecosystem.
The 5 binaries team are a proven infrastructure company in the Cardano ecosystem.
Project already previously funded thus showing interest. It provides a useful functionality for dev's thus addressing the challenge.

The information provided was sufficient to provide insight into the project and links assisted understanding. Budget is reasonable and would be interested to know what else could upgrade the Yoroi wallet.

Since the total amount of work needed is only estimated to be 10 hrs a detailed roadmap is not necessary, however I would have liked to see a more precise start date. Why is an estimate of 3 months from receiving the funds given for a project that would only take 10hrs? Besides that every aspect of this smaller project is clearly described and easy to follow and understand.
The proposal is about the completion of an already started implementation. The deliverables are stated. Nothing more is needed.
only 1200 USD is requested and the specific deliverables are outlined. It will be relatively easy to judge if the project is successful.  Perhaps they will need more funds in a future round.
This proposal appears to be a useful concept that would benefit Yoroi users and by extension contribute to Developer ecosystem.

Will sort out CIP12 stakepool operator communications to Yoroi backend software ,needed by Yoroi lightweight wallets and other lightweight wallets.  Was already approved in round 3,not funded because over budget

Yes, will be completed within 1 month from receiving funding, all detail already assessed and approved, funding the hick-up. Comply with self assessment checklist, 1 month, 8 engineering hours at 100 EUR per hour, total budget 950 USD
Good information and well presented with links that allowed me to gain a working understanding of what the team are trying to achieve.

Five Binaries is well known in Cardano community, saw them on last Catalyst Week Townhall, giving feedback on work completed. Cardano pioneers with solid track record, also trusted by Emurgo, Trezor and IOG (IOHK)

In this proposal you state: "Many jurisdictions, mostly on European markets, have consumer protection laws that make it difficult to introduce an application without a localized interface.". 
If this is the case, then many dApps would be hard to introduce and maintain on these markets without some bigger type of coordination. An example of a restrictive law or condition would increase the credibility of this proposal. 
Could this proposal be more generalized and valid for all languages that need to be translated? A community driven platform for translations or something similar? The community seems happy to help in this aspect according to the comments.
It is hard to identifying a clear connection between this proposal and the key metrics given the 'Developer Ecosystem' campaign brief. Can you try to clarify this further in your proposal?
This proposal offers a year worth of support for localizing a specific market, it is unclear if this really is considered impactful given this particular campaign. 
I will rate this a (2) in terms of impact with the current information available. 
Note that this assessment is posted in the 'Localize Yoroi for Slovak market' and '...for Czech market' since both proposals are very similar.

The proposer presents clear evidence of prior related work and experience within the field. The type of work this proposal addresses is not considered very complex, which makes this proposal likely to be successful if it were to be funded. 
The budget is clearly outlined and the references of the proposer are very strong. In terms of feasibility, this proposal achieves a (5). It is likely, with the information given, to be implemented if funded. 
Note that this assessment is posted in the 'Localize Yoroi for Slovak market' and '...for Czech market' since both proposals are very similar.

This proposal promises localization for a smaller specific market during a year for 2500 dollars worth of compensation. The proposer does not mention any obligations or promises to uphold the translations within a reasonable timeframe after new updates. Provide details about your obligations in terms of deadlines in order to increase the credibility of the proposal overall.

In a perfect world, all apps and platforms would be available in every language. It all comes down to ROI in this case. You ask for 2500 dollars worth of funding for this proposal (Slovak market) as well as for the Czech market, that is 5000 dollars worth of funding in total. 
Will 5000 dollars worth of ADA to these two proposals contribute to more ROI to the community then other proposals in this campaign? It is hard to judge if this proposal is impactful given the funding. In terms of auditability, the proposal seems plausible. Since the proposal is hard to assess I will take a neutral standing an give this proposal a rating of (3).
Note that this assessment is posted in the 'Localize Yoroi for Slovak market' and '...for Czech market' since both proposals are very similar.
The proposal is simple and involves providing Slovak language support to Yoroi. The process is auditable.

Feasibility: 3/5
From the attached presentation, the proposer seems to have a good grasp of  of the opportunity and the industry. They claim to have lead startups related to genomics. Links to evidence such as Linked in profile would strengthen their case.  I see a lack of evidence for the proposer's understanding of how Cardano would be implemented on a technical level.  It sounds like a potential application for Atala Prism, but this is not discussed. I think more technical research needs to be done or presented before the project will appear feasible.
No detailed plan on what would actually be produced, thus unlikely to be successful. Evidence to back up proposers claimed experience would be good (LinkedIn profile?)

Auditability: 2/5
The proposers offer no specific timeline, no breakdown of fund allocation,  and no other auditable goals.  I think they concept is a really good one, but it is very large in scope. To make a convincing proposal, a detailed development plan showing an understanding of the technological requirements should be included.
$50,000 to research an idea seems expensive. A detailed plan with milestones should be produced.
Seems like a nice DApp that would bring in a new user base with continued interactions with Cardano.

feasibility: 4/5
The proposers seem to know the industry, and they have the technical support of Gimbalabs playground.  The projected allocation of funds seems somewhat arbitrary but I appreciate it may be hard to estimate which aspect of development will be more costly.  Overall I feel that the project has the background knowledge and access to technical resources to successfully execute the project.

Auditabilty: 4/5
The proposal is basically for the development of the platform which is auditable by demonstration of a successful product. Expectations of user participation are modest and auditable.  It will be important to clearly demonstrate How funds were allocated during the development process in order to show a good return on intention.

Crowdfunding is an excellent idea. It would provide a secondary funding vehicle outside of catalyst. It could help build revenue options for both startups and Cardano enthusiasts. Motivated investors could help improve products and drive overall Cardano ecosystem exposure through various marketing strategies.
The team has the skills to deliver something here, though this is a complex undertaking.
There are no details on the plan thus it is unlikely to be successfully implemented.
There is no detail in this plan thus its feasibility cannot be effectively assessed.
The proposal contains no information other than a very brief explanation of its purpose.
It seems obvious to grow the community in Africa information needs to be provided in African languages.
The information provided in the Roadmap is sufficient to trach and audit the project progress. The milestones' dates are provided, and KPI's is described in detail.
Scope, Timeline and Budget are well defined, KPM's are well defined, feedback channels are well defined, cant ask for much more.
Using the blockchain to provide immutable time/date and location stamping on aerial photography provides a compelling use case

This proposal addresses Cardano Fund 5: DApps & Integrations Challenge. The project proposal is solid and can impact many people seeking to buy NFT via the Cardano DEX. The problem and solution in the proposal are well described and explained. This proposal, if implemented correctly, will increase the utility of the Cardano Blockchain.

It is likely for this proposal to be implemented because it includes a straightforward plan which will serve the Cardano Community Users to get exposure to more NFT project through Cardano DEX. This proposal is highly feasible as it comprises a team that is interested in building on top of Cardano Blockchain. The only question is, will 5000 USD be enough?
Reasonably detailed plan and low cost which would add a great function to the NFT world.
The information provided in the Roadmap is sufficient to track and audit the project progress. The milestones' dates and KPI's are clear.
this could be an interesting idea. It is not clearly communicated how the economics, content delivery and marketing will be done.

The proposal does address an emerging use case  and such a platform could bring large scale adoption to Cardano. However many competing project do or will exists and successful execution will be difficult.  Such a product will probably only be successful by a very large team of professionals with high level connections to the music distribution industry.
This would be a great flagship project. This projects tries to solve inequality and Cardano tries to do the same. All basic requirements (it will be an app that uses Cardano) are also fulfilled.

The proposal aims to build a Cardano blockchain-based solution for monetizing music talents using the sale of fungible tokens. The aim is clear; however, the implementation procedure is not very clear and leaves some gaps. There is a need for more clarity of the implementation process.

This is a very creative idea and a good application of the blockchain technology. Some details about the relation between artists and the audience may be complicated but I see that it would be a feature of the system, it would work best for some artists than others. It is also a good way to attract new people to the blockchain world and Cardano ecosystem.
The proposer brings industry experience, but relies on a non-specified local software development shop (which is unlikely to have deep experience in Cardanp).

There is not enough detail on how this would actually work. How are they delivering content? How are they marketing to end use consumers to get them to buy tokens with with they will then support bands? Why do the bands pay back to fans? how can they afford this? How is the algorithm to promote bands to work. Is this centralised or decentralised? Open source? Evidence of proposers competence would be useful (LinkedIn Profiles). More information on what the local tech company would be creating. A budget related to that.

The proposal is not very specific and does not convince that the team has the skills or resources to execute.  A more convincing proposal would include blockchain specialists, and a detailed technical map of what is in effect a very complex proposal. Because the proposal lacks specifics, it is unlikely that it will become a valuable product.

The stated experience is believable, but the amount of information is quite limited. Also a local company specialised in software-development does not mean, that there is sufficient knowledge available to implement the proposal on Cardano.
There is no reference to the software company that is being planned to hired for implementing the solution. The aim is ambitious and there is a substantial technical challenge in this open problem.

There is little information provided about the team that intends to dissolve the app. They are authors involved in music and software development, but nothing else is informed to us. It would be beneficial to detail who the people on that team are, what they do professionally, individually, and some examples of their work. However, it is positive that we know that there is an intention to hire specific professionals for each area of ​​development of the app, for example, a UI / UX designer. So, I believe that the team is capable and qualified for the project, there was only a lack of detail about it, to increase confidence.

The alleged experience is very good and very relevant to this implementation. It also mentions that a local company would be hired to conduct the development of the platform itself. It doesn't mention explicitly if this company also has experience with blockchain developments, but this might be covered as well. The budget breakdown does not include any money for marketing, although a marketing campaign is announced in the roadmap, so this should be better explained.

Fund allocation is defined but not timelines or specific goals are given. The concept is more nuanced and complex than the proposers make out and I'm not convinced they have the organizational or technical resources to use the funds efficiently.

Roadmap and a basic breakdown of the projects costs are available. No KPIs are provided. The provided information give the impression that it is still very unclear how the project will actually proceed.
The proposal has limitations in implementing and even the architecture for effective monetization of the music talents.

We are given a division of how the money would be used, according to the hiring of each professional, and also an estimate in months of what would happen and when. Regarding this last point, despite making it clear to outsiders how the project would happen, chronologically, the explanation is very brief. It would be interesting to add more details about each stage. For example, in the ninth month a marketing campaign would be carried out. But how, exactly? It would be through social networks, how would this project reach people? Because there is something similar already, like patreon on youtube. This new way of supporting artists needs to be well publicized, so that the public understands its advantages, not least because many people are still unfamiliar with cryptocurrencies and intellectual contracts. To resolve these issues, a slightly more detailed explanation of the steps was necessary, in my opinion.

The proposal has a good roadmap and milestones. It could also include some KPIs and key metrics related to the engagement of both artists and audience in the platform during the first year. Also, the budget breakdown is good but it does not include some points of the roadmap, such as the marketing campaign. Some possible challenges should be assessed, like an artist selling his tokens but not sharing any of the profits with the audience and other aspects related to that.
I did not find any metrics on how it increases the number of proposers.
Not clear it meets this challenge. This seems like it should be in the proposer outreach fund.
More information about the breakdown of the budget would be a plus.
This could be an interesting use case, and if it worked would draw a lot of new users into the Cardano ecosystem.
Yes, NFT standards are important to the industry.
The proposers claim experience in the field. Credentials could not be verified with the inputs provided in the proposal.
Yes, the team has knowledge in the field and it is already actively working in it.
This task is simple, buy membership into a standards setting organization. there is no reason to doubt that it will happen.
There are general timetables to finish the work on the proposal.

feasibility: 1/5
The proposer's experience is highly relevant to the project but they provide no means to verify this experience.  The relationship of the proposer to the paypixl project is unclear.  The propeser did not respond to community questions during the refine stage.

Auditability 1/5 
The proposer does not provide a breakdown of fund allocation, a timeline, or a clear picture of what success would look like. if the funds were delivered to the proposer, it would be very difficult to assess if they were put to productive use.

There is a clear timeline with milestones that meet the challenge. There are relevant metrics and KPIs.

There are details about the team's qualifications and experience, but there are no details about the team's expertise with Plutus. There are details on the budget allocation.

Translation of proposals and other documents into different languages, especially Spanish, is crucial for the future of Project Catalyst and therefore Cardano. If possible, wouldn't it be most effective it were complimentary to the Ideascale website and not an entirely new one? However, as one of the comments pointed out, there can be no system for choosing which proposal gets translated and which not.
Seems like a good area to fund. Catalyst community needs to be inclusive of non-English first language members and Spanish is a broadly spoken component.

This proposal doesn't require great technical complexity, only people with skills in web development and translators. From the development point of view there are indications that the team is able to execute the proposal. It is unclear who will perform the translation or the team's ability to translate. My point is:

Will this be a professional translation? I don't see the need for a professional translation, as the focus is on transmitting the content, but about 80% of the proposal's budget will be used for the translation of proposals, and it should be noted that, using an extension in the browser, a user can achieve practically the same quality of translation and will probably achieve the same understanding.

If we are thinking about translation quality it may be that an automatic translator is not perfect, but if the aim is a professional translation it would be important to describe the team's experience in translation.

Translation costs are inconclusive, as the definition of translation cost was established in cost per hour and not cost per word, without a definition of proposals to be translated or payment to be made per translated word, the auditability became hard to measure.

There is a justified concern with the translation of Catalyst material to expand the reach in communities that speak other languages ​​/ do not understand English, however it is necessary to reflect on the feasibility of translating proposals, as this would generate a great additional cost and would end up maintaining the community in silos, since for people who speak different languages ​​they need to interact at some point and this proposal doesn't solve this problem.

Some risks that I think are important to mention:

There is mention that only part of the proposals will be translated, I think it is important to define this more clearly, as this makes the translation process arbitrary, it can be any number. In addition, a conflict of interest may arise, as the translation and curation of these proposals would be limited to the intention of the ALDEA team.

Based on the team's experience and what they have already done, I believe it's very feasible to achieve the desired goals for Phase 1, which would be funded with this proposal. The only point that's a bit off is the cost for website development, which seems to be too small, and the Discord upgrades are not all listed as well so it's not possible to evaluate if that's feasible, but the remaining topics are achievable.

Translation costs are inconclusive, as the definition of translation cost was established in cost per hour and not cost per word, without a definition of proposals to be translated or payment to be made per translated word, the auditability became hard to measure.

The KPIs cited are not KPIs but metrics, but they are relevant metrics and good indicators of performance and success of the proposal, however the absence of KPIs makes auditing difficult in an objective way.

Although there are details about the qualifications of the team, there is no information about the need for a professional translator, if necessary it would be important to describe details about this person (the reason I am including this detail was mentioned during the assessment). There is a link to the Aldea DAO website, on the website there is information about the SPOs participating in the DAO, but there are no names and details about the members, which makes it difficult for the community to have more information.

All the information they have added is easily verifiable. They have split the project among several funding rounds, thus making it easier for the community to continue funding them, if the previous rounds prove to be valuable.

The success criteria is clear, and the suggested KPIs/metrics are also relevant to the problem. General milestones are good too. The budget breakdown shows that most of the money would go to translation, but Ii believe that it's a bit off since the Discord improvement and website development might cost more than what's stated there.
The proposers have verifiable credentials to be sure that the proposal will be implemented successfully.
this project details the scope, timeline, and budget as well as a detailed plan on how the goal will be achieved.

The proposal does not mention laying out the progress via open source, instead a "proprietary algorithm" will be used. The timeline does not mention the actual completion or delivery of the dapp(s) to users. Therefore, the information provided is insufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal.
milestones and deliverables are clear, this one will be very simple to track

The proposal itself is not targeted at reaching out to new entrepreneurs, but may help new entrepreneurs in their onboarding providing useful information about cardano. Brand awareness is not enough to make people submit their ideas to Catalyst, so I still think it matches the challenge scope.
The experience presented is relevant to the proposal and the plan is detailed enough. There seems to be already a community around ALDEA which will make the maintenance of a wiki easier.
The way they have addressed most issues in their proposal, I think they have planned well in advance and have enough experience and knowledge to get this project done.

The plan is detailed enough and the budget is partitioned. Success metrics are defined as well as deliverables and a timeline.
The only downside is that phase 2 to 3 rely on successive fundings, that are not guaranteed, so there's the risk that only the spanish version will be built.
The proposal of creating a template for tokenized securities is original.
No experience in bootstraping companies ; no proof of programming skills.
It is a DeFi project that addresses a financial need.
This is a single idea, not scaling up the DeFi ecosystem. Thus does not address the challenge.
There is no information regarding detailing the relevant experience of the team behind the project.

No details on how the 10% APY will be funded. Is this a Ponzi scheme? People won't pay 10% p.a. on a home loan, interest rates are way below that in the developed world. Are you proposing the lender is actually taking equity in the properties bought?
There is little information about the implementation. Borrow money from what institutions to buy real state?

feasibility: 2/5
More specific experience in smart contracts and NFT development would benefit the proposal.  Quantification of CO2 sequestration and variable rules regarding easements and stewardship make establishing the legitimacy of the project very difficult, especially if the goal is to promote participation by small land holders globally. At least in the USA there are tax benefits associated with easements which would incentivize participation by landowners.  A more open system without active enforcement may be an option but the system would be vulnerable to abuse and it may be considered disingenuous to sell carbon credits based off of such an open/unenforceable standard.

Auditability 4/5
Since the funding requested is specifically for the development of the NFT/Dapp system, production of such system would mean the realization of the proposal goals. Because the proposer has 50 acres of land to use as a pilot, they have a good opportunity to test and implement the software. However the more challenging aspect of the proposal would come in future stages. Auditability of carbon sequestration and stewardship practices will propose a significant challenge to the ultimate success of the proposer's vision.
Educating students on cardano certainty help grow the developer ecosystem.
The team has a long track record of designing and providing Blockchain education.
Team has proved blockchain teaching experience
Proposal addresses something that could pose a significant bottleneck in the future if left unattended.

assessmentNote: This proposal does address the challenge, but maybe would be more suitable for the grow up defi ecosystem.
Every dApp building on Cardano can make use of this Metamask-like product, this effectively addresses the challenge.
This proposal can extend the Yoroi wallet to work with browser based dApps set to go live in the Goguen era.
Very little detail given to allow determination of success probability. Please provide more detailed plan with milestones etc. No details to back up claim team has the experience to deliver.
Emurgo is well known and respected, so it is their team.
The teams experience makes them about as heavyweight as you get in the Cardano/Ergo ecosystem
The proposing team has one of the strongest records as a Cardano founding entity.
The Emurgo team behind this proposal has the dev resources needed to successfully implement this plan
The proposal is on the light side but the Emurgo team are well trusted developers and one of the founding Cardano entities.
There is no team more fit to build this solution than the Emurgo devs who delivered Yoroi wallet.
Cardano needs a Metamask like solution for dApps to really take off and there is no team more qualified than the Yoroi builders at Emurgo.
Great to see a team with members based in Japan step up with a proposal that will help grow the Japanese Cardano developer base
Emurgo has HQ in Japan and this proposal aligns with the challenge goals to expand Cardano developers across that region
The team has a Japan office and they have several deep ties with Cardano's Japanese community. The proposal to bring more Japanese devs into Catalyst is effectively addressing the challenge.
Emurgo has a solid base in Japan and this proposal can help bring a lot of Japan's dev talent into the Cardano Catalyst ecosystem.
There is a full plan included in this with accurate/reasonable deliverables outlined.

The team behind this has strong experience working with Cardano's Japanese community, Seba lives in Japan and is Emurgo's technical lead. The plan to bring more Japanese devs into Cardano is likely to be a success as a result.
This is a complete proposal from the Emurgo team to more directly engage the Cardano Japanese dev community.

The proposal team is effective but more clarity is needed with regard to how the proposed implementation will impact distributed decision making. Without a clear description of how the impact, confidence in success is reduced.
The proposal is feasible. It is not well described how it  addresses the challenge.
Within the scope of the task as per the proposal, the proposers have excellent demonstrated capability to complete the project.
Experience as an SPO is hardly enough to help the developer eco-system I believe.

Sports betting and gambling in general are huge industries through which large amounts of money flow. The interest in participation will help draw new users to the network and increase transaction volume generating more value. This DApp has great potential.
If done well it could be a powerful app. This is a crowded space and will not be easy to break into.

The proposal appears to have the experience to successfully develop the MVP although with a proposal of this type I would have liked to learn more about them. Who are they and what experience do they have within the betting industry?
More detail on competitive landscape and how this will compete to show it would be feasible to gain market share.
The proposal is inline with the challenge's mission by offering ways to capitalize on waste while also cleaning up the waste. This is a worthwhile combination of great things.
The proposal to create a market for ebooks doesn't help the developer ecosystem in any ways.
There is enough information to show that the team can execute the project.
There is a good breakdown of the necessary milestones to track the project.
This is a very detailed proposal which addresses the challenge. It is asking for a very small sum for what is being provided.

While an app motivating people to do sports will sure bring some value to people, the proposal is very vague, indicating that a detailed concept has not been made yet, making it unlikely that the project will have a high impact.
No real plan. This is a request for people to come up with one in this domain.

The proposal is not clear about how Cardano would be used in this case. If it's going to be subscription, rewards based on performance, how performance would be measured, and other points. Also, the problem statement is not a problem but part of the solution already. The text should be rewritten in order to make it clearer about the need of Blockchain and Cardano in such a project.
I think there needs to be more detail on why blockchain (and cardano in particular) would be necessary to make this app. How would ada be used for this?
The way it is written at the moment, it looks like an idea for a stand-alone app on top of which the idea of the Cardano blockchain was slapped upon just to make it fit for a fund proposal.
The proposer has no exprience in software development. No detailed plan or milestones are presented. It is highly unlikely that this project will be implemented.
There is noted experience in sport and training but what about dapp development? Who will the team be and how is it going to work? Need more concrete info here.

The experience described by the team is not enough to execute the proposal. At least one developer is required to create the dapp.

The proposal is a draft, there is no plan. There are no details on resource allocation.

I recommend detailing the proposal according to the Catalyst documentation.

The proposer is a fitness trainer with a lot of experience in his domain. Yet for this challenge, he should have contacted a developer first to see how this project can be implemented and what the time and financial costs would be, before submitting a proposal for dApp creation.
In terms of ADA - no. Should be course tickets realized via tokens or training videos via nfts. What is the  USP.

Since the description of the project is very vague and it is not even clear what EXACTLY the app is supposed to do; For example it is unclear how the rewards for moving are gonna be paid, considering ADA is a proof of stake token. Many more things need to be considered and described in order to create an audible proposal.

There's not enough information in this proposal to assess besides an idea. This proposal will greatly benefit by articulating the existing problem and the intended DApp solution and its mechanics and interactions with the Cardano blockchain. It may be prudent for the proposer to on-board IT skills and opinions in the team to assist own presenting an auditable inventory of phases/stages which should include dev pathways, resources and the cost of achieving each milestone. It would also benefit voters if the benefits of said DApp can be explained further in terms of healthy-lifestyle adoption, interactions with the blockchain, and the sustainability of the program.
roadmap, metrics, details, use case scenarios and more would benefit greatly. Please refine and narrow the scope of this.

The proposer needs to work with a developer/team of developers to be able to write a complete proposal. I'm sure he understands his needs as a fitness trainer best, but he needs someone with a development background who can translate that into more concrete terms. Also, there needs to be more thought given to the blockchain integration side.
The proposal has addressed a current need that may drive some user adoption.
Great plan that would help DeFi projects get of the ground with lower technical effort thus accelerating deployment.
It is a very important project for a working DeFi ecosystem in Cardano.
The experience of the proposers in the Cardano ecosystem is vast, and this proposal builds on previous funding rounds.
The proposal presents a destination for the funds and also a timetable for the project.
The plan would need more detail to evaluate is likelihood of successful implementation.
The team has relevant experience in the area, and the plan looks to be achivable.
The team has experience in the industry and in blockchain in general.
This proposal is highly feasible because the proposer and his team have extensive technical experience
The proposal is very detailed, structured and well-made. It contains clear milestones, success criteria and a realistic budget. Well done!

Gimbalabs website and resources demonstrate experience, skills and engagement into providing resources to learners and promoting Cardano's environment. 4 experienced developers full-time will most likely be able to develop great resources documentation and tools.  The budget has low details though, basically it is the salary for the 4 developers during a 3-month development phase. I understand that these developers are supposed to offer user assistance for the tools after that initial period and help new coming developers : it would help to explain under which conditions they will ensure this mission.

It is likely for this proposal to be implemented because it includes a straightforward plan which will serve the Cardano Developer Community to build open source tool to facilitate Cardano Blockchain Developer adaption.
This project is feasible, however it is not clear that 1/6th of the fund budget should be spent on this as it doesn't seem to directly meet the challenge.
The information provided in this Roadmap is sufficient to track and audit the project progress. The milestones' dates and KPI's are clear.

The proposal addresses the Fund 5: Catalyst value onboarding challenge very. The problem is described and the solution is well identified. This project can benefit the Cardano Catalyst Community. The question is will you build the site or integrate with other platforms?

The idea seems very good and useful, since it intends to build a platform on which the authors of funded projects can search for members to build their work team. In almost all the proposals I saw, they were composed by an author who had the idea and some pertinent knowledge for that, but it would still be necessary to compose some time with professionals in specific areas who would help to make the idea a reality. In other words, a platform that would be the bridge between these project creators and the specialized workforce seems to me very necessary. The project dialogues with the objectives of the challenge, since it is likely to move the community and still attract new participants.

100 percent on-chain NFTs can be an ideal way to save high-value NFTs securely and permanently. The proposal will offer the community an alternate schema of things that will be highly secure. Being a open-source initiative it will be a good value to the dev community in Cardano to innovate further.
The proposal surfaces the lifetime problems of external resources when minting NFTs. The proposed solution is, however, only feasible for very limited use.

This proposal addresses Cardano Fund 5: Metadata Challenge. The project proposal is solid and can impact many people seeking to get exposure to NFT through the Cardano Blockchain. The problem and solution in the proposal are well described and explained. This proposal, if implemented correctly, will transform bring a lot of new users to the Cardano Blockchain Ecosystems.
The proposal has provided verifiable credentials and has excellent experience in Cardano software development. Therefore it is very likely that the proposal will be Implemented successfully.

It is likely for this proposal to be implemented because it includes a straightforward plan which will serve the Cardano Community Users to get exposure to the NFT market through Cardano Blockchain. This proposal is highly feasible as it encompasses an Emurgo team that has the skillset to build this solution. The only question is how much time per week will the team dedicate to this project.
Yes, approach and links to existing GitHub projects suggest that the team has thought about the problem deeply and is in a position to execute.
Although it would have been helpful to separately list the specific deliverables, the "Proposed Solution" section contains sufficient detail to audit progress and success.
This proposal addresses Cardano Fund 5: DApps & Integrations Challenge. The project proposal is solid and can bring a lot of value to the Cardano ecosystem.
The team's credentials are outstanding. A big plus for confidence is the Binance hackathon award.

The proposer provides a step-by-step plan for the implementation with clear milestones and a defined time horizon. The only thing I miss in this area is that the proposer has not mentioned possible difficulties and how to deal with them.
Further I think it's important to improve details about the process related to the issue and purchase of the policy and subsequent monitoring of that, because in some countries there are some limitations that don't allow these kind of services.
It is likely for this proposal to be implemented because it has a strong core team and a simple strategy to build an assurance product on top of the Cardano ecosystem.
Cardanoscan is a swiff knife explorer for developers. Most of the developers start their journey on testnet and this will definitely help them.
Cardanoscan itself is a showcase of this developer experience.
Advertising Catalyst to students is definitely a way to onboard more people in Catalyst.
It is likely for this proposal to be implemented because it includes a straightforward plan and a team that has delivered on previous challenge.
The problem statement is unclear. It merely ask a question but doesn't identify a problem that addresses Fund 5: Catalyst Value Onboarding .
No detailed plan which could be audited and does not really have anything to do with the project catalyst community.
Adding more app development options for the Cardano ecosystem meets this challenge and the proposal seems feasible.
I like the idea of having a more proactive method of on ramping developers and forming teams.

feasibility:  1/5
It is hard to judge the feasibility of the proposal because no specific achievements or goals are specified. The proposer did not participate in discussion during the refinement phase so I doubt their commitment to the project.
Would have liked more details in the plan portion, on how the solution will be approached.

auditability: 1/5
The proposer does not detail the allocation of funds or propose auditable goals.
Indicators are mentioned, but no objective or key result.

This proposal addresses Cardano Fund 5: Grow Africa, Grow Cardano initiative. The project proposal is solid and can impact many people seeking to get a home in Africa. The problem and solution in the proposal are well stated and explained. This proposal, if implemented correctly, will transform the lives of many people in the African marketplace who are seeking to build a home or rent a sustainable property.
The current proposal is just to build a house to prove up the builders design. It seems likely the proponents could deliver on this.

This proposal falls within the scope of the challenge because it addresses a concrete and recognized problem in Africa. However, the solution of tokenization of the usufruct, which would provide funding, does not seem to me to correspond to the problem of uncultivated arable land as I understood it in my reading. Overall, the percentage of landowners in Africa with formal certification of their land title, either individually or jointly, is very low. Completing the idea with a solution allowing progress in land identification and the formalization of land ownership in Africa would make it a proposal more in line with the problem.
Draft proposal. There is no plan or any information allowing  auditability.
More details required on what is going to be done, milestones, risks, competitor analysis, front end platforms etc. As hiring is driven by the employer, how will it be marketed to them?

The problem and solution description is reasonable and clear and is within the scope of the challenge. There is a concise and objective plan. The goals and metrics established indicate a positive impact on the metrics of the challenge. The proposal describes the creation of a DEX in the AMM model and with a model that allows different mathematical functions for different pairs.
It seems like the team has the necessary experience. Your website looks good. With the fair distribution, I'm sure you'll get the backing of the community.

Given the plan to clone uniswap and merge it into a working DEX on Cardano, it isn't clear if the team has assessed the risks involved with moving onto a EUTXO, PoS blockchain vs an account modeled PoW blockchain. It isn't clear how the team will implement EUTXO on the swap. The team has talent currently being developed as plutus pioneer enrollees. The proposal doesn't include details on how the governance token will be used within the platform. trying to do both a dex and a luanch pad with low budget like this has risk of budget overages.

There is clarity in the description of the problem, the solution and how they addresses the challenge.

There are relevant metrics for defining success. There are several details about the team, their qualifications (links to Linkedin and Github have been included) and budget allocation. The roadmap presents clear and relevant milestones. It would be interesting to add KPIs.

Development of the platform is easily auditable. Fund allocation is broken down, and a development timeline is provided. It should be possible to judge the success of the platform development within 6 months. Little guidance is given as to what success looks like as far as adoption and number of transactions.  These are the metrics which most impact the relevant challenge goals.

This project aim to meet a required need in the largest country (population) in Africa. Success here could then be rolled out to the rest of the continent. It would drive adoption of Cardano in Africa if successful.
It is likely for this proposal to be implemented because the project plan is well done, and the team has experience in the Nigerian financial market.
The project appears to address a real financial pronlem. There is very little information regarding how this part of the market works.
There is very little information regarding the team. There is no one with a blockchain background included.

I'm not sure what Asdra Token is offering that Ada cannot do with the unbanked project in Africa adapted to Thailand. It feels like a project that has been done and misses the point whilst being overly ambitious for the proposer's capacity.

This proposal certainly addresses the challenge and may in fact be a stellar Dapplication. The community senses that this proposal has merit but there are many questions that still remain. I feel this proposal will grow with further collaboration and engagement from the PC community.

Judging from the proposal's comments, the team has worked hard to update the proposal and provide the necessary information. Yet it is missing a definition of success as to how many people it is aiming to reach per milestone.

The ability to audit this project should be straight forward - though the KPIs are not outlined in the proposal - by examining Daily/Monthly Active Users, number of transactions settled on the block chain, comparison of exchange rate data used in the app to rates peers received in another forum, fees saved by users, total annual remittance settled by the app. I also appreciate that the team outlines the risk of bureaucratic delays as that could impact the project.

The proposal problem statement highlight the lack of apps and games based on the Cardano blockchain and propose a solution to develop a "city cards" trading game - based on NTF tokens - that clearly addresses the challenge. The creation of such a game addresses the challenge because it could potentially generate transactions and add value to the ecosystem with a new asset built on top of it, which however remains limited to an aspect of pure entertainment.
The most intriguing part of the idea is related to the fact that the players will be incentivized to trade specific tokens based on categories or real-life events: this mechanism could generate attention on particular NTFs and could keep interest in the game alive: it would be really great to expand this concept and present it in more depth (e.g. by already presenting a detailed incentive mechanism for rarer cards or ADA), in order to have a greater impact on the challenge.

Great idea for promoting Cardano Dapps and properly designed this proposal could shine bright. Its the sort of idea that could really engage people and make them want to play. Having common cards means potentially people can collect as much as they wish but the real kicker would be in more exclusive cards to really make this thing fly.

The proposal provides a detailed plan for the implementation: milestones and time horizon are defined in a clear way. The definition of success is well presented and it is really clear what we should expect as a final product from the proposal.
There is also an hard number set as goal for the number of transactions after 6 months, KPI that will be extremely useful in the future.
The proposal also provides a solution for the main possible difficulty that could encounter: a marketing strategy is presented to face the initial hard step of diffusion and adoption. An in-depth study on this topic (e.g. presentation of puzzle examples for the initial distribution of cards, an example of a social plan for the diffusion of the first giveways, etc.) it would be the key for me to give 5 stars on this criterion.

In my opinion this proposal is within the challenge goal. At the same time I think is more related about relaunching an online Yoga class and related services: it's not sure that this kind of activities help many connection with the Cardano ecosystem.
Furthermore the relation with Cardano blockchain services it is not deep specified, so I suggest to better introduce and explain HOW Cardano services were used, through use cases related to user's operations (e.g how ATALA prism functionalities were implemented to develop Yoga marketplace…). However the objective of the proposal not only related to Cardano but versus other online services (es. e-commerce, chat, …).
no valid metrics provided, but there could be a way how to track new people, and possibly progress toward the goal.

The proposal is for a prototype, not a finished product. However, if realized, the project has potential to onboard many users from all walks of life due to incentives for both lending and borrowing parties. If KYC can include Atala Prism identies such at those that may emerge out of the World Mobile partnership in Africa (and their associated credit history) the project has a lot of "RealFi" potential.

"Kitty Party" is well focused on the scaling of DeFi on the Cardano Network. The proposal is seeking to address a challenging issue at the boundary between centralized and decentralized loan systems. Central systems have clear KYC protocols that enable them to offer uncollateralized loans. On the other hand, current DeFi systems are purely trustless but require +100% collateral for insurance of funds. Kitty Party is seeking to establish KYC and trust within small community groups but in a manner that can be implemented in a global decentralized manner.

The proposer already acknowledged that there are some pretty big challenges regarding trust with the proposed solution. In the comments is also mentioned, that several other companies outside of blockchain technologies tried it and failed. Smart contracts should help with this, but a little doubt remains. But I don't use this aspect for feasibility, as this might happen after the implementation. The stated experience is good and the linkedin info provides additional trust. I am confident, that the propser can pull it off.

The proposal is for a prototype, and its presentation is very professional. The proposer participated actively in the refinement stage to address community concerns.  Github and Linked in are provided for the proposer, who will contract additional assistance.  The development goals for the initial funding round are modest and realistic. I can see how the platform could have utility for testers even in early development stages.  I believe this is a good allocation of funds to begin developing DeFi platforms on Cardano.  My only concern is a cost overrun during this stage.

The proposer has carefully described the objectives and tasks which gives confidence regarding successful implementation. The proposal is focused on an alpha implementation to test the concept. A description of the initial test group would have been a helpful addition to the proposal.

Budget Breakdown, Timeline and Deliverables are provided. The proposal is about the creation of a prototype and therefore the amout of details is enough to audit the progress and the success of the proposal.

The items described in the timeline are not objective indicators that allow auditability.

There is no information about how many people will be needed for the development of dapp, only information about the proposer. Different activities were indicated to be carried out in the development of the proposal (UX design, Web application, Smart contract + tokenomics design, Security review) It will be necessary to hire more people to develop the proposal and this raises doubts about the feasibility of the project and the budget.

There are details about the proposer, his experiences and qualifications, but there is no information about his skills with developing smart contracts.

There is a budget breakdown, but the lack of a technical plan makes it difficult to understand whether the budget is reasonable and makes auditability difficult.

The vision of success is subjective and there is a lack of solid elements that allow auditability. There are no KPIs and metrics.

The funds requested are modest and their allocation is clearly defined. The developer will host a forum and provide weekly updates. Goals for the prototype are clear and return on intention will be assessable within a 3 to 6 month period.

The proposal includes a clear specification of what the funds will be used for; what the timeline is for delivering results; and what will be delivered. The proposer has committed to weekly updates over a six month period.
No information given on how this would be done this it is not possible to evaluate its feasibility.
Since this proposal lacks an implementation plan it is difficult to assess.

The proposal does not address any specific aspects of the challenge, it also deviates from the governance model in proposing a single individual to manage future disbursement of funds and management of success looks like. Even when being successful on implementing this proposal, value delivery through gaming seems to me in conflict with the objective of the challenge, since the creation of such a game/interface will inevitably limit the possibilities, instead of offering supporting tools for developers combine and recombine into new technology/value.
This seems more aimed at bringing in new people (children) to the ecosystem. Whilst that may (or may not) be a good idea, it does not seem to address the challenge.

The proposer is surely referring to the redstone functionality of minecraft that enables the building of electrical circuits and rather complex functional machines, even small virtual machines within the game. Complex tasks like this however require people to really know what they do and are rather playing and doing it for fun than efficient programming. Targeted developing of blockchain applications (which is complex considering cardano uses two programming languages, two layers. peer-to-peer functionalities etc. I don't think it would be very money efficient to write a game that would probably take a lot more money to build than what is in the budget and would also produce a lot of non-functional code rather than producing tools that simplify developing for developers with different levels of experience.
The goal of the challenge is to incentivize developers to build on top of Cardano. This proposal does not address this at all.
Developing games that interact with cardano are a good way to grow the community. If children learn about blockchain in an early age it will be easier for them to adapt to these new technologies.
Not sure how this will enhance the developer ecosystem, this more sounds like a DApp to me. The proposal needs to clarify how the end product will make life easier for Cardano developers.

The proposal is attractive, because it promises to create a more fun and motivating environment for developers to create their applications while interacting with each other and in a kind of game. And they would also be paid in ADA. However, it seems to me that the plan is still a bit abstract, I couldn't understand exactly how the idea would happen in practice, how this game would be structured. It is also somewhat problematic that the requested funding is very high, a project of this dimension should be better detailed in its explanation.
Woking in healthcare and knowing about Minecraft does not sound like a relevant experience to build something similar to minecraft on Cardano.

A detailed knowledge of what is needed by a game development team of multiple platforms is missing in the case of this proposal. Looking for a developer who would support would provide the necessary backing to give this proposal a highly likely successful implementation.

The proposer provide no evidence on how the goal is to be achieved, only a budget structure for fund management without indication of its governance or control model. I'd of liked to see more details, even if the proposer is not technically savvy, things like a business strategy, a specific and detailed opportunity, or something similar would of been helpful. This proposal is about hiring and outsourcing the job, there is no existing team, which increases the risk of failure in this proposal.

The proposer has no previous experience with development and no detailed plan on what is required and how many people will be needed to adress such a challenge. Identifying that is part of the plan, which makes this plan pretty optimistic.
Given the lack of experience and detail of the plan presented, the proposal is not likely to be successfully implemented.

There is only one proposer which doesn't work in a technical field. It makes a proposal more trustworthy if they gather a team before asking for funds because the implementers are then already committed as they spent some time searching for a team. And it cancels the possibility that no proper team can be found. The whole proposal is still really general and there are no indicators that it will become more detailed in the near future. I would recomend to search for a team first and then submit proposal that contains technical details as well so voters can decide about the probability that the game will actually be developed.

For 100k founds a more detailed roadmap and budget is needed.
Clearly stated in the proposal that the team behind it does not currently have the resources or knowledge to finalize this. Makes it harder to trust both the timeplan and budget.
The proposer comes from a totally different background, doesn't have any experience with software project management or implementation
Resources needed to build this gaming system have not been identified yet. This proposal is only asking funds to distribute to the crowd in an unexplained way.

The milestones and metrics in this proposal provide a good guide and a starting point to assess progress, which is good.  The proposal lacks a good description of what the end state would be like, I know it's hard at the current stage, but I would of liked that or simply a bit more detail and activities on the high level plan to achieve those numbers in a way that helps support those claims.

The proposal only vontains vague information about how the challenge is going to be adressed but no information in regard to how it will exactly interact with the structure of cardanos programming or what the requirements for the idea are. It is rather a pitch than a proposal, as many questions occur and many things need to be discussed before it can possibly be assessed on it's feasibility and impact.
This proposal mixes different ideas without explaining one clearly. How do you incentivize developers to build 1,000 games for just 25,000?

Without a detailed roadmap and clear milestones it is hard to assess the proposal and to decide how much work is behind it. As the proposal is in a really early stage a reflection about challenges and risks would be helpfull.
It's good that the proposal has clear deliverables and timeplan and also a rough outline of how the budget will be allocated, however I need a clearer description of what the actual product is.

It is specified how the funding would be divided into two major parts, for the payment of the developers and the creation of the game itself. However, within this division there is still a lot of information missing, for example: in the part of the money for creating the game, how much would be allocated to each specific action? Building such a wide technology demands several aspects, which are not exposed here. The author also includes an expectation of results by project time, measured in months. I think this type of planning is positive, but, seeing it, it would be more appropriate for it to be accompanied by a schedule on the dates when each stage would be accomplished, instead of just a projection of the final results.
If it works this project would provide significant benefits both for African citizens and the Cardano ecosystem. It is highly ambitious, but could also be transformational.

This proposal addresses the F5: Grow Africa, Grow  Cardano challenge in great detail, and the Cardano community can benefit from this project's launch. This proposal can generate a greater level of impact if implemented correctly.

Based on the details suggested in this project proposal, it is highly likely for this proposal to be implemented. The team seems to have extensive experience and connections in this industry and understand the African market. This edge may enable this project to be implemented well as it considers the different perspectives and partners.
The information in the roadmap and milestones is sufficient and can be audit against the project progress toward completion. This project provides clear KPI's and milestones.

This challenge appear similar in scale to Ethiopia challenge, but looking at the planned solution structure, budget lay-out, realistic activities plan, taking into account distance and geography, probably 17 countries
This looks like it better fits for Dapps in cardano, and the proposal topic is very broad
Publicly hosted events and sessions might make it easier assess the success of the proposal
A social media marketing plan would be a good addition. This would only work if it can go viral.

No-code development has potential to increase the number of applications on Cardano. But this is really a potential impact; there are very few no-code frameworks today. The only working no-code solutions are around spreadsheet/database data analysis (such as Google Appsheet) or workflow management (such as JIRA or Podio)
Is no-code safe for financial application on Cardano? What is the risk of large losses for developers using no-code options?
Having web socket support will cut down effort and cost of incoming and existing developers.
They estimate 150h of eng work, without more details.
What happens after the one year support that the proposers are offering? Will that leave developers and DApps with a problem?
The timeline is defined along with the clear goal items.
The proposer seems to fully understand the need for successful usability and frictionless operations.

This proposal very clearly identifies a lack in the tooling of a subset of Cardano developers and offers to build a solution that would directly improve the experience of developers on Cardano.
