The team has 3 members participating in the Catalyst community and involved in several improvement projects, such as tools for CAs, creation of documentation and they have been developing the Landing Page for several weeks, which shows their commitment. There are details about the experience / qualification and links so that the community can have more information about the proposers.

There are details on the budget allocation. The timeline described is reasonable, the proposals described would be delivered in 3 months.

The roadmap / milestones link was updated about a month ago and is unclear. There is an idea of an iterative roadmap that can be updated, but the lack of clarity makes it difficult to understand what will be delivered and when.

There's already a MVP available which looks good and already contains a lot of the promised content, so it's likely the team would successfully implement further changes. The proposal itself is a bit confusing as it's difficult to distinguish what will be done for Fund4 and for Fund5. The proposal would benefit for making the milestones clear here rather then having to search for these in the GitHub page. The budget would benefit of bit more details e.g. will the librarian be a full time position ? What are the "management" costs specifically for ?

Every required element of the proposal is present, all the details are clear without any lacks. If successfully implemented it would clearly be an asset to the Catalyst community.
My only slight concern is that there are multiple projects that seek to become the default "landing page" and resource for Project Catalyst, and this is not addressed. But even though there's bound to be some redundancy in time each could fill its own niche and attract a certain part of the community with its feature set.

The problem statement is subjective, it would be important to add data to support the statement.

The statement used to support the problem: "But there are no active YouTube channels about Cardano in other languages" is not true, this is easily verified by doing research about Cardano in different languages.

Although the arguments are not credible, there really is a problem with the language barrier that needs to be addressed, which is how.

The solution described in the proposal does not address the challenge in a relevant way, as it doesn't establish a clear method of improving value onboarding for Catalyst, being a proposal for wide dissemination in the Russian community but with no indication of how it will result in results for Catalyst and the items established in the Challenge Brief.

Another great aspect to be considered is that videos on Youtube already have the option of automatic translated subtitles, this aspect greatly reduces the potential of the proposal.

There is no information about the proposer's experience and qualifications, just a 2-minute video translated, which I consider insufficient to demonstrate the proposer's ability to execute the proposal. What is the proposer's ability to translate and dub content? This is not clear.

The plan does not require complexity, it comes down to translating, subtitling and dubbing Charles Hoskinson's videos. The hourly budget is 260 USD. Dubbing costs vary widely according to several factors, but the established value is within the acceptable range. Dubbing costs are much higher than translation and subtitling.

Charles has dozens of hours of recorded video and in most of the videos there are AMAs, which often deal with random subjects and not related to Cardano, in addition to a small part of the videos is related to Catalyst. So I think it's important that there is a definition of what would be translated / dubbed.

The budget is detailed according to the number of hours to be worked.

The proposers possess the requisite experience to successfully execute the project, but the plan is not presented as a staged set of intermediate activities or milestones. Thus, the proposal is more descriptive of the technologies that would be employed, rather that prescriptive of the path that development would take. The proposal lacks a plan for client engagement and testing, but that would be critical to adoption: a service-design or agile methodology would have been valuable for this.

The only thing more I would have wished from this proposal would have been a short sample video of the intended outcome. The proposal seems very qualified in marketing and it's clear by his proposal that he's a proficient writer, but no reference to his background in video production is given. The proposal is for a video series after all.

While the proposal clearly understands major challenges to entering the catalyst ecosystem, the skills and individuals required to complete this work is unclear. The proposer identifies they have 25 years of experience, but it is unclear to me whether "motivating thousands of people to find success, working in high level Hospitality Management/Marketing/Sales" is what is required to get this proposal to the next stages and implemented. 

While I appreciate the breakdown of each stage that a new proposer would go through, it is not clear the timeline or key performance indicators that would lead to successful implementation. 

The proposal would also benefit from adding in the process that would occur on the back end. Would there be opportunities to for more community input into the structure described here? What are the foreseen challenges and how would they be overcome?

These are two main problems that I identify in this proposal. The first is: how will people know about the existence of this channel, even though it already has a considerable amount of subscribers? The channel needs to reach more people, if it wants to fulfill its objectives. It is necessary that part of the investment is directed to the dissemination of this content, outside of youtube, inclusive. An idea would be a profile on instagram, focused on posting the news of the channel, extra mini complementary content, stories talking curiosities about the theme and etc. This profile could be the main channel of communication with the potential public, and through paid advertising and partnership with other profiles already more consolidated, of the same branch, it would certainly be possible to reach more people and attract them to the channel. He would need people dedicated exclusively to feeding and maintaining the relevant profile, graphic design, for example, would be indispensable in the correct elaboration of the posts. The second point is how exactly the investment money would be allocated, what equipment the author intends to buy, how he will use it, what kind of professionals he intends to hire to form his team and with what functions they will work. These questions are not very detailed, nor how would these video lessons on the subject take place: if they would be short, medium or long videos, with exactly what kind of didactics they would be taught ... I also felt a lack of firmness in relation to the constancy that videos would be posted, the author states that "the idea is to post a video a week", but the ideal would be to propose a more solid and slightly more frequent goal, such as 2 or 3 weekly content.

The current roadmap only focuses on web development.
This project needs a detailed roadmap of the project Data analytics deliverable. What are the milestones or steps to fully integrate this web product and real-world data?

The idea to create a marketplace for graffiti artworks is aligned with the main challenge objectives because it can attract a specific type of users (the one interested in this art field) to the Cardano ecosystem, allowing them to own digital copies of graffiti and support their preferred street artists.
A strong factor is the mechanism presented for a token owner to have some earning related to merchandise sale: it could create a good virtuous cycle in terms of adoptions and transactions.
The only limit that I see is that this marketplace will be limited to a niche of users. It would be great to add some metrics to explain to the general public how much this market segment is big, to better understand how many people are already involved in this sector and to better evaluate how big could be the impact of this project in term of user adoption, token created and transactions generated.

The main picture of the project is clear enough and the proposer presents evidences of their web development skills.
At the same time it would be great to have some more information about:
- team members and specific skills of each one
- the technologies involved for the marketplace development
- technical details about the minting process: it is clear that the proposers will do a research to identify the author, but how this information will be stored? Integrating it in the minting policy? How will be recognized the authorship from a technical point of view (you will contact the authors and ask them to create a wallet/signature and embed it in the minting policy)? Or all this information will be stored in a centralized way?
- some specifics about the marketing campaign (in what form will it be done, through what media?)
- (Not considered for rating because out of funding request): technical details about the smart contract that will be involved in the project evaluation. The main policy to split the earnings is clear but it would be great to add some specification about this topic to increase the feasibility perception for voters and CAs.
In general I really like the "editorial" approach that the proposer would like to pursue: with some more in-depth technical details I am sure that this project can receive a much higher evaluation for this criterium.
The project plan timeframe needs more details. Think of the key performance metrics? And outline the Milestone in your project plan.

The general roadmap for the project is presented in a good way, but it would be nice to have some specific milestones for the stage for which fund are requested (website wireframe, website graphics, implementation, etc.).
It would also be really useful to have some KPIs (and also hard number estimate) about the users expected to be engaged with the website, with the initial token sale, the number of authors involved and also some metrics about the marketing campaign.
These indicators (related only to the part for which funds are quested) could make easier the evaluation of the success of the project. A nice add would be to provide the same metrics for the completed project (even if not part of the funds request).

These types of activities could definitely help ADA grow in the long term.  However more details should be provided on the size of this bootcamp. How many student are you going to educate for 5 days given you are asking for $30,000.

The idea is good, and it would be a good way to introduce teenagers into the blockchain and Cardano ecosystems. The plan is very well explained in the attachment. My only comment would be to include more information in the proposal text itself, some summary, to make it easier for voters to better understand the proposal.

The proposal includes, that there will be 2 videos per week in a three-month period, that will be shared on social media and the website. So auditing the progress can be done very easily.

It might be interesting to collect and provide data from each video to see which videos were viewed the most and from which country, gender…… this would be an additional information that this project could provide since it would give a broad overview on which real world use cases attract the most people. 

The proposal does not include, how the roadmap looks like in terms of organizing meetups with any of the projects that will be portrayed and with two videos per week, I´m thinking that this is a very tight schedule. It would be interesting to get more information about actual content, since right now the scope is still very broad and it would be interesting to know more about the videos that were to be created. I´m also not sure if the videos will be portraying the real-world success stories from the outside, or if the team of the project will be involved. One of the challenges could be to get enough people to participate in a video production in this short amount of time (3 months). Another challenge, as always, is visibility. It would be important to find ways to promote the videos and to share them so community engagement with the project would be important. 

It was mentioned, that as a documentary filmer + crew, a lot of other proposals and ideas might be interested in cooperating, so in general, the experience of the proposer is much needed and appreciated in the community I´d think. I´d always advise, that to create educational content, it´s important to have a diverse team that would in the best-case scenario include a film-maker, a teacher and a developer or whoever is best involved in the content, so the community should always try to build interdisciplinary teams for best results.

The roadmap is clear with well defined dates. KPIs are good, but I believe there could be other KPIs related to other metric like number of users, visitors, people registered, number of bookings, etc. Budget breakdown is good. It would be good also to have some mapped risks associated with the project, as currently there are no risks mapped.

The proposal provides copious amounts of information with links that do help to inform the reader. However, assessing the success of the project is difficult as much of the discussion is obtuse. I felt like I was reading a contract that may or may not contain small print that I hadn't been able to find. This made me consider the voters being asked to decide whether this was a proposal they felt should be funded. I was left feeling many of the PC community will struggle to understand what the proposal is trying to achieve.

The idea is great, we shall focus on the carbon emission suppression and giving something back. Unfortunately the proposal would welcome more details about its detailed project plan, team content as well metrics. I would suggest to improve the proposal and work through.

There is no clarity in the purpose of this proposal and how it addresses the challenge, there is no mention of dapp. I recommend clarification. In addition, there are no goals or metrics that make it possible to measure the impact of the proposal on the challenge.(A smart contract was mentioned, but it is not clear what the need for that smart contract is if the proposal is only to include a plugin in the wallets)

The energy requirements of the Cardano network, and thus its carbon footprint are a tiny, tiny fraction of those of Bitcoin and Ethereum. So instead of presenting it as a problem we need to solve, we should try and advertise it as much as possible. If the idea presented in this solution would be implemented, it would most likely create mixed messaging and even have a negative impact on the adoption of Cardano, possibly driving users away instead of encouraging adoption. Instead of focusing on ways to mitigate an almost non-existent problem we should think of ways to educate people on why and how Cardano is millions of times more environmentally sustainable than BTC and ETH.

There is no clarity in the purpose of the proposal, there is no clear and structured plan. The lack of clarity in the objective makes it difficult to understand the aptitude of the proposer to develop the proposal, but there is no mention of skill with software development or smart contracts, so there is no indication of relevant experience.

There is no details on resources allocation.

It is not clear whether this additional transaction tax (carbon tax) will be mandatory or optional, if optional it would be just a donation and of low complexity, but if it is mandatory it is something that needs to go through a vote and a governance process. One cannot simply decide to create a tax on the network by the arbitrary will of anyone.

In addition, what is the environmental impact of Cardano's pools on the environment? This question needs to be answered before the feasibility and relevance of the proposal is understood.


The energy expenditure to operate pools is extremely lower than the costs with bockchains that use PoW, this is inherent to the consensus protocols derived from PoS in general. The energy expenditure of PoS blockchains is practically negligible in the grand scheme of things.

Where would these taxes be used?

The proposer describes himself as a graphic designer, yet this project would require a lot of technical knowledge in order to be implemented. However no plans are described on how this is to be achieved. If resubmitted I would suggest including a detailed plan and a broken down budget, so the community can better asses the feasibility of the proposal.

More detail needs to be provided in how the proposal would technically work. THe proposer should find collaborators who can then implement this. How will reforestation projects be chosen and audited? Even Norway's sovereign wealth fund with its vast resources has trouble with monitoring donations to address issues like this.

No clear roadmap is provided, and no planed deployment date is mentioned, I would strongly recommend including these in any future iteration. The team behind the project is not clearly described and in the case that there are plans to hire additional personal, it would have been helpful to include those in the proposal.  I would have liked to see a more clearer explanation of the phrase once the project is completed any unused catalyst funding would go to the 'Treda' fund. How exactly would that fund function, and what value would it bring to the Cardano community.

Required Team and budget could be structured in depth. And Proposal
scopes could be outlined, as well some UI (user interfaces) proposals could help towards
proposal successful completion.
Steps in this directions could be taken, as for example:
1. Select 3-5 websites with similar focus and select features set
for the POC (Proof of concept)
2. Approach some company or teams with selected feature set
and have timeframes and budget proposals
3. Outline development and product marketing in separate
phases, as well your main product focus with separate budgets
goals. Payroll functionality will bring focus on Employers, but if
you choose Employee evaluation, this will bring focus towards
bringing large pool of Employee profiles to be feasible for
Employers to participate.
4. Create strategy and possible challenges for competition
outdo.

As mentioned above, the proposed idea itself is very interesting and could very well be a great addition to the  Cardano ecosystem. The problem is the lack of basic information in this proposal at the moment. The proposal needs to be completed with: 
- proof of prior experience 
- detailed budget
- time table with major and minor milestones
- cost breakdown
- Metrics to measure the success of the proposal in the future

If the proposal get complemented with the above mentioned points, it could be a great contender for funding since the idea is interesting within this challenge. However, the proposal is lacking in its current form and I will rate it a (1) in terms of auditability.
proposalTitle: Raffly.io the simple way to raffle

assessmentNote:
All the general mechanics of the game are explained in a good way, however it would be great to add more specific information about the technologies that will be used for the developments: the mention of a "Javascript based editor" it is not clear enough, I would have liked to see which frameworks will be used, in which way the assets in the game will be tokenized automatically (using a central server? interacting with the users wallets? which technology will be used to interact with the central server or the wallets?).
Unfortunately costs breakdown are missing, but the funds requested are adequate for the general plan described in phase one.
It would be really helpful to provide more information about the team and the specific skills. At the same time the proposers demonstrated some of the skills necessary for the realization of the project (design of the characters, minting of example CNTFs).

The roadmap is described in sufficient depth, including the time horizon for the future expansions.
The success of the project is clearly defined ("release of 1h lenght single player campaign demo within 3 months from voting / funding date") and I think it will be relatively easy to follow the development progress and assess it.
The missing parts that can definitely improve the rating for this criteria are related to the definition of goals in terms of user involved (e.g. set the goal to have 50 active players in the first 2 months). For the next phases it would be great to define a goal also in term of transactions generated / token minted and exchanged (the last sentence was not considered for rating because out of funding request).

The proposals claim a combined experience of 40 years. However, no reference to work done in the past has been provided, even after a comment from a community member. Google search of the name given in the proposal also did not reveal any related profile.

The proposal could be better organized but the team members do seem to have relevant blockchain experience and connections to local art worlds. It would be nice if this experience was verifiable or more fully detailed. After seeing so many NFT proposals, I was skeptical, but on closer reading I feel that this proposal has a good plan and ability to carve out a unique niche in the marketplace.

It's difficult to assess the experience of the proposers, specially in the area of blockchain and smart contract development, links to online CV (linkedin) or previous work would inspire more confidence for voters. The overall proposal is well written and clear but is lacking in details, specially in terms of technical implementation of the proposal. There is also no budget breakdown, just allocating the requested funds between the different bullet points mentioned the  "Funding" section would be an improvement . The timeline seems a bit to optimistic, given there's only 2 of you working part-time to build the game from the ground up and you are dependent on a 3rd party to design the cards.

From my personal expertise and life experience, I believe the proposal is even more feasible than the author has been able to illustrate. In the very short space of the proposal and the attachments provided, the author has clearly made me believe that the proposal is feasible, nevertheless, they could have done (or could do in the future) a better job at demonstrating that the experience to successfully execute this project exists out there in the world and that they have enough mastery of it to channel it for the particular case of Cardano. To greatly increase the potential for success of the proposal I would suggest two things. 1) That the proposal is focused on piloting a relatively small, well-known, and well-supported (regarding infrastructure) region. And, 2) That instead of creating Hubs 'de Novo' (new, from scratch, etc.), the proposal focuses on refurbishing existing hubs as Carnano Hubs. For the first point, I suggest the authors take an area they know well and propose to build the ten hubs there as a demonstration (this could be in a province in India, a city in Africa, or a small natural region in Latin America). It should be a region where there is electricity, internet, a minimal tradition of computers' use, stable government, etc. For the second point, I suggest that in such a region they can find existing institutions that can be transformed into Cardano Hubs, for example, a public school or a private school, a public library. In Latin America, we have places like cultural centers that function as meeting and teaching places, like Volkhochschule in Germany, places for continuous education. An even better example would be internet services (cafe internet) these are private places where the owner lends computers to the public for hours, to do government tasks (registers), homework, research or play video games. A place like this already has a technical and social infrastructure that can be harnessed for a Cardano Hub at a gain for the owner, the community, and Cardano. In the end, if the model is well documented, the experience can be shared with the broader community to be replicated widely.

The verifiability of the project is presented well enough. With the collaboration of a caring supervisor, adequate indicators can be identified for each of the stages of the process and for the results. For example, 1) the number of hubs engaged, built, or recruited. 2) the installation and start of the hubs (in construction, in training, installed, connected, online), 3) Activities scheduled in the hub, number of proponents, number of participants, computer activity, online activity, blockchain activity. 4) Subjective evaluation by the community members. It would be very important to adequately consider the involvement of social scientists to carefully and objectivelly document the last point. Finally, as mentioned in the previous point, documenting well the project would be a major requirement and that requires the involvement of someone versatile in communications (blogging, vlogging, video documentary, podcasting). Adequate documentation of the project would provide the best means for verification, as others would be able to double-check the process and reproduce it themselves.

I give a 1 for feasibility because there is almost no detail for the work that needs to be completed. The proposer does not outline what kind of code needs to be written to integrate Cardano into BTCPay point of sale servers. He does not tell us what $85,000 is needed to do.
proposalTitle: Cardano Support for Point of Sale

assessmentNote: I give a 1 for auditability because no metrics or timeline really given. We have no way of measuring success, based on what is written in this proposal.
proposalTitle: Cardano Support for Point of Sale

assessmentNote: The proposal is simple, and there are no major technical difficulties seen in implementing the project. The proposers have sufficient experience in handling a project of this scale.
proposalTitle: Devs for Awarenes Event West Africa

assessmentNote: I think that bringing together people who would like to propose an idea but are lacking some skill, can be very beneficial and increase the number of proposed ideas.

This proposal appears to meet the requirements of reaching out to the community to bridge collaboration amongst the community.  All developers and collaborators who take part in this would benefit and scaling doesn't appear to be an issue.

Short and long term metrics are well designed, but it would be nice to see how exactly they plan to measure the long term metrics - Tracking interactions between collaborators to determine if more collaborations are fostered through the collaboration list

The proposal is inspired by a real need of the Catalyst community and the team seems to be genuinely interested in improving the website. Therefore, they have included all the relevant information, leaving no room for potentially unanswered questions.

The presented roadmap seems very plausible and well thought of. The team behind the proposal seems very driven and competent.
There is little to no doubt in my mind that this project will be realized if it is being funded.

The initial request which will cover 3 months of development doesn't seem to be a big ask, especially with two developers on board (including plutus pioneer participant). If there's any concern, it will be around the support for the project going forward, things will need to be hashed out in how to support the project 2,5,10 years down the road.

Having been working on the product for 3 years, the proposers definitely have what it takes to be successful, with clear guidelines. ur platform allows businesses to take huge steps in becoming privacy compliant. One benefit of recent privacy legislations (like GDPR, CCPA, LGDP) which requires companies to be transparent about the processing of personal data, inform the consumer would benefit commerce to use this system and thus increase its likelihood of success.

All neccessary information is provided in this indeed very detailed and structured proposal, which presents a solid, actionable project that can be assessed positively with confidence. Especially the replies to the feedback from the last funding round show that the process is really taken seriously.

The funding amount is very reasonable(and clearly budgeted out), but the team has shown they already have most of the equipment and all of the skills required to deliver on this proposal. The timeline is very clearly stated with two videos being produced per week from July to September 2021. The KEWW video series is going to continue to be produced it is up to the Catalyst voters to decide if Cardano will be a recurring topic.

Looking at the structured plan, it's great. $8,900 for 10 lengthy videos hosted on YouTube, is a fair deal. 
All the experiences mentioned together will provide great works with regard to the fame. It's a great news, if latest by October this year this videos will be made available and accessible to new members. 
Looking at the plans and experience, there's surety that this project can be implemented successfully.
It is very detailed, so I would say the feasibility is pointed out well. I especially like the planned analysis of the metrics.

Yes of course, dates and timelines have been provided. The Catalyst Team can just keep track of that easy and as the YouTube channel link is made available, close monitoring can be made by the Team for assessment regularly.
It's a great project and deserves upvotes!

I give a 2 for impact because it is an interesting idea I just don't know how much value Cardano users will get by 1 degree removal from the stake pool. I like the idea of helping animals, but I don't think it really addresses the DApp challenge. It is also unclear whether the proposers can scale this project because their proposal states that they don't know how the API or oracles even work.

The goals and process is laid out clearly the proposal is complex and involves building more than 10 smart contracts and a integrated platform. However, it will be easy to monitor and audit the progress as per the plan presented.

This seems like it should be simple enough to make a solution that is better than what we have now, in a relatively short amount of time. But people also need to know about it, so it should be connected to ideascale.
The proposal is well written and provides sufficient information to make an assessment. based on the size of the proposal and budget requested it seems a feasible prospect.

The problem and the solution make sense and are clear, but the proposal described doesn't clearly describe how it is aligned with this challenge, in reality what has been described indicates alignment with the distributed decision making challenge, because organizing teams according to their similarity is something that allows voters, CAs and vCAs to find out about the teams to vote or evaluate on those teams' proposals. Despite that, I can also see some relationship with this challenge, according to the Guiding Questions described in the Challenge Brief of the challenge, so it is possible to relate something, but to a lesser degree of impact.

I have high confidence that they will be able to create a website. However, the ambition is also to have a "website that provides a central source of information which is constantly updated."
The proposal only mentions the creation, not the operation and content management of the site. Therefore I take two stars away.

The plan could use more details. How will the categorization happen. Will proposals be manually categorized by the team running this project? How will the aggregation work? The proposal lists numbnersous probelms that need to be solved, however it is not clear they have planned how to solve them. This may impact the likelihood of success. How will this be funded going forward if it is not fully automated?

Essentially, the proposer has provided proof of his experience as a oftware developer with a focus on frontend development, which is required for the project. The expected initial implementation launch date has been set for ~30th May (+/- 1 week) - the project is currently under development, weekly updates are being provided online. 

The budget has a clear breakdown into components and is seems to me very likely that the proposal will be implemented successfully.

The team has multiple proposals in Fund5, all aiming towards the same goal. However, it is not clear who would be responsible for curating proposal data using the tools created.
They want to create a nail but who is the person with the hammer?

Increasing resources for a good and informed decision making process is very important for decentralised decision making from the viewpoint of quality of made decisions as well as for lowering entry barriers for CAs and voters. The catalyst process would gravely benefit from such a resource.

The List of projects being funded and their progress are diligently covered in town halls however a website can provide a ready reference and can definitely improve the visibility of progress and transparency. There is a need to unify all community sites for better UI.

I truly see no obstacle in the implementation of the primary objective of the proposal, building the website. The team seems competent, motivated and experienced. They have budgeted their proposal very fairly, but at a doable rate.

The team is composed of 3 members with experiences in web / mobile developmnet, research & analysis, marketing, documentation and management. Based on the information described, I believe that the team has the capacity to execute the proposal.

The plan described is reasonable and detailed, with an objective timeline. The plan involves tracking proposals that have already been funded and the amount that has already been made available for each proposal over time.

The budget described is reasonable and has details on the allocation of resources.

The team is alright. It will take some coordination to make this, but it should be possible to build a simple product, which could be improved to include more information and more streamlined over time.

Excellent description of the team and the basic problem, solution, added-value, actions, roadmap and costs. Well-done. Provided that there is a good interaction with other similar initiatives, this proposal has excellent chances to succeed and add value

The information provided is very clear and on point. The only real concern/lack that I have identified with the proposal is one that has been addressed in the comments section as well: who will actively maintain the website after it launches? The proposed solution is an automated one, but even that will have to be maintained from time to time. But still it's an initiative well worth starting.

The information on what is planned to be achieved is clear, the time budget is transparent and credible considering the experiece of the team, making its feasibility highly likely. The use of the project for adressing the challenge is obvious and its success will be easy to audit once it is updated in future catalyst rounds and and the change of the success can be measured comparing different funding rounds.

Very detailed inputs are provided. This certainly allows for good audibility. Please make sure to stretch out to similar initiatives early in the project, so that a maximum of synergies can be created.
This could be a great idea, but there is not enough detail in the plan to evaluate what would actually be provided.

The problem statement makes sense and is reasonable. There is potential for a dapp to fulfill this need, but there is no plan for how this will be accomplished and there are no metrics or goals that indicate the impact of the proposal on this challenge and for Cardano. Without a plan, it is not possible to indicate impact and if the proposal addresses the challenge.

I believe that this proposal is very innovative and interesting. Indeed, the music industry is very bureaucratic, often as record companies and copyright holders (whether composing, reproducing, selling, etc.) profit from the work of artists, who lose their autonomy and decision-making power. If the financial transactions of contracts, products, copyrights and etc. were made via ADA, it would increase transparency and security for artists and could somehow (which I didn't quite understand) benefit the public itself.

The proposal aims to adapt the unified  Cardano payment system for people involved in organizing live music events. Organizing live music involves a large number of support troops like lights, sound, etc. One common application with a unified payment will improve the handling of organizers' handling with ticket sales as NFT can add value.

The proposer does not provide any links to his prior experience. He states he is not a developer, yet he makes up a budget for a dApp development without any cost description or developer quotas or anything else for that matter.
There is no information to allow audibility. I recommend including this information according to the Catalyst documentation.

The proposal does not include any budget details, any prior experience, any metrics or any detailed description for the project. Hard to assess, I strongly recommend re-applying for a future fund but with a complete proposal.

I do think that a more adequate onboarding mechanism would be good, however I am struggling to understand how it would work and, besides that, all the basis of Catalyst Project nowadays works with good engaged volunteering people who are already helping to create a solid growth of ADA. 
Maybe rewrite the proposal with more tangible examples in each function and provide a little bit more detail in how you see the problem and how your platform wants to solve it would be interesting.
Another thing is to clarify which are the key metrics in this proposal.

The idea is great, a very good way to dissect different aspects of the Catalyst onboarding, how it could look like. It's very well structured. It might be possible to merge this with different initiatives, even if it gets funded, because there are many ideas going on regarding the onboarding topic. I believe the impact of this proposal within this challenge is huge.
Unclear what the deliverable is. The money requested is supposed to be given to others to "reward meaningful participation and contributions to the Catapult initiative". But how? Who decides?

The roadmap for the LOAD part is clear and it is very feasible. The other parts are also achievable but it is not that clear how this would be implemented, but from what I know about the community, it would be very feasible as well. The budget in this case might be flexible, but it would be good to have some estimate about how long this initiative would last if the proposal was funded.

The proposal is for minting a NFT for every smart contract created using Marlow, to establish ownership. This is currently possible in many ways using any proof of existing technology. A separate integration with Marlow is not an ideal solution.
proposalTitle: NFT for each CARDANO Smart Contract

assessmentNote: More information required on the plan, and how it addresses the challenge. What is the point of the NFT's liked to the smart contracts? Is this to allow linking documentation?
proposalTitle: NFT for each CARDANO Smart Contract

assessmentNote: The information provides is not sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal. The proposal lacks accountability.
proposalTitle: NFT for each CARDANO Smart Contract

assessmentNote: The process for development has not been finalized and the plan provided in the proposal seems vague. There is limited scope to audit the progress with this state of the proposal.
proposalTitle: NFT for each CARDANO Smart Contract

assessmentNote:
The deliverable is open-source software that can be used by developers, so this is within the scope of the challenge.
Deduction of one star because it is unclear who is asking for this product.
Interesting project. Competes with "Cardano IPFS chronicles" which already provides a similar service and wants a smaller amount of funds to continue it.

The proposer alleged has experience with blockchain and software development, so it might not be difficult to implement this. Since it is going to be an open-source development, also, it's even better to find bugs and improve the code in general. The roadmap and each steps to make it possible are clear, so I don't see man difficulties in implementing this solution.

The proposal almost trivializes the work necessary. It appears that the proposer has a pretty good handle on the situation and conveys enough info for people somewhat familiar with Filecoin and IPFS. A little bit more background on the problem that it's trying to solve would make this proposal stronger.

No comprehensive description of the functional or performance characteristics of either the "naive" or "robust" systems is provided such that the proposal could be audited. 

It is not clear how or when this product would be used in the lifecycle of an NFT. The proposal would benefit greatly from a well-defined set of use cases and associated acceptance criteria.

This CA would be particularly interested in how this solution would interact with the broader Cardano DeFi ecosystem and how that could be audited.

The process is presented in phases and involves the development of software. There is a need to open source the project, which is assumed for all Catalyst-funded projects. With this backdrop, the project can be audited and monitored.

The proposal has some great ideas to incentivize participation with Cardano in Africa through free wifi systems and brick and mortar outreach. If properly realized this falls squarely within the challenge.

It is not clear what the plan actually is? If it is the routers for mini buses why do we need a store. It seems the proposers has a few ideas, but that they don't necessarily require each other. Perhaps focus on one.

The author of the proposal is well prepared to execute it, due to his years of experience with the areas that involve the idea, such as the automobile and Graphic Design. The use of Information and Graphic Design is of crucial importance in the transfer of information, in a clear and intuitive way. Regarding the participation of Africans, it would happen, for example, in the stages of installing routers, such as drivers, etc., so it is quite significant.

the problem that it is not clear what specifically is to be implemented also affects this evaluation criterion. The qualifications listed are not very detailed. However, some of the listed objectives of the proposal do not require a particularly high level of expertise, and from the description of the projects in the proposal, it can be seen that the proposer has already dealt with the problem in more detail and therefore has at least basic expertise in this area. I score neutral.

While a App like this could bring more people to cardano and help our mission it doesn't really have to. It's not a 100% clear how this app could benefit our community. It would be great if the proposal had a more in depth explanation how this app brings more progress to cardano except from being able to tipp someone.

This proposal doesn't explain how it will use Cardano Community fund to create a Quality Dapps and integrations that will increase utility & adoption of Cardano. The project doesn't meet the Challenge of Fund 5 Dapps. Please think of how and why you would need to use Cardano blockchain to advance its adaption? What problem are your proposal  solving?
This proposal doesn't include a team or a project plan. Therefore making it unfeasible. Please revisit your proposal by developing a step by step plan on how you plan to implement this proposal.

The proposer has started the application, so there's less unknown, however, with a request for 200K for a single developer team without clear defined project plan as well as milestones, it's going to be a challenge to achieve a favorable outcome

This proposal could provide a lot more of informations to help its assesment. There is no clear roadmap, no risk assesment (even though they are already 6 years in development). Then if you read the proposal and the comments it's not quite clear if the App is actually finished or still in progress.
proposer asking for 4/5 of the fund. They have already failed to get the idea off the ground once. Strong evidence should be provided as to why this time would be different.
This proposal lacks a roadmap, KPI's, and milestone. Please review and include how progress will be tracked on this proposal.
There's not enough information to be able to gauge how one qualify as success criteria, ie. #users in community, partnership with local community, etc.

The proposal team is completed skilled and have a good technical knowledge, so in my opinion will able to make surely a good pilot . In relation to the possible success of the initiative, I think that idea functionality is useful, so there are a lot of possibilities for the adoption by the community. Further I think it's important to improve details about the process related to the functionality and with more detailed plan
This proposal doesn't include detail describe on team, team skills, or team experience. Therefore rendering the project unfeasible.

The project contains no unfeasible parts. There are a lot of various projects that need to be adressed, however as there is a whole organisation behind it. I am pretty optimistic the workload can be dealt with by those people. The impact of the project hence how it affects the challenge has the potential to be quite big, depending on how well the opportunities that are created by it are used

Yes there's enough information on this project with regards to tracking of their progress and the success of it. Rationale being that they've broken the year into margins and assigned specific goals for every margin. Per that, auditing and close monitoring can be done in order to ensure progress and success.
In view of promoting Cardano, the approach of this proposal is basically one of the best I've across, reach out to the people, educate them to understanding and you'll realize the power of knowledge investment. That's why I'm content with their topic, "Planting Roots In Africa".
There is already a prototype implemented, which helps to lower the implementation risks. The proposer has some code on GitHub. The code quality is average.

The planned collaboration between the proposer and another developer appears to be sufficient for the scope of the work. A higher score would have been allocated if said developer would be already known and deemed as knowledgeable enough to implement the proposal within the allotted timeframe.

The proposer appears to have sufficient experience and understanding of the necessary skills to go forward with this proposal. I did feel that some things remained unanswered at this stage and further collaboration will benefit the overall proposal.

This is a very comprehensive and detailed proposal that features an idea that could benefit many people in rural Africa. It is really refreshing to see a green project in the blockchain space which is known for wasting so much energy. Converting waste into useable soil will definitely happen and I hope Cardano is a part of it.

Several interesting people with relevant backgound are involved in the project but in general the blockchain aspect of the proposal seems like an afterthought.  The plan calls for large investment in infrastructure, mass production of sanipods, construction of an experimental compound, and large numbers of staff when the the sanipod technology has not undergone any small scale pilot testing in the target environment. 

I think some small scale proof of concept would be required, and a stronger argument for the blockchain integration be made, before the proposal seems feasible and appropriate for catalyst.

The proposal includes the construction of experimental buildings which will be error prone and difficult to audit. The cost of the buildings, and sanipods, and blockchain development in the proposal seems arbitrary.  Much of the funds are allotted to be spent before any pilot program would take place. Tracking the use of funds and the efficiency with which they are applied would be extremely difficult.

A launchpad and DEX built on Cardano is something that existing and new users would appreciate; it certainly would benefit adoption.

However, it lacks detailed information on what the proposal is truly about. It appears that this is not built on Cardano initially (only a migration will happen in Q3) which warrants a deduction.

A platform to support random token launches on Cardano does not provide use to as many people as possible, but rather use to a few people that want to make money by pushing out new tokens. It will rather harm the majority of the community. The ventup.ip homepage offers "Project ratings" which is not further explained, but which, if it refers to the catalyst process, is totally problematic and unacceptable.
No verifiable information about the team is presented. The outlined plan is too broad to get a sense of a clear direction; thus, I deem the likelihood of success to be very low.
I give a 1 for feasibility because so little information is given. It is very unclear what works need to be done and whether it would be feasible. Very little detail given for the work ahead.
Please detail how this proposal meets the challenge. What are you delivering? Where is the evidence you have the ability to deliver? Milestones?
There is no clear roadmap and how the project is likely to be executed by the team. The team size and their capability are also not deductible from the proposal.
The milestones are very unspecific, so it will be difficult to track them. No rationale for the budget is provided.

They don't provide concrete Key Performance Indicators to measure their success. As said in previous notes they need to define their project on the technical side so that we can assess its feasibility and viability. So as it is now there is no way to audit the progress: it either succeeds completely or it fails completely. Since there is a team of experienced people (according to their LinkedIn profiles which are not even linked in the proposal) we at least have a list of accountable people but this is not enough. We need more details. It feels like they are not taking their Catalyst application seriously...

Since the site is operational and it's not only the team participating in creating and refining the tool, the whole community can help, I think it's very feasible. Moreover, the intention of scale up and bring some professionals in design, e.g., is very rational.
The only thing that was not clear for me is the thinking that if it scales up fast, how are you intending to monetize to keep covering the costs.

The proposers are very active CATALYST community members. They are well-networked with other activists, so that this proposal has a very good chance to attract a larger number of supporters, co-designers and co-developers. The proposers have spent humble effort to provide the required background information. I consider this to be a key-project for the future if CATALYST, very likely to succeed, since it provides excellent solutions to major pain-points of today.

There is an objective to fund the translation / subtitling / dubbing of 25 hours of videos over 3 months, but there is no clear and well-structured roadmap indicating the beginning, middle and end. I recommend defining an objective timeline.

There is budget brakdown. There are no metrics that indicate an impact on the challenge. No KPIS. There are no details on the qualification and experience of the proposer.

The program is pretty detailed, and I like the idea of self-funding using referral fees. 

I am skeptical about the 1-hour stream daily, it feels overextended. 

The proposer seems to meet the requirements, and the possibility to reach out to student associations is a big plus! But I bet he does not know. nor is part of all of them, so I think that some obstacles might occur with the outreach, and thus decrease the speed to the estimated timeframe.

daily outreach of 2 000 - too much IMO
number of ideas submitted- 100/fund way too much 

but hey, the sky is the limit. These metrics are valid and can definitely asses the efficiency of the project.

The problem of fake degrees is serious and the Indian government is alive to the issue and has taken major steps in stemming it. The issue of regulatory compliance in the case of users' private data is a serious problem that has not been considered in the proposal.

The proposer Github credentials are good and have the capability to develop the required app for the proposal. The concept is simple and involves adaptation risks. Unless a large number of people are onboarded there will be less utility. Getting a critical mass of users may require advertising efforts.

The author is responsible for the project alone and does not indicate having any development skills. He says he needs to recruit an IT developer to implement the project. The description of the project concept is fairly complete, but the technical implementation is imprecise. At this stage the risks of the project are not presented, and it seems that the author is not in a position to assess them without surrounding himself with the missing skills.

No metrics are defined to assess the success of the project. The project leader does not list development milestones. It will be very difficult on this basis to assess the progress of the project. For a future proposal, I recommend including a development schedule, risk assessment, and a more explicit quantitative definition for project success.

Excellent information that conveys what this team is about and trying to achieve. Excellent links to working sites that provide examples of work in motion. Some query about budget breakdown although not sufficient to detract from overall proposal.

This proposal is feasible and if it reaches 1 million youths then could drive more Africans to engage with blockchain projects such as Cardano. If Cardano is funding this, will this just be a generic blockchain educational product, or will Cardano be featured in it?

This proposal fully aligns with a clear need within community advisors participants. From my point of view this is a real pain point within the community that was identified and the proposal address it with an adequate solution. In the coming cycles, an increase in the number of proposals is expected and this tool will facilitate the Community Advisor workload management.

I don't get how this proposal exactly plans to improve the catalyst process and it's proposal. I get that the proposer is trying to finance a printing machine snd I guess in order to produce Cardano merch, even though it is not explicitly mentioned. Yet this would not adress the set challenge.
The proposal is not related to the challenge, I recommend submitting the proposal in an appropriate challenge or creating a new challenge in the Challenge Setting.
This proposal would be better suited in a different challenge category. More likely, Proposer Outreach, since it's about creating Cardano merchandise (T-Shirt, mugs etc).

We almost have only a purpose to evaluate the feasibility, it's not enough. The App should be described with at least some details. The proposer mentions greatgreenwall.org, without making a link to the project. In the project milestones, the proposer expect to having hired the development team after 9 months, it seems far too long to me for a blockchain project : there is a good chance that another project fulfill this needs in a shorter time.

The proposer has presented a plan to how the product would look like, but no plan on how to implement it. There is mention of other platforms who would function as the first adopters, but no elaboration as to why they would want to onboard. There would be a marketing plan needed to get the platform known. 
The proposer has relevant experience as an app developer. Yet it is not clear from the proposal if it is the intention to create this DApp alone or if there is a team necessary to perform the development. To make this evident, it is advised to use the seek-tags to try and find the right people.

The idea is of this development is very good and is a good application of smart contracts. I would have liked to see more information about the tokenomics of this project. Will there be a token for the platform, or it will use ADA directly? Also, I understood based on the comment section that not only owners will be able to book houses, but any user, but it was not clear in the proposal itself. Some more information about the fees associated to the booking system and other details should also be included.
proposalTitle: A DEX aggregator built on Cardano

assessmentNote: Based on the alleged experience, roadmap and also in the budget breakdown that allocates $10k to the dApps developer, I believe that this project is feasible with the proposed budget. The team is also already engaged, there is a running website with good information and well designed. I don't see big challenges in implementing this, besides some legal risks involved that might be there but were not foreseen.
proposalTitle: A DEX aggregator built on Cardano

assessmentNote: The roadmap is clear with well defined dates. KPIs are good, but I believe there could be other KPIs related to other metric like number of users, visitors, people registered, number of bookings, etc. Budget breakdown is good. It would be good also to have some mapped risks associated with the project, as currently there are no risks mapped.
proposalTitle: A DEX aggregator built on Cardano

assessmentNote:
There is no plan in the description.

There is an attachment file with many details about a business plan but the proposal described in this business plan is for a crossborder payment system and has nothing to do with a crosschain DEX. I recommend that the proposer clarify the purpose of the proposal and what the relation of the plan described in the attachment file with a DEX and this challenge.

There is a large difference between a Dex and a crosschain DEX aggregator. A Dex by itself is a DAPP that has a relatively large complexity, a  Cross Chain  DEX aggregator is a much more complex project.

One of the few projects that develops a  Cross Chain DEX, Thorchain took more than 2 years to launch their mainnet and even after launch still has few pairs, the point is that getting a bridge cross chain efficiently was only possible through recently with the AMM model, because atomic swaps do not allow relevant liquidity.

My recommendation is that if the team intends to develop a project of such complexity, it should submit a proposal with sufficient plan and details. The community can help with feedback and if it is necessary help the team can look for people or developers interested in the Discord channel.

It is likely for this proposal to be implemented because it includes a straightforward Webdesign plan. The core question to be answered are: What data will you be tracking? Will the data be open source and free? How will these data analytic benefit the Cardano community? How will this data analytics be collected?

The proposal itself is about the registration of a company. This should be possible by most people and therefore no special references are needed. I would still prefer to have some public references for the knowledge that is stated. (xxx years of experiienc in data analytics, ...)

No technical details provided. Economics very rough and maketplace take extremely high (50-75% in the examples given?). How are you interacting with the artists? What will you do if the art was illegally placed? No evidence of technical capability provided.
It is likely for this proposal to be implemented because it includes a straightforward plan but the proposal lack details on team background and proposer.

The proposer has referenced the website being maintained by them. They are likely to have the expertise to implement the proposal. However, no other details regarding the team composition or their expertise are given.

The proposers don't seem to have experience in the field they are trying to take on. The reference they provided is for a tourism related portal that doesn't seem to have any relevance to art curation or distribution, NFTs of artist management. The proposed revenue split between the artist and the marketplace seems extremely unfair and unjustified. I would advise to gain more experience in the field and revise the business plan if reapplying in a future fund.
The proposal isn't in depth enough to do a proper assessment. The roadmap is quite short and there isn't any text about challenges and risks

Just having a big number of children participating in these bootcamps is not enough to assess the success of the project. There needs to be a way to assess how many of those children have remained interested in blockchain, Cardano or have even begun developing skills that would help them navigate the ecosystem.

Such videos can definitely increase the awareness of Cardano, but I do not believe that it will increase the number of proposers, or the number of ideas rapidly. 

This feels more of the marketing of Cardano, rather than the target group are proposers.
They seem to lack a technical copywriter or a person capable of understanding and explaining the technology.

Feasibility: 4/5
The proposer has relevant developer experience and is a Plutus pioneer with early testnet access. The project goals and costs are focused, well-defined, and effectively communicated.  The professional attitude towards the presentation of the proposal shows that a lot of work has gone into developing the concept up to this point. It is one of the more feasible proposals I have come across so far.  I only question if enough funds have been allocated to Legal Council and Marketing.  As long as a viable product is produced, future funding rounds could address this.

The idea is of this development is very good and is a good application of smart contracts. I would have liked to see more information about the tokenomics of this project. Will there be a token for the platform, or it will use ADA directly? Also, I understood based on the comment section that not only owners will be able to book houses, but any user, but it was not clear in the proposal itself. Some more information about the fees associated to the booking system and other details should also be included.

The potential of this idea is huge however there are unknown risks in adaptation. Security of the digital persona, acceptance by the people to put their preferences in open block chain and various regulatory compliance. It is a bold experiment and there are strong reasons to try it.

This is a more suitable idea to 'catalyst value onboarding'. However if you create a mechanism to outreach people and then provide them with this kind of content would be good.
Since it's an idea, need more lapidation to become an actual project.

While it could be good to make instructive videos from a beginner point of view, there is no evidence of previous experience that could inspire trust or a detailed plan that could make up for it. In fact, there is no plan at all.

There is no information about the proposer, no roadmap, no clear understandable solution and even not a clear problem. It is hard to see for what the 20k is needed. Maybe have a look at other proposals and try again for next fund! good luck
Draft proposal. There is no plan. I recommend that the proposer detail the proposal, the objective and follow the Catalyst documentation so that we can give appropriate feedback.

There is no information about the proposal capacity of performing the described task, even though it might be easy to do so. There is not budget breakdown and explanation why 20k is needed in this case. More information about the videos and content in there should be included, besides other general information about the project.

There is no plan for the implementation, deliverables and success metrics are not defined and  a project timeline is missing. 
The budget has no partitioning and there's no explanation on how it will be used for this project. There's also no mention on how much work will be covered by this budget. 1 video? 10?
No information given on how producing some videos would increase the number of porpoers outside the Cardano community. How would these people even know about the video's. What is the marketing plan?
Draft proposal. There is no plan and no details to audit the proposal. Include details, so that we can give appropriate feedback.

There is no information regarding auditability: roadmap, milestones, KPIs, and any other that could help the community to audit and keep track of the developments being done if this proposal is funded. Information is needed in this regard.
Interesting proposal which if correctly implemented would enable Cardano to spread more easily across the African continent.

The plan is very possible to bring to reality. There are, however, a few elements that are missing: To become the 'most popular wallet in Africa' in 1 year's time, you will need a plan to market this on a big scale. You would also need to make sure that the app makes the app store in Transsion brands. The system of 2FA-authentication raised the question that if people are already in need to share a device where would that second device come from to authenticate them?
The details provided in the Roadmap are sufficient to track and audit the project progress. The milestones' dates and KPI's are clear.

The proposal has basic milestones listed for success metrics, but lacks a detailed budget or a quantified goal. While a need for blockchain is identified, it is clear that the blockchain tech aspects need to be bolstered for a more auditable proposal.

This is an excellent proposal from a dynamic team. They are generating great interest from the community. This concept they are proposing makes me think that developers will engage heartily with the project and that equals the challenge.

The proposer is established but a still growing startup with a dedicated team and results. The videos, links and graphic clearly demonstrates the work done so far in the AI/ML space.
The funding will be used to form a new team which shall implement the connection to the blockchain. The breakdown shows the estimated working hours clearly, but might be lacking on other potential resources.
Added benefit is a free sample of a couple of robots to be tested by the Cardano community, added after a nice suggestion from community member which made into actual proposal.
The proposal did not specifically mention potential risks, and ways to mitigate them which might be beneficial to evaluate the overall feasibility.
Proposers are aiming to add Cardano functionality to their current product, as such it is highly likely to succeed.
Yes this project is feasible and more detailed is needed around the team that will implement this project. Otherwise, It is a feasible project.
Nice idea, especially the part about escrowing payments. provides more security to workers.

Voters should have enough information to feel confident their candidate will succeed. More detailed information on the use of funds would have been nice to ensure there is a solid business plan and attainable goals. For example, voters may be concerned regarding the high allocation of funds for salaries. A start up is a risky endeavor; personal time and effort is paramount, but salary safety and comfort is not necessarily an initial requirement. Full funding effort should be poured into implementation and not necessarily on salary. Product adoption and success will drive future revenue and high salaries. Allocating more funds toward marketing and developer help vs salary could lead to exponential future salary gains. Ramen noodles now, steak and caviar later.  Regarding marketing, the target audience needs to be addressed and tactics to obtain adoption in the product should be a goal.

In my opinion a mass adoption for Cardano is essential, with this kind of project we as a community getting a chance to bring some fun beside all the other serious projects out there. So yes the Quest for Ada addresses the challenge (end user value) definitely effective!
$100,000 is a lot to ask for without a serious game development plan? What are the game mechanics?

The author has invested a great amount of time and effort into the proposal and appears to have the necessary skillset to drive the proposal. Successful implementation is difficult to gauge as there appears to be mixed sentiment on issues of centralisation which have not been fully teased out in this plan. The budget is minimal but this does not seem to be a mitigating factor in terms of worth to the community.

Although many aspects of this proposal are more thoughtful than current NFT market apps for artists, it is still just a mechanism, which would not exist without the artists. So Artists are still grey...their value is as undefined content, as beneficiaries and not as drivers of the innovation. Artist's have local relationships to their community and  unique world views. It may be important to bring ortists onto the team, in the creation of the mechanism, which then may create from the artist up, rather than from the mechanism down, to the artist. Artists often create from unique disjunctures in cultures. These "breaks" in language create unique semantic structures. This could further drive the mechanism you are creating towards something new, and needed.

The team described experience in the development of several DeFi dapps since 2017 and described working with the main Cardano launchpad, but there is no information available to make it possible to verify these allegations, so there is no way to indicate the team's aptitude to develop this proposal.

There is no solid plan, just a draft.

There is no budget breakdown.

I recommend including this information so that we can give you appropriate feedback.
The proposal doesn't include any self identified key metrics or goals, or even if this is a general project or specific for certain dapps. Very difficult to audit without goalposts identified.

There are not enough details about the team, budget allocation or roadmap.

There are no reasonable KPIs or metrics.

The deliverables described are subjective. I recommend that you give more details on what will be the videos and catalogs described in the proposal.

Although I think that might be important to have a newsletter about Catalys (I had no idea how big the ROI of it was), I believe that would be good if you find other methods to get the email addresses. Saying this because, since you have better detailed in the comments how you intend to get them, it seems to me that the sources used are very niched and that might not outreach that much. This is because we're using mainly the people and platforms which are already inside the community. 
Maybe would be interesting to create a content for small business in which you promote the projects being funded and marketing in a way that they can find a solution to their business or they may create a solution as well.

Is Cardano's energy use high? I don't think it is. It might be better to market your project as simply an environmental charity. What's Treelabs? More info about the feasibility and security of a wallet plug is needed. How will the project reforest farmland and ensure the forest will be permanent? It sounds like it would be very expensive.
Some experience is given for part of the job, but many other aspects aren't covered. Budget spreading and time plan would be also welcome.
The proposal has little detail and the proposer has not demonstrated domain or technical experience.

There is no information to audit the proposal.

There is no clarity on the problem and how the problem addresses the challenge, I recommend that the proposer provide details on energy expenditures of the  Cardano blockchain to support his proposal.

I give a 5 for impact because working with college students is an extremely effect way to address the challenge question of expanding Cardano in Africa. This proposal provides detail on how to complete their project and how it adds to Cardano through education and engagement around blockchain technology. They begin their project by focusing on one university but can scale to other universities within Ethiopia (and it could scale into other countries if they are successful with expansion within the country). There are several clear metrics about the number of people to be involved and events to be held. They even plan to evaluate their workshops to make improvements for the next one.

There is a lot to like about the proposal and overall I think the team would make a reasonable attempt with their experience and the plan provided. The budget seems too high although most of that is for phase 2 of the proposal. I feel phase 1 up and running followed by phase 2 in a subsequent proposal would be far greater at finding success.

The proposer has a technical background and  works with Addis Ababa University.  With some motivation and enthusiasm this vision seems entirely feasible. It seems as if it wouldn't take long for some students to become involved and help carry the weight of the project. A highly detailed timeline for the project has been produced, as well as a plan for financial sustainability.

This project appears 5/5 feasible because the budget is detailed and realistic and they provide a very specific calendar for completing steps of the project. Their recruitment efforts are wise and will make all the difference in expansion/scalability. However, "risks" are not addressed; there is a blank header on their google doc, so I reduce the score to 4.

The information provided is very good, the plan is well mapped although the details of certain aspects are lacking. I would like to see further proof of materials to be used in education of students, examples of flyers etc. Again reiterate that asking for significant funds without greater detail makes it difficult to assess higher at this stage.

The problem and solution statement described is reasonable. The proposal is within the scope of the challenge and has great potential to not only improve decision making, but to create tools and a data management model to improve various processes that today are problematic and fragmented between IdeaScale and independent tools. There is a long-term plan, which is a positive point and increases the long-term impact.

The proposal is a continuation of a work that is already being developed and is already showing positive results in decision making through several swarm sessions where several members of Catalyst participate regularly to improve several points of Catalyst, among them decision making.
proposalTitle: Open Ideas and Data For Cooperation

assessmentNote:
The proposer, Ro Mathew, has been developing work related to this proposal for several weeks, a large part of the deliverables referring to the Fund4 proposal (not yet voted / nor funded) has already been completed, which shows commitment. I recommend the inclusion of a link to Linkedin so that the community can check your skills transparently. In the proposal there is a description that several administrators will be "hired" to assist in the management of the platforms as well.

The proposal is a continuation of the "Adagov.org (Co-creation)" proposal. The plan and the established budget are reasonable and are detailed, giving continuity to what was presented in the proposal of Fund4.

Due to the complexity of the proposal, there is a risk that Adagov.org will not be used as intended. The decision to use a platform other than IdeaScale is uncertain and depends on several factors. Despite this, I think it is important that we use an open source platform that is more flexible and that meets the demand of the Catalyst community.
proposalTitle: Open Ideas and Data For Cooperation

assessmentNote:
It gives no doubt that this is feasible, since there is a lot that has been already made. 
There's just two things that makes me wondering: 1 – if the fund4 do not get voted which will be the real downgrade to fund5 project? ; 2 – In the problem statement you said "[…] can't use ideascale API because it holds private member data", however you've not well explored the security problem (since it's an off-chain platform which everyone could contribute). Maybe addressing these two problems to clarify everything would be a great incrementation to the project.

Furthermore, in 'feasibility' would be a good thing to see things more well explained. Point 3, for example, if the negotiation is not successful, what will be the actual risk or downgrade?
proposalTitle: Open Ideas and Data For Cooperation

assessmentNote:
Auditability: 3/5

The proposer gives a good breakdown of the allocation of funding, but they have not set specific goals that address the key points of the challenge.  This will make assessment of the success of the program difficult. How many users and how much participation would be considered a success? How can you differentiate users who already delegate from first time delegators?

The problem statement in this proposal is simply false (and thus this entire proposal becomes moot). "DeFi smart contracts that anyone can interact with are subject to "DoS" attacks" is not at all true in Cardano's Plutus model since developers can scale their dApp by deploying multiple versions of the same contract and using a state-thread token to track/sync state across the contracts. This means that not only is DOS attack an unrealistic risk vector, it means the smart contract can actually scale to meet the demand of a large user base. Nowhere in the proposal does the author mention this as it ruins there narrative that UTXO needs an account view, it does not, and the devs at IOHK have made it clear how Plutus contracts can be constructed to mitigate the "race to the UTXO" problem.

The proposal also conflates the Ethereum transaction mempool process with Cardano's which is another fatal flaw since these are vastly different
proposalTitle: AVOUM: Account View on UTXO Model

assessmentNote: The open-source code given as example shows good coding practices and demonstrate coding skills both in Solidity and Plutus.
proposalTitle: AVOUM: Account View on UTXO Model

assessmentNote:
Auditability: 3/5

The proposer does detail fund allocation for the first year, and shows how successful block-minting by participants will provide some revenue to the project.  However, they do not provide metrics to measure the success of the project.  Since the challenge is to promote adoption through integrations, how many delegators using the platform would be considered a success?
