Can we establish that these delegators were not already delegating to small pools?  being able to answer these questions would be essential for the auditability of the project as framed by the challenge goals.
This would greatly shorten the development time for applications relying on NFT ownership, as well as improve the UX for its users reducing the need for multiple wallet ownership validations.

The proposal includes a project plan, goals/deliverable expectations, total developer hours and budget to complete the main deliverables in the coming months. The team is also working closely with the IOHK Plutus team.

Here steps taken in Assessment section could improve Auditability.
So clear step-by-step plan with metrics set would help Proposal auditability and
budget allocations for various steps or phases of the proposed project.

I apologize if I did not understand perfectly, however the difference between what you've already been doing and this proposal is that now all the attention goes to Project Catalyst (the fund5 will be the only sponsor of the event and it'll be mandatory to submit a proposal)? 
If this is the case, is there a chance to diminish the movement of the events due the absence of great sponsor's names?
Besides that, I really see value in this proposal.

It was a great idea to implement as metric the need to mention the program in submitting an idea.
However, it could include as well a manner to measure the 'non-proposers' contribution as well, like CA/Voters, since I imagine that the events will give visibility not only to the entrepreneurs itself, but to viewers and contributors.

This proposal addresses Cardano Fund 5: Developer Ecosystem Challenge. The project proposal is solid and can impact many developers seeking to build or integrate payment API on their platform using the Cardano Blockchain. The problem and solution in the proposal are well described and explained. This proposal, if implemented correctly, will increase Cardano Blockchain within the developer community.

It is likely for this proposal to be implemented because it includes a straightforward plan which will serve the adaption of Cardano Blockchain by developers. This proposal is highly feasible as it encompasses a strongly diverse skilled team with the skillset to build an APIs solution on top of the Cardano Platform which will facilitate the payment connection between multiple wallets and gateways.

The proposal seems to be very beneficial both for the African continent and for the Catalyst community, meeting the objectives of the challenge. This is because it is intended to create a first SPO in Kenya, in addition to other activities such as promoting workshops, which will aim to educate young people about ADA. Also, promote donations that benefit the local community and promote education, for example. In this way, Africa will certainly gain a lot, and the Catalyst community will be taken, on several fronts, to a new location.

There is a huge potential to grow Cardona in Africa, and this project addresses it in its implementation plan. This proposal needs details on the team, who will implement this proposal, and their relevant experience. How do you plan to overcome the challenges of running a stake pool? Will you be working with yourself, or do you have a team?

Whilst the proposers have the technical expereince to deliver on this, do they have domain experience/contacts to have it accepted in the industry? What is the slaes plan to get firms like ticketek to accept this? Would they not be happy with just a centralised solution?
Plan lacking in details on how to actually get the product accepted into what in the end is a highly centralised industry.
The proposal is well described. It would be helpful for voters to see a potential timeline. It should also be noted whether the second planet (post end-game) would require additional funding.
More information needs to be provided as to haw this proposal addresses the challenge. It seems focused on entrepreneurs trying to scale up a business.

The problem description doesn't describe the problem clearly but a solution, I recommend that the statement be modified to communicate the objective more clearly.

DEXs based on order books (including crosschain atomic swaps) never achieved relevant adoption among the DeFi community, it was only with the introduction of the AMM model that the use of DEXs became attractive, this is due to the greater liquidity of the AMM model . This places uncertainty in this aspect of the proposal, I believe that the part that deals with AMM has a much more evident and promising potential, however DEXs in the AMM model do not present ease for crosschain swaps as in the order book model and this would make it difficult to develop a bridge ERGO-Cardano.

The metrics and KPIs described would have an extremely positive impact on Cardano's DeFi challenge and ecosystem if they are met.

The proposal is well writen, sets goal post for a ErgoDEx on the Cardano network and shows that there is a clear path to meet these goal posts. 
But there is a timeline issue as mentioned above. And I think the creators undersell on their longterm vision of having a cross chain DEx.

The problem and the solution are clear and reasonable. The proposal has scope within the challenge, as the translation of material could attract Spanish speakers, but the impact of the proposal is limited by some factors.

Voters will still have to deal with an English voting app.

Proposers can submit proposals in Spanish, but this can decrease their reach and

Community Advisors are currently unable to participate without understanding some English, as there are no mechanisms that allow assessments in other languages. At best they would have to use a text translator and in this case the purpose of this proposal is lost, because if we are counting on people to use text translators there is no sense that advisors need to read proposals translated manually.

Although these factors that I mentioned above are not decisive for voters and proposers, they reduce the impact of the proposal on value onboarding impact.

The team has provided all the necessary information. They have an ample combined experience that does not cast any doubt on their implementation capabilities. Besides that, they have already started their discord server and the landing page for the website. They have a good plan that can easily be implemented.
This could be an interesting DApp. However why would people want NFT's of an  ebook? How do you manage the original sellers who can sell infinite copies at marginal cost of zero vs second hand sales?
The team introduction is acceptable, but it would have been more meaningful if verifiable information was provided.

Email sender verification and email signing using Cardano blockchain is an innovative idea with the potential to accelerate adoption. There are high-value emails which might justify transaction cost. There is a need to audit the proposal with respect to the security protocol proposed. As discussed in the comments the alternatives like DKIM exists in which the cryptographic public key of the organization is added as a specially-formatted TXT record in the domain's overall DNS records. However, the is scope to explore the use of Cardano Wallet keys or such schemes to do away with DNS altogether. This will improve the authentication of email without the constrain of DNS.

This project needs a detailed roadmap of the project deliverable. What are the milestones or steps to fully integrate this product? What are the KPI's (How many by when)? How much time will the team dedicate per week to this part-time project?

There are many issues which may impact the feasibility of this proposal. How are they funding compliance and reporting to meet solvency? How are they marketing to insurers to sell their underwriting? How do they reach underserved consumers when they are not actually dealing with them? How are they managing their float?

While the proposal qualifies as a new utilization of the Cardano blockchain and probably is a lot of fun and has the potential to bring on some new users and integrate a new use of NFTs, it does not qualify for the target of "providing the most value for end-users" compared to other proposals that are much more far-reaching.

More information about the proposers previous games/projects and links to LinkdIn/CVs to get a better understanding of the team behind the project would have made it easier to predict the success of the proposal. A clearer description of game mechanics could have helped in anticipating the games' popularity and thus of the whole project. The budget requested is extremely small and the team should have mentioned other sources of financing or if none are available what's their plan to release a polished product.

Based on the stated team's experience, it seems that the project is very feasible and it might not be too difficult to meet the dates proposed there. Some points of the roadmap are already met, and it would be good to include information about them in the proposal. Also, based on the information available in the proposer's answers in comment section in IdeaScale, it seems that they really know what they are doing and that the proposal is completely feasible.

The DApp would have the potential of helping 272M people if successful. 
Great idea to improve on international transactions within a legal framework. The system would be beneficial for the blockchain, both nations between the transactions and above all the users.

I commend the desire to encourage less technical people into the Cardano ecosystem but I don't feel the proposal currently justifies why this needs to be a blockchain project. There also doesn't appear there is a strong enough hook for the project to pull in users and maintain its staying power. In addition to playable cards it's recommend their be some sort of interface that allows interaction among players and an incentive to keep using the game. A technology capability that only blockchain could provide is a way to make this unique, exciting, and even educational.

The proposal still needs a fair bit of design and implementation work to achieve success. Its great to see the website up and running and some early designs available. The proposers appear to have the skillset to write the code but may require some assistance with design and marketing aspects.

The proposers have hosted a site and started promoting the NFT Drops on Twitter and other media. With enthusiasm shown, it is possible the proposal will be implemented. However, details regarding who will prepare the complex smart contract for the project are not clear, and the technical capabilities of the proposers are not established.

A clear roadmap is presented (even if a bit optimistic, as mentioned above) as well as clear success criteria that would allow the community to follow the progress of the proposal and measure it's impact

The proposal has clear phases and outcome in each phase however number and type of smart contract required to create a game out of the NFTs is not clear and may need a detailed analysis of the features of the proposed game.

The proposal team is completed skilled on Yoga platforms and related app world, but it's not well and clear documented  other fundamental experiences on blockchain, so it's difficult to have have a good trade-off  between business and technical knowledge. In relation to the possible success of the initiative, it's difficult to define because there aren't business case in the documentation that introduce rationales… I think that the proposer have to better describe that.  Further I think it's important to improve details about the process related to the issue related to the market or adoption risks.

The proposer provides a briefly plan for the implementation with milestones and a defined time horizon, but I think the proposer is missing some information about adoption and delivery of the solution, also the proposer has not mentioned possible difficulties and how to deal with them.. The proposer hasn't considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation.

price/outcome is not efficient IMO 

also, this would address only involved, there are projects addressing everyone.

The proposed is well aligned with the objectives of the challenge, as it would increase the engagement and bring new proposers to the Catalyst ecosystem. I am not sure about the engagement of the community about this due to the luck factor involved. Since most people would not win at first and this might push away some serious projects that have well defined deadlines but are seeking for mentorship. I believe this would be specially applicable for smaller size projects/proposals. Some important information, like budget breakdown, is presented only in the attachments, and this is not ideal, mainly in the voters perspective. The fact that the raffle also offers stakepool hardware is not aligned with the purpose of the challenge.

WebSocket are important to reduce latency of client applications. This proposal will be useful when there is a Decentralised exchange on Cardano. However, the need is already covered today with Ogmios. If a developer really has this need, they could run a cardano node themselves.

While the initial creation seems feasible, apparent issues (e.g. fragmentation of knowledge base, managing changes across multiple platforms) is not addresses. It is also not clear that the miro board and videos about discord usage would make things easier and better.

Discord is only one communication platform among the Cardano community and the proposal may have significant less reach and effect as anticipated by the proposer.

There is a clear description of the problem, the solution and how the proposal addresses the challenge in a relevant way, but there are no budget breakdowns, KPIs and metrics to audit the proposal.

A 3-month timeline has been established for the delivery of Miro board tutorials, but there is no mention of the videos. There are no details about the proposers' experience.

It is important to note that the work is already in progress and this is a point in favor of auditability, as there is already delivery before funding.

The problem statement is unclear: why is it not advantageous for "developers of all skills". If it disadvantages low-skill developers, what is the benefit for the community to reward them? If the claim is that it disadvantages the skilled developers, what is the data from previous funds that backs up the claim? Why do mini-proposal need funding rather than being left to hobbyists?

I would have loved to see greater detail on the timeline. If a more detailed plan can include a budget estimation and how development will be carried out in real-life terms might the assessments. Also - with regards to metrics. It is great to use a metrics framework with concrete examples of goals and objectives & targets.
Is there any way to quantify this? Other than that - it doesn't have much context without quantifiable measurements that could convey this message.
While there might be groups within the community that have the dkills to work on such a solution, financially this will be challenging considering the amount of funds demanded.
It's recommendable a more understandable view of the proposed metrics and how the value can bring ROI and value to the entire Cardano ecosystem.

If the problem is to bring in FIAT to ADA seamlessly, then the metric should be the number of currencies and jurisdictions this is able to be done in, probably weighted by population an/or GDP of the currencies. It could also be useful to measure the number of entities through which these transaction can be done, again possibly taking into account the volume of transactions these entities undertake.

The proposer needs to search for more feedback to expand their KPIs listed. Given the amount set for the challenge and the category in question, more data needs to be considered for collection in order to better understand the direction of development.

The metrics included in the proposal are good, and it could also include some others like 'money saved in comparison to traditional international transactions' and some others that shows that this is a better solution than the current financial system. Although, risks of taxation from some countries, such as the US that current has some strict rules about this, should be assessed as well and should be taken into consideration when creating these metrics.

The suggested success metrics are relevant if they are measured against the proposals resulting from this challenge, but the lack of a timeline for indicating impact makes these metrics subjective. I recommend including a time horizon for evaluating metrics.

The definition of success is very subjective, I think more tangible goals are necessary.

Thank you for your idea proposal. I enjoyed reading it. To improve its relevance to the Cardano community, please kindly consider the following suggestions: Rethink and revise the need to have more details like a business plan, cost breakdown excel or a project plan. The proposed metrics are spot on but recommend an overview with some quadrants or SWOT or PEST analysis.

More though needs to go into the metrics. A proposal should be accepted based on potential number of users and their repeated interactions. We also want to encourage diversity of uses cases. We don't want to fund multiple applications in the same industry or geography, as these have less impact going forward than different use cases which can really grow adoptions. Use cased which engage users to other interactions with the Cardano blockchain should also be valued highly.

More detail on how particular DID proposals should be differentiated would be useful, as well as capability and processes the proposers might use in developing them, as well as business plans as necessary to implement them.

While moving NFTs to a more energy-efficient blockchain like Cardano is a positive thing, and there are many promising use cases to NFTs, the proposal focuses on the monetary aspects of NFTs. NFTs are not solely a tool to license and monetize things like art and collectibles but can go far beyond that, so the challenge in this scope and formulation does adress cardanos mission sufficiently, as ADA is explicitrly supposed to go beyond monetary aspects of Crypto

There have already been a lot of NFT related projects on Catalyst, some of the high profile like Artano mentioned by Charles Hoskinson several times, some of them not in Catalyst but still built on Cardano like SpaceBudz (creator interviewed by Charles Hoskinson) however the challenge doesn't acknowledge or incorporate this and the challenge isn't formulated in such a way that would imply that building an already existing initiatives would be an option.
The proposer has a good understanding and vision for what it is they want to see out of this challenge setting. It is recommended they expand upon their current KPI and success metric list.

The metrics need more detail as to how the community should differentiate between particular proposals fro NFT use cases, and should include how proponents should be differentiated as to their capability and resources to implement proposals as practical applications of their ideas.

I believe that the definition of 2,000 USD per pool is not realistic. This encourages the creation of unsustainable operations just so that the proposals meet the challenge goal. it is necessary to establish a more sustainable definition considering how these pools will maintain decentralization for a longer period.

I think the objective should focus less on the number of countries and more on geographic decentralization, legal jurisdictions and the potential duration of these operations. Perhaps establish a minimum period for these pools to operate.

This challenge establishes 2,000 USD as the minimum estimate needed to start a pool, which indicates that the 200,000 budget would be impractical to meet the target of + 100 countries with operations.

Leaving the bold target aside, I believe that the challenge has the potential to significantly increase the number of countries with operations.

Definition of success is very clear. The Challenge KPIs and metric are good and clear in relation to the proposed success criteria. Some information like that should also be included to assess the funded proposals in this challenge. Only negative side is the risk of receiving multiple proposals from the same country and not reaching to 100 different countries as well were not assessed.
Work needs to be done on the metrics. 4 of the 5 are just measuring number of proposals. The challenge should be measuring results from the proposals. What is return on intention? Is that measurable?

I think measuring the amount of hubs and people joined is once part of the story. The hub quality and content shall get at least the same focus. How to would be the community activity tracked and continuously followed up. Setting up the hubs seems just a fraction of the overall story and if the funds will be used only for that it won't last long. Try to focus a bit on a longer time plan and future upscaling, maintenance and continuous adaptation aspects as well.
Criteria and metrics are ok. I think the commercial significance of this proposal should also be considered.

Metrics are difficult to set in this kind of challenge because NFTs are usually not transacted in the same way as fungible tokens. The proposed metric are good and general enough to fit any kind of NTF related proposal, although proposals would need specific metrics and KPIs based on their business models and niches.

The submission for current funding is broken in to two largely independent tasks that develop core aspects of the overall project. funds are broken down into developer costs for each project. Auditing will mostly consist of assessment of any viable products produced before subsequent Catalyst rounds.
Key measurement for the success of this project is clearly stated such as: onboarding 5 SME companies in 3 regions, with expectation of about 1000-2000 people to join per month as from May 2021

Project catalyst will be the driver of Cardano and is the driver of innovation using Cardano. The proposal to create a professional-grade video series will improve Catalyst's visibility and provide a forum for the proposers and other stakeholders to get involved.
It seems like something doable, especially given the fact that the proposer has already produced videos and knows his way about cardano and the project catalyst topic
The proposer has hosted few related video series and had demonstrated the capability to produce engaging content.
The proposal is simple, and creating the videos required for onboarding stakeholders is likely feasible.
The proposal is detailed and the proposal has substantial experience. The plan is comprehensive and has a detailed analysis of steps and the process to be undertaken each step.
Aggregating the information is reasonable. The developer has the experience and is already using the proposed toolset as part of the proposal.

The proposal team's mature experience in this application area significantly mitigates project risk. The market-testing aspect of the plan will align the application for successful user adoption. The 12-month plan is somewhat vague as to specific activities in each of the three phases, but those are detailed elsewhere in the proposal.
This is very important. The history of funded projects in meeting their objectives needs to be tracked to avoid repeating the same mistakes.

Success is not only in creating another tool, but also ensure that the data quality is good enough. The proposal seems to implicitly assume that someone else will curate the data on an ongoing basis but it is not clear who.
The team has the neccessary experience to implement such a project and provides structured information on how it plans to achieve the plans set.
The technical process is simple and the experience of the proposers is adequate to implement the proposal sucessully.
Like I wrote in an assessment to another proposal belonging to the same project: They create a nail but it is unclear who the person with the hammer is.
I think they have outlined well why it is needed and what they will include. They have also described well what they will do with the funds. I think it is a good proposal.
The proposal is simple and has clearly identified test points. The progress can be easily monitored.

I did not understand what the problem is. Something is done unchanged since the 60s and suddenly it needs to change. 
I did not understand what the proposed solution would do. Uber for something.

A blockchain solution for the music industry is highly desirable and would meet the challenge.  However there is a lot of competition in the space and it would take an exceptional team to have a impact.

Really like the direction of this proposal, it reads exactly how decentralised organisations should progress. Granted will need further revision and governance aspects to be negotiated but meets the requirements of 'pass the baton' onboarding.

No issues with experience (or motivation) of the author but will caution that the process needs to remain as simple as possible. Onboarding in organisations is often overdone, too much information too soon. The plan will benefit from further revision.

I did not even understand what is being proposed here. A "mechanism for onboarding" with "three discrete but fluid functions". 
Clarification needed.

Given that we're dealing with a proposal in development the information provided is of sufficient quality to feasibly assess. The proposal strikes at the heart of the onboarding challenge and will be interesting to watch.
It is not clear how this proposal meets the objects of this fund to "help the Catalyst community to get better at distributed decision making within the next two Catalyst rounds".

As the related "Catalyst catapult" proposal, this is too vague for me to deduce what the goal is. 
If you want to curate onboarding materials, I suggest you just do it and then ask for money for continuing doing it.
The part about compensation frameworks really amounts to saying "give me the money and I'll figure out how to use it".

Improving Catalyst is important and the whole community would benefit from it. On-chain governance is going to be hard but is gonna bring a lot of value. It is worth to allocate some of the funds to improving it.

Given that the proposer is a engaged community member, retro organizer and facilitator it is likely that this is gonna be improved successfully / is gonna bring loads of knowlege on what to do better. They are already committed as they are gonna continue their work even if they are not getting funded. The budget is appropriate.
It is unclear how the proposing team will add value in making NFT and smart contracts accessible on the Marlowe Playground.
proposalTitle: NFT for each CARDANO Smart Contract

assessmentNote: I'm not convinced that minting NFTs with Cardano will be a differentiator that promotes Cardano adoption as a smart contract platform.
proposalTitle: NFT for each CARDANO Smart Contract

assessmentNote: I have no basis to assess the capabilities of the team. However, the vagueness of the proposal itself gives me low confidence. If you can't explain clearly where you want to go, it is likely you won't arrive.
proposalTitle: NFT for each CARDANO Smart Contract

assessmentNote: IPFS is been the preferred storage system for NFT files in Cardano. The proposal is for creating a bridge with filecoin storage, that has an assured storage feature. This is likely to be useful for a few NFT that require such reliable storage requirements.
The proposer's experience and estimated time and high-level breakdown for completion, as well as definitions of in-scope vs out-of-scope work convey a moderate likelihood of success.

While this proposal would improve the Cardano ecosystem as a whole, I fail to see how it directly relates to the experience of developers on Cardano. If it were to be resubmitted in the future I would suggest probably placing it in a different category.

The proposer is operating Spectrum Cardano stake pool. Spectrum pool is a Mission Oriented pool that donates to some cause. The proposer however has not presented capability in software development capability.
Project seems feasible. Its not clear it meets the challenge of "helps the developer focus on building successful apps".
its not really clear how the routers have anything to do with Cardano. This seems to just be a request for funds to start a small retail store to sell some Cardano related hardware.
The proposed concept is unique and has the potential for worldwide deployment with sufficient scaling. It can provide a boost to Cardano adoption.
It's a good idea to leverage a trustless decentralized system such as cardano with a smart contract capability to connect ppl in need of a help with their community
The proposal is backed by an experienced team and has a detailed plan that seems tangible with great effort. I am positive that it can be implemented successfully.

Based on the experience and plans expressed above, it is feasible enough that this project can be implemented successfully. A little challenge might occur as obviously the budget might not be enough but I'm sure there's a plan B.

The proposal states that there are some gaps in the team behind the proposal. Finding the right competence is essential to fulfill this. I would prefer if the required team emmbers were on-board before the proposal were written.
This is an interesting idea. It doesn't really drive Cardano in Africa, as the Cardano side would be the people donating.
A reasonable part of this idea relies on the physical sanitation units. Is this tech actually up and running and approved for use? What would be the cost per D-lav for someone to donate?

The project is explained really well and according to the presentation I cannot see any problems in it's feasibility, providing that the schedule can be kept, but even if it can't thisshould not be detrimental to the project itself. It adresses the presented challenge and multiple other challenges very well.

It is not clear how this project grows Cardano in Africa given the Afrcian side is about the D-Lavs. It is also not clear if the D-Lav is proven tech and if there are any approvals required for usage.
The project has a clear plan and stages which will produce measurable data to identify progress. The white paper outlining the proposal is sufficient to assess that that the proposal is audit able.
This project starts on Ethereum then migrates to Cardano. How will be certain that you will migrate to Cardano providing this community the ultimate value?
Spot on. This is a a very good example of community members taking the initiative and actively seeking to improve the decision making and participation process for everyone.

This proposal addresses the growing need for additional infrastructure to host the growing Catalyst Community.  The entire community would benefit from the creation of this and there are plans to be able to make fixes and changes for future issues that are brought up by the community.

The community members that have initiated this proposal are already working on delivering the project. Funding will only accelerate and amplify their results. A clear background of the people involved is presented. The risk of this proposal failing is minimal.

All members have both sound technical and SME knowledge of the Cardano ecosystem and the Catalyst system as well.  They all have relevant experience in this space and have already done work to try and build with the current system to solve some of the problems that they are looking to solve with additional funding.

This proposal has a roadmap and general plan to get it moving if selected.  THis will make this proposal with the plans and features that they would like to create from the additional funding easily implementable.  Since this proposal will first build the infrastructure to build the community page and then support it there is a definition of success that is in line with DevOps.

The proposers spent the required effort to provide a breakdown of benefits, activities and costs. This will allow sufficient success-tracking and auditing along the road. More than this, I honor the entanglement of the proposers with the active CATALYST Community. This will make sure that there are not only the formal auditing steps in place, but also numerous checks & balances based on short-term feedback of 'friendly supporters'.

This may be a good idea. Not clear it focuses on the goal of encouraging more meaningful participation from the community. It seems more likely to be aimed at bringing in more Russians to the community.

I see this initiative as a good way to onboard the Russian population and increase Cardano's visibility there. Although, not all videos made by Charles are Catalyst related, and the main topic of the challenge in Catalyst onboarding. It would be better to focus on content related to Catalyst, and in this way the proposal would be very aligned to the challenge goals.

The demo video is great to exemplify the capabilities of the proposer in achieving the desired goal. The plan in clear and seems to be completely achievable. The budget is also well explained. Everything about feasibility seems fine.
No clear measure of how it is increasing participation of the community in the next two funds.

I really think that for a rapid growth and the explosion of ideas, the more suitable environment is the university, where people from all around the world are living together, sharing experiences and seen each other's problems and thinking about solutions, other than that, they're breathing a environment of change and evolution.  
However, I'm thinking that if these people do not know about Cardano or Project Catalyst, how productive would be sending emails to them. How the students would see receiving an email from something that they don't know. I really thing that they wouldn't open it – since nowadays the selling of private information like email to industries and companies are present, they might receive thousands of emails every day.
I really think that a project more community involved would be of a greater impact. We already have lots of members across the world with great credentials and who are willing to help. Maybe create a platform which put these people together and which aims create a presentation and validate a method that could be presented inside the universities and colleges around the world, but presential – would be much more appealing.

To be blunt, I do not like that salary is the top expense. Nobody should be asked to work for free(wait I am doing that now), but devoting more resources to the outreach campaigns and incentives would make this goal more feasible.
This could be a useful tool in educating new CA's. Given the load already on CA's, would they spend additional time on? Would this be a required module before being able to asses for new CA's?
The proposal is feasible. One question I do have is the additional time load this may put on community members. Will this discourage their use? How long are the tutorials going to be?

This idea offers support for project developers, through a project classification system, milestones and funnel for projects. One of the goals is to improve the feedback that project developers will receive as the number of proposals increases, by providing them with expert feedback in their project area. The problem posed is only described by a few very open questions and lacks concrete illustrations. It seems to me that experienced developers don't necessarily feel as lost in the Catalyst environment as the author suggests.
Based on the clear scope, budget and timeline it is likely that this proposal will succeed. The team is identified and they have the necessary skills required.

The 27K is for director and producer fees. The assumption is that the team has found funding for the preliminary aspects of the budget. This seems reasonable as long as that funding is real, because funding direction and production without a complete product ready to be directed and produced would potentially be a waste of funds.
No metrics. No mention of how this could impact the fund goal or how this could be measured.

(This is a duplicate of another proposal by the same team with some added info in the attachment) Building an insurance dApp on the Cardano ecosystem for registering claims and paying the claims could have a potential of utility increase and wider adoption. Since the app is already being build by developers, it would have been very useful to have some more details regarding how the app is running in order to be able to determine how effectively it addresses the challenge.
The extra information in the attachment offers a bit of an insight into the general idea of the app, though it doesn't go into enough details to help better assess its implementation.
A free marketplace that's attractive to makers and takers alike would indeed drive adoption.

The proposer commits on providing evidence of the use of the fund toward the goal. However, measurement of the success is not defined, and the 4 milestones roadmap only contains very general statements. The proposers does not describes the target and the key figures that will enable the community to monitor the progress of the project.
Not really any way to audit the success. The goals don't actually align with the challenge.
no detailed plan or evidence of experience to enable success likelihood to be ascertained.
Draft proposal. There is no information to assess the auditability of the proposal.
No detail is given to understand how the funds will be utilized.
There is no roadmap or milestones outline that would help measure the progress of the proposal.
Please provide more information. Detailed plan, budget breakdown, milestones, KPI's etc.
A marketplace for Art NFTs always brings traffic to a network. But there are already other NFT Marketplaces out there and except from the graffit Theme its hard to see the advantage of this proposal.

The proposal is for creating a Steet Graffiti-based NFT market specific to a location. If a generalized NFT market catering for all art NFTs is created, it will most likely take care of this specific requirement.

Graffiti is somewhat mainstream so I see the potential to generate NFT interest. This is a unique niche among the many NFT related proposals. The impact on the Cardano ecosystem may be slow to develop but the idea has a lot of value.

The proposal targets a very small niche, a small number of street artists and street art enthusiasts in a relatively small European nation. The impact of the project on the whole Cardano ecosystem would be extremely limited as not even those involved would be necessarily directly exposed to Cardano.
the budget is broken down into parts that can be audited pretty good. It is stated to be finalized until the end of the year. The auditing of the stated tasks should be easy to implement.

The proposal involves implementing NFT backed and creating a overlay on the existing website to georeference it. The project is relatively simple with the less technical risk, and the progress can be audited.

The text explains several times what the idea is about and how it will happen, in addition to mentioning how the total financial amount will be divided among the parts of the project. There is also a more synthesized timeline of how the steps would take place, which helps to understand the whole thing in a more chronological way. Therefore, we know how the money will be shared and the intention of what to do, according to the time in months, so the project's applicability is very detailed and apparently safe.

A blockchain bootcamp sounds like a great idea. Getting information out there helps to build the community and to educate the people about the blockchain space. Once a bootcamp was done there is always an option to scale this up and to a second, third etc. version. Getting the information out there is one of the most important things.

The proposer shows that has experience and knows how many crew member and with which knowledge the proposal needs to be done.

The proposal does not specify how it will self-fund afterwards in order to continue creating updates and maintaining the dedicated website – since ADA is still young and is evolving each second. Therefore, if the money ends with paying the crew members, the project would stay static and end?
The proposer is an established filmmaker and I don't see feasibility issues with the project.   The trailer is simply voiceovers and found footage, which can be assembled with few logistical issues.
Building a crowdfunding platform with accountability features on Cardano is a great way to drive adoption.
By adding info on top of well understood crowdfunding platforms, the proposal is concise while providing sufficient information (features to build, budget breakdown).

Auditability: 4/5
Goals are well defined and auditable. It should be possible to verify that funding has gone to the indicated topics. The number and ADA size of campaigns in the months following release will allow for an assessment of the return on intention.
The proposal plan, timeline and outlined deliverables are complete and its likely they will be implemented successfully.
The information provided is insufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal.
It is not clear this proposal meets the challenge of the dev ecosystem

The challenge is to provide most possible value for end users. While the business that is presented here seems like a nice idea, I feel like this does not belong into a project catalyst fund, as the funding will basically go into a property investment platform for investing into property of a specific company. Also keep in mind that property investment is something that almost only rich, privileged people will benefit of. I feel like there are at the moment other, more important projects for the cardano ecosystem that another investment opportunity
I'm confused by the title of this project. From the Casaba website I do not get the idea of housing in glamping hats over the 28 day period but more of a centralized a holidaying investment platform.

Despite the plan not being super detailed, I think it is likely that it will be sucessfully implemented, as the proposer plans to hire developers to implement it, meaning that it is most likely to be done by a versed person.

They may be experienced in software development and real estate, but I am not sure they understand blockchain very well. It looks to me like they should build a regular, centralized app instead. I don't see anything in the products that needs to be a dapp.
Plan doesn't really detail what will be done in terms of blockchain. No evidence given of proposers experience.
There are no technical details, nothing about the team and no plan or budget for the requested funds
Please provide detailed plan on what will actually be done and why you are capable of delivering it.
Draft proposal. There is no information available to evaluate auditability.

What are you planning to use the ADA for? Is it just to pay the fee to write the transaction to the blockchain, or are you going to sell the ADA given you you by Project Catalyst and keep the money for yourself? If it is the first maybe its marginally an ok idea, but if the second then you are just asking Porject Catalyst to give you an asset to sell for which you will keep the funds.
The basic goal of the proposal seems valid enough but I was concerned with the legal aspects which may have been resolved but further clarity required.

If they will receive a license required, they can definitely do it. I posed a question to the proposer, what is the current state. Waiting for a response, but I suggested withdrawal of a proposal if it can not be done.
Please produce a plan on how you would go about implementing this idea.
The proposal appears to be a suitable use case of challenge funds although I note lack of comments from the community.

Yes. The timeline for the project spelled out in a general terms. However it is a straightforward project development.

Once product is ready, the biggest implementation is to commercialised it. Proposer mentioned that he will request another round of funding to cater this implementation nation/world wide.
The plan they have laid out would be beneficial to both the Ethiopian people and the Cardano community, helping them both expand in an organic way.
proposalTitle: Cashout and Buy ADA in Ethiopia

assessmentNote: The is always a requirement for a local facility to fiat out crypto. This improves adoption of crypto. The proposal aims to field a local money exchange in ADA with in the government regulations. This will improve the adoption and liquidity of ADA in a substantial manner.
proposalTitle: Cashout and Buy ADA in Ethiopia

assessmentNote: While there remains some discussion about the suitability of this proposal in the current challenge, I am satisfied that the explanation given by the proposer is valid. Perhaps the query that does get generated after reading through the proposal is that a lot more work needs to be completed to get the ball rolling.
proposalTitle: Smart Contract Audit Token SCAT DAO

assessmentNote:
I believe it is a good idea. I have got lost too, sometimes, such videos would be very appreciated.

Yet I am missing a more detailed timeframe, and the whole proposal requires more work to do.
The proposal is quite vague and, for example, does not explain what the proposed videos will be about. Setting up a node? Submitting a proposal?
The proposer admits to not being sufficiently qualified, yet he does not partner with another team member who might be. There is no plan described, no information given.

Since this is just an idea, there is no evidence of feasibility – no explanation in the steps that will be taken, the platform, how it is going to be made, no roadmap, no plan.
However, creating videos it is not a thing out of the world. You just need to mature your idea.

"I still feel like it is a good idea!" is not enough of an argument/proposal requesting USD20000. There needs to be a clear detailed project, backed-up by a broken-down budget, a defined expected launch date. Suggest re-submission with all the necessary details included.
Seems a relatively simple idea that could add functionality and users quickly to the ADA ecosystem.
The proposal addresses the challenge but lacks a bit of clarity when describing the problem. A detailed description of the solution is needed in order to better communicate the project.

The idea of localizedor language agnostic wallets in Africa does meet the challenge of promoting adoption in Africa. However the focus of the project on too many languages makes the project seem less realistic and less likely to achieve its intended impact.
It would be good to have more on how security will be ensured.

The creation of a wallet in itself is quite complex, but the goal of the project is a comprehensive adaptation to individual requirements of the African market. There is hardly any information on this aspect in the proposal, and the project plan also allows little time for this aspect. No mention of the resources required for this aspect. However, this aspect is the most important aspect of the proposal and therefore the missing information has a strong impact on the evaluation.

Verifying the popularity of an app in an AppStore is easy. Maybe the proposer could have tackled a bit the marketing side, as it is not enough to build a great product, you also have to promote it. But, since it will be one of the (first/few) wallets that adapts to the unique needs of the people in Africa, maybe it won't need a lot of marketing resources. However, I encourage the proposer to take that into consideration, well before finishing the development of the app.
Also, maybe the budget could have been a bit more detailed.

I think this proposal is unique. There no other similar and they solve an important challenge in the Robotic & AI Community. But the most important is that they attract a lot new users & developers to the Cardano Community due his Robot and development is Open Source.
There is not enough information on what they are actually trying to do and how it would work to be able to say it would be successful.

Excellent information provided and certainly sufficient to assess but it is a little expert centric and may not be fathomable to entire community. I would like further breakdown of budget and simplified plan to improve the quality of this submission.

This project is feasible. It clearly shows how it could increase exposure to Cardano by building a user base who can code smart contracts onto Cardano with their project. It would be interesting to see more information on how they will ensure smart contracts are error free and producing what is expected given the lower technical knowledge of the programmers. Failure to ensure this could be a reputational risk for Cardano.

The requested budget is not broken down, but clear goals are given for the initial months, and metrics of success given for a 12 month period. While I expect the time frame may be optimistic being that it is reliant on the release of smart contracts, I feel that it will be easy to judge preliminary success in 3-6 months.

The information provided in the Roadmap is somewhat sufficient to track and audit the project progress.  The Roadmap need to be organized in a timeline. ( which will give clarity on progression and completion date).
The team has subject matter experts in time tracking and billing, only weak spot might be block chain
This proposal is highly feasible because the team seems to understand the problem and the proposed solution can be implemented successfully by this current team.
The proposal provides sufficient information to audit it's progress through milestones while recognizing that it doesn't know everything yet.
description of proposer seems to be legit, website works,
The proposer already made most of the product, and therefore, provided its experience.

Having a working site that are already functioning is a proof that the proposer is fully capable in executing his plan. The asked amount is a bit on the higher end for a 4 months project, granted there are a lot of man power involved. One risk for this project is the high fee to mint the NFT, it could hinder the adoption rate especially in the beginning when mass adoption is needed to ensure the continuity of the project.
Complete proposal plan from a developer who has already implemented the nft-maker initial product.
Seems reasonable to assume this project is feasible given prior work and plan detailed.

Information provided was not complete and comprehensive. It is not easy to audit based on the full deliverables later.

However, audit can be based on the goals and its timeline.
Yes I think it is modern and up to date. With enough support it could be a real success and good form of marketing for Cardano.

There is not really a plan except to develop an adventure game that somehow links to ADA. What platforms will it be on? What is the tokenomics in the game? Can the prospers back up the significant experience claims made (linkedIn profiles?). We don't even have a surname for Dirk?
After reading all the informations about the idea and the plannings around I think it is a realistic project. With enough support it could be a real success!

As mentioned before, the information provided and the exact addressing of the challenge (end user value, mass adoption, higher awareness, bigger media reach) let this project look more then feasible and make it easy to assess it.

The proposal appears to effectively address the challenge and has certainly engaged the community in conversation. Reading through most of the proposal and comments made me think that perhaps further discussion is required at this stage to assess the overall merit of this proposal to the PC community.

since minimal funds for minting a single NFT are all that is requested, this aspect of an audit will be easy. The proposer does give timelines for specific phases of the project, so this does give something to assess in the coming months.
The progress auditable, and the success is a complex metric. Since there is almost nill financial cost to Treasury, this metric is not applicable for this proposal.

High level point of view, yes.

Zoom in to the key personnel, there are two developers working on this project. Two developers for such a huge project can delay the deliverable of the project by months.

Timeline for chapter 5 is dragging too long in 2023. In my opinion game should run in parallel with chapter 4. 

Amount requested is too little and only for 2 months?

Understand from the proposal, this is the second time the proposal requested for fund. This time 20,000 been requested for a temporary manpower to deliver the proposal?
Yes, they have put much energy into various aspects of building the mechanism.
Yes, objectives been mentioned clearly point by point. Auditing process is easy later to determine the success of the proposal.
Not clear that 100,000 for 20 submissions is a great contribution.

This proposal addresses Cardano Fund 5: Proposer Outreach Challenge. The project proposal is solid and can encourage entrepreneurs from outside the Cardano ecosystem to submit proposals to Catalyst. The problem and solution in the proposal are well described and explained. This proposal, if implemented correctly, will bring a lot of new proposers to the Cardano Ecosystems.
It is likely for this proposal to be implemented because it includes a straightforward plan that will be implemented successfully after funding.

The attached document's Roadmap is clear and provides an in-depth, step-by-step action plan, making this project easier to audit. 
The only question is what is an estimated amount of people or entrepreneur your plan to reach with this project?
The achievement steps are realistic. Front loading would be advantageous, interview and find organisations who would join, this part could be one of the key points.

The problem description makes sense, the proposal is related to the challenge, but it is important to indicate that EMURGO is already developing a dapp connector for for YOROI wallet, which is Cardano's official wallet. Wallets are mission critical software and need high standards of security and quality. The vast majority of users and transactions related to DeFi on Ethereum occur through only one wallet, Metamask, so having multiple wallets is not a requirement to have a functioning DeFi ecosystem.

The creation of an unofficial wallet by an unknown team, the absence of a detailed and structured plan and the absence of goals or metrics do not indicate a positive outcome for this proposal in relation to this challenge and for Cardano's ecosystem.

I recommend that the team describe details about the plan, indicate who will be involved in the proposal and what additional benefit Gero Wallet would bring over the official wallets (Yoroi and Daedalus).
There is no detailed plan or evidence of capability. Thus it is unlikely to be successfully delivered.

The only piece of information provided about the team is that they are 'in since 2017' and are associates of cardstarter defi projects. No plan for implementation, detailed budget, or defined scope of work was included.
The current proposal is an idea with a placeholder webpage. Please provide a detailed plan and evidence of capability to deliver on that plan.
There is no information to audit this proposal. I recommend that the proposal be drawn up based on the Catalyst documentation.

To my understanding, the proposal focuses on the generation of visual aids for Catalysts Community advisors. I believe I can foresee how the proposal could contribute to forward and improve distributed decision-making. Nevertheless, the proponent has not made it clear how he believes the visual resources created for the Catalyst Community Advisors could impact the broader issue of distributed decision-making for the whole community. The proposal would benefit from offering a brief description of the role and expected effect of the visual resources created for the Catalyst Community Advisors on the Distributed decision-making of the community. This brief description could be used by the proponent to demonstrate his understanding of the process within Catalyst and its articulation with the broader community. This brief description could further strengthen the proposal by demonstrating the communications skills necessary to explain the complex process involved in the Catalyst's assessments and their integration with the governance of the community at large.

This proposal will have a meaningful impact through the creation of infographics to support the catalyst community.  Although the content from the infographics will a rehash of Community information, it will enhance the visual appeal and understanding through the infographic.  To continual support the development of the proposal, additional funding would need to be provided to make changes and/or develop further.
More information is need to explain why how this proposal meets the challenge. Whilst infographics might be nice to have, why are they integral to the challenge and a best use of limited funds.

Given the nature of the proposal, it is very feasible. The proposal constitutes in essence a graphic design contract. I believe there are commercial standards to identify how much work would be necessary to execute the proposal, what results should be expected, and at what cost. Unfortunately, the proposal does not provide sufficient information to assess how effectively it addresses the challenge. As I have mentioned in the previous two items of this assessment, the proposal would benefit from a description of how the proponent envisions the visual resources for the Catalyst Community Advisors  would contribute to the broader decision making of the community and, in doing this, the proponent could demonstrate his experience with Catalyst and the community, and as a graphic designer by, at least, listing preliminary the "infographic" that they believe would be necessary to achieve their goal.
It is missing metrics and KPI, mainly, and the themes which will be aborded are not described.
There is sufficient information in the ongoing project section and link to website provided.
The progress can be easily audited simply and openly. The number of apps listed and the quality of the site will be in the open domain.
Yes, the proposer aims to gather ongoing feedback via surveys to measure success.

Good draft and ideas. I think it is a good proposal - to reach people using newsletter, just I think there are better ideas, thus more effective. 

And only 12 newsletter per 3 months = 4/month. Consider budget.

I wish you had given more detail in the budget.
After the 14 weeks, which are coherent with the budget asked, will the mailing stop and the project will end?
How will it self-fund in the future in order to make it continuous?
metrics to use refereall code/hashtag could work, even someone would just skip it. So there would be some deviances from reality, but I think it can work.
Without a plan to reach potential proposers who do not know about Cardano how does this address the challenge

The author details the step by step of the realization of his project, from how the newsletter would circulate, what would be written, how to measure the success of the action and so on. Also specific to how much money will be allocated to each part of the process, making it easier to follow the progress of the project. It touches on several points, such as relevant topics for the newsletter, steak pools, types of media involved and etc ... In other words, the parts of the whole are very clear and it is possible to understand with linearity and logic how the idea will proceed.
This may be an interesting idea, however there is little detail in the proposal.

Good proposal that is well laid out and seems reasonable in addressing the challenge. It is very localised in the short term which is ok especially if a winning formula can be achieved by the team for a single university that can then be applied elsewhere.

What a great way to expose Ethiopian youth to Cardano and engage them in the existing community and encourage community building. If successful the model could work all over the world.  This proposal if successful could have a huge impact on the challenge goals.
The proposal has a clear set of scope, timeline as well as budget. the group can also benefit from cashflow generated by the apparel sales.
Proposal provides significant detail and discusses the issues with the current system and how this would help to remedy them.
proposalTitle: Open Ideas and Data For Cooperation

assessmentNote: This is a relatively simple proposal which clearly works towards building a community for Cardano in Ethiopia.

I think that currently, catalysts can get more proposers from more developed countries, given the percentage of educated/not educated people. (my personal perspective). It is a good idea to spread the news, increase the awareness but I think there are better projects who are approaching to this more effectively.
The physical presence to advertise Catalyst in Addis Ababa for onboarding proposers and innovators can bring serious players to Project Catalyst.

This proposal is well prepared and presented.  The self assessment was completed and the proposal was updated to include insights and collaborations from the community.  There is a reasonable budget.  The definition of success is clear and achievable and aligned with the KPI of the campaign.
Is NLP really required? Does this not introduce more complexity? Does the proposer have experience with NLP?
How new users find out about this? Will adding another thing not even more overwhelm new users?

You do not need an Accounts model to make Cardano DeFi operate at scale. There are several solutions to the UTXO spend per block and the proposal fails to mention any of them. Why would IOHK develop a smart contract platform for 5 years that does not scale/is susceptible to DOS attacks? This is never answered or made clear in this proposal.
proposalTitle: AVOUM: Account View on UTXO Model

assessmentNote: The team's experience in Accounts vs. eUTXO accounting models is not made clear. The proposal also fails to mention the Plutus design patterns DeFi teams may use as a workaround to the UTXO 'race' described in the proposal.
proposalTitle: AVOUM: Account View on UTXO Model

assessmentNote: The team behind this proposal is building Glow, this does not give them any experience in the DeFi space or in the ability to properly analyze Accounts vs. UTxO models. Given the lack of experience and since the plan presented does not at all mention the mitigations that exist (running several contracts and syncing the UTxO state) it's unclear why this proposal is needed.
proposalTitle: AVOUM: Account View on UTXO Model

assessmentNote: The proposal shares how feasible the solution is and offers an alternative way to achieve the desired results.
proposalTitle: AVOUM: Account View on UTXO Model

assessmentNote: This proposal is not at all required for Cardano DeFi, the eUTXO Plutus model can work at scale and IOHK Plutus devs have spoken on several developer calls on how these design patterns can be safely implemented in DeFi protocols on Cardano
proposalTitle: AVOUM: Account View on UTXO Model

assessmentNote: Rebuilding eth's accounts model on Cardano is not the answer to scaling Cardano's DeFi ecosystem.
proposalTitle: AVOUM: Account View on UTXO Model

assessmentNote: Nice detailed proposal that adds a features that would be great for users but also aid in decentralising the Cardano ecosystem.
How does producing hardware Daedalus nodes meet the challenge goal?
Possible the proposer can meet this goal. How are the physical units being sold/distributed?
The project has milestones. But there is no OKR to measure success.
The proposer team background seems to have the relevant experience and knowledge.
Budget, Success-Criteria and Schedule is available and has a good degree of details.

There is no roadmap or milestones defined. The definition of succes is unclear as well. The proposal is really short which makes it quite hard to asses. I'm sure there are other projects that try to make insurance work on cardano so maybe a risk assessment would have been great.
The Liqwid protocol already exists, but the whole DeFi ecosystem is at risk if a hack is exploited.
This is an interesting proposal but 1. IOHK is already working on Marlowe mobile tooling and 2. it feels like the demand for this from Cardano devs would be small.
proposalTitle: Mobile Plutus and Marlowe Dev Tools

assessmentNote: The idea is great and the problem formulation about the availability of laptops/smartphones is definitely valid. This could effectively onboard a large number of new developers.
proposalTitle: Mobile Plutus and Marlowe Dev Tools

assessmentNote: For Cardano DeFi lending solutions to function properly additional research into loan risks and the liquidation process is required. This proposal is addressing this lack of DeFi lending research.
proposalTitle: Liqwid x Credmark R&D on Loan Risks

assessmentNote: This project scales up DeFi by introducing risk models for other existing lending platforms.
proposalTitle: Liqwid x Credmark R&D on Loan Risks

assessmentNote: The Liqwid x Credmark team has included a complete project plan including metrics, a timeline in the deliverables section and a project budget. Both teams have domain expertise in the DeFi space.
proposalTitle: Liqwid x Credmark R&D on Loan Risks

assessmentNote: Every Cardano DeFi team building a lending protocol in the eUTXO model must develop solutions around the default, market and liquidity risks that exists. The teams behind this proposal are collaborating to ensure the Liqwid protocol has completed this research before launch
proposalTitle: Liqwid x Credmark R&D on Loan Risks

assessmentNote: I strongly agree. Future Games like 'Star Citizen' need this kind of economy mechanics.
proposalTitle: Native Token API for Game Devs

assessmentNote: Well detailed proposal. Big project, hard to assess whether the proposer can pull it off.

assessmentNote: The proposal addresses the Fund 5: Grow Africa, Grow Cardano challenge. It addresses How Cardano can reach more people in Africa and Asia by offering Payroll solution products that integrate Hiring with Paying Government Employee

I found it very difficult to understand who is the author of this proposal. Is it John, Jason? Just as I did not understand who he is, I also did not know what his background would be. But if it is John, he is a person who has experience with AI, which is essential to carry out the project. It would be beneficial to make it clearer who the author is, what he does, and also if he intends to form a team, etc.

It is likely for this proposal to be implemented because the project plan is good. The team has experience and plan to hire more experienced engineers to build the hiring solution on top of Cardano Blockchain while offering the services to the government across Africa and Asia.

More detail should be provided on how it will be implemented and why employers would accept the provided metrics and employees payment in ADA. Could they not be paid in their local currency or a stable coin (or at least have that option) and the metadata recorded on the block chain?

This is one of the weaker dApp use cases for the main reason you can create an NFT "ticket" and distribute them on the blockchain in an app already today, just using metadata/token minting. You dont need a decentralized contract for this in fact it arguable works worse in a decentralized way since you only would want a single issue (the event host) to be able to issue new tickets.

Please complete this proposal with a timeline, budget, metrics and some technical explaners.

The benefits from the discord partnership could improve some aspects of the discord experience for the Catalyst community, but most of them are not functional, but rather cosmetic - vanity URL, fancy partner server badge, animated server icon etc. Some additional information regarding which of the perks they view as being the ones that make a difference would give some beneficial insight.

I believe that the perks and benefits are good, but they are not essential to increase the engagement with participants in the community. I'm not sure if there are other benefits in being partner with Discord that were not mentioned in the text, but I see that the 2 servers bots are the most usable perks among them. The reward for active user is also a good incentive, but it might be difficult to make fair decisions by  2 people only, since there is a lot going on in the Discord server. Anyway, the budget is quite low and this might be a good experiment.

The team has not provided links to their prior experience, though they are indeed very active members on the Catalyst discord server. It is hard to assess their knowledge based only on their admin status and activity on discord. Otherwise, the proposal is easy to understand and seems reasonably easy to implement.

The proposal is completely feasible based on the proposer's experience. Although, I don't see these improvements in the Discord server being responsible for increasing the number of community members significantly, since they would affect them only after they have already signed up, so I'm not sure how this would impact the growth rate of new members, so if the current growth projection does not show that 7000 will already be there after 6 months, the only reason to increase the number of members would be the possibility to receive rewards for participation, but I'm not sure how effective this would be to solve the problem. But I believe it is worth trying since the required budget is low.

The plan is not really all that clear on how the rewards scheme will be decided. Is this just on the proposers opinion? There is no plan on how they intend to reach the goal of 7000 users. How do unexpected rewards drive meaningful participation?

The goals after 3, 6 and 12 months are clear. It should be good to have some way to measure members activity and their contributions, so there is a basis to reward them and to justify the reward instead of only a subjective decision made by an admin. It should also mention the time span in which the rewards would be distributed, for example, would it take 12 months? Or less? Rewards should be publicly disclosed to improve accountability.

The information provided was easy to follow although I feel there is some leeway required to allow for further iterations that are likely to develop with application. The proposal overall represents a real application of the community in action developing an improved user interface that hopefully improves onboarding for newcomers to the community.

I would welcome a bit separated structure for this project with more pre-research part. Identify the studios who would join and spend some amount of the dedicated budget onto and than based on the result modify the following plans. This way the roadmap would become more leaner and if the 1st phase of identifying the first adapters becomes successful the later actions can be simply followed, audited and measured.

The proposer clearly has inside technical and managerial experience from IOHK where he worked as Product Manager.This would imply full familiarity with the Cardano ethos, Haskell foundations, philosophy and general IOHK operations and vision. I think this is a clear advantage for the proposer. 
The IOHK website still hosts a webpage with information, confirming that he worked there:
https://iohk.io/en/team/rob-cohen
It states that "Rob joined IOHK after completing one of the company's Haskell courses in 2018.... He previously served in the military ... bachelor's degree in computer science and mathematics from Columbia  ... .bachelor's in economics and political science from Brown University.... Studying part-time at Georgia Tech to earn his master's degree in computer science...
So the relevant skill and experience seem to be in place. 
Although the proposal does not break down the budget into components (a potential weakness as the Community Advisor Assessment Guide asks that the budget be outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items). Fortunately, the proposer did respond to a comment about the budget and stated that he would be required to pay 25-30% of this amount in taxes plus some funds would be used for overhead for a web presence and ensuring that legal precautions are taken. So, we have some budget breakdown provided - although not a full one. Also the unspecified funds for overhead and legal precautions - should be quantified. 
As regards future maintenance costs, the proposer does consider that (also in the comments) - and he maintains that if the API changes and ongoing development will be needed to support multi-assets - "a startup could be formed that would make this service hosted"... 
I didn't see a proposed timetable to complete the work. The proposal  would have been stronger if it included information on the timetable with clear milestones linked to time.

assessmentNote:
SDKs constitute the corner stone of any dev ecosystem. This proposal aims to provide an SDK for iOS and OSX developers making Cardano an option for all these existing developers, given the reach of Apple's devices there is no doubt that this proposal perfectly addresses the dev eco system challenge.

Without SDK, each developer needs to reinvent the wheel in order to solve common problems instead of focusing on their real project.

A quality SDK ensures reliability for all the application depending on it and rapid development. The availability of an SDK is many time what will make the difference when choosing a platform to develop on. Since there are many other blockchain projects competing with Cardano, the more SDKs there are the better.

The author has been diligent in preparing a proposal that has as much information as possible but is it the right information? I really like this concept but am struggling with the risk/reward aspect of starting the project from scratch. I feel the proposer needs to source a ready made team that doesn't require this level of funding until they are at the stage where the project has been designed and is ready to launch.
proposalTitle: Devs for Awarenes Event West Africa

assessmentNote: I do miss here some credentials. I acknowledge the attempt to pay a professional for graphics and editing, however since this is an educational channel and it seems that it's not just someone explaining some content, but creating a story behind each content, it might to be necessary to have a group to help writing the story and the content and help to direct.

The proposer outlines how trending incentives (e.g. NFTs) can be combined with social/environmental causes while proposing novel incentives like animal encounters that could be possibly be implemented in the future. If this type of reward is viable is yet to be seen but the idea is certainly refreshing and likely very impactful to supporters. This DApp would bring increased utility to Cardano and would drive adoption. While the link to the Africa challenge is there (the proposer says so himself), animal conservation is also an interest in developed nations and has global utility. The TL;DR is on this page, for more in-depth details, make sure to refer to the pdf.

I think this is one of the main problems for Catalyst to start having a lot of engaged users. It is all a bit messy, different sources of information, and it is difficult to know what is going on when with different funds. The process is a little complicated, and we need a single page with all necessary information to know how we can get involved. If you are new, or haven't been on here in a few weeks it is very easy to be a bit confused about what is actually going on and how you can actually do things to help the whole community.

From what was described in the proposal, the only technical complexity would be the development of the website, which requires a developer, the rest of the proposal requires involvement, research and understanding of Catalyst. The experience described by the team indicates the ability to perform the task. I recommend including links so that the community has access to more information about Jakob and Ben, so that the community can check their qualifications transparently. Recalling that the team has a proposal in this same challenge that deals with the creation of a webpage with details about the teams, so the members themselves are well aware of the importance of having details of the proposers and even so they forgot to include this information. It is important to note that the project is already under development and the team is already adding information about the updates, which shows commitment.

There is a confusing aspect to the plan, the creation of a calendar, information and documentation will require constant updating and the budget describes funding for only 3 weeks of work. How will be the update of this information? This is not clear. There is a mention that in the long run more information will be added, but would that involve more funding?

The point is that to understand the feasibility of the budget, there must be clear deliverables, if the budget is only intended to create a calendar and aggregate information (something that is subjective and unclear in the proposal description) I believe that budget is unreasonable and above what is necessary.

In any case, it is not possible to be sure because the deliverables are not clear and there is no clarity as to whether the updates are included in the budget.

Although the objectives on the roadmap are clear, I miss a clearer date guided information. All the content is feasible in approximately in 3 weeks, but it does not comprehend a start or end date, nor how much time in each step. It would be easier to understand if it was more explained.
Nevertheless, I think that the success metrics list could be more compliant with the challenge objective.
When we put "qualitative feedback" on the use of the platform, we have a metric about the platform and not about how the platform engaged people to commit with the Catalyst Project. 
Maybe a good way to measure if the people using the platform are committing with the Catalyst Project and if the platform is bringing new people to the project is to add a little survey before and after each fund, which elucidate to the platform if the person who is using the platform is new to the project, if (s)he engaged in it, if the platform helped him to understand and embracing the project, etc.

The proposal goes very well with the objectives of the challenge, as it aims to better educate and guide users about their legal rights with regard to metadata. This would be done from an app, which, as explained in the proposal, would follow several steps to demonstrate the content, approaching it through different aspects.
