Having this data will allow the community to decide whether or not to continue funding these hubs for future grows, or if self-sustainability should be demanded. Furthermore, stating that Cardano is building technology for the blockchain-savvy population only is misguiding.  Current Cardano Ambassadors serve a good role of foot soldiers who can educate their own communities and continue aiding to the organic growth of the ecosystem.

Small businesses are the backbone of our economy and without them we'd have oligopolies, like Amazon and Uber are becoming, in complete control. This proposal will be a success if the game plan is adhered to, and gamification is actually implemented.
The idea is solid but the proposal is skinny. If more were presented, it would be easier to envision how this will be implemented.

I really did not see much advantage to have this kind of product. It's just another method to do one thing that can already be done without taxes, depending on your money exchange. 
If you had a card which gives cashback in ADA would be more interesting.
In my opinion it required a ot of time and funds to realize this project and carries a lot of uncertainties for success and even then it might fail because of the absence of marketing skills

Since the challenge is focused in the end-user in 2021 (or the next few years) I think this project has low impact. The data nowadays is that a very low percentage of BTC, e.g., is actually used to buy goods, since the currency is in its young stages – it is still growing in value and gaining maturity to actually become a tradable. Therefore, I think that in these few years to come by this won't be of much value.
Other than that, I would be useful to find some key metrics to analyze.
proposalTitle: Cardano Support for Point of Sale

assessmentNote: It will require a good development team and a plan. I am missing a thorough plan right now

A decentralized exchange to swap Cardano native tokens will improve the circulation and utility of the tokens. There is a strong need to establish Native Token DEX as soon as smart contracts are in place.

The proposers have the domain and technical experience to deliver this project and have detailed how they will do so. As it is expanding their current commercial product that would have a string incentive to deliver the project.

This proposal addresses Cardano Fund 5: Developer Ecosystem. The project proposal is solid and can impact many people seeking to pay for services and product without paying a large transfer fee to a third party.
Sufficient information is provided in the proposal. Thoughtful responses in the comment section further warrant the highest score.
It is a good idea how to make cardano more known, and thus to increase number of proposals, but Ads can be blocked, filtered and skipped. So the outcome does not have to be that positive as expected.

The proposal is well written and the team behind seems to be hard at work at succeeding. Maybe the key message for the campaign could be changed from " Up to 15M$ every 6 weeks for different challenges", so as not to send out the wrong message? People who join Catalyst don't join for the money, but for the funding of new, competitive projects that would benefit the entire community.

It seems reasonable based on the budget. The team looks committed and ready to do this when they get the funding. Targeting an audience that already know about blockchain seems easy, there are a lot of crypto youtubers for example. And then they can put the ad on more general entrepreneurial channels to attract people from the second group.
The plan is very detailed and the experience relevant to the proposal. A considerable amount of effort was put in presenting the proposal and this surely helps with trust.

Roadmap and milestones seem to be very well defined, the main objective of the project seems to be adequate. The project could have a better explanation of the total hours that will be assigned to each of the project participants.

I feel that the proposer certainly has the skillset required to get the project up and running. The plan appears straightforward if somewhat open ended in terms of the big picture use cases that might be applicable to such a Dapp. The budget is light on detail but seems moderate in relation to requested funds.

The facility of "Proof of Existance" as a service can result in various spin-off innovations. The proposal aims to develop a security verified system that will offer PoE as a service, a core fundamental use case of metadata; therefore, the proposal addresses the challenge comprehensively.

The team is highly accomplished. Beautiful and well crafted images and animation. But the actual content for the story is somewhat vague, in terms of how is using the blockchain going to be presented. There are so many possibilities, that go beyond finance. If this will only address finance, then this should perhaps be stated explicitly. Otherwise it becomes more of a political statement about forms of government. Which is fine. But it is not about the educating people on the uses of blockchain.
Will there be only one token for each artwork? That might not generate much funds. Maybe each piece could have numbered NFTs in a run of 10 or 100.

The connection of the proposer contacts with the linked institute is unclear for me. I would maybe expect some previous occasions or if this is the first time, some more detailed plan from organisation point  of view. Attendance information is also, missing, what everything the required costs are covering. How the youngsters will be selected, how they'll know about. Will it be free, or the requested founds are for orga only? These points would be necessary to answer in order that the proposal succeeds in my eyes.

The team has laid out the general direction, the amount of videos per week they intend to produce and a roadmap for all the content. Given all the details, the proposal seems feasible and will probably attract like-minded entrepreneurs.
Information is enough but I think anyone could make a system like this for way less funding

The project per total has clear verifiable metrics, yet the proposal is only for the first phase of the entire project, which has 3 in total. For this first phase, there is not enough information that would help the community assess it, leading to the possibility of the project not being finished.

The proposal did identify a scope, timeline, and budget which was broken down. this could be used to audit the success of the proposal. However, it there is little to show for a plan for audit of the code.
There aren't any links included that would attest the team's experience. The plan does not state what happens with the USD8000 after the ADA is sold.

The goal of the proposal is to sell the USD8000 worth of ADA in-person or through social channels, a strategy that is hard to investigate and keep track of. Regardless of the situation Ethiopia, there will have to be better ways to help people buy ADA than this.
This is a relatively simple plan which will add to the ecosystem and the proposer should be able to deliver.

Difficult to assess fully given the lack of information and lack of fully described plan and budget. I also note that the author raised concerns with the community that were not fully addressed. This proposal may benefit from ongoing discussions with community members for further consideration in subsequent funding rounds.
proposalTitle: Cashout and Buy ADA in Ethiopia

assessmentNote: The plan is relatively simple, however there is are a lot of complexities from a regulatory standpoint in physical ADA to FIAT. The proposers have listed "Key Connections" as relevant experience. It is impossible to judge this and thus whether the proposal will be implemented successfully.
proposalTitle: Cashout and Buy ADA in Ethiopia

assessmentNote: Basis of the project is decentralised art marketplace, yet the decentralisation is pushed to future work. Please describe how this will work. There is a heading legality issues - solved, but the text shows it is a work in progress.  It would seem this idea needs some more work to figure out how it will fulfil its desire to become decentralised.

One of the most mature proposals what I've seen till now. I like that the proposers didn't gave up on their idea, followed up and reworked it. The proposal has a big potential and it addresses the problem very precisely. From scalability point of view it also holds a lot of potential for further expansions.

The proposers have reliable experience and the budget brake down and milestones are also realistic. As risk I see an acceptance / open attitude from the charity organisations. They usually impacted by some government and higher circles, thus it might be hard to assign any of them. Beside in some cases the people who make donations wants to stay anonymous , that part is also lost, shall be calculated with it.
A newsletter could indeed help already interested people stay updated on what happens in Cardano / Catalyst, thus improving brand awareness and the reach of initiatives

The author claims to work directly with business leadership and writing written content for developers and CEOS, which fits perfectly with his proposal. Also attached to his LinkedIn profile, where you can see some places he has studied and some examples of his work. Thus, someone is shown to be competent to take the lead of the project. Regarding the formation of time, the author is interested in including some volunteers from the community and editors. What was not very clear to me is whether these volunteers would work for free or be paid, which would be right for me.

The plan is very detailed, the budget is partitioned, milestones and deliverables are there. Success metrics are sensible and clearly defined. It is definitely easy to see if this project met the goals it had at the start and there is enough information even for starters to judge the feasibility of it (e.g. pros and cons, why a newsletter, personal information about proposer)

This proposal directly addresses the challenge by 'injecting vitality and diversity' into the Cardano / Project Catalyst community.  It presents live 'Hands-on' events in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia focused on several tech hubs and established institutions, such as a local University.   Additionally, this proposal is an example of a 'multi platform proposer outreach campaign' because it includes social media ads, posters and flyers, and traditional media.  I feel this proposal will bring new members (developers / entrepreneurs / academics) into the community, increase media coverage and increase the quality of proposals.

The proposal team seem quite motivated and have the necessary experience required to deliver on this proposal. The plan is reasonably straightforward and does not hold too many risks to be achieved. I would like to see further information about all team members and what they bring to the project.

The lead proposer demostrates in the comments that he is community oriented and dedicated to this project.  The project is 'on-going' and, if funded, will increase it's scope and effectiveness.  There is a growing team of implementers and is connected to several existing networks in the pivotal city of Addis Ababa.  There are metrics and goals by which to measure success.  I believe that this team and this project will bring real, 'hands - on' value to our community.

The information was sufficient to allow insight into what the team are trying to achieve. It would have been good to see a mock up of the flyers that are being touted. In addition the budget would have benefitted by having greater detail especially in regard to the Part-time salaries requested.

The proposal addresses the challenge of the lack of resources in east Africa for the East African community to be aware of Cardano. A detailed description is needed. Still, the current stage of this proposal needs more developmental descriptions to elaborate on the project's overall core mission while providing more context to the general audience.

There is no technical documentation included in the proposal, there is a mention of an existing tokenized ticket system they plan to build to but with no detail into the mechanics of the system they are building this presented plan is not very compelling.

This is a large proposal at 60k. As with many NFT-DAO related projects, the specific direction of these funds are not detailed. However, there is a detailed road map for the project and defined success reporting and 3, 6 and 12 months. A fully operational product is expected within 6 months.

The proposer effectively addresses the challenge by outlining a game that would bring users into the Cardano ecosystem. The usage of tokens in the way described would be an interesting use case to see how this is handled by a wallet's UI (i.e. would you need some way to filter the various tokens per project). The game that is described is something that I would definitely be interested in playing and have no doubt that it would similarly attract others as well.

The proposal aims to increase the types of tokens used by a single app (both fungible and non-fungible) and have a mechanism to encourage daily use of those tokens. The type of application proposed has the potential of encouraging a dedicated following.  In addition, this proposal has the opportunity to solve challenges that could be of benefit to the Cardano community as a whole.

The proposal is several hundred words long, yet at the end of it I still wasn't sure what it was exactly about. Would there be 2 online meeting between Slush and the proposer on behalf of IOG, while one of them would be a "mentoring session focused on hands-on advice on building companies". Who needs advice to build a company? IOG? The description should focus first on describing what the event is in clear terms, without too much emphasis on marketing speech.
More information could be given as to how this proposal impacts the wider community rather than a small number of DAO's who could conceivably communicate effectively already.

The proposal is clear however more details regarding the objectives and measures of success would improve the proposal. If publishing finds is the principal objective, how will utilization of these finds be measured?

This proposal address the clear (and soon to be pressing) need for assuring the reliability and performance of the oracles upon which smart contracts and other services depend. It falls squarely within the metadata challenge because it analyzes on-chain oracle metadata and also records its results as transaction metadata. (In fact, the tool could be used to measure its own reliability.) The emphasis on the transparency and the availability of the framework is righly important for building confidence it in and in the oracles that it assesses.
The proposal did not justify the necessity/relevance of the credit-risk demo for its goal of providing oracle reliability metrics.

The authors propose to monitor Dapp and oracle performance, publishing results to the blockchain. The data can later be aggregated and reported. This is a great use of metadata and will strengthen the entire DeFi/Dapp ecosystem of Cardano.

The Authors are experienced in deploying solutions in highly regulated environments. Their linkedin profiles are available. They expect to produce the deliverables in 1 month time. My only question is their familiarity/technical understanding of the blockchain aspects of the proposal. Nevertheless this looks like a team that can achieve the goals of the project.

It appears the benefits for investing are reward based,... like Kickstarter.  In the U.S. equity based options are now available to most investors. Future equity based reward opportunities could take market share away form rewards based options. Adding an equity licensing options to the roadmap could possibly drive interest and votes.    

Additional background information/options for U.S. companies: 
U.S. Securities-based Crowdfunding Under Title III of the JOBS Act , Feb. 28, 2017By: Vladimir Ivanov and Anzhela Knyazeva
Abstract:
"Title III of the JOBS Act created a new exemption from registration for Internet-based securities offerings of up to $1 million over a 12-month period.  The SEC adopted securities-based crowdfunding rules on October 30, 2015.  Issuers were able to use the new exemption beginning May 16, 2016, when the final rules became effective.  Below we present initial evidence on the offering activity in the Title III crowdfunding market for offerings initiated during May 16, 2016-December 31, 2016."
Link:
https://www.sec.gov/dera/staff-papers/white-papers/28feb17_ivanov-knyazeva_crowdfunding-under-titleiii-jobs-act.html#.YJnr4rdZZ1I.mailto
The proposal Identifies a clear and defined budget and a detailed plan for deliverables, as well as total value locked in the protocol for easy measurement of success.
Draft proposal. There is no information that allows auditability.

Again, insurance is a critical area of need but I do not see within this proposal a description of the specific insurance products, an understanding of the insurance regulations in the African nations, data or details about actuarial evaluations or risk assessments that would go into development and implementation of an insurance app. The proposal mainly asks for salaries of employees with no clear outline of what tasks each of those employees will accomplish in 2021.

My biggest concern is the long-term funding for the game. I played EOS Knights, and loved it, but it turned into a rug-pull. I was so disappointed. Also, how will fees affect gameplay? Is $9,000 enough?

A DEX is the ideal solution to encourage DeFi teams to deploy finance solutions and to scale up Cardano's DeFi ecosystem. This multi-pool DEX is particularly designed to onboard as much projects as possible within a set timeframe of 6 months. 
There is also the potential to work cross chain using an ERC-20 converter. 
The features that this DEX proposal offers are very interesting and would provide a win-win-win situation which our ecosystem aims for.

The funding through catalyst is a responsive system with build-in accountability and audit.  Allowing money to individual entities to fund proposals without community oversight can not be considered appropriate at this stage of Catalyst.

Setting a target of funding 10 proposals is the only tangible KPI. Things like "We will keep an eye on how many..." and "We look at how long it takes.." are not appropriate KPI's as the success metrics should to be defined a priori. The timeline presented is very vague. What do you mean by " at 3 months experimental mini-proposals will be operating" ? You will have mini-proposals funded ? At 6 months mark, "we are expediting the fund and project success process", how does the community measure progress against this ?

A critical problem here is national governments which control who can interact with their currencies. Look at what the US does with its currency imposing sacntions and blacklists on individuals, companies and countries and imposing large fines and threat of removal from the ability to conduct business in USD to anyone who fails. Look at the $6 billion fine and 1 yr banning of USD transaction in NY given to Society Generale.
NFT use case proposals are worth eliciting but I think this challenge needs more thought as to its structure for encouraging them.

Since basically anyone can get proposals funded if they formulate them well, transparency and credibility of the projects needs to be ensured in order to improve trust in the catalyst process and motivate more people to partake in it. All in all, it is vital to the success of the platform to demonstrate that good behaviour will becrewarded and caah grabbers don't have a chance.

This is an excellent idea for a challenge. Catalyst offers an incomparable advantage for proposers looking to develop on the Cardano blockchain, when pitted against more traditional funding models. However, there currently is not a robust system for auditing proposals once they have been funded. Given the lack of standard requirements for auditing across all proposals, this is an area ripe for development. With a comprehensive auditing process in place, voters can rest much easier knowing that the money being allocated is spent in an accountable manner with clear reporting mechanisms.

This is I think good feedback for the Catalyst process  but not something that needs to be undertaken by a challenge for proposals for Treasury funds. It might be better reworked as a proposal within a separate challenge in respect of how to improve the Catalyst / governance process, to the extent that this is not already being thought about within the Catalyst project. It might be that a proposal for a prize fund for best executed projects could incentivise those who have had proposals funded, and that might be a simpler thing to recommend.

Some aspects of the proposals might be easy to understand and to audit, but technical knowledge will be needed in order to audit smart contracts, for example. It might not be easy to do that, but some people in the Catalyst community might have this capability. This can also bring new players to Catalyst community, people interested in developing audit systems and professional auditors.

Suggested key metrics are good. Since solutions will be implemented to audit Catalyst proposals, they could compete have some overlap to compare the efficiency of different systems auditing the same proposal. Another interesting metric would be the cost per audition, which would make it easier to compare competitors that present the same audit quality.

Data from previous funds points to the fact that people are willing and eager to drive the adoption and education to further promote Cardano. It would be worthwhile to give these projects a fair chance of proving their worth and then decide whether or not it is feasible to further invest in this approach. At the moment, there are many different outlets for Cardano to propagate organically.
What might be improved on this system is that my ADA will be sold directly against fiat, but only when I need it for actual payment for a purchage. Then then it is staked or lend (for interest)
The proposal clearly describes and attacks the problem by tokenisation and increased transaction amounts through service. Scalability is also possible.
Performance indicators seems right. Bug fixing might welcome some buffer time, but in overall it is a good project proposal.
Budget breakdown and milestones are provided. KPIs are not povided, but with the nature of the proposal, the funded proposals are a natural fit.

This project takes an existing centralised application and applies to in a decentralised way on the Cardano blockchain. This would drive a large number of users to interact repeated with the blockchain.

The proposers have the domain and technical experience to deliver this project and have detailed how they will do so. As it is expanding their current commercial product that would have a string incentive to deliver the project.

The development stages of the project are well described and will allow the development of the project to be followed. The ambition of the team is to officially launch the decentralized exchange platform within a year, and this requires in the short term to complete the team.
Plan not particularly detailed. Not sure just taking things that already exist and putting them in one place rather than a few would add the most value for users in 2021.
phd 5 years of experience in the sector.yes it can work.(just maybe in the future instead of pay in ada pay in the stable coin of ada)

It is a bit strange for me that the consulting company website for which he currently work is not working http://www.msi-partner.com/ and also he is the only employee registered in this company on Linkedin, It's not clear to me, but he might be the founder. Likewise, a second company appears on its Linkedin page, of which it mentions if it was a founder called "IMOVA", this company does not exist in linkedin and does not have an associated website. In his profile webpage he says that he has been part of many companies but this is not shown in the LinkedIn profile. Strange. The two teammates have full time jobs. So you can infer that they will not be 100% dedicated to the project.
The team's experience in online marketing campaigns is quite clear, not only from their CVs, but they have also laid out a detailed plan proving that they are familiar with the costs and the process.
Very well outlined proposal, with roadmap and important success metrics. They have described what they will do and what kind of impact they expect.
It is definetly a good idea to rech for students directly. Young-driven minds can definitely increase the evolution of Cardano ecosystem.

It is unclear from the proposal how advertisement campaigns and twitch streams contribute to attract the brightest entrepreneurs to Catalyst. Higher education in India, China, US, and top 100 universities for devs looks different and it is unclear what market the twitch streams (if even effective) would reach. This proposal may be more suited to support people that just made it into the space, but not necessarily to attract new minds.

Since this is purely marketing driven and allocated budget appears to be more for personal use ($1,500 for hardware/software?), I see a severe lack of information on how this proposal would actually be implemented to reach outreach goals.
It is not clear how feasible the plan is. 10% response rate on unsolicited direct mail seems high.

Without any universities coming on board, they have no data. Would this project be considered a success if they build the software but don't populate it with any data or link to any university systems.
The proposal is an experiment worth trying since, if successful has a huge scope for scaling. There is every increasing demand for a decentralized market for physical items.
The experience listed and the Github profile does not convey much reason to believe that this proposal can be successfully implemented in the allotted time.
The proposer showed his skills already on other projects for catalyst (ca guidelines) and the references are also convincing.
KPI/Metric and Roadmap is stated and make sense. All of the are SMART (specific, measureable, activating, realistic, time-bound.)
The team behind this is experienced in webapp development and learning Plutus in the pioneer program, highly likely to successfully implement this app on schedule.
Very impressive concept that focusses on cultural literacy...really enjoyed researching your proposal well done!

I think budget/outcome efficiency is not so effective. Also, creating just a "movie" is one thing, another is marketing and make people watch it. I watched the trailer, and I would not go to see such a movie. 

everyone has their own taste, for sure.
A high-quality motion comic & graphic-novel with a good story would surely teach and attract a lot of youth, especially from Africa, but definitely not limited to.
maybe a number of watchers can be indicator, but if distributed worldwide, it would be not so precise, and I do not see a way /except writing down, that watching this movie brought me to cardano/.
After reading the proposal I see no questions unanswered and the fact that they have been able to source funding from other places too, is proof of their commitment and talent.
This idea is in twice. No detail on what is being developed and how honesty would be assessed.

There are no success criteria defined, so it's not possible for the community to assess impact of the proposal. The roadmap/milestones are described under the KPI section and these are tangible but very unambitious for the scope of the proposal.
The idea behind the proposal is well thought, in the spirit of the overall Cardano/Catalyst vision and has the potential to bring a diverse array of individuals to the ecosystem.
Without a plan to reach people who do not know about Cardano it is hard to see how these videos would address the challenge of bringing in new proposers from outside the community.

The team behind the proposal seems to be experienced in creating the type of content they intend to produce. The plan is reasonable, well thought and given their experience it is highly likely to succeed.
This doesn't necessarily grow the number of devs, only helps meet the demand with the offer
Please detail how this addresses the challenge. It seems like a standard real estate investment idea loosely tied to blockchain.

It is not clear why selling 8000ADA outright makes a significant impact on ADA adoption in Africa. Even if the plan is to use the 8000ADA to pay the transaction fees, the case has not been made that ADA transaction fees are a significant hurdle to ADA adoption.

Making the ability to purchase ADA easier and more reliable to people who may not have an exchange account, or no desire to create one, would almost certainly lead to a wider adoption of the Cardano ecosystem and would drive user adoption.

The proposal is lacking sufficient information to really help it stand out. Most things considered by the author seem reasonable but there is little further information to work with in assessing success of the proposal. It strikes me as the sort of proposal that needed to have already had the wheels set in motion prior to application for funds.
Yes, problem statement is clear, methodology and project timeline forecast is clear. It is easy to audit the  project later. Project scope is not too big.

Challenges mentioned are inability to trade ADA to local currency in Ethiopia and payment system which can transact in ADA.

Proposal only tackle one issue which is an Exchange to convert ADA to local currency.

The other challenge which to pay and transact using ADA is not clearly mentioned.
proposalTitle: Cashout and Buy ADA in Ethiopia

assessmentNote: Experience and skills seem to be eligible. More proof would be nice to have.
proposalTitle: Cashout and Buy ADA in Ethiopia

assessmentNote:
Initially proposer is working on this project alone until he invited two others to jump in.

Project can be implemented successfully on the first idea, a place where locals can buy or sell ADA in their local currency. The second objective which had not been mentioned the implementation plan is doubtful.
proposalTitle: Cashout and Buy ADA in Ethiopia

assessmentNote: Some metrics are not measurable, most of them are. Good proposal overall.
proposalTitle: Cashout and Buy ADA in Ethiopia

assessmentNote: This proposal tackles a subject that could bring a lot of attention to the Cardano ecosystem, either in a positive light or in a negative one if it does not succeed, for a reason or another. Transparency, scrutiny and as much information as possible beforehand is crucial. While the plan is explicit, it doesn't get into as many details as I would have hoped, especially considering their proposal. The fact that they ask for a small budget, that would only cover the first 6 months until they would get their business going, does alleviate some of the concerns.
proposalTitle: Cashout and Buy ADA in Ethiopia

assessmentNote: Proposer had already list the success measurement. It is an objective oriented and can be measured easily during the audit in the future.
proposalTitle: Cashout and Buy ADA in Ethiopia

assessmentNote: There is no plan. it is unlikely to be successful.
nft-maker.io has working product already. Chances are very hight that they deliver the full product.

When disruptive and transformational technologies roll out, it's the teams of motivated individuals who progress the effort. Risk takers that take the time to learn and create utility where there was none, start to pave the way for the rest of us. Trust and transparency in NFTs will help drive greater adoption and continued need for this type of service. Anti-piracy, certified guarantee, certified collectibles, memorabilia grading type companies and the list goes on, will be looking to incorporate this type of application into their business model. The NFT market is just budding and Cardano should be the vehicle of choice. The Cardano community needs a win with NFT development and to gain adoption and trust on its blockchain.  This project should receive investment to help enable web portal improvement, usability, trust and overall success with the Cardano ecosystem. Bottom line...they already have a working product.
Having qualified open-source experts available to support catalyst proposer is a very good fit for the challenge.

This project will definetely provide a lot of purpose to a lot of people if implemented. The proposal is very well-written, explains exactly the purpose, the functions and the obstacles and is very detailed and transparent. Kudos!

This is exactly the type of idea that I feel meets community expectations. The team have arrived at an excellent application that addresses a societal issue. The proposal may grow in terms of application with further refinement but at this stage appears a well thought out starting point.

This initiative sounds really good and the fact that the team has already started working on it, means they are passionate about reaching as many people from Addis Ababa and helping them discover the potential of Project Catalyst.

The proposal appears to be a small scale localised initiative that targets an appropriate market. The team are coordinating their program with further activities scheduled for Ethiopia. The proposal meets the challenge.

In terms of the Roadmap, please provide some dates. For content: what content are you planning on creating? How many by when? How do you plan on delivering these content resources? Will it be in person or online?

The idea behind the proposal is good I understand it as something minecraft like with finite ressource. The proposer says he has to watch his ideas not to get out of control. It still happened a little. It is hard to tell how this game is gonna be able to scale. But a game does always bring a good network effect to a ecosystem.

A well designed NFT game could successfully onboard new participants in the Cardano Ecosystem.  The proposer claims to have extensive experience in the gaming industry which would benefit the design and marketing of the product.
The proposers have background in the area and should have the skills to deliver. They are also asking for a very small sum.
Based on the experience of the team, insight presented in the proposal, and clear scope definition there is a great chance that this will be implemented successfully.
this proposal's success would be easily tracked by whether or not the metadata schema is added to the blocks, and whether the data is explorable.
Doesn't address growing number of developers on Cardano, just provides an alternate way for project financing

The proposal is for ErgoDEX (which has not yet launched on Ergo yet) to rebuild there contracts in Plutus. The team is using AgeUSD as an example of there ability to port Ergo contracts to Plutus even though the AgeUSD Plutus contract is FAR from complete (and the team admits this). It feels a bit of a stretch to say they are going to take a significantly more complex protocol in a DEX and deploy it in Plutus in the next 6 months (which is the entire point of the DeFi challenge, scaling up cardano's DeFi dApps in the next 6 months)

This brings valuable DeFi functionality to the Cardano ecosystem.  The potential synergy with the Ergo blockchain offers value and an on-ramp for innovation for DeFi applications on Cardano.  

The development and implementation timeline is well-aligned with Cardano's Alonzo mainnet launch, which would capitalize on and contribute to overall Cardano awareness and demand.
DEX is the core of DeFI. The approach is innovative with a mix of AMM and order-book exchanges.
As i understadn from reading in their chats and github, they are mainly working on finishing the UI with most of the backend dev finished so it seems it will certainly be completed.

The team has no experience building Haskell code in Plutus and the timeline to deliver this DEX on Cardano is 1 year. That is not effectively meeting the challenge when their are other DEX proposals in this challenge building directly on Plutus now.

Experience of team is impressive and the proposal is well-thought through and realistically outlined.  Alignment with Cardano's evolution is well-considered and delivery milestones are reasonable, given the resources outlined.  The detailed, professional and focused proposal builds confidence in the ability of the team to deliver.

Future development directions and funding plans seem reasonable, but greater confidence of success would come from inclusion of marketing and community support resources to support growth.
The proposal is very well thought out and leaves no stone unturned within the details of the proposal.  All questions I could think of were answered within the proposal.

Once the server gets extremely big, bots might sure help to organize the discord server if properly programmed. Since the activity on the server is still relativeely low at the moment, it needs to be determined whether this is neccessary already.

I believe that, since there is currently no restriction regarding roles assignment, the process could very well be automated and this would save admin's time, which they could use to focus on more productive work. It's a small improvement, but since the budget is small as well, it is appropriate.

Auditability current is one of the aspects of Catalyst that is less known by its participants. Every fund the question about funded proposals is raised. And as mentioned in the challenge, auditability will be overwhelming for IOG alone to perform in the following funds. This challenge really is needed. Budget also is good so we have different proposals competing and alternatives to audit funded proposals.

This proposal covers the essence of Charles H.'s view of accountability, almost absent from the discussion to date. What is there to say? If properly promoted, it should attract interest from teams of community members and (as is the goal) 3rd party Quality assurance agencies (some for profit some not for profit).

Given the current Cardano's trajectory of growth and its aim to become fully decentralized in terms of operations (Voltaire era), it is crucial that the community learns to self-regulate and control. The proposed challenge setting will give members a chance to come up with clever ways to establish a clear and fair feedback loop between funded projects and the voting members. This will enable the community to reach sustainability early on to ensure long term success.

Great idea and something the community should be looking to brainstorm on. We cannot move to continued decentralisation of governance and funding without check and balances to ensure funded projects are delivered and held accountable. It is important that we don't make the same mistakes twice. to do this we need to measure what we have done and hold projects and their proposers accountable. Its fine for projects to fail. Its not fine to have subsequent projects make the same mistakes.

As the proposer mentions, as the number of proposals increase per fund it could become overwhelming for IOG to audit everything. For this reason it's important ( but perhaps not critical) for the community to start thinking about this, and setting it as a challenge would be an appropriate way to promote that.

The proposer has a great understanding of what they would like to see in terms of audibility metrics for future projects. If these features are established, with more time and data this list can be expanded upon. 
The suggested budget for the challenge is a great starting point to get things moving in the right direction.
The KPI's described are relevant to the challenge and would allow the community to measure the progress of proposals arsing from this challenge

The proposal lays out success criteria and suggested metrics to be measured. What is provided in the proposal is clear and is a good place to start. Given the diversity of challenges already active, it may be challenging to develop an auditability system that works across all. Instead, there may be interest in developing specific challenge auditability processes for each. For example, the useful auditing measures for the Proposer Outreach challenge may not necessarily align with what is required for the dApps & Integrations challenge. Some clarity could be useful whether the intent is for a broader auditability process across all challenges or for specific ones. This would provide additional confidence that the challenge is able to be measured appropriately.

The team does provide a vision of the project's implementation. I will quote here" YaySwap is more than just a platform to swap assets; here are some fascinating features about our project:" 

However, the features in my view are too general and lack meat on the bones. This is primarily a technical project (DApp) and it should be heavy on technical aspects if it is to compensate for the lack of the documented experience of the team. 
 As it stands now, it seems like the proposers do have the vision for what could be a solution, but lack a full blown technical and operational plan. 

Receiving and sending crypto requires compliance with some rules and also requires support teams that are available and also could lead to legal exposure if problems are incurred. Some aspects of the proposal gloss over the risks and challenges. 

Unfortunately, for a project of this scope it may seem unsatisfactory that the team is anonymous and that the team apparently needs to outsource all key technical components ("If you have experience with Plutus, developing smart contracts, react, java, c++, or a good UI/UX designer and like our project, send us your resume ").

As regards anonymity, the telegram group of the proposal states that "Due to legal concerns, the team has chosen to be semi-anonymous at the moment. " - which indicates a problem of legal nature - which undermines the likelihood of this proposal's successful implementation.

Before submitting a proposal for a DEX that will involve other people's assets and funds, I would expect the proposers to resolve any outstanding legal issues that require them to retain anonymity. 

The risk to the proposers may be grave, serious or minor, but as the proposal stands - the risk of jeopardizing Catalyst treasury funds - is then equally serious. This unresolved legal jeopardy for the proposing team makes it unlikely the proposal will be implemented successfully, as the issues has not been resolved by the time of my assessment.

Furthermore, this legal issue should have been well presented, detailed and fleshed out in the proposal itself. The fact that it is not addressed well in the proposal itself, is a problem. I had to search through the Telegram group to find these risks and threats to the project. 

As it stands, the proposers are only hinting to it in general terms in the Telegram chat group (http://t.me/yayswap) - which means that I can only guess about how serious it is. This reduces the likelihood of the proposal's viability to a minimum in my eyes.

The experience described in the proposal covers the team's qualifications in - Computer science / Software engineering, Full Stack Development, Crypto Experts.

There is no information about the team's experience in developing smart contracts, there is no information about the team's experience with Plutus or if they are participating in the Plutus Pioneer Program.

The people who will participate in the project have not been described and there is also no reference or link to check the team's qualifications, which makes it difficult to judge the team's viability and aptitude in successfully executing the proposal. I recommend that this is detailed and that it is informed how many people will develop this project and details of these people.

The plan describes a clear roadmap with objective goals, but several details need to be clarified:

What is the purpose of launching a token before dapp is released?

The plan lacks some information to be viable, such as:

There is no definition of an economic model to be implemented at DEX and this is one of the main factors in any DEX.

The described wrapped assets model is extremely centralized, which creates dependency on contract administrators. Wrapped tokens are an unresolved problem, at Ethereum there are several BTC tokens, but most involve centralized solutions, where developers have access to the private key of the original BTC and could simply apply an exit scam and take all the money. The point is that wrapped assets do not yet have an ideal model and it is important to make the risks clear, mainly because we are talking about DeFi and the idea is decentralization and not pseudo decentralization.

Several security risks were not considered, such as:

-Lack of audit on smart contracts.
-Risk of centralization of smart contracts in developers (so far they are anonymous and this is a considerable risk)
-There is no definition of an economic model to be implemented at DEX and this is one of the main factors in any DEX.

Considering the fact that the purpose is to be a fully decentralized DEX, there is no mention of creating a governance model. A dapp controlled by the developers is not DeFi, it is true that a project needs centralization in the beginning to be developed, but the absence of a governance distribution plan is a problem that needs to be addressed.

An important point to note is that the YAYSWAP team conducted an IDO on the Exmarkets lauchpad (https://exmarkets.com/launchpad/yay-btc) that week and raised $ 600,000 USD. According to the link, 2,040,000 YAY tokens were sold, with a soft cap of $ 60,000 and traded at a price of $ 0.25USD, for a total of 240,000 YAY tokens sold in thatsoft cap amount. The rest of the tokens (1,800,000) were sold for $ 0.30USD. This can be verified in the link above.

I am not taking into account the fact that the team raised money in an IDO, this aspect does not influence my score. The reason I am including this information in the assessment is for transparency to voters, as the team raised a considerable amount of funds outside of Catalyst and this is not described in the proposal, although the team has published it on Twitter.

There is not enough information on how the wrapped token are secured. Are the original BTC and ETC held to 100% back the wrapped tokens? Otherwise this risks being a wrapped token printing machine. There is little detail on how and when all the mechanics are being done. A more detailed plan with benchmarks would be useful to allow auditing of progress and thus asses likelihood of success.

The proposal tries to achieve a lot. It provides a short roadmap which is helps to get an idea on how you plan to do your progress. To really do a good assessment for the voters it would help if you submit a well structured step-by-step plan with clear milestones. Possible challenges are not included in the proposal.  The proposal could overall be a lot more detailed which would help to see in which direction the development is going.

With the purposeful anonymity of the proposers according to the proposal's Telegram group, ("At the moment we are semi anonymous until we have settled everything and have legally the right to operate a DEX") and ( "A DEX is not something easy to legally start this is why we are not fully public yet") - it will be difficult to audit the progress and the success of the proposal. 

The team may be forced to operate from the shadows if the legal situation and status remains unresolved, which will make it very difficult to assess the proposal's progress - if they are afraid of disclosing their identities. 

I have a big issue with the unresolved legal ramifications of running a DEX - receiving other people's money - with the team based in what may seem to be a crypto-unfriendly jurisdiction that requires anonymity for the team. 

Why is this important for auditability?  

Well, the criteria requires "a clear understandable solution that addresses the problem." 

A DEX with an anonymous team that faces legal jeopardy is not "a clear and understandable solution to the problem", it is a partial solution (the idea may be good, but the proposing team may not be able to deliver) that is bringing along other problems - legal uncertainty as indicated by the proposing team. 

Hence, it would probably be best to address all legal concerns first and publish a legal opinion on the proposal's viability and auditability, as legal compliance will now be an important factor for this team and their proposal - as they have raised the issue themselves.

The proposer's submission for creating a platform to swap native tokens aligns very well with the challenge - but there is more than just alignment in order for a proposal to be effective (read below). 

Yes, the proposed decentralized exchange is a good idea - in line with the spirit of the Cardano ecosystem. The team has stated that it is working toward launching one that would be built using smart contracts. 

However that is not all. 

The F5: DApps & Integrations challenge text states that novel AND viable (!!) applications get built of top of Cardano attracting users. 
The problem that I have with this proposal is whether it is viable? So this is novel, but is it viable?
Will the team manage to attract users to the platform? WIll their efforts result in new, viable applications built on top of Cardano ... if they are unable to overcome legal hurdles? See below.
Members of the proposing team in their Telegram group (link provided in the proposal (http://t.me/yayswap) have stated that some legal concerns exist ("Due to legal concerns, the team has chosen to be semi-anonymous at the moment. More info. about the team will be shared with the community once those concerns are resolved. Please be patient.") and ("At the moment we are semi anonymous until we have settled everything and have legally the right to operate a DEX") and ( "A DEX is not something easy to legally start this is why we are not fully public yet"). Hence the team members have publicly expressed that they are facing legal issues regarding the possibility of  operating a DEX and that these issues have not been resolved yet. 
The owner of the Telegram group stated: ("Having & operating a dex has a lot of issues & legal issues which we are not fully prepared for at the moment"
Hence, a key word from the challenge "VIABLE" applications - seems to be an issue with this proposal and the owner has confirmed that the proposal is not ready yet at the moment . Maybe it would be best to sort out the legal issues, drop anonimity and resubmit in the next funding challenge, if voters do not approve the proposal in Fund 5.

This proposal addresses the challenge, but is not being open about developments and actively supporting decentralized governance at this stage. Self promoting by offering air drops, alleged early backer token sales, no code available on the github, anonymous and unverifyable skill sets, centralize the power into who ever has the keys to the wallet with the YAY in reserves. this is not decentralized at all.
Hard to asses likelihood of success. It would be great to see some proof of expertise (Who are the proposers, LinkedIn Profiles?). Do they have any financial markets experience?

This proposal has a lot of development and questions related to the team formation, the timeline to build the infrastructure for it, and ultimately supporting the tool beyond the first-year funding is created.  The funds requested may only support one year of operations and currently, this project is relying on private fundraising and donations.  The core team based off statements in the proposal would seem to have the expertise to execute a project but will need to flush out additional developers to complete it.  There still seems to be a lot of unknowns in the project as the team members' identities are still unknown and just a lot of questions to be answered about who and how this will be developed and implemented.

The timeline consists of items and milestones that are pretty open to definition, which makes it hard to evaluate the progress properly. No rationale for the budget is provided, no details on how the money is used. This makes it difficult to audit the progress of the proposal.

The problem and solution statement described is reasonable. The proposal has the potential to have a positive impact on Catalyst, but the concept of this proposal is more related to the auditability of proposals that have already been funded than to decision making, but that does not make the proposal any less important.

The availability of a history of proposals and teams of proposers and their performance in previous Funds, allows the community to have more information about recurring proposals / teams in Catalyst
The proposer pays themselves a salary and proposes launching within 5 months. code and progress will be viewable on github. We should be able to assess the success of the project using these factors.

Given that the team has good experience in web dev, that side of things is covered however there is a large risk in being able to adapt contracts from Ethereum to a fundamentally different transaction model. the team is part of the plutus pioneers program however there is risk that they will face trouble. There are also no specific dates in the plan, or recognition of milestones in progress that the project is dependent on.

There is no definition of the problem to be solved (it is implied that the problem is the lack of DEXs at Cardano, but this needs to be better communicated so that it is not subject to interpretation)

There is information that indicates how the proposal will address the challenge and promote improvements for Cardano, the development of a DEX is an essential application for the DeFi ecosystem.

There is a budget breakdown, the timeline is defined in 4 months and is within the scope of the challenge.

Relevant metrics have been defined, but KPIs have not been defined.

The proposal does not present a staged plan with intermediate goals, nor does it outline a concrete and specific technical approach. Its "detailed plan" asserts or assumes that capabilities such as the Sophia DAO or the IOHK metadata team will implement the solution.

I give a 1 for feasibility because the proposer describes that it is very difficult to become a card issuer but provides no evidence that they will be able to accomplish the task. There is no marketing plan for how to get people to use this over the already existing prepaid debit cards.
I give a 1 for auditability because the metrics identified are vague. The proposer does not indicate what values for each metric would indicate success. Time horizon uses general milestones.

The problem that I see is, the majority of streaming providers nowadays are offering their own movies – Netflix with its own prod., Disney+, HBO, YT, etc. Therefore, I'm very curious to understand how are you intending to pitch them to use this platform.

I bet you will have lots of users if there is lots of good/new movies on the platform, however I've not seen a plan for that.

Furthermore, I wish you had a more detailed budget.

Currently this is in the form of an idea with a few potential options for being technically delivered. What it need sis a technical roadmap on what will actually be built with milestones to allow progress to be monitored and success likelihood assesed.

This is good idea, but the proposer was not reply some questions from community comment, such as: How will you custody the BTC and ETH that you're wrapping? Where does the 0.25% fee come from? is it based on some network parameters? profit feasibility? How does this compare against existing ethereum DeFi apps and Liqwid? or some thing like that.

The proposer seems to have the experience to implement this proposal. Ideally, we could see some previous video work the proposer has done, but given that the proposer has mentioned that he will rely on community feedback i'm confident good content will be produced. There is an overall emphasis on community participation, which is a strong point of this proposal. The content and structure of the tutorials are clear and well layed out and the timelines presented are realistic. The requested budget is sensible.

All deliverables are specified in enough detail to be definitively assessed for progress. However, it would have been helpful to quantify terms like "periodically", to detail what is meant by "portable", and to discuss data volumes or other numerical metrics.

Seeing the curriculum of the team and looking into the white paper, it seems to me that everything is well planned and it has the right people involved.
The only thing that I missed is to see in 'risks' the one that you do not get voted on the other fund, for example. How it would affect the project?
Other than that, I've seen that you will be needing a huge amount of money in the other phases: how are you planning to rise this amount of money (almost $3M)?

I give a 1 based on the proposal itself. It is not feasible for 10 studios by mid year and 50 by year end to be on board to directly host their content on this application. I believe a lot can be done in this year, but not what the proposal says will be done.

There is no concrete plan on what is happening technically to facilitate a stream platform. Provide a plan on what you are going to make technically, a realistic plan on how you will get content, and how you will market to end users. This is a not a space 30,000 will make an impact in this year (which is the challenge goal).

The proposer does not at all mention the ADApay solution that has already gone live and works with multiple Cardano wallets (Daedalus/Yoroi) out of the box. There is also no technical documentation describing the integration of the BTCpay protocol into Cardano.
proposalTitle: Cardano Support for Point of Sale

assessmentNote:
The proposal contains a lot of information and something audiovisual like an explanatory video is always a plus. Yet there were still some aspects not entirely clear. 
If a constraint is imposed on a transaction. Would that transaction bounce or would it pass? 
How would a 'scam address' be determined? What would stop competition from flagging eachother? 
How would the 'minimum of 1 ADA per registration' scale towards the future?
Project is feasible, though it not clear it addresses the challenge. Note there are similar proposals such as the one by NFT-DAO (in both fund 4 and fund5)

The project is complex with a multitude of steps and complete information on team size and the phases of development have not been given very clearly. There is no explicit commitment to open-source the software too. However, if the development process and the number of people working on it are clarified it will be simple to audit the progress and can monitor its implementation.
The budget is quite reasonable for the amount of work they intend to get done. They have pointed out all the necessary details and have also taken the time to make a short video pitch.

The proposal includes a budget and some details on what success looks like however it doesn't provide a timing plan prior to launch, it would be very difficult to assess the progress of the project prior to launch according to this plan.

I am giving a 1 in auditability because no key metrics or KPIs were identified foe measuring sucess. The only milestones are the broad agenda for the bootcamp given. Proposal does not explain why this boot camp addresses the challenge problem.

It is not clear that the technical side of this project has been planned and thus feasibility is an issue. Given it is being developed for a specific political party in one country, does it address the challenge of providing the most value for end users in 2021? More detail on who this would be provided to political parties (or any other groups requiring governance) around the world would be useful.

The proposal is very information-efficient. Containing all necessary elements to asses and yet not elaborating too much to keep it short and to the point. 
The roadmap exists out of milestones with a given quarter when this is expected to succeed. 
The budget breakdown is logical and set correctly to cover expected initial costs.

The proposal does not include what all mini-projects are going to be funded or the details regarding who will select the mini proposal for funding. Therefore it has no scope for assessing the suitability or the success criteria.

It is certainly useful to try to measure the ways in which the Cardano network interacts with the legacy financial system but I think the challenge needs more work to elucidate what metrics and criteria can be used to make judgements about that and to encourage specific proposals for partnerships that can engage it. It might be worth thinking for example about how to approach governments, agencies, exchanges and companies which IOHK and the Cardano Foundation have not yet had the bandwidth to approach, and ways that interaction with them could be encouraged and measured through proposals in response to the challenge.

The idea is great, but unfortunately the proposal is missing lot of data. I would prefer too see what will be the first languages targeted, why and an actual time plan about each of them. Team contents and overall project time plan would be also necessary if I would need to make a decision about. There is lot of potential in it and it would be good to work through more a bit.
This is not really a plan in itself but a request for the meta data team to build something. Even in that regards little detailed information is given
As already described, issuing a Debit card is hard to do. It requires a company with large funds and marketing skills to spread it over the world
No detailed plan provided to allow assessment of likelihood of success.
Too little documentation is provided to make a professional  audit possible
Since we are depending in some people to do the job of validating some institution, we must have some warranties of these people.

The overall project idea is definitely in scope of the challenge. However, I'm not sure whether the scope of this proposal is. The only thing I found is "the money we are requesting will go toward promotion and listing", which amounts to saying "Just give us more money".

While the idea is nice, there are more attractive tools in the works to accomplish similar things. I would see the project in a more positive light if the proposers could better demonstrate their qualifications and a technical roadmap.
The project plan presented is somewhat complete but there is o WP or technical docs describing the protocol.
The lack of documentation for a complex dapp as well as lengthy timeline need to be better addressed.

Since the project is blocked by the smart contract launch, the progress will not be fully controlled by the team, so it will not be easy to be able to audit the progress. In the timeline, it was mentioned that the team would do token launch in April 2021, but it appears that they have missed this milestone, as they just finished the public sale and airdrop events. This isn't a major concern, though.
No detailed plan, thus hard to assess likelihood of completing the parts not already done. There is a lot of complexity in building a market place. how does this work in a light wallet?
More detail required on how the marketplace functionality will be produced and how this can work with a lite wallet/
Based on the addressed comments, self-identifying credentials, and GitHub profile, the proposer is very capable in implementing the proposal successfully.
Could be useful app, but who are the clients? Who wants a white label version of this software? How will you compete with Uber, Didi etc?

Experience claims don't gel. Is this a company with 200+ developers, or one person with 5 years programing experience? Where is it being launched? Who is the client for this white label software? There is huge money spent in marketing to win this space, how will you compete?

The proposer's role in DEB is not clear. It is mentioned as a product development manager in a Linkedin Profile with the same name. The proposer has not provided his linked profile. The Identity of the 200 developers to which the proposer is referring is also not clear. However, assuming that the claims are currently pending verification, it can be assumed that the proposer and his company have the capability to implement the proposal in the right earnest.
Could be interesting if successfully implemented. However smart contracts meeting the real world is not simple.

Because the proposal is unclear on the standard to be built, the complexity is difficult to assess. While there is no lack of information, clear information is missing and thus, the proposal lacks focus and unfeasible. The information provided is insufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal.

The proposed budget seems consistent with the ambition of the initial development. A budget is foreseen for future updates to cover the evolutions of the evaluation process of proposals in future Funds. However, there is a risk of having to recreate a significant part of the video content if the process of evaluation of the proposals, which is still young, evolves.
A realistic timeline is proposed as well as tangible KPI's which will allow the community to understand what impact the videos are having on the review process of ProjectCatalyst
The Roadmap is clear and provides an in-depth, step-by-step action plan, making this project easier to audit.

Not a very detailed plan provided. This proposal is to provide functionality to a project the proposer is building (and has 2 other proposal in to cover functionality for). How feasible is is to reverse engineer uniswap, please provide evidence.

This proposal has potential if it focuses on describing its solution by identifying a specific real problem.
The current problem statement is vague and lacks precision in attracting new users to the Cardano ecosystems. It doesn't fully address fund 5 Dapps & integration objectives. Please think of these questions: Will this proposal only focus on Sri-lanka? will the data collected focus on Sri Lanka, Asia, or will it be global. How do you plan to sustain the flow of information? How will you be acquiring the data?

Great idea in terms of political analysis, but there's a huge issue. If this project receives Catalyst funding, then Project Catalyst would indirectly fund a political party and that means conflict of interest. Project Catalyst should remain neutral on political stances. So the proposal is a good idea if it were to exclude any possibility of funding a political party and just offer the service to anyone interested. I would also have sincere concerns about sharing my full political spectrum and making that public for anyone to see.

The proposal aims to onboard people onto the cardano blockchain, however the problem statement is a problem for the political parties and not the people themselves, so it's unclear how the people will benefit from being surveilled and have their info minted into the block chain without Self Sovereignty, which was never mentioned in the proposal. Self sovereignty is essential in order to be aligned with decentralization, otherwise central powers will exert power over individuals. Which would be the case here.

This is an interesting proposal of a blockchain based political party subscription service that allows a political party to gather data about its supporters and their wishes. The initial pilot is in Netherlands which seems very Cardano-friendly so I could see some success there, even though the onboarding numbers would be small at first. If the idea caught on on a larger scale, it could have a tremendous onboarding and legitimizing effect for Cardano.

The data presented in the proposal suffices in terms of metrics, budget breakdown and roadmap. What is lacking, though, is a risk assessment that is paired with making political preferences public, especially in nations where there is political instability.

It is a brilliant idea to cater the problem of the paper wallet users; security.

The idea is by having a third party (mobile apps) to validate the paper wallet.

It is an easy project with a big impact on the community.

The NFT-maker.io team is one of the first teams out of the gate, they have a working NFT maker product that is currently being utilized. Based on their existing product it appears they have the drive and skills to improve the product and adoption interest in Cardano.

Funds are broken down into certain aspects of the project. But certain cost such as Atala Prism and the sanitation workshops seem hard to estimate at this time.  20k is requested for marketplace ADA float which seems unrealistic without relevant expertise and  a clear plan for the marketplace.

As an early investor in both Cardano and Ergo, I'm very excited for this project. However, the Ergo community seems quite small and there is going to be a lot of competition from other DEXs on Cardano. What competitive advantage will ErgoDEX have? I spotted a big mistake in your proposal, "This rapid growth will ensure the popularity of the Uniswap exchange." Uniswap?!?
yes, This proposal seems to clearly outline how and when they plan to finish the project. Also i like that they do more than clone uniswap by also having an amm.

The team's experience delivering scalable DeFi dApps  on Cardano is not known. No Plutus dev resource is identified, the AMM build on Ergo is not complete and the SigmaUSD protocol deployed on Ergo was exploited. That timeline (1 year at least before going live on Cardano) is also not as competitive as the other AMM DEXs in this f5 challenge.

As the "world's operating system", Cardano needs to make headway into many communities soon. This proposal indirectly addresses the silo mentality that is prevalent in many of our blockchain competitors. To facilitate real world applications and solve the world's needs, this is an essential proposal to tap into the wisdom of the people that have no access to Cardano yet.
Whilst this is important, I am not sure this qualifies as a challenge. Also how will 0 hubs in 10 places make a significant impact for Cardano globally?

With a greater team (also because of speed of developing, testing and marketing thid might be a successful project. To keep the costs low and the commitment high, py every memeber of the team a basic salary, just for staying alive and a share of the gains after release.

This project would expand the universe of developers who could interact with the Cardano ecosystem. It meets the challenge brief by expanding the developer toolkit. More importantly it will enable more developers to build onto cardano.
This proposal lack details, and is very expensive for what it is providing.
This would be useful, though why just focus on Americans? Whilst each country has its own rules, detailed transaction reporting and valuation should be transferrable across jurisdictions.
proposalTitle: Back to Basis - Tax compliance tool

assessmentNote: This would represent a very conscious and deliberate effort by two very active members of the community to improve its processes.
As noted in the description, the dev and testing are already done. The team also seems strong, and with the extra funding, I believe they will be able to ship the product to the market successfully.

The proposal does not contain any information about the current status of the project, what was achieved so war and what the requested funds will be used for specifically to further the goals of the project.
I give a 1 for auditability because ZERO KPIs are listed.
If successful this could reach new group of people who might make proposals in future funds.
This proposal addresses Cardano Fund 5: DApps & Integrations Challenge. The project proposal is solid and can impact many people seeking to buy property with Cryptocurrency.

The basis of all decision making is to be well informed. Having good video tutorials will lower the entry barrier for new CAs and this will lead to a better general understanding of the role within the CA-community.

The proposal directly addresses the proof-of-existence and privacy aspects of the Metadata Challenge. It proposes significant new features for a rapidly maturing application that apparently is already receiving a significant level of adoption.

I give a 1 for impact because the proposal provides very little information for how they will solve the problem of cardano users needing access to a UniSwap like app. It may be true that Cardano users do need this type of application but if the only concept is to copy UniSwap then I don't see why so much money is needed to copy something else.
Education and motivation is important to drive growth of blockchain in Africa.
No key metrics were posted, and it is very tricky to trace the number of proposers to the project.
Seems to be a plan to buy land and sell /rent apartments on it. Not clear how it is a DApp.
this idea fits in the challenges, and it can maybe used later in voltaire for the cardano gouvernance
The proposal lack any detail on how to audit the progress and success of the proposal.

The idea is interesting in the sense of improving a situation that already exists. Paper wallets are, in fact, an important variable for Cardano's growth, and if the issue of security could be improved it would certainly benefit the community. I'm just not sure if this security system would be developed by an application, but probably yes, in that case it would really be a very valuable application for the community.

Developer seems to be on the right track in terms of accomplishing this. Being a plutus pioneer is great, hopefully he will ask questions to others there on how to accomplish the details of this task. The task is narrow enough in scope that I think this will be accomplished successfully.

Difficult to gauge the experience and skillset of the author without further information. This proposal would have certainly benefitted by having a github link to show work completed to date. The budget is not excessive and if the use case can be validated, I think this is an interesting proposal.
From the information given, the scope of competence and related experience is not well detailed. there is no evidence that there is capacity to deliver this project
Some useful experience evident although many concerns with legality and risks that still need to be tackled. Proposal needs further refinement before it can be fully assessed.
proposalTitle: Cashout and Buy ADA in Ethiopia

assessmentNote: Reasonable concept but lacking in detail and therefore very difficult to gauge likelihood of success until further information provided by team. I feel its important for the legal and risk aspects to be bedded down before further assessment can be defined.
proposalTitle: Cashout and Buy ADA in Ethiopia

assessmentNote: No plan. No information as to how this would address the challenge.
No experience proof no description was provided.

The proposer has a detailed roadmap, and he states is already proceeding hiring the external developers for coding the app. The first campaign is expected in October 21.  The budget breakdown also gives a good level of auditability to the project.

A DEx is essential to a blockchain ecosystem. You want to be able to trade your DeFi-tokens. 
Not mentioned in the proposal but still relavent to my decision to give 5 stars: The Ergo team has a clear roadmap to implement crosschain swaps via the gravitiy protocol and NiPoWPoWs. Getting a port of the ErgoDEx to Cardano could, in the long run, open up the Cardano ecosystem to every mayor crypto.

The proposal does not effectively address the challenge of scaling up Cardano's DeFi sector in the next 6 months. The DEX is not complete and has not launched on Ergo yet. The process of porting it to Cardano (Haskell) will be a several month process that can only commence once the system is in production on Ergo.

As a CA we are seeing an increased number of proposals suggesting some form of a bridge or port of their dApp to Cardano. All of those protocols are already live on other chains. In the case of ErgoDEX this team has yet to deploy the Dex solution on Ergo and are now requesting funds from the Cardano community to build a ported version of the system on Plutus. This is not effectively addressing the challenge as well as other AMM DEX's in this challenge building native Plutus DEXs that will be live in the next six months.

The proposal shows a working example of a smart contract on EUTXO, which is evidence that the working bits have already been developed on Ergo but need a friendly user interface to enable adoption. The feasibility of porting the contracts over to Cardano is shown in the proposal, with example of other Ergo contracts being re written for cardano. The Dev team have shown their work on existing blockchain defi products such as SigUSD.

The team's experience working with ErgoScript is made clear, however the AgeUSD example used to show team's ability to port into Plutus is not even close to being complete enough for a testnet release, also waiting 12 months for a DEX to go live on Cardano given the requested funds is not competitive at all. There are other DEX's in this challenge offering Plutus from day 1 dex's for a fraction of the requested budget.
With the ErgoPlatform having connections to IOG and the experience of the team members. I do not see how this would not be implemented successfully.

The team does not have a live protocol on Ergo yet so they should not be talking about any port until that's complete, the roadmap is also 12 months out which does not align with the challenge goal of scaling up Cardano's DeFi ecosystem with functional/working protocols on Plutus mainnet in the next 6 months.

The plan to bring ErgoDEX to Cardano is not one a CA can completely analyze in its current state as the solution has not gone live yet on Ergo. There is no way to judge the current viability of the solution and the last Defi solution the Ergo team launched (AgeUSD stablecoin) was hacked and had to be reset. The team behind this proposal also does not specify who the Plutus developers building these contracts in Haskell will be. The budget/timeline also don't match the amount of work outlined in this proposal.
The goal and milestones have been clearly defined, which can be used to audit the progress. The github is also provided.
As an added value, the miro board could help in onboarding users and foster faster participation.
i could see myself using the setup and use of miro-board as a tool for support. Tevo did an excellent job. I have no doubt that it will be successfully implemented.

Auditability is the foundation of a strong process. In catalyst, the process is aiming to fund people across the globe. This throws in huge challenges hence there is a need to come up with innovative mechanical to achieve audibility in a secure and safe environment.

As a community advisor who has participated in the community for a few months now, there is no doubt in my mind that this project is feasible.
