There are already many discussions taking place on auditability and opening it up beyond discord to the entire community would likely draw in more ideas from a broader group of participants. The way that it is framed here would allow for a wide array of proposals to be submitted. It does not restrict exactly what is being looked for which leaves ample room for innovation in this space.

There is no credible information about the proposers available. Literally nowhere their names can be found. The whole project related accounts have only been created recently but have loads of traffic with low effort comments. Same with the comments here on catalyst, a lot of them don't have a lot of substance. This really catches the eye, especially considering that the actual proposal text is pretty short and does not give a detailed outline of the project or the plan how it's going to be implemented.

The idea to make more transparent and easier the access to the funded proposals have a great potential. With this, you could try to figure out which characteristics of each successful projects have in common as well as the failed ones. That said, this could create a database for the CA and proposers to improve their judge on voting, if CA, and improve their proposal, if proposer. Therefore, it will potentially improve the decision making.
Some ideas that could help with this project in the future is: if possible, create graphs that make clear the common points among the successful projects and another one with those who failed; open a channel to allow the failed project's team to talk about why they think it failed, where they could have improved – it might help another proposer.

The team has experience in software development, web development and is participating in the Plutus Pionner Program. I recommend including more details about the other members of the team, as there are only details about Nick's bio.

The budget was set in relation to hours of work to carry out the project.
 
This part of the proposal is confusing: "Our goal is to make a token exchange section in the RAY Wallet". Will DEX users have to use the RAY wallet to interact with DEX? Will it be possible to interact through Yoroi? My point is that reliance on an external wallet can introduce security problems and dependency on RAY wallet.


The team did reverse engineering on the Uniswap protocol and this allowed for better performance, but what does better performance mean? There is no clear definition of the changes in relation to the Uniswap protocol. Is there any change in the equations? Is there a bonding curve model?

What is the team's expertise in the development of alternative financial models for the exchange?

Many DEXs are taking advantage of the work developed by Uniswap to make a "vampire attack", forking the code, but this creates dependency on the work developed by the Uniswap team and on the financial models and equations. Uniswap develops regular updates and this week implemented changes to the protocol (v3). What is the team's capacity to develop new implementations and keep the protocol updated?

No experience or details are provided. It seems as if the funding will be only utilized to promote the platform, which itself seems suspicious given the large number of bots obviously supporting the project on Ideascale. The whitepaper is quite vague and specifically has a disclaimer attempting to absolve themselves of "reliance on any information contained in this document"

There team plans on using bug bounties to audit the non-existent code in the github, and not put the project through a security audit which shows that it is it can't be audited. There is no clear budget to judge progress against, and no clear timeline with dates.

There are details about the team and their qualification. I recommend the inclusion of links to Linkedin from all proposers, so that the community has transparency and easy access to check. Considering that the purpose of the proposal is to provide more information about the teams, I think that the members of the team themselves are well aware of the importance of having links to their profiles and even so  two proposers do not have links to their profiles.

There is a reasonable timeline for implementing the proposal (5 weeks), but there is a confusing aspect to the plan, the creation of this proposal will require constant updating and the budget describes funding for only 5 weeks of work. How will be the update of this information? This is not clear. There is a mention that in the long run more information will be added or updated, but would that involve more funding? The point is that to understand the feasibility of the budget.

The proposing team is already providing updates on project progress and has defined metrics for success. Implementation has started and weekly updates can be found here: https://www.notion.so/cardanocommunity/Project-Updates-7f42f8cc1648444dbfe6e18b74ccc3b7

The success of the proposal and its progress seem to be easy to measure and follow. The challenge is well addressed and the offered solution seems to be suitable for the task at hand.

I believe that the team involved in creating the project is very solid. According to what has been said, there are more than 200 engineers with experience in the food industry and in blockchain. It is also important to note that they already have a certain investment in the idea, both financially and for apps already developed. However, programmers, designers and other types of professionals necessary for the smooth running of the project could also have been cited. In addition, it would be beneficial to include more information about the leaders of this team, there are 200 engineers, but which ones command, what exactly do they do? It is always good to have a more palpable sense of the professional trajectory of those involved. These are details that would improve a good impression that is already passed.

Since the key metrics of this challenge is to increase media coverage and new member ideas, videos are a great gateway to share information and engage members/non-members. Since way before the pandemic hit, videos started to become more important for learning in a flipped classroom/ blended learning environment. In this proposal, videos are proposed to be used both as educational material as well as for showing success stories/ emotional onboarding, therefore providing two possible pathways of attracting new users. From the trailer provided, I would say that it points more towards a motivational/ emotional aspect as well as transporting the vision of ADA to help people understand, how valuable the project is. Using real world usecases is a very good idea, since one of the key criticisms that is held against Cardano is, that it doesn´t provide smart contracts, yet. So the scope is very useful and can work as a way to promote the idea and give an overview on how active the Cardano Community actually is.

While the proposal relies on the development work by an external entity, I belief that the team assessed the risk.

If implemented, this can boost adoption tremendously.

Outlined metrics and ongoing communication from the proposer to the greater community warrants a high score in auditability. An open source git repository would improve this score more.
The information provides is sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal.

The proposer has experience in building 2 food delivery startups as well as technical experiences in Solidity, Plutus, & web dev experience. The concern that I have with the plan is the industry that Valorem will be competing at is a very low margin industry. There's not enough market research done at this point to evaluate the breakdown of how the cost savings generated can be profitable enough to support the business in the long term

The chances of the project being successful depend directly on the low transaction costs and times of the Cardano blockchain. The team claims to be made up of students with experience in smartcontract crafting and Haskell development, but they only identify as anonymous crypto-enthusiasts. In addition, the team says it will have to strengthen itself to achieve the goals, which exudes a certain transparency but leaves doubts about the chances of success.

The proposers are operating anonymously and have said that they have to hire people for implementation.  It is not possible to assess the capability in this setting and one can just hope that it may get implemented.

You have directly addressed the issue of Community Advisor training as stated as a potential direction on the F5 Distributed Decision Making cover page. You have designed a good range of potential content in your tutorials and have outlined how the proposal will continue to be a community project into the future. I would consider that the information presented might also be useful for proposers themselves. Thanks for your efforts.

This proposal is a great implementation that mesh the cardano blockchain with the customer needs from any point of view. The proposal clearly articulates how it will add value to the Cardano ecosystem and for the stakeholders (in detail for insurer, investors and insurance company). Furthermore there is a running solution and cloud platform just done for testing purpose...

This proposal addresses the challenge of scaling up Cardano's DeFi by bringing in essentially a fork of uniswap, adapting the contracts over to Plutus. The proposal doesn't include a plan on how it will attract liquidity providers to Ray Swap or why LPs would want to use their platform over others in the same space.

The problem statement is a bit vague, why does the "common man" need access to Data-Analytics solutions ? The solution is also not very specific i.e. what types of data sets are you intending to analyse and for what specific outcome or to assist with what type of decisions ? there are lots of Data Analytics tools available, how does your proposed tool distinguish from these ? . The proposal mentions that they want to use Cardano to benefit from it's decentralization, scalability and and authenticity which makes sense, but there's is no mention on how they would integrate a Data Analytics tools with blockchain technology and Cardano specifically.

Since this application makes a real difference to every one involved in the transaction, I really think that this has a great potential. Here, in Brazil, we have the same problem and sometimes it shows on TV some news about the "new slavery system" which involves the drivers, that many times they have debts to pay and can not get out of this system.
Moreover, since it have a direct monetary impact to the costumer, who creates the demand, it's easy to imagine that it will work.

This is a huge challenge in today's world. Small businesses around the globe are suffering due to the pandemic and this proposal has identified a method using blockchain to support and enhance their recoveries.
I'm missing KPI and metrics and a roadmap with milestones.
proposalTitle: Cardano Support for Point of Sale

assessmentNote: This proposal is lacking technical documentation, a timeline or any form of metrics/KPIs
proposalTitle: Cardano Support for Point of Sale

assessmentNote: This project is likely to bring hundreds of thousands of users of the Cardano blockchain through automated token swap for low fees. If the app is up to the task, the influence of a decentralized exchange platform is potentially huge in terms of growth in transactions. The different features seem to be very complete, I particularly appreciate the smart wallet enabling to swap between main cryptos.
The funding requested is not intended to go towards building or integrating a Dapp, but toward promotion. "the money we are requesting will go toward promotion and listing"

The proposal is very innovative, because it seeks to use an existing and well-consolidated service in a more just and safe way, by involving ADA and cutting some fees and bureaucracies that involve food delivery. As stated in the text, the use of this app would benefit both customers, as well as restaurants and couriers. In other words, it is an app of great significance for society and for the Catalyst community.
It is not clear how creating a new site summarising other sources of information reduces the cognitive load in understanding the ecosystem. Would it not be better to clean up the official site?

This proposal is a great idea that getting real use of blockchain and improve the transactions volume on Cardano blockchain,  because I think that a blockchain explorer that clearly shows smart contracts and the interactions with them is a great thing. 
The proposal clearly articulates how it will add value to the Cardano ecosystem and for the stakeholders (in deep detail for users that offer services based on tokens, and  so on.. )

A more detailed plan on how the smart contract to real world information interface will be managed is required. As is a detailed plan on how the core produce will be built and marketed. Seems unlikely this could be produced for the funds requested. What physical location are you intending on starting in. How are you managing governance?

It is a proven fact that a large percentage of the population is able to learn new information through video much more efficiently. Having a much more informed pool of community advisors would greatly improve the decision making process of Project Catalyst as a whole. This would lead to a better outcome for the whole Cardano community.

The project roadmap is specific and quantifiable enough that progress can be audited throughout the course of the project, although the fifth phase of the roadmap is somewhat vague. In general, more emphasis on measurable detail would have been helpful in the roadmap and capability description.

The proposal team is completed skilled and have a good trade of business and technical knowledge, so in my opinion will able to make surely a production platform The proposal offers a realistic timetable to complete the work. The proposer has considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation
Very little evidence given that proposer(s) have relevant skills to organize, market, implement, and teach a coding bootcamp for teenagers in Africa. No budget provided. No risks addressed.

As you discussed, I think transaction fees will be a limiting factor, unless the game uses Babel fees where SPOs accept your token as the transaction fee. It might be better to keep most of the game off-chain and only have trading of completed item NFTs on-chain. I'm very hopeful for the success of your project, but I think you might need to make more progress with ideas before getting funding. Long-term funding is key to the success of this kind of game. How would you ensure the longevity of the project?
With senior developers and experienced people in bothe blockchain tech and gaimig platform the team looks self sufficient to achieve the proposed target.
They have provided both the context of their fund 4 and 5 proposal gives a continuity in their approach and the further documentation and details is sufficient to understand the proposal

Indeed it will be a challenge to fight against Ueber Eats and Takeaway (Thuisbezorgd.nl). Pay very good attention that customers do not put too many     
illegal claims which need handlin g and time. Use GPS location on delivery to proof the goods are delivered at the correct location
While the proposer sounds talented, there isn't much presented on what experience they have with blockchain. In addition, there are several outside dependencies that are not yet realized.
Simple plan to deliver a 10 videos. How long are they? Likely to be implemented. How are they marketed?

Exchange will be an essential piece in bootstraping the Cardano ecosystem. With the combination of AMM and book order, I believe YaySwap will have a large share of the market, and will solve the important problem of token exchange in Cardano ecosystem.
The team is implementing the first dex on Cardano but the timeline for implementation is too far out to give this 5 stars.

The proposers say " the money we are requesting will go toward promotion and listing" but this gives little confidence that the funds will be allocated efficiently. If the project is not executed on a technical level, the Catalyst funds will be wasted.
RAY Team has a working MVP of their wallet solution and is submitting a proposal to extend these efforts.

The proposer provides a step-by-step plan for the implementation with poor milestones and a high level time horizon. I miss in this area that the proposer has not mentioned possible difficulties and market competitor. I think that they require to do a business plan, especially related to revenues of the services
a standardized approach to human readable addresses would improve the development experience as well as the user experience.
A payment gateway is very much needed to build e-commerce websites. However, there are already existing solutions such as nowpayments.io
Reasonable proposal that would make a nice use of the blockchain. As long as security and cost issues can be resoleved.

The problem and solution statement is reasonable and objective. The creation of tutorials for CAs is within the scope of the challenge and has a great potential for impact on decision making. The proposal has a plan for these tutorials to remain updated during the next Funds, which is an essential point to guarantee the relevance and impact of the tutorials during the next Funds.

This proposal will have a greater impact in ensuring that CA are given proper resources in a central location to learn and build their skills to enable future assessment reviews for each funding step.  There is a plan to help improve and make updates as needed for the future.

The project team has demonstrated successful development of prior capabilities that it would build on as part of the Metadata Challenge. The proposal's plan clearly distinguishes the new capabilities that would be funded and it details a realistic set of activities and a viable roadmap.

I give a 1 for feasibility of impact because the only budgetary information given is the hourly rate to pay coders. I would like to see information about what coders will do with those hours of work. I don't understand, based on submission, what kind of work needs to be done.

The problem and solution statement is clear and reasonable. The proposal is fully aligned with the challenge and has great potential to improve the decision-making process of CAs and vCAs. The team is already developing the project and the expectation is for a quick implementation, which increases the potential for positive impact on Catalyst.

The proposers claim 15 years of combined experience in academics and industry. However, they have not specified which industry or which academic experience. No validating references are also enclosed in the proposal.
While the details are missing, the concept - if properly implemented - could accelerate adoption.

This proposal effectively addresses the challenge of bringing DeFi to cardano by using a similar block chain to deliver an innovative working product, leverages the advantages that EUTXO brings to DeFi and will be able to be used in the wild before implementing on Cardano.  The key innovation that EUTXO brings is the ability to merge liquidity between the order book and AMM, something that isn't possible on the accounting model.

The resource plan is well-laid out and clearly links to proposed results.  The development and delivery milestones are clearly laid out on a reasonable timeframe.  This provides the high level information needed to audit progress.  

One area for improvement could be dapp usage or adoption targets as measures of success.
Metrics are well set out. Also need to monitor how proposals did meeting timelines and budgets.
The problem statement chosen is rather generic but since they are having most of the things planned and documented accordingly the proposal effectively addresses the challenge
The project plan is flushed out, and the team is leveraging what they are already doing in fund4. This is work in progress, as far as I understand.

doesn't seem to meet the challenge goal of "What applications will provide the most value for end users in 2021?" Initial proposal requires restaurants to handle delivery. No details on how this project actually connects customers and restaurants.
The propose addresses the need to decentralize food delivery system to help small business as well as the couriers without unnecessary overhead.

This proposal is a good idea for a great implementation of a backend service that communicate with the cardano blockchain and add value for the cardano wallet owners.  The proposal clearly articulates how it will add value to the Cardano ecosystem. However the objective of the proposal is based only on back-end system and not for front-end system, so I think it's a god starting point for developers and for stake pool owner that can be run these services for the final users. I think there is a possible security concerns related to the owner wallet, but it's important to deep dive on the detailed process.
The Roadmap is clear and provides an in-depth, step-by-step action plan, making this project easier to audit
The project is feasible. The case for why a new source of truth on the Cardano community is required needs to be more strongly made. Would this not confuse new users more?
Team is looking very good and suitable for the job. I have visited their links, and I personally like the page design, so I have trust that they can deliver high quality ads.
The implementation and adaptation will have clear audit trails. The process and the aim are clear.
I give a 1 for auditability because the only clear metric that we could evaluate on is trading volume. Trading volume with no other metrics lacks meaning.
The experience of proposers appears to match the stated aims well. The team have already produced quality material and the likelihood of successful implementation is high.
This proposal identifies and provides a solution to a key pain point for community advisors in fulfilling their role.

There is no correlation between what will be in the Euclid net site and its relation to Cardano. The vision to increase Cardano proliferation in Sri Lanka is noble and need to be encouraged but the proposal seems to serve no such purpose.
The proposal is not clear on what is planned to be achieved. There is no specific goal regarding what type of data analytic solution is aimed at in the proposal.  It is not auditable.

The team is unknown to the reader. Why would accomplished academics and industrialists shy away from providing who they are? The information provides is insufficient to audtio the progress and success of the proposal.

It is not clear the proposers have the technical ability to deliver this project. A question for the governance design. Have you thought about how to get people to compromise? Direct voting can lead to large issues where minorities are not protected and people vote for incompatible things (high services and low taxation for insatnce).

The proposal's budget is only for the 1st phase out of 3, so only for USD16500 out of a total budget of USD76500, the rest being planned for future funds. The proposer is not a developer, he plans of hiring a professional team for the development side. Since the developers are not invested in this project, they would only be work for hire, is there not a big risk of the project not getting funded in a future round and losing all the investments done thus far? A possible solution would be to split the proposal in two phases, each one having a larger budget, but reducing the chances of not being funded and of not having some MVP at the end of the first phase.
Very hard to be convinced with this much requested funding

The proposal is not effectively addressing the challenge of launching a DeFi protocol on Cardano in the next 6 months, this DEX has not launched on Ergo yet and its unclear the team has full understanding of the work required to bring this DEX to Plutus.

The proposal is one of several AMM DEX's in this challenge yet its the only one building on a different blockchain. As a CA the amount requested and fact this has not gone live on the Ergo chain yet means this proposal is not effectively addressing the challenge (deploying Plutus DeFi protocols in the next 6 months)/

There are already existing Dapps made by the Ergo team. The team seams quite expirienced with creating secure and user friendly Dapps. The smart contracts are in large parts already being tested and only need to be ported. 
There only seams to be a little discrepancy with the estimated public launch in 2nd half of August and the definitions of success.
looking at the history of the team with ergo, playing around with their stablecoin UI. it does seem likely they have the experience needed.
Plan is well set out, and easy to audit. If the goal is to meet the challenge of scaling up DeFi ecosystem, some metrics to measure success here would be good.
More then sufficient information is provided. They linked their Github, and provided a roadmap. Since the team has connection to Input Output, I am certain they will be held accountable.
The community has already proposed many solutions to improve Distribution Decision making, and this challenge would require similar solutions geared towards audibility
The metrics all seem audible and should be able to be adressed, assuming that the group auditing a project consists of people with all the different required skills, which should be doable.

The proposal describes roadmap and goals, but there are no metrics in the KPIs and there is no budget breakdown. There is no information about the team members, which is a big problem and completely compromises the audit of the proposal. I recommend that the information described above be included, especially details about who is behind the proposal, as it is an essential point of auditability.

When I saw this project for the first time I got excited and signed up for the upcoming airdrop. But to be eligible you had to follow this project on reddit or telegram ( a tactic that is being used from a lot of projects that are advertising with airdrops). So the official reddit sub of YaySwap is full with new accounts with almost no karma that write really short comments. I know nobody is able to fully control a subreddit but there is no official information or anything on this sub. 

Then I came here and in the comments it is exactly the same. There are a 100 comments but all of them are really short and don't really provide any content. There are just a few that are asking critical questions but nobody answered them. 

It would really benefit your proposal if you would expain who these 4 MCGill Alumni are or even better just introduce the whole team. Maybe provide a link to your Linkedin page. It always helps to built trust in a project If you know the people that are behind it. I visited your website to look for further information but I couldn't find anything there regarding your team/company.

There is a comment stating: There is no technique documents, there is no any person to develope. But request too much money (1 mill at first time, then 250k, 100k, now 65k). It just focus to attract people to its channels and collects data. - Why did you reduce your budget again and again but after you got feedback from the community there is still no budget in the proposal. It is important for the funder to see where the funds are going and how they are allocated. 

Then a DEX needs a lot of coding. I was looking for your github link in the proposal but I did not find one. A proposal should not only mention on what is going to be done but also on how it is going to be done. If you explain some technical aspects this is going to help to build trust a lot.

Given the proposers background and the GitHub information provided, there's a high likelihood the solution can be implemented. The proposal lists the dev plans required to produce the product including breakdowns in costing. It does not however present the number of resources required for the project (solo vs team effort) and it would benefit greatly if this info is provided for better clarity. Also for better clarity, entering 'time it will take' to complete each of the activities will provide transparency to voters on how the product can be completed in the 6 month time-frame presented.

This proposal does identifies a potential problem that may be frightening to the newcomers and may undermine the potential growth of the Catalyst Project, which is the overwhelming of information and the non-intuitive platform of the project. 
However, what may enrich the proposal is to be more far reaching. When we talk about a website simplifying the information it means that we are reaching people which are already interest to this project and want to participate already – because we can assume that they're allocating part of their time to read and understand and finally reaching the platform. However, to be fair, they're already a bit interested – and of course if they find a platform supplying with good information and intuitive navigation it'll help to aggregate them in the Project. But maybe if this platform includes more general information and educational (in a easy way) contents (starting from the beginning – decentralization, crypto potential, crypto intention, difference between the ecosystems, etc) and then present the Cardano and the Catalyst Project, I think it would have a greater strength to aggregate not only the people who are already looking and already know about it, but it could get newcomers into this world.

The proposal asks for $65'000 for "promotion and listing" but doesn't mention how the success would be measured. 
No basis to assess the team's qualifications. The team chose to remain anonymous and does not mention any references.
Given that the overall project is quite ambitious, I have low confidence in their ability to execute.

The proposers do not give convincing qualifications and their proposal does not relay a technical understanding of what is a very ambitious project. They claim to have acquired funding from other sources but want 65k from Catalyst for marketing. If they want funds from Catalyst I suggest they provide a more professional and nuanced roadmap that shows they understand the problem they are trying to solve, before asking for funds to market an incomplete product.

Given the plan and experience it is unlikely that the proposal will be successfully implemented. The team behind the project doesn't provide any proof of skill's needed to successfully implement the extensive scope of this project. Wrapped assets are a major feature, Swap contracts are a major feature, and innovation fund is a major feature, etc. and the budget is awfully short for that. The budget isn't detailed out into categories at all, which signals an increased risk of missing the budget. The economics of this project are also not clear, and without having them locked in a multi-signature contract there is high risk of remaining coins to be sold off in an untasteful way.

The proposal lists the functionalities of the solution and at the same time explains how it will leverage Cardano's features. It presents a dev pathway that is understandable even to voters unfamiliar with IT developments. A timeline against this will provide a trackable mechanism to assess where the project is at and how it is meeting its milestones. This will provide better auditability and greater confidence

The team's proposal spends a good deal of time outlining the project, then only includes a single sentence at the end stating that the funds are used for promotion of the DEX, not development. No guidelines for success, explanation of why they need $65k for promotion, or checkpointing metrics are provided.

The problem, the solution and the proposal are clear and reasonable, but from what has been described I see greater alignment with the Distributed Decision Making challenge (the impact of this proposal would be greater). The roadmap is objective and is divided into steps, the timeline for the implementation is defined in 5 weeks, within the challenge requirements.

There is a budget breakdown, but as I mentioned in the rationale above, there is no clarity if updates are included in the budget. There are details about the proposers' experience. Reasonable metrics have been described, but there are no KPIs.

The proposal claims that the app is already in development with 200+ engineers. The current proposal is for creating an ADA payment system and evolving a schema to onboard non-crypto users. This experiment, if successful, has immense potential for mass adaptation of Cardano in a fast-moving segment. The methodology is unique, involving reducing the margin to the restaurants and delivery agents; therefore, it has a higher chance of adaptability.

Regarding making the project happen, I see that everything is well underway. It is said directly, through topics, what benefits each type of user of the app would have (customers, delivery people or restaurant owners). This guides well what are the points to be worked on when building the app. It is also said how the financing money would be used, by parts, and how the actions would develop over the months. On this last point, in my opinion, it could have been more detailed, because the intervals mentioned are very long. In 12/18 months, many things happen, it would be beneficial to also understand what the order between them would be and so on.

As a new CA, I can say that this proposal corresponds directly to my immediate need and it is a need for the development of the Catalyst program to improve the quality of reviews. To guide me, I have for the moment only the CA Onboarding guide. I lack experience in evaluating a roadmap or the depth of development of an idea. The proposal will help increase the number of CAs and especially the quality of their reviews by providing them with the keys to reading and evaluating projects.

The proposer is an active member of the Catalyst community and helped coordinate the CA assessment guide for Fund5. There are details about the proposer's experience and qualification, as well as links to his website, where it is possible to have more information and access to his Linkedin, this information allows the community to transparently check the proposer's capacity.

There is a reasonable and detailed plan for creating the tutorials. The tutorials were well structured and will be organized in modules so that they can be updated in a practical way as the documentation and the assessment process is updated. The topics cited for the tutorials are relevant and reasonable.

There is a well-established roadmap that provides for the delivery of tutorials in 3 months, which indicates a potential impact in the short term, which is an important point to meet the challenge.

The proposal positively affects the challenge in multiple ways: Exchange of knowledge and training between developers from multiple different countries and raising broader awareness for the cardano project that might possibly make more people enthusiastic sbout becoming developers.
proposalTitle: Devs for Awarenes Event West Africa

assessmentNote: The team seems to be experienced enough to implement what is needed for this proposal. Budget is well broken down, but there is no mention about maintenance and next Funds, which would be good to see some information about. Besides that, the plan is clear and is likely achievable.

Information provided allowed greater understanding of the problem being addressed. Community feedback seems to confirm that the idea is valid and warrants attention. Perhaps budget and plan could have had stronger detail to assist the auditing of likelihood of success.
its not clear this is a developer experience proposal. Should possibly be in the DApps and integrations fund.

Whilst this proposal has the potential to attract many users to Cardano if its built well and marketed properly, I'm not sure that simply including Ada currency in the checkout box is enough. Why not build the whole thing on Cardano smart contract tech. Not sure if 'drivers' are also independent bike rider deliveries and any person with a Cardano DID..

The proposal team is skilled only on technology knowledge and there isn't any information on other team members, so in my opinion I suggest to the proposer to involve other people in this project before start-up. I think that exchange functionalities related to blockchain exploring are incredible evolving in the market during the last years, so there are a lot of possibilities for the adoption by the users. Further I think it's important to improve details about the process related to the issue related to the market or capital risk.

I am satisfied that you will be able to  complete the task that you have set yourself. It is reassuring that you are already involved in working with the Community Advisor Guidelines and that you have created the website that hosts information currently. Your budget seems to be an entirely reasonable amount which will allow you to create more content and I like the fact that you have budgeted incentives for further contributors.

The proposer provides a step-by-step plan for the implementation with clear milestones and a defined time horizon, also in technical realization. The solutions is well documented and there is a running pilot platform for testing. The only thing I miss in this area is that the proposer has not mentioned possible difficulties in adoption processes.

Admittedly this is my first go at being a community advisor and I am getting overwhelmed with the amount of proposals. I understand you are not going to limit that amount, but having a way to organize/list the ones with low assessments is needed. The review the reviewer phase for vCAs must be an enormous task so clearer ways to work together will be helpful.

The entity should be able to do this given their claimed experience. However the plan is very thin on details. It doesn't state when it would be, where it would be and how many students it would target. Would they also be charging students? How are they selecting students? $30,000 is a lot of money for a summer bootcamp.

feasibility: 2/5
The proposer does not present a clear time-line for development although smart contract will certainly be required to execute the product. The real costs/transaction volumes required to play would have a dramatic impact on the attractiveness of gameplay. The proposer needs to provide a more granular and detailed description of the gameplay to demonstrate their understanding of how such a game would function on the block chain.  Once the funding has been used up, how will the project remain sustainable?
No detailed plan on tech to be built or marketing plan. How will it compete with the large VC funded competitors burning billions to dominate this market?

-There is no any public profiles of Dev team members.
-The Idea submitter has replied in a community comment that he has developed a smartcontract on Ethereum, but there is no way to check it out.

There is no explanation of how this project will simplify development on Cardano. It makes sending tokens/ADA easier, but that is not the primary goal of the challenge. Using WNS in applications adds a feature, but it does not really make the development easier.

The proposer failed to answer how a whitelabel solution would address the challenge goal and missed or ignored another great collaboration opportunity in the comment section. Core features for the drivers (e.g. global chat) further lack details on implementation and does not address regulations.

The information provides is not sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal.

How will you validate the data coming into the smart contracts. Without this everything falls apart. How do you make sure all cash flows go through it and some are not diverted. How to do measure physical work done. How will you deal with defaults on payments.

The team described experiences and qualifications to execute the proposal.

There is a very well articulated and detailed rationale. The plan is reasonable and well structured. There are budget allocation details.

There is a reasonable timeline and the deliverables described therein are within the scope of the challenge brief.

I've not understood how are you going to achieve the further development required in the platform after the first 3 months of fund. Since you have not asked for the entire funding and gave no expectations of ROI, it is not clear how are you going to implement it. Let's assume that you don't have lots of trades happening after the launch of MVP, which is plausible, how are you going to make money to further dev.?

I'm sorry to say it but $12'000 for pledge would buy you less than 9'000 ADA and this is unfortunately far from enough to sustain a pool. Th plan is to promote the pool for 5 months, but it doesn't say how this goal is to be achieved. There are hundreds of pools in a similar situation.
This seems like it could be a good idea, though the technical details seem to still need to be worked out.
It might be helpful to talk about the security of funds on your platform. How will token holders receive a share of the transaction fees?
The description itself is quite short, however the scope is pretty straightforward and it is bread-and-butter programming. The estimated effort is about 2-3 months for one person. Seems realistic.
This project seems feasible and would make JS programming on Cardano and easier experience for developers.

Web-based, centralized password managers are horrendous. People are looking for a secure and reusable solution and this will be it. This proposal has the potential of bringing in an enormous group of new users to Cardano.
The trailer they have put up for the proposal is of genuine high-quality, proving the team's experience and capability in fulfilling the project.

The proposal does not provide sufficient info on who will complete this work, the implementation strategy they will follow to port to the Ergodex to Plutus and given the timeline (and fact other AMM's are already deploying Plutus beta apps) this proposal is less competitive than other DEXs in this challenge.
This proposal exceeds expectations with regards to addressing a challenge. It is clearly presented and well layed-out.
The ground work has been laid-out in fund4 and it looks like they're progressing well by participating in fund5 as well.
A very well structured proposal that contains all information I need to make an assessment.
There is a clear indication of the problem and solution and the YouTube videos add value.
A decent roadmap is provided. Critical issue will be marketing.
It looks well researched and the supporting documentation affords it credibility.

This proposal does technically meet the challenge of growing Cardano's footprint in Africa through creating an Ethiopian Stake pool. I am not able to verify that this will be the "first" Ethiopian stake pool though. I see a very limited benefit to the greater African community since the funding and subsequent rewards will only benefit the few people on your team.
The proposal addresses the challenge because it envisions to setup a stake pool in Ethiopia and to educate others to do the same.
i'm a bit concerned by the after, doing a website is the simplest task managing it will be the hard work

Great idea to improve general user friendlyness of wallets. It simplifies long strings of address code into human readable wallet names. So a user would be able to access a private addressbook and select a name as a recipient. Pretty much the same idea as selecting a name instead of a bank address while homebanking. A system like this would add to general accessability. The proposal is a better fit for the Metadata challenge. A wallet name is metadata.

Can you talk about the security of funds in your wallet and on the exchange? There's lots of action in your Github depository, so it's great to see that your getting stuff done. Tell us more about the NFT market place and Ray Kickstart.

Please detail the end use product you will produce. " The DApps our company will develop provide decentralized real-time data related products and services. " This doesn't say what you are doing, let alone a plan for how you will do it.
Using the funds to set up shop and hire unspecified interns can hardly be considered a success.
No description of what is actually being produced other than data related products and services. Please detail what you will produce and how this addresses the challenge.
An exchange that combines AMM with order book, with capability of partial filling - This really seems all people need. I believe ErgoDex will become the top DEX on Cardano.
Proposers have the skillset to do this and are already heavily involved, thus likely to succeed if funded.
This is a very strong team. With the previous on Ergo, I think the team will successfully complete the implementation. The plan also looks good to me.

The experience of this team building on Cardano is nill, this is an Ergo dApp that is going to have a difficult time making the leap into the Plutus (Haskell) framework Cardano is built on. The proposal timeline is also clear this won't go live for 1 years, this challenge is meant to fund DeFi protocols going live as Plutus dApps in <6 months. It's also not clear who the Haskell dev talent building these contracts in Plutus will be.

The proposal team should focus on getting this dex implemented in Ergo before talking about any form of 'Plutus port', using the AgeUSD as an example of their ability to port ErgoScript into Plutus is a complete non-starter as the contracts are not even complete for that stablecoin protocol. The timeline to launch on Plutus of 12 months is also way too long to be a competitive proposal.

I fully support this proposal. This is well-in-line with a number of other proposals and has the potential to become part of an overall CATALYST Community Toolset. 

 Please make sure that you investigate the following along the road:
1) How can this complement other similar proposals, like cardanocataly.st landing page, Catalyst Community Tools and Visual communication for community ?
2) Strategically discuss in a wider group, if this should migrate into IdeaScale or become part of an overall, CATALYST Community-run we space and toolset ?

I also added some comments earlier in the feedback phase, which I want to repeat here:

" I would dream of a clustered project-funnel, which shown the various projects in its stages over their lifecycle, clustered according to the nature/scope of the project, could be similar to COIN360.com  and e.g. colored according to ROI achievement (following different KPI mix along the life-cycle).
This could of course also be a feature directly on IdeaScale, but maybe a dedicated website is easier to do."

The project seems very thought through, all elements and metrics are considered, sustainability has been taken into account, the budget requested seems appropriate. The only thing I'm concerned about with this project is, something mentioned in one of the comments, the fact that you have to pay a fee each time the data is stored on the blockchain. Even at current rates of transaction fees, if someone has a really large number of logins that are constantly updated or if someone is constantly creating new ones, it could end up being prohibitively expensive. This issue could escalate if the price of ADA increases.

The proposal does not in itself solve a general problem but what it presents is another utility for the Cardano blockchain & the security it offers. In the absence of any blockchain-based password system (that I know of), this solution leverages the functionalities of Cardano in a novel way. There are numerous password applications currently on the market, all providing sustainable business models. This proposal does that with the added benefit of no 3rd party servers being involved (except for the authenticator) and more importantly provides an education pathway for users unaware of Cardano.

Integrating Blockchain technology with Data-analytics is a big undertaking and it's not clear if the team has the experience to implement such a proposal. The team is composed of 3 academics, which universities ? have they publish there work on research journals ? Whats the CV of the "accomplished" industrialists (LinkedIn profiles) ?. 
Overall this reads like a concept rather then an executable proposal. What type of data do you intend to analyse ? for what purpose and with what tools ? how will you access that data ?. The proposal mentions it aims to serve in "the fields of finance, wild-life ecology, supply chain management, traffic control systems, health and education sectors"  but this is very broad. The roadmap (which is detailed under the KPI section) does not address any of the questions above, only describes administrative and organizational steps. It comes across as the team what's funding to start thinking about the problem/solution (e.g. "Establishing the Research and Development department"), these should have been formulated beforehand.

There is a need for developing a "developer ecosystem" in west Africa. The proposal to develop a app using international app developers to enable the conduct of a treasure hunt event in West Africa may not be an optimum way to improve the developer ecosystem. Conduct of training provision of internet connection and procurement of training material may are likely to yield better results.
proposalTitle: Devs for Awarenes Event West Africa

assessmentNote:
The problem and solution description is reasonable and is within the scope of the challenge. The option of a new, more agile model for fundind of lower cost proposals and the possibility for the community to participate in it by voting with its own financial capital distributes decision making in Catalyst.

Experimenting with new fundind models is a positive thing and can have a positive impact for Catalyst and the challenge. Due to the relatively low budget set for the proposals, the tendency is the small number of people to participate as co-funders, which considerably limits the potential impact on the distribution of decision making in the next 2 Funds.

Tons of information to digest here and I really like the short elevator pitches from the team. Again I wanted to go with 5 stars, but I believe more than half of the videos should be about Catalyst to most effectively address the challenge. Maybe this proposal should be split up into 5 Project Catalyst on boarding videos then the next 5 vids can do a deep dive into Node/Stake Pool, Tokens, NFT, Smart Contracts, and future forks. Overall awesome proposal with plenty of information for me to get a good understanding of your vision. Rock on KEWW!

Since part of the budget is addressed to professional marketers who should be able to measure the conversion of 'viewers' to 'new members for Catalyst Project' it may be a trustworthy method to verify the data, and the adding of surveys enhance the auditability potential. 
Besides that, the presence in social media is easily followed.
If the proposed solution is well implemented, it could be of great interest of the general pubic and an important tool for those who wants to invite friends, family, etc, to join this world.
At last but not least, it may be interesting to inform who the team is when they start to join the project.

The plan presented is not at all clear in its implementation strategy, the Github linked is outdated and it looks like no one on this proposing team worked on it and in addition no Plutus developer building this protocol in Haskell is identified in the proposal plan. There is no technical docs/WP from the proposing team included in this.

There is clarity in the problem and the solution presented. The proposal is in line with the challenge.

There is a budget breakdown, details about the team's experience. A 3-month timeline for delivery has been defined and objective milestones have been presented, but there is no clear definition of how long each stage described in the milestones will last.

There is no KPI or metrics to analyze in this proposal. But I understand that the success of the project would be measured by the time between the submit of a proposal and the actual funding of the project. Therefore, I think the proposal would be more complete if you add something like this in the metrics.
Besides that, the idea must be scalable, it must aggregate enough people to vote and help the co-funding in order to give confidence in the decision of funding and avoid frauds.

The proposal is simple and is likely to be implemented successfully. However, the additional return to the Cardano community is quite uncertain and will depend on the ability of the team to attract local delegation to their pool for sustainability.

This Challenge is very focused on attracting new users to the platform. I feel like the majority of participants in the project will already be staking their ADA. However, it may onboard users into the NFT world, and may attract ADA holders in exchanges to delegate directly. Protectors and Ambassadors may also be onboarded into the Cardano ecosystem.  The concept meshes well with the Africa and mission driven stake pools them. I think the impact of the project is potentially large.
The refered examples and linked github repositories show that the proposer is well equipped to manage the challenge, however one or two people more would not hurt.
There won't even be a single FTE assigned to this work is a large red flag when most of the other proposals building entire protocols have teams of developers working full time.

This is a powerful engine that is able to enhance the reliability of the Cardano`s network. The creation of a escrow dApp is very important to allow the healthu growth of the community.
However, I missed some metrics and goals – what do you expect that the community earn with this proposal (more reliability, members, dapps, etc)?
A good success measure will still need to be define to ensure we can track the success of this proposal, such as user community size, # of contracts written for the escrow.
I give a 1 for auditability because the timeline is vague and metrics unclear. Some of the metrics the proposer says they aren't sure if they can track it.

The team behind this proposal is implementing a wallet/swap/NFT solution to serve as a one stop DeFi aggregator for Cardano users. The wallet dApp they are creating will enable all Cardano assets to be stored in a single location.

The team needs to deploy the AMM DEX to Ergo blockchain before requesting this amount of funds to build the contracts on Plutus. As stated above the last protocol deployed to Ergo was exploited almost immediately, the team needs to prove they can successfully deploy on their own chain and then prove they have the Haskell Plutus devs capable of building their contracts on Cardano.
Has no any details to explain how to use the budget.

Not clear how this project can compete in a space where billions of VC capital are competing. Even if technically it can be produced, there is no clear idea who the target market for this white label software is.
Can you give an example of one of the games you have created?

The scope is stated as (1) "ledger for all data license contract concluded between individuals and businesses." and (2) "ledger for all privacy interactions via the privacy rights management platform". A blockchain with smart contracts is clearly neither needed nor appropriate given these requirements.
The proposal has sections that paint conflicting pictures. The proposer fails to create trust; current operations should have a trail that can be easily directed to.

The proposal meets the objectives of the challenge very well, because it proposes to create a website that facilitates the visualization, by new interested parties, of the people who make up the Catalyst project and their functions and skills. New members of the community may indeed have to understand the project as a whole, and by understanding its members and their functions, it is possible to establish a direct exchange of information with them, these difficulties can be effectively remedied. The proposal would also facilitate the flow of ideas by new members, who choose the person with the most suitable profile for their claims, and would greatly increase the visibility of the team as a whole. Note: 5.

Though if not most, some people prefer one on one (face to face) tutoring and hands on practicals to boost their understanding and engagement, the COVID19 Pandemic has changed the nature of how things should be done normally. For instance, students are having lectures online, churches are congregating online, social events are being hosted online, etc it's wise to make use of video teachings to welcome people from all over the world to Cardano and Project Catalyst. 
Again, if not most, everyone is trying hard to accept, adjust and adopt to the new normal which's "digitalization". 
If new members get access to video trainings consistently and accurately about Cardano and Project Catalyst, it will boost their engagement level and passion!
However, I rated it a 4 star because they need to also look at hosting virtual sessions where new members would have the opportunity of asking and receiving questions in real time.
Yeah, with that the project is great!

The plan is thorough. Where the proposer is not sure about an implementation detail, an educated assumption has been made that appears feasible.

The proposer was quick to send his cv on request and underlines the listed development experience. The Greebly Monster NFTS (listed in the attached pdf) are not insignificant in establishing trust.

My suggestion to the proposer is to start reaching out to protectors soon and get some buy-in from them.

The measurement of the achievement of the objectives has been presented, a breakdown of the budget is available and a planned start date. Additional milestones would be helpful to allow for better tracking of the project. Furthermore, the criteria for goal achievement are vague. A numerical value for the individual criteria would help.

Plan doesn't cover delivery. No detail on how restaurants and customers actualyl conencted. One big website, or individual between restaurant and customers. Where is the marketing plan to bring on restaurants and customers? The current listed competitors are burning cash to gain scale. How will this compete?
The team behind this proposal includes no original content (WP, technical docs), all of these links included are from other teams and no Haskell Plutus developer resource is identified.

Implementing alternative funding structures is an interesting idea. The proposal effectively addresses the challenge and could be useful in discovering the best methods through an iterative, trial and error approach. 
The proposal could better explain the connection between alternative funding models and DDM. It should be very clear for voters.

Establishing a state pool in Ethiopia is likely to encourage the staking of the local population with the pool and improve investment in ADA. It is also likely to improve the awareness of Cardano. There may be no direct tangible returns, however, the proposal might enable adaptation and improve Cardano network reach in Ethiopia.  Ownership of the seed pledge needs to be addressed, with the promise that it will be used for some Cardano improvement activity once the stake pool becomes self-sustaining.

Cardano stake pools are a well established technical concept and there should be no issues in setting one up. Given the average wages and electricity prices in ethiopia, there should be no issues with the staking rewards paying for the electricity costs and wages for minor jobs providing enough staking can be secured. The 12.000 USD stake is most likely not enough to become elected for blocks. Considering the scarcity of funds those 12000 should maybe not be in the budget at all, but instead all of the stake should be achieved via advertising. With the advertisement budget it will most likey be possible to aquire enough delegators

Short form video is an effective way to reach new people and encourage participation. This is a great idea and an impressive and thorough proposal. We need more entry level introductions to Catalyst and this format is concise and informative. The only reason I am not going with 5 starts here is because the topics quickly stray away from Catalyst. I am personally very interested in all 10 of these topics, but the goal here is to onboard new people into Catalyst.

The GitHub link provided is stale and has not been updated with meaningful code commits in half a year. It's also not clear why the proposer is referencing a stale repo that no one on their team contributed work on. A proposal this complex also requires complete technical documentation and again its not clear why the proposer is linking articles on bonding curves from 2019. There is also no Plutus developer resource with a Haskell background identified in the proposal.

The team has two members who are involved in the Catalyst community, they participate as CAs and are involved in the development of some projects and implementations for improvements in Catalyst, some of these implementations have already been delivered, such as  documentation, and other projects are under development, such as the Catalyst Project Landing Page and the CA tool.

The budget described is reasonable and has details on the allocation of resources.

Some aspects of the plan need to be further clarified. If there is a high demand for people requesting funds, it may be necessary to establish some priority model for the distribution of the Funds (possibly the first ones will be prioritized by the model that was presented and this ends up benefiting people with prior knowledge. How to maintain equal conditions) in that case?

In addition, how will the funds be managed? We don't have smart contracts yet. Will the proposers be in charge of allocating resources?

If the totality of the funds is not distributed, the remaining amount would be returned to the treasury or passed on to another proposal. There is no clarity on this point. What would define if the funds would be returned or passed on to bounties in the Landing Page proposal?

There is a conflict of interest in this case, as the team is involved in the Landing Page proposal and could benefit from these additional resources. I believe that this situation needs to be better defined, since approving such a loophole can give freedom to other proposals to redistribute unused resources in an arbitrary way.

One thing that catch my attention is the thought that if this scale, how faster it would really be compared with the actual project, once you need a time to analyze every proposal and help them to improve them, by giving advises if necessary.
However, it is feasible, since the team members are assiduous in the community and have experience in the job.
Maybe if you use some tool like the one developed by Vic (CA-tool, for example), you could allocate an even number of people to each project, which could make them focus and accelerate the whole process.
Another point to analyze is if the proposals submitted into this platform would be feasible with $250, since the other half is conditionate to results.

The proposal do address, in my opinion, one of the major problems to general people when talking about the crypto world – the complexity. It is known that the crypto world is not intuitive nor easy to understand to the public. It mixes several themes that are not often well grounded to the people such as concepts of economy and computational technology.
The idea to create a not long series of easy-to-understand videos that creates a solid ground to the people at least start to walk by their selves is great.

Therefore, I think it would be more productive if we could add some base knowledge into the first video. Assuming that the people that are seeking this kind of content do not know this world, as stated, then we want them to first understand what being into this world mean. Thus, we must introduce the concept of decentralization and why it's a good way to embrace it in the world as it is today and as it'll be tomorrow, introduce the concept of DeFi (because money is a great incentive), the concept of validation and the difference between PoW and PoS associating them with the environmental problem (always bringing the content to the real world).
After these little introductions and explanations, and just then, enter with the second theme video (What is Cardano and Project Catalyst). At this point, you've introduced the major and simpler concepts that makes the eyes bright when we think about the future of technology, world and practicality.

The reason why I think this may be a good approach is because the best way to attract someone without knowledge of the subject is to create an idea of profitability, not only due to money, but also due to practicality, sustainability, trustless actions, etc.

I really enjoy the adding of surveys as an attempt to try to measure the conversion of viewers to new participants to the Catalyst Project, and the understanding of the need to hire a professional to make these calculations and compose the data needed to know if the series is really giving result. 

Since it will use YT platform to promote the series, depending on how the proposer use the platform, it's very scalable to the general public, and if the series is well constructed, it will reach a vast public.

Experience seems valid and while a small team certainly seem enthusiastic. Plan could be fleshed out a bit to provide greater insight into timeline/what to expect on the journey. Feel confident that this team is approaching a useful addition to the PC community.

Expertise on this team are mainly anchored in the advertising world and experienced with maximising profits and revenues through mass promotion of consumer goods. This is a large budget for investigative work and unclear how the rest of it will be generated.

Cost / benefit ratio is very positive in this project. The proposer openly shares his experience and has confidence in doing the job. Moreover highlights the long term plans and maintenance aspects, which is usually always forgotten.

In my opinion, the proposals effects might have far more effects. It is most likely to provide minor employment opportunities and the opportunities for people to learn about blockchain technology, so it is a very welcome proposal regarding bringing some wealth by cardano into ethiopia.
This is a capable team of JS devs who have already implemented some of their outlined deliverables and are requesting funding to hire more roles to bring the wallet dApp solution to market sooner.
Provided that the bios of the proposers are credible, they should be very well qualified to successfully implement the project
Linked code examples warrant high confidence in the success of this proposal.
The team has already implemented the first two deliverables outlined in the proposal. The project roadmap and budget are also sufficient.
This is a DeFi project, not scaling up other DeFi projects which is the goal.
Not really a detailed plan but doable by one developer in a reasonable amount of time.
It is not clear this proposal improves distributed decision making, it appears to be attempting instead to bypass it.
What is the acronym KEWW? This may be useful, but it seems more like funding someone to build their own  YouTube brand than drive engagement in the community.
This could be a useful DApp. But should it not be in the DApps and integrations challenge?

This is a creative and innovative solution to the campaign challenge - It creates a collaborator list or 'marketplace' where community members can look for teams and teams can look for members.  This would definitely make it easier for community members to collaborate and give a simple 'first step' to participating in PC (project catalyst).  However, even though there is budget for 'Marketing' it is unclear how the proposal will encourage 'outside proposers' - people from outside of the community.  This is only a slight problem with alignment to the campaign.  The proposal could be more clear in how it would bring 'outside proposers' into the community.  For instance, connection with other networks or more details about the marketing.

There is clarity in describing the problem, the solution and how the proposal will address the challenge.

Various information has been described that allows the audit of the proposal. 

There are details on budget allocation, a clear timeline, milestones. The use of social media metrics in conjunction with surveys is an effective way to measure the impact of the proposal on the challenge. My only recommendation is to include more details about the proposer / his experiences so that the community has greater clarity in this regard.

Criteria for determining successful implementation are in place, although the criteria are somewhat vague. The release date of 2021-08-01 is very concrete and well usable. Even better would be several milestones, which would allow a finer gradation of auditing.

Given the proposers and the scope of the proposal itself it's clear that the proposal will be implemented successfully. The level of success of the initiative as a whole is dependant on factors outside of the control of the proposers, thus it's level of overall success isn't completely guaranteed. However it's a risk well worth taking as it could potentially open up a new avenue of funding and free up Project Catalyst from proposals potentially better served by an alternative mechanism of funding.

Very little thought and own effort is put to create a staking pool as proposed without community investment. The group collectively can do that without the help of the community. Once they setup a successful stake pool  it would be right for the community to delegate or invest for interns and other community services. 
Without taking any risk for oneself there is very little incentive to succeed. 
a better idea would be to team up with university computer science departments and setup a stake pool as a project.  The universities have hardware and network.

This proposal provides adequate details on how the Stake Pool will be operated over the 12 month time horizon. I would like to see more details on the long-term upkeep though. Do you expect to employ 5-6 people from the $12,000 stake? Also, how do you plan to utilize the marketing budget? What happens if the stake pool fails to grow and is not able to sustain itself? Will it require more funding in future funds?

The problem and solution description is clear and reasonable. I see this proposal as a tutorial created specifically for this challenge, through a series of 10 videos that will introduce people to Catalyst and how to participate.

Although some videos have a theme unrelated to Catalyst (Nodes / Staking, tokens, NFTs, smart contracts and roadmap) I believe that this material can help many people with little or no knowledge in blockchain as an introduction to the deeper Catalyst videos of the series , related to the creation of proposals, voting and roles of several members within Catalyst.

This is a tutorial that can be consumed by novices in the blockchain space or by people with prior knowledge who only need to understand the specific parts of Catalyst and this shows that it has the potential to impact the challenge.

Detailed plan. It would be good to have some metrics and goals going forward to meet the fund goal. For instance number (and size) of DeFi projects implementing the modules produced. This would force the proposers to collaborate with potential DeFi projects. To speed up usage will they be providing Beta access to their API's so development have occur in parallel.
The proposer needs to be more clear in the project statement and proposed solution and include the relevant technical docs needed for DeFi protocol to be completely evaluated.

There is budget breakdown, details about the team. The roadmap describes some milestones as a reference for development over 12 months, this helps in the audit and identification of compliance.

Metrics and deliverables are reasonable and allow audit of the proposal.

This proposal is technically complex, but the problem and the solution have been very well articulated and have been clarified, the alignment with the challenge is evident.
A co-funding system for smaller proposals seems like a good idea to adress the funding of low-cost proposals at a lower entry barrier and integrate more creators and funders into the ecosystem.

Yes it does address the challenge but I'm scoring this a 4-star because it partially address the challenge despite the effort wanting to create the first ever stake pool in Ethiopia. The challenge though made a little specification to Ethiopia, I think the solution must contain a future plan for Africa at large.
Their description, states categorically that they just need a start up capital because the rewards generated out of it is what they gonna use in managing operations and no further additional funding will be required!
The team seems to be experienced, however I would have liked some examples of previous work within blockchain development.

I fail to see what real problem this Dapp will resolve in the world. It comes across as a open source facebook with  emphasis on consumer culture and impulsive purchasing of stuff.  It will increase utility & adoption of end products by the eyballs their marketing strategy will reach but I'm not convinved that this app is in alignment with overal Cardano community commitments and will bring worthwhile visibility to the protocol itself.

This proposal reads from my perspective as a research project referencing the work of other teams. Not at all clear how the value prop of this AMM stacks up compared to the other AMM Dex's competing for funding in this challenge. A CA needs more original content to sufficiently audit the progress of this proposal, none of that is possible with the proposal's current state.

It is very hard to map this proposal to "distributed decision making". As this is an experiment to improve the funding method for catalyst, it might fit the guiding question "How can we ensure that the Catalyst process keeps iterating to improve?" but is a very far strech.

Caralyst has established various mechanism to ensure fair funding and prevent misuse. An existing platform was used to keep the scope of the project in check. The risk of misuse of the proposed solution seems pretty high and this troubles me. Phil and Victor have proven to provide solutions that offer significant added value. Combined with my doubts, I am at 4 points.
The whole governance part is missing. Who effectively would decide about funding? How and by whom are the deciders chosen? What would be the criteria upon which funding is granted or denied?

Given the teams experience and funding required it seems very likely this proposal would be implemented successfully. The fact that a team member is already running a stake pool on the testnet with local hardware confirms this teams ability to execute the proposal.
This propsal is going to enable Elixir developers to start building on Cardano and therefore addresses the challenge.
This is not complex or innovative and the proposer already delivered related work, therefore I have high confidence in the ability to execute.
Proposer of this proposal have not just explained AMM for beginners but have explained how it is gonna execute the proposal and the budget it has asked looks sufficient to take the proposal forward.

This proposal should consider reviewing the other AMM proposals in this challenge as well as the f5 dApp challenge, onboarding the specific Haskell developers needed t build the solution in Plutus, and provide links to their own work, not that of other teams who started work in a different programming language/blockchain.
This is attempting to change the economics of funding, the proposer does not provide any evidence they have experience  in this area.
What's missing are the numbers. How much stake do you deem "sufficient" after five months? How much income do you expect to generate for the treasury? How much do you need to be sustainable?
Easy to audit if the videos are produced. How do we audit if the project is a success in terms of the fund challenge of driving engagement?

The proposal shows, if implemented, the bar to enter the Cardano ecosystem will be lowered for > 10 million of developers. Code comparisons illustrate effectively how little a JavaScript developer needs to know/write to effectively use the Cardano blockchain.
Goal is to create a JS API for cardano-graphql, probably something along the lines of Ethereum's web3.js. Useful for web developers.
The roadmap, metrics and included content all form a well presented project plan.
This is a complete dApp proposal with a live MVP and an entire full-time dev team behind it.

Proposer Ken, is already a participative member of the Catalyst project, participated in the development of the Catalyst documentation and participated in the last phase of Fund4 Assessments. The proposer started a series "Elevator pitch" on Youtube where he interviewed 3 proposers with active proposals on Catalyst.

I recommend the inclusion of a link where people can access more information about the proposer, however for what has been described and for the experience presented i think the proposer is capable of implement this proposal.

There is a very detailed and structured plan for the execution of the proposal and a clear and objective rationale for how it addresses the challenge.

The budget is reasonable and is well detailed. There is a plan to expand the proposal concept in the next Funds. Possible risks were assessed, such as the impact in the event of a change of guidelines in Catalyst that could make the video series less relevant. There is a clear and objective timeline, with milestones.

While the team obviously has some experience i web design and within the cardano ecosystem, the milestones lack a concrete timeframe of the implementation and some details on the plan on how to build up the system. Yet, given the experience of the team it is likely that the proposal will be implemented.

The proposal has provided little to no original content in the proposal, all of the links are 1. from outdated Github repos and articles and 2. are overly theoretical or referencing projects that are not live in production yet.

Yes indeed, talking about experience, at least one personality (Nebiyu) is already known to be running a stake pool on the Cardano TestNet. By now it can be said that he's come across several challenges and have derived or adapt several concurrent solutions with regards to the fame. That alone gives their project a heads up and surety of implementation success.
