The other personalities are also known to have experience with development of Apps as well as web development somehow. It depicts that marketing and education about the project wouldn't be a barrier to them.
With their experiences, it's pretty clear that they all have connections to people who might be enthusiastic about blockchain or development. This would make implementation easier as all they'll have to do is little education about Cardano for these individuals.
To asses their plans, it is good that within the first 3 months of receiving funding, the project can be built, implemented and running already. That shows how serious this team is and foremost view of how committed they're gonna remain as long as the project operates.
Also, creation of treasury out of returns and rewards is a good idea. It depicts that the profits of this project isn't going to be squandered but instead would be used for much more profitable agendas like payment of electricity bills and seeding of local Cardano ventures as stated in their proposal. Not forgetting the fact that the project after a while will be self sustaining! That's amazing 👍.
Cardano and Project Catalyst have also bee involved in their promotional plan. This is essential because people in Ethiopia who know little or nothing about Cardano and Project Catalyst will have the opportunity of enhancing their knowledge and utilizing them more. It's a great news!

Technical experience and drive of proposers to deliver is evident.
What would be useful to see is how dependent you are on IOG for the success of this proposal

Pleas provide a detailed budget and milestones. This doesn't seem like a concrete proposal. It releis on new hires which the requested funds won't support and a marketing from someone you have not provided evidence you can pay for or is otherwise associated with the project.

I like the proposal and how it addresses the issue. Also it brings advantages to Cardano from versatility point of view. The proposer has focus on the maintenance and long term plans which is beneficial.

The proposal reads like a theoretic research project and not a detailed project plan focused on building an AMM. They're building off an RABC model but the concept is very theoretical and has not been shown to work at scale at all in any Ethereum DeFi protocol.

Enough information have been provided, Project Catalyst can just track their progress easily. If funded, at least in about 3 months, we should be able to access and assess the project running from the local hardware from Addis Ababa. Following up promotion about Cardano and Project Catalyst must be realized in at least a year time. This will be possible by receiving and witnessing of more people from Ethiopia utilizing both Cardano and Project Catalyst. If after a least of 4 years, they write to Project Catalyst seeking for another funding, then it will mean they failed 😞 of which I'm not sure would be their result, they'll certainly succeed if they go according to plan and prioritize the vision of the project!

Appears to be a valid use case of funds and seems to tick the boxes for developers. Therefore happy to give this proposal full marks in meeting challenge requirements. A number of community have commented how this proposal would benefit them.

The information provided as well as the level of transparency and engagement from SoMee is a good starting point, as can be viewed here, where it lists project plan, margins, staffing cost, income projects, etc. https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1MEM7nm0Zcfme-ScLzSHxjoutJ27fElTp6C9-q0Gyuio/edit#gid=406588375

The proposal is overly wordy and includes links to work that no one on the proposing team has been apart of. A protocol as complex as an AMM bonding curve requires a team willing to produce a Whitepaper and technical docs describing their solution in detail. The other AMM protocols in this challenge are more straightforward and present more DeFi compelling solutions with their own content included.
If executed well, this would provide a backbone for DeFi projects. Timeline is perhaps a little long to hit the fund goal of scaling up DeFi within 6 months

It is not discussed how this proposal addresses the challenge. A key risk of proposers funding their own proposal is suggested to mitigate by delaying partial payment. This does not however actually address this issue. The solution will just allow small amount to be funded if you match with your own funding (which you get back) and meet milestones you set for your self, which could be easily gamed.
Existing Plutus code on GitHub is Weill documented, and GitBook looks clear.
This proposer fill one of the objective of having decentralize system in the social media space, where it's monopolized by a few.

Although the amount asked is higher than most in the DApps Fund, the proposer had agreed to break up the amount to multiple phases and has provided a thorough analysis that will bring feasibility to the project. See here => https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1MEM7nm0Zcfme-ScLzSHxjoutJ27fElTp6C9-q0Gyuio/edit#gid=406588375
This proposal may have merit, but it doesn't seem to fit in the current challenge. Perhaps it would sit better in Grow Africa, grow Cardano, or proposer outreach.
proposalTitle: Devs for Awarenes Event West Africa

assessmentNote: It is not clear this proposal meets the challenge of helping the developer focus on building succesful apps. It is focused on bringing new developers in. This may be a great goal, but it doesn't seem to meet the challenge.
proposalTitle: Devs for Awarenes Event West Africa

assessmentNote: Without a dispute resolution process this can't work. Plan should include that from the outset or funds will get stranded in smart contracts.
It is missing metrics and KPI in this proposal and I wish you had detailed a little bit more the roadmap and include some milestones.
The proposal addresses the Fund 5: Grow Africa, Grow Cardano challenge. It addresses How Cardano can reach more people in Africa by offering a new community pool in Ethiopia.
The team claims substantial experience sufficient to operate and market a stake pool.
The proposal shows the problem and solution effectively and in an efficient manner.
The proposers have not made the case as to how this addresses the challenge.

This proposal would benefit from a simple timeline (plan on a page) showing key milestones and deliverables.
The finances can then be aligned to these milestones/deliverables. At the moment it is not clear what is being requested $150k or $75k. If $75k then how will the money be spent bits of points 1-4 and some marketing ??
A simple tidy-up in how this proposal is presented will make a huge difference.

I feel confident that this team and proposal will be implemented successfully. The teamleader is a professional web developer according to his linkedin profile.  The two other team members have complementary skills.   The roadmap and documentation of milestones (on the notion website) is clear and adequate.  I would like to see that 'challenges and risks' are considered.  For instance, what if no one comes to the website?  Based on the interactions with commenters and the profile of the team leader, I feel he will overcome challenges faced by the proposal.  I would like to see a more clear goal that says what success looks like.  For instance, the success metric states 'number of users'.  How many users to the system do they estimate in the short and long term?

If we as a cardano ecosystem want to dominate DeFi space than we will need Curve kind of protocol on cardano. As this proposal tackles the challenge to create an AMM protocol it 100% meets the challenge.

requested total funds 75000, do not equal 150,000 - 300,000 requested in the accompanying text. An incoherent budget is unlikely to lead to a successful project.
Also please provide evidence of experience and how you are bringing on  Mr. Allen Kay to the project.

There is no timeline for this project or any breakdown of Cardano component costs or what experience with integration proposer is bringing to the project. Killer app definition is very specific to different app cultures and would suggest proposer comes back after they recruit a Cardano developer onto their team and declare their relationship to the community beyond being 'massive holders of ADA and long time supporters of Cardano'.

The proposal needs to make their exact plans for the type of AMM/DEX they are working on more clear, other AMM DeFi protocols in this challenge make their plans for implementation very clear, this proposal does not.

As was also mentioned in the comments, the barrier to entry for developing applications for Cardano is very high. The hurdle for the most commonly used programming languages for web applications, would bring a significant improvement for the Cardano developer ecosystem.

Many people voting are non-technical and jargon-averse. The proposal for technical integration is great but the lay question will be 'so what!'
what would sell this is for you to back up your headline that millions of users will be brought to Cardano.  How? When? Do you already have them & once the integration is built they appear or is the funding also to be used to promote Somee?
Also some sort of simple architecture would be useful so people can contextualise how Cardano fits in to the Somee ecosystem, the Bitboy video speaks about Ethereum, Waves, Steem....
Simplifying the use of Cardano for different programming languages fits very well with the chosen challenge. An SDK for Elexir would implement this requirement.
The proposer has presented his experience in similar projects and also already got with the implementation. The available information is convincing.
Regarding the metrics I do like the comparison to the Ethereum downloads, since that's a reasonable target to achieve. The project status can be tracked also.

Although the proposal states a real Project Catalyst problem, I do not think that it is in accordance with the idea of the challenge. I do not see how making the funding faster will help the distribution decision making.
It's important to notice, though, that this is a good idea and it should be better explored in another challenge.
The proposer is also working on other projects that use Cardano as a base. The code examples used are sound. Participation in the Plutus Pioneer program is another plus.
The team and vision of the project are its strong points. However, the development team Kromeon does not appear to be particularly suited to tackle the implementation - based on their self portrayal.
The proposer did provide clear references to their experience.
The Roadmap is clear and provides an in-depth, step-by-step action plan, making this project easier to audit.
There is not a clear plan on what is being developed.

The problem and the solution presented are within the scope of the challenge. The development of financial primitives (bonding curves) has the purpose of providing DeFi dapps (but they can also apply to other niches like NFTs and DAOs for example) with low-level mathematical models, this would allow different applications to leverage on economic models in order to deploy reliable market-focused DApps. This concept would facilitate the development of Dapps, as it would reduce the development time of financial models, allow the use of reliable models, increasing reliability and facilitate composability. The proposal has great potential for impact on Cardano's DeFi ecosystem and this challenge.

I took the trouble looking into the github files to see if the off-chain implementation notes following one of the comments and was pleasantly surprised by the documentation that left me wanting to know more.

The proposers have the experience to implement the proposal successfully. Having participated in the Discord server for a few months, the two proposers are everywhere. They are responsible for many useful tools already in place, and this offers a heightened sense of confidence that the proposal will be successful.
One of several API wrapper proposals. Fits squarely within the scope of the challenge.
The timeline is well define, as well as the goals.
It is not clear how this reaches entrepreneurs outside the Cardano ecosystem.

As the project's scope is not overly complex in nature it would be easy for the community to follow the progress being made on the GitBook provided and audit the success of the initiative. The roadmap clearly describes the intentions of the proposer and provides adequate information on how this is going to be implemented and what the community should follow.

The author details what the initial and subsequent objectives of his project are, as well as how to achieve them, and attaches a website where you can follow the progress of the project, in weeks. Define a base of skills to be distributed by members of the Catalyst project, create mechanisms that work through DATA to link information (skills with people)... There are several steps detailed here, in addition to an approximation in weeks of how long each would finish being made. In this way, it is possible to see how well the plan is already structured, a clear step by step of what to do, how and when. In addition, it also details very well how the financing money would be used.

proposer have seem to experience in software development and have enrolled to plutus pioneers program its highly likely that proposal will be implemented . only slight issue i have is that there is no record of Guides created by proposer.
Not clear on the economics of why PMX would be valuable. It seems to be highly inflationary with new tokens constantly generated.
This seems like a reasonable extension to the developer toolkit.

The relevant experience of the member aligns with the topic/ goal. The user is already committed to the Plutus pioneer program. SMART goals apply: the objective is Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Realistic and Timely. Success is highly likely, except if the member decides to drop out of Plutus pioneer.

It seems the kind of project that will ease on boarding of a vast m=number of enthusiasts to Cardano platform and there is potential for it to become a bridge for many system designers learning to think DLT conceptually. Very useful.

To be successful this type of project needs to gain users. What is the marketing plan to bring on users and developers? Scarcity creates value. Why would either side be interested in a highly inflationary token. Where is the money coming from to pay the ADA fees to registers these tokens onto the blockchain?
There is definitely a need for more developer resources, so this does the Cardano ecosystem some justice, because it provides templates to expedite dApp production.
The roadmap and financial plan are not specific, but the project itself is very clear.

Metaverse to reward gamers for playing, and this proposal addressed the integration challenge by allowing gamers to convert this rewards in NFT. Gamers are a compelling audience for Playermint. But this would benefit the community if the NFT were minted on Cardano.

Yes it seems that a 5000 budget can really go a long way to funding this single Plutus Pioneer to trace his journey and provide a stellar result only an astrophysicist can have the discipline to deliver.

A step-by-step template style guide on how to use create dApps would be an instrument to reduce barriers for future dApp creators and would hence make it easier for developers to follow protocol and create dApps on the Cardano Network. Using templates would have the ability to be scalable and to be used as a blue print for future problems. It would be important to ensure visibility for dApp creators.
This project will do a service to engage the community through education of the off-chain code.  This is an educational target which should enable others to develop in the future more easily
As a smart contract developer with prior knowledge and wishful thinking to learn and contribute I feel that the proposal will be completed successfully

proposer have not mentioned any timeline or shown how deliverables will look like through information but as proposer is asking for 5k and is willing do work on his proposal irrespective of it getting funded or not makes it highly feasible coz there is no feasibility for passion.

Well written and executed guides, authored be someone involved in the early stages of Plutus (the Plutus Pioneers program) is bound to make attracting new developers to the Cardano ecosystem easier. Educating developers and starting conversations between them is a key element of this challenge.
The proposal contains most of what is needed, to make it even better some information on how the funds will be used and a rough time estimate for the deliverables would have made it even better.

A roadmap and implementation plan is needed because money is being allocated to this project and there needs to be clear milestones (goal posts) set out in the beginning to increase community confidence.
The git book with details about the research and the the step by step procedure efficiently explains and gives sufficient information about the proposal

Since this task is primarily a documentation type of task the relevant experience of the proposer is within reason as well as the proposed budget for all the documentation processes required for this project.
Simple proposal to provide simples guides for developers to use Plutus. Feasible and would improve the developer experience. Tick.

The idea is superb and the fact that the Plutus Pioneer Program is already funneling development proposals, is great. However, this proposal might need more description for it to hone its true potential.
Great project, It will definitely deliver a soft landing to get more developers and would be developers engaged in the ecosystem.
There is a roadmap and deliverables seem to be adequate in describing what will be created and delivered upon completion.  This proposal is pretty straightforward as a documentation building piece

As a current stake pool operator and member of the Plutus Pioneers program the proposer is clearly a competent individual with a long-term commitment to the Cardano ecosystem who intends to successfully complete the project. Work on the project has already begun and the project is in the initial stages. The proposed budget seems very reasonable and the proposal as a whole a very good allocation of treasury funds.
